text:
I came across this restaurant on TikTok and had been looking forward to trying it.

The standout for me was definitely the Ube sliders. The soft, pillowy ube buns were unique and paired perfectly with the chorizo patty, sauce, and toppings. It was a creative take on Filipino fusion and absolutely delicious.

We also ordered the lumpia shanghai. They were generously sized, but the wrapper wasn‚Äôt as crispy as I would‚Äôve liked. The sauce, however, was flavorful and complemented the dish well.

The pork BBQ skewers were good ‚Äî tender meat with just the right amount of sauce that wasn‚Äôt overly sweet. While it didn‚Äôt quite compare to the BBQ skewers back home, it was still enjoyable.

The lechon was another highlight. The skin was perfectly crispy, and the meat was thick-cut, juicy, and tender with just the right amount of fat ‚Äî buttery but not rubbery. The sauce it came with wasn‚Äôt the traditional lechon sauce I‚Äôm used to; it leaned more vinegary, which didn‚Äôt quite hit the mark for me. The inasal rice was also underwhelming ‚Äî it lacked the bold garlic flavor I was expecting and tasted quite bland.

Overall, the service was great, and the staff were friendly and attentive. While I enjoyed parts of the meal, I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be back.

Brought my husband here to share this wonderful experience at Kalye since we are both adventurous eaters!

Our reservation was for 7:30pm but we walked in 10 minutes early and were able to be seated!

We were served the lumpia shanghai and ube drinks to start our meal off. I loved that the lumpia was packed with meat and thin on the skin but the ube drinks were too grainy for our taste. I'm not sure it was a fav but would not order that again.

For appetizers we got the bbq skewers and kinilaw ceviche tuna. The BBQ Skewers are bigger than the traditional skewers I'm used to at Malay restaurants but still really good! I love that you could taste the charred bbq which is a good indicator for me! The ceviche on the other hand.. wasn't as delectable by itself but once we ordered a side of pita chips, we changed our tunes! I think it's a must to have some sort of carbs to pair with and may be a bit heavy.

Hubby and I ordered one of each for the two entrees offered - beef tapa w. sunny side egg and mushroom sisig (both served with rice). I like both as it's not too salty but I think it could be heavier on the flavour? The meat could be marinated a bit longer imo but it was still good regardless.

To finish off, we got the mango float and ube ice cream. I thought the mango float was going to be more of a milkshake but it's actually a piece of cake with a cherry on top! The ube ice cream is topped with shaved coconut and so so SO rich in flavour. I preferred the ice cream over the cake but my husband had different opinions. Either way, we love both of our choices and would reorder this!!

My first time officially trying Philippine food, really interesting flavors, tastes vary. Big portions; staff was really nice and friendly.
Space is small so reservations are suggested on weekends. However, the smell inside the restaurant would be strong when they are deep frying food.

üç¥‚ú®Deep fried spring roll was my favorite. It was filled with grounded meat and huge! Nice flavor with slight crispy skin.

The pork belly was delicious, tender and juicy. But the fried pork skin came with meat was too hard.

Coconut shrimp rice was a light one, pretty refreshing. Simple seasoned shrimps with mango slices. The rice was a little bit over cooked, kinda soggy.

üíúüç®üíõUbe ice cream the best! It was so rich and creamy with sauces and toppings. Definitely the must-order dessert.

Ube buns were good too, but a little bit unflavored, so eat it with more sauces on the top.

Amazing food! Though overall pretty fatty, not the healthiest if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for. Mango salad was underwhelming, but otherwise everything was delicious. The wait time was short too - only took around 10 min for the mains to be served.

Halo halo shaved ice was probably the best dessert I‚Äôve ever had. Not too sweet, the texture was layered and varied. Rich in flavor. Love.

everything from drinks, appetizer, to dessert was fantastic. Atmosphere was great with a great playlist. Our server jerremiah was very accommodating and explained all the dishes to us very well. A good spot for a date night or even a casual dinner with friends. 10/10 recommend if you want to try Filipino cuisine

My second time at @rakunyc and I enjoyed my cold zaru udon a lot more than the hot udon I‚Äôve had last time! Got an add-on veggie tempura but sadly they were not hot anymore when they came to me.

Had a bite of the buta shabu and I liked the grilled flavors of the sliced pork a lot!

Delicious Udon and Katsu don 10/10 quality ingredients and made with love. The noodles seem home made, chewy and so nice. Staff very friendly and restaurant is very pretty and clean!!!!! Really flavorful and the soup made me feel really good. Will come back definitely.

Cute noodle spot. The monkfish liver was delicate and a little rich, but honestly, nothing too memorable. The udon noodles themselves were great‚Äînice texture and chew‚Äîbut the pork belly dried noodles had an overwhelming smoky flavor, and not in a good way. It almost tasted like they had been sitting near actual cigarette smoke. Plus, the dish was seriously lacking salt‚Äîit definitely needed some soy sauce or seasoning.

On the other hand, the kani maze udon with crab roe was light but packed with a strong roe flavor, so if you‚Äôre into seafood, you‚Äôll probably love it. The tempura was perfectly cooked‚Äîcrispy, light, and delicious.

The restaurant itself is small and intimate. It can get a little loud, but you can still have a conversation, making it a solid date spot.
Amazing udon noodle. It‚Äôs one of the best.  Great texture and feel.  However the flavor of broth and seasoning could use tweaking.  I do recommend the chicken tatsuta age!

No wonder why they‚Äôre called the best ramen place in Manhattan, the dishes were soooo good! We looooved the Agedashi tofu, it was literally the best I‚Äôve ever tried! The chicken was also very good, but the shrimp tempuras were phenomenal
I ordered ebiten udon and was a little disappointed at first as there weren‚Äôt that many ingredients in it, but the taste was unreal! I don‚Äôt know what they do to create such yummy water there in that dish but I know it just kept growing on me
My partner got the curry hot udon and loved it as well

A Szechuan tapas and speakeasy like bar, offering Asian inspired cocktails and food. The vintage decor and mood lighting really sets the experience. I visited twice, once seated at the bar for cocktails and the second to enjoy the full experience with food. Personally, I felt the experience at the bar was much better. When seated, our waiter didn‚Äôt really seem engaged and the food took too long to come out, hence the score. Nonetheless, really good drinks and worthy of a visit for the cocktails (and maybe the food, if you manage to have a better experience than I did while seated).

This place is great! The food is flavorful and delicious. My friend and I shared a few things. Neither of us had a drink so cant speak to the cocktails, but the ones we saw others order looked good. It‚Äôs cute and cozy inside. The staff is sweet, maybe a bit overly attentive at times but I‚Äôd rather that than be ignored. So glad I went and was able to cross this spot off my list!

Super cozy and intimate spot, great for date night! They were fully booked on a Thursday night, so make sure you grab reservations in advance. Every single cocktail is unique and delicious; my favorite was the Happy Together (clarified milk!!) and the Earl Grey Gimlet was tasty as well. The food was delicious; we had crab fried rice, chili filet fish, snow pea sprouts, salt and pepper fritto misto, and soft shell crab. The spice level was manageable but had me sweating. Service was friendly and attentive as well.

Ye's Apothecary: where the drinks are potent and the reservation system is... well, a work in progress. We booked for four through Resy, but Ye's was like, "Who?" Luckily, our server was a saint and squeezed us in at the bar before upgrading us to a table.

On to the good stuff: Happy Together, 2046, and Sichuan Old Fashioned cocktails were expertly crafted. Appetizers? Sichuan Wontons exploded with flavor, Chili Filet O' Fish was "I'll-have-two, please" good, and Changsha Spiced Chicken surprisingly paired well with pineapple (who knew?). Friendly staff, perfect sound levels, and lounge vibes make Ye's ideal for dates or small gatherings. Love the place! We'll be back ‚Äì with a paper reservation confirmation üòÇ  a must try guys!

Wonderful experience! The staff was so polite and friendly, checking in on us to see if we needed more food or drinks. Food arrived super fast and was incredibly delicious. The cocktails were very well balanced and tasty. I'm definitely coming back soon with more friends soon!

I ordered the saba sushi, ankimo, ebiten udon, and sakura sake panna cotta.
The udon was excellent. Both the broth and noodles were clean and well balanced.
The panna cotta was very well made. The combination with red bean worked nicely and the subtle aroma of sake at the end was memorable.
The ankimo was not very impressive even at $10.
I personally found the shari in the saba sushi slightly too much, but not enough to break the overall balance of the sushi. The other dishes were also good.
Overall, the flavors were clean and refined. The prices felt reasonable(for New York) and the quality is comparable to some of the best local spots in Japan.

This place never disappoints. I wouldn‚Äôt wait more than 30-40 minutes for here but if you get a reservation, no problem. The food is good and the service is as good as it can get when they‚Äôre busy. The drinks are solid and this is definitely one of my go to udon spots. The menu has a good amount of options so there‚Äôs ideally something for every palette.

It was raining and freezing. But there were line waiting outside. Food is delicious. Atmosphere is nice. Employees are great. The only down side is the price. Understand it‚Äôs NYC and SOHO, but still highly overpriced. I would not visit again just for the price.

Exceptional all around. One of my fave restaurants at one of my fave parts of the city - and for good reason.

FOOD
The food is excellent. If you're craving a wide array of Japanese food, this place really hits. During this visit we ordered the chicken karage, the tofu, and the roll cake. All incredibly delicious.

The karage was fried perfectly and came with lemon (which just makes so much sense) and a spiced mayo which was the perfect accompaniment. We asked for salt on the side which helped the flavors pop even more.

The tofu was also delicious. The broth that it was in + the bonito with the shaved ginger, gave it an incredible depth of flavor which is hard to describe. Umami if I were ever to taste it. Highly recommend.

The roll cake was the sleeper. Incredibly delicious with pieces of fruit embedded throughout. Very generous portion with a raspberry mousse on the side which was a perfect pairing.

SERVICE
This was outstanding. 10/10. They were extremely accommodating with our small baby and several staff members from various parts of the restaurant checked in on us throughout our meal to make sure that we had everything that we needed and that everything was okay. Truly memorable, especially given the restaurant was packed on a Saturday night and very, very busy. Service really punched above its weight class.

ATMOSPHERE
What else is there to say. This is prime SoHo on MacDougal. The energy is infectious. However, the smart layout of the restaurant optimizes the space so that there is quite a bit of seating (we were lucky to snag 2 seats a bit later in the evening for dinner w/o a reservation), but you still feel there is space to navigate through the restaurant. Overall, definitely has that clean Japandi sort of vibe fitting of the restaurant and cuisine.

Overall, this deserves its 5-star review. I would rate higher if possible.

Make a reservation or come right at opening to ensure a spot! We got very lucky and were seated right away at 5:10pm without a reservation. Everything was delicious and would totally come back. The broths are a bit on the saltier side but delicious nonetheless. Overheard another table try to order dessert at 5:45 but the server said it ran out so order early if you know what you want!can‚Äôt wait to come back.

We had a lovely experience at Da Andrea Chelsea. We sat outdoors on a beautiful Saturday afternoon, and the atmosphere was perfect, charming, relaxed, and ideal for people-watching. The scenery added a special touch to the meal.

I ordered the Pennette con Melanzane and it was absolutely delicious. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the eggplant was tender and flavorful, blending wonderfully with the tomato sauce and fresh basil. You can really taste the quality of the ingredients.

Great food, great vibes, and a great location. Highly recommend for a casual but memorable Italian dining experience in Chelsea.

I thought the restaurant was beautiful lots of flowers, rustic feeling and lots of personal touches in terms of decoration. I thought the food was okay nothing mind blowing, I came on a weekend so was able to try some things off the brunch menu I got the PAPPARDELLE, pasta was yummy and sauce was too, but the lamb pieces had too much of a gamey after taste which was not enjoyable so had to eat around lamb pieces. My bf got the bolognese the sauce was delicious but his pasta was a bit overcooked. We also got the margarita flatbread which was sooo GOOD, thin cheesy but still light with the fresh basil on top. Lastly we got the tiramisu which was disappointing not enough coffee or soaking to lady fingers. Service was great though, very welcoming and attentive.

This place was just okay for me. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, which I appreciated, but the food didn‚Äôt quite hit the mark. The gnocchi was a standout‚Äîabsolutely delicious and perfectly executed‚Äîbut the other dishes were just decent and a bit bland. The tiramisu was the biggest letdown; it ended up tasting mostly like whipped cream and coffee, missing that rich, custardy texture that really makes it shine.

I also ordered the same cocktail twice, and both times, the glass was super sticky, which made it pretty unpleasant to hold. The service was friendly, but little details like that took away from the experience.

Everything about this place is gorgeous - from the outside to every detail inside. Dark, cozy, intimate. No detail has been missed. The service is amazing, our server - Santiago - was well versed in the menu, wines, and specials. He was very sweet and genuinely wanted us to have a wonderful evening. The octopus was delicious, tender and seasoned just right. I got the lamb chop special which melted in your mouth. 10/10

An unforgettable dining experience! The food was exceptional and the ambiance was stunning - true credit to the chef. The lobster soup was a masterpiece and the tiramisu was easily one of the best I‚Äôve ever tasted. The staff went above and beyond; the hostess and waiter were incredibly warm and surprised us with complimentary limoncello shots to celebrate our anniversary. Every detail made the evening special. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Awesome Vietnamese and Thai fusion food! I got the lemongrass short rib and husband got the pho Bo which were both excellent. We also ended up getting mango sticky rice for dessert which was also just as excellent. Our server Pete was very pleasant and very attentive! He gave great recommendations for the cocktails! Highly recommend this place.

OBAO, since 2009, is a Thai restaurant sharing neighboring Vietnamese cuisine to create a unique fusion of Asian palate. This modern Thai concept introduces innovative culinary techniques blending the best of Thai and Vietnamese ingredients. Enjoy various Thai and Vietnamese comfort foods from the streets of South East Asia in New York City. Pete served us today with superb service. Food and drinks came out quick and you can taste the quality while experiencing comfort through food. There are two floors of beautiful space filled with numerous decorations with a NYC vibe. This is a perfect place for gatherings or simply to enjoy a fabulous meal. Highly recommend making a reservation as OBAO gets filled out quickly. Rest is right at your fingertips!

First time in new york and decided to try obao with family members. Everything was so good and Kelly was amazing. We got appetizers to share and I got the beef and broccoli with flat rice noodles. sooo flavorful! I got a coconut cake for dessert and it was delicious. Will come back next time I visit :)

The atmosphere is amazing. Nice romantic lighting without being too dark. Very simple but elegant decorations. Music is soft acoustic pop covers. Our server Pete was so accommodating and made sure we lacked for nothing, I never had to look for him, very attentive and polite without hovering.

I had the Short Rib Pho and my wife got the drunken noodles. Both were really good. I can't wait to come back with friends. Definitely recommend for dates and small groups but they also seem to be able to accommodate big parties as well. Another Gem in Hell's Kitchen.

Yay for our server, Emily. She was friendly and efficient and helped us make our selections from a lovely menu. The food was delicious. The cocktail was also very delicious. If you‚Äôre going to the theater, the perfect place to have a well prepared meal.

Izakaya Mew always hits the spot. We ordered from their lunch special and were so impressed! Everything was super fresh, flavorful, and nicely portioned. The prices are very reasonable for the quality you‚Äôre getting. The space has a cool, modern vibe with good lighting, and the staff made the whole experience even better with how friendly and attentive they were. I‚Äôd definitely recommend checking it out, especially for lunch, their lunch menu is a total win.

Small bites over large portions‚Äîevery time.
If you‚Äôre someone who lives for flavor-packed dishes meant for sharing, this hidden NYC spot is calling your name. Every single plate felt like it was crafted to nourish not just your appetite, but your soul.

Best $$$$ spent‚Äîwithout breaking the bank.
It‚Äôs not expensive, but every bite is cooked to absolute perfection. Perfect for a first date‚Äîaffordable, cozy, and made for sharing stories over shared plates.

Izaka mew was pretty good! This place is super popular and busy. There was a lot of people waiting to go in, even when it just opened. This restaurant is open from 12-2 pm, and then it closes and opens back up again from 5-9:30pm. Despite it being busy, my food came out pretty quickly. I got the salmon sashimi taco and it was really tasty! It was a salmon taco with guacamole, which is a good fusion of Hispanic and Japanese food. The portion size was a little small though. The service was good and the waiter answered any questions I had. The place had a nice underground ambience to it. Overall, I would recommend. It has a lot of good Japanese food items on its menu.

Price: $11.95üí∏
Rating: 7.5/10üìù

We finally tried this Japanese restaurant right next to our hotel after noticing the constant crowd gathered outside every night. The wait was over an hour, but once we were seated downstairs, we were greeted warmly and felt right at home.

I went with my fianc√© and our son, and we decided to try a variety of dishes since everything was portioned small and perfect for sharing. We ordered the ramen, chicken nanban, kani cream croquettes, and a California roll for our son. Each dish was absolutely delicious.

We also sampled a couple of their cocktails, which were just as thoughtfully crafted. The vibe of the place was lively but cozy, and the staff was kind and attentive.
The wait may be long but it was totally worth it. Highly recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre in the area!

A restaurant that serves excellent Japanese food!
The atmosphere is great, the staff is very attentive, and the food is delicious ‚Äì all the dishes were tasty, large, and worth the price.
The cocktails were really good too.
Anyone in the area who wants to experience a Japanese vibe in New York, I highly recommend visiting.
The restaurant is located on the basement level (-1).
It‚Äôs advisable to make a reservation in advance or expect to wait about 30 minutes for a table.

Spice, variety, flavor. Authenticity ‚Äî but with a price.

We stopped by on a cold, rainy day ‚Äî perfect noodle soup weather. Tried two of their popular soup options, both came out piping hot and rich in flavor. Definitely seasoned with that classic Sichuan peppercorn kick ‚Äî subtle, not overwhelming, but present enough for fans of that numbing spice to appreciate.

It does feel a bit over seasoned to the point I had a hard time telling what was what.

That said, the total came out to about $80 for three soups and three drinks. Bit of sticker shock for a quick meal in a market setting. The food was good, don‚Äôt get me wrong, but for that price point, it didn‚Äôt wow me enough to make it a regular stop.

Service was decent ‚Äî staff was friendly and helpful, but nothing exceptional.

Hugo‚Äôs Take:
üü° One-and-done. Decent for a rainy day, but not something I‚Äôd go out of my way for again.

Vibe: 7/10
Value: 5/10
Flavor: 8/10

Delicious noodles.  In Chelsea market so might be hard sometimes to find a seat but the great food. I ordered the noodles dry so they were sauced but not in a broth.   Broth dishes looked great also but the dry version was perfectly sauced and full of flavor. The meat was very tender and juicy.  Overall would definitely return.

Okay WOW.

This place has incredibly fresh noodles that taste so good. Cut and made fresh, there is a glass window and you can see through where they are literally slapping the noodles against the counter right in front of you. The flavor is absolutely crazy, can‚Äôt say enough good things about the taste of these noodles.

They serve the noodles dry or in a soup version like ramen.

Sometimes there is a line because this place is very popular, but the service is usually pretty quick and they keep it moving.

Right in Chelsea Market right in the front by anthropology

The noodles at this spot in Chelsea Market are incredibly fresh‚Äîyou can really taste the difference! I ordered the beef noodle soup with a spicy kick, and it was amazing. The broth was rich and flavorful, and the beef was tender and perfectly cooked. The spice level was just right, adding an extra depth of flavor without overpowering the dish.

The noodles themselves were perfectly chewy and satisfying, making this a standout meal in Chelsea Market. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre craving delicious, fresh noodles with a bit of heat!

I adore fresh, hand pulled noodles and wow! The line was worth the wait.

You can also sit at the walk up bar and watch the artistry.

They serve VERY generous portions. Loved the flavorful chicken wings.

Three of us ordered four items, and wow, we could have easily fed 6-8 people.

Very spicy, and I‚Äôm not talking ghost pepper level, but bring your water!

We sat outside, and enjoyed the crisp, end of October weather.

Hands down one of the best home style Thai restaurants disguised as a dive bar.  Friendly service and if you hang out long enough you‚Äôll get a free shot of whiskey.  The ginger wings were cooked to perfection so juicy and tender.

Tip: to open the front door which has no handles reach for the top corner and pull.

Typical New York bar but much better. Very busy very crowded. The staff is pleasant and very quick to grab you a drink. Drinks were on the chalet side for the city which was greatly appreciated. One of the owners gave complementary shots which was pretty cool. I ordered the Chinese sausage fried rice and the ginger wings to go and i will say both were just as amazing after heating them up again. I definitely plan on visiting the next time I‚Äôm in the city.

Almost broke my nail trying to open the door with no door nob. The food was ok good but super overpriced for a place like this, and the portion was small. They served most things on paper plates w plastic utensils. I get the vibe is supposed to be like this bc it's a dive bar, but it's just so janky it's worse than any of my college town bars I was literally so shocked.

Don't even try going into the bathroom here it's nasty.

Dive bar with strong drinks and excellent Asian street food. The crispy rice was incredible. The vibe is crowded and rowdy with fairly gross bathrooms, but if you're here to drink and hang it's a great spot. Servers and bartenders are super nice!

Was sent here by a fellow bartender at one of the most well known bars in the city & this is probably one of the best dive bars I've never heard about! The outside looks bombed out & just getting the door to open is a puzzle unto itself haha! The crispy fried rice is OUT OF THIS WORLD!! Definitely add a little of that sweet spicy sauce. It was late night Tuesday so it was on the quiet side but the bartender kept us laughing & then he started pouring up Jameson shots, which is their thing. If you're looking for a true proper dive with amazing food served on paper plates you will not be disappointed. Will def be going back & trying out more of the menu. Good luck opening the door!

Cash Only - Found this great spot for lunch while walking around Chinatown. Fast service and good food. Recommend the pork soup dumplings and orange beef. The place is cash only, and they have an ATM at the front if you need to get cash out. Overall, a solid find! Pictured: soup dumplings, fried rice, garlic eggplant, sesame chicken.

Had a great experience at Joe's Shanghai in New York. Pro tip: don't forget to grab a ticket number before joining the line - it gets packed fast. I waited about 30 minutes to get a seat, but it was absolutely worth it. Even though it was very crowded, the staff still provided excellent, efficient service. I ordered the steak and broccoli instead of the usual soup dumplings, and it really hit the spot. The steak was tender and flavorful, and the broccoli was fresh and perfectly cooked. The atmosphere was lively. Great price also. Definitely recommend and would come back again!

What does cold weather demand? Soup dumplings!

Look no further. Effective in what they do best - rolling out excellent food at the speed of an assembly line. Low noise levels, effective service, and CASH ONLY restaurant.

We got straight to ordering our Shanghai Chives & Shrimp with Pork Wonton Soup ($14.95), Veggie Dumplings ($11.95), and Veggie Fried Rice ($14.95) - which is not egg-less by the way.

Every check is slapped with a service charge, so think before you tip! Will definitely visit again because service and food is really good.

PS: try their hot sauce - it is extremely delicious if you like spice!

We had a long day after a 6 hour trip from Virginia and a tour from the Liberty so we were hungry and this was recommended from a family friend. We had to wait for about 20mins to be seated and the food was served in a timely manner. Food tasted great and filling, we had to take some back to the hotel because we ordered too much lol. The servers were attentive to us as well. 5/5‚≠ê

There was a half-hour wait on Saturday afternoon. I took a ticket and went for a walk in the area. When we returned, we entered a very nicely decorated place. The food was reasonable. I've eaten much better Chinese food in other places, and the place was packed. I don't understand why. I won't be back. There are better and cheaper places.

Overall rating: 4.4 - 4.6
Price: $66 w/ tip

I‚Äôm so torn about this rating that it has to be range. When I walked by during the week, the place was empty. So I understood why they only do walk-ins. However when I arrived on Saturday at 6, it was crowded! I was the last one to get a table but not sure if ‚Äútable‚Äù is the right term. Maybe a makeshift table. I was seated next to the door and it was freezing. And being so close to the door, I had people waiting literally next to my seat. I‚Äôve never felt so unseen as a solo diner. Items I ordered:

- plantain: 4/5 good
- Edamame dumpling: 5/5 great, but wish there was more portion
- Tuna tartar taco: 1/5 not worth it
- Popcorn ice cream: 1/5 I don‚Äôt know why I thought this was literally popcorn ice cream. No, it‚Äôs popcorn on ice cream.

Unfortunately, I found myself at another fusion spot without realizing it. The service was okay. Not the best, not the worst. The seating was my biggest turn off & likely won‚Äôt be coming back. If you‚Äôre going with a group of 3 or more, I recommend.

Insanely delicious food! 10/10 every time. When I lived closer to Thursday Kitchen I‚Äôd go regularly. Now that I live farther I still like to visit when I‚Äôm in the area.

Great, amazing food and solid service. The quality speaks for itself. Great options across all my visits:
- Edamame dumplings
- Seafood paella
- Lucky noodle
- Truffle mac and cheese
- Korean popcorn chicken
- Steak
- Duck empanadas

They try to fit a lot of people in a small space so the tables are nearly glued next to each other. You won‚Äôt have privacy for your conversations but it may not matter because you‚Äôll be occupied with the delicious food and drinks!

Price-wise, it‚Äôs probably more than you‚Äôd like to pay for the portion sizes‚Ä¶ but since the food is truly that delicious it‚Äôs a splurge worth going for once in a while. Enjoy!

Wow! My boyfriend & I spontaneously came into this spot last night and I am so happy that we did. The food was extremely delicious and so memorable.

We got the asparagus (garlic heavy and so delicious) plantains (the portion was so incredibly small but so yummy and Im a goat cheese hater) tuna tacos, and the steak was the star of the show. The glaze on that steak was superb with the grits *chef‚Äôs kiss* they sent us chicken on the house (thank you!) it was a great addition to our meal.

If we are ever in the area again, we would def wanna try more plates. My only qualm was the plastic water cupsüí≠

Really delish Korean tapas type restaurant. The edamame dumplings were perfect entities. The tomato salad cheese thing was very fresh. Solid vegetarian options. The deconstructed tacos were really yummy too.

It‚Äôs a quaint little restaurant. Great lighting, very cozy. Not too busy for a Monday night.

The touches were very nice‚Ä¶ however‚Ä¶ they do water in a plastic cup. Which is crazy I think? For a $40+ meal.

I didn‚Äôt think the tapas were that exceptional - I could make something like it at home - but they were nice, in a nice atmosphere.

Truffle Mac n cheese was homey.

The truffle mac and cheese is to die for!! Also loved their lucky noodles! Honestly can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on this menu. We ordered the steak and chicken as well which were both great too!! No pics of the dishes because we instantly filled out plates before we could think of it. These dishes are designed to be shared and are appetizer sized by the way

Visited a few times and their coffee is great. Avocado toast was mixed with feta cheese which is slightly different from other restaurants. Somehow there were many tourists and quite busy. We waited about 7mins for a table.

The pancakes, eggs, and greek sausage were all to die for.

We came back to try the French toast but it wasn't as good as the pancakes but still delicious xD.

The coffee was alright but wish they served it in a mug instead of a glass cup so it wouldn't be so hot to touch and get so cold fast (this might be my ignorance if this is a certain culinary style but not my favorite).

The first time we were able to order a side of 2 eggs but the second time they told me they were trying to move away from that and sell more set menu items so next time it would be more expensive and come with the toast. Not the biggest deal but feels unnecessary.

All said and done probably one of my favorite breakfast places, would definitely come back, and wish they offered breakfast all day every day instead of just for Christmas week!

Visited NYC a few months ago and came here for breakfast. I believe I ordered the buttermilk pancakes. Which were okay, for me personally, they were just basic pancakes that I could make a home. Although the fruit on it was fresh and the pancakes were fluffy and light. Clean atmosphere and quick service. Waitress was nice. I would recommend this place though as it is nice and convenient and simple.

Food was great. The Pancakes and French toast were well presented and very delicious. The latte was the perfect temp and tasted good. (I do wish this location offered flavored lattes such as caramel or vanilla.)

We arrived before 9 am on Sat and got seat without waiting. By the time we leave, it was long line outside‚Ä¶so I recommend to arrive before 9am if you don‚Äôt want to wait.
The food was delicious and their service was very friendly! Forget about the calories and enjoy the food!! :)

Awesome place to grab some delicious Korean food! This restaurant has a fun atmosphere- a good place for a date or night out with friends. They have deals/specials so look out for that on the menu depending on when you go. Everything we ordered was yummy. The food came out quick. Also, you get a discount for paying with cash which saved us some money on the bill. Would definitely come back again.

This place surprised me. The food is really good.  The slushy banana and lychee drinks worth it. The pouches worth it. We got the whote peach, lychee, and blue aloe. So fun. Would definitely be back. Cute decor insode and nice staff. Cheesy Spicy Chicken Deokbokki

Boiled Smoked Pork belly wrap outrageously yummy

Seafood Jjamppong phenomenal

Truffle Jjajangmyun W Bulgogi interesting

Gochujang Pork Belly amazing

Grilled Squid my favorite we also had dumplings

This spot is perfect for a quick bite, whether you're dining solo or with friends. They offer a variety of options to fit different tastes, making it easy to find something you‚Äôll enjoy. Plus, their late hours make it a convenient choice for a meal or a snacky snack any time of day. The casual atmosphere and quick service add to the overall experience, making it a solid go to spot.
It is located in K town so good to hang with friends! Reasonable price, delicious and various anju for soju! I definitely come back soon!

Cute spot. It was hard to find with the signage, but it's up a few flights of stairs. The spot is very cozy and welcoming. It reminds of places I went to in Seoul, Korea. Came on a snowy day and got a hot dish. It was very warming and spicy! The staff gave samples of fish cake soup which was very comforting.

NAYA is truly exceptional in every way, and I must say that I had an incredibly wonderful experience during my visit yesterday.

Oh my gosh, it was truly a wonderful experience.

An excellent selection of dishes, very warm and helpful personnel, and a lovely atmosphere ‚Äì what else could anyone desire?

Every single item available on the menu is delightful, the service provided is consistently excellent, and the overall ambience and atmosphere are undoubtedly the true standout features of the experience.

An extensive variety of menu choices, a warm and friendly team, and an overall fantastic ambiance ‚Äì what else could you desire?

It is not only incredibly tasty but also remarkably nutritious.

These boys undoubtedly offer a remarkably outstanding menu with a wide variety of choices.

The personnel were very courteous and demonstrated an impressive sense of propriety in their conduct.

The assistance is extremely useful and approachable.

The employees are extremely polite, and the level of service they provide is notably swift.

I am filled with excitement and eagerness at the idea of returning. Kindly remember to return and consistently suggest this location to others.
Simple and fresh food. I love this location because it‚Äôs never busy, the staff are friendly and attentive

Ordered pickup on a weeknight and when I went to pick it up it wasn‚Äôt ready even though they said it was ready in the app. But the store workers were great I told them my name and they assembled my order in front of me. Really good food, great portions, everything was fresh and delicious.

To all the beautiful people working on 4/23/2025 at 1pm, thank you for making my bowl the most amazing bowl I have had in a while. Food tasted so fresh and portions were AMAZING.
THANK YOU. I WILL BE BACK
The food is always delicious and very affordable.  The staff are always laughing and smiling. This place has become my main go to for my lunch break as well as dinner.

I went to the OG location in Chicago years ago and had a pleasant experience. I decided to take my brother here while he was in town visiting.
I made a reservation for 5:30 on a Saturday. Reservations are recommended as it was already starting to get busy. Our server greeted us quickly to take our order. He made sure our waters remained filled.
I ordered the blood orange tequila cocktail. It was lackluster and overpriced for what you get.
To eat we split a burger (add the bacon and egg), fries, and broccoli. The food was all fabulous. The burger was just as good as I remembered it. Despite the amazing food, the atmosphere isn‚Äôt cohesive and inviting. The music is loud. The pacing of the drinks and food was awkward. I couldn‚Äôt help but feel that the interior design feels like it‚Äôs trying too hard to be Soho. Overall the experience was a letdown.

Ate here in 3.22.2025. Got the General Jane's Fried Chicken and the Double Cheeseburger with eggs and bacon. I liked the fried chicken, it was sweet and spicy. They gave us wet towels to wipe our hands and mouth after eating.

The cheeseburger, however, was very greasy. It left such a heavy feeling in my mouth and stomach that I could only eat half the burger. It was not appetizing at all to eat. It wasn't horrible per se but it was not good. Maybe it was a mistake to add the eggs and bacon.

I also had the fries with garlic aioli sauce. It's nice.

The restaurant's interior is nice. It has a cute dim lighting aesthetic going on. The servers were quick.

I don't think I'll come back here again. The quality does not match the price.

Burger was SO GOOD def lived up to hype- bread was so soft and there was a good amount of sauce in there - every bite I took was saucy and yummy. Chicken frites was avg, just roasted chicken honestly but the fries were SO GOOD. General Jane‚Äôs fried chicken was delicious and honestly filled us up - huge portions considering it was an appetizer üò≠ broccoli was delicious nice and charred and HUGE
Ice cream was HUGE as well - legit two HUGE scoops
Loved the ambience and drinks too!!!

I had an amazing experience at this restaurant in New York! The burger I ordered was absolutely delicious‚Äîjuicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The ingredients were fresh, and every bite was just perfect. The service was also excellent; the staff was friendly, attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed.

The only downside was the wait time‚Äîwe had to wait about 40 minutes for our food, which was a bit too long. However, once the food arrived, it was definitely worth the wait. If they could speed up the kitchen a little, this place would be perfect.

Overall, I highly recommend this spot for burger lovers. Just be prepared for a bit of a wait, but trust me, it‚Äôs worth it!

Au Chevel NYC is an absolute gem! My recent visit was nothing short of amazing, highlighted by an incredibly delicious burger that was juicy, flavorful, and cooked to utter perfection with the freshest ingredients in every single bite. The service was equally outstanding; the staff were friendly, attentive, and genuinely cared about ensuring we had everything we needed for a fantastic dining experience. If you're in New York and craving a truly exceptional burger and top-notch service, look no further than Au Chevel ‚Äì it's a must-try that will leave you completely satisfied and eager to return.

Authentic and exotic Asian cuisine

We had a wonderful lunch time at EM Vietnamese Bistro today and the food was amazingly delicious. We have ordered Ly‚Äôs Chicken Wings which is indeed one of best in town. The wings are crispy out but succulent and tender with Ly‚Äôs secret recipe. Pork Vermicelli is also the great selection for those who seek balance between carbs, protein and vegetable. Butter Clams were also something that you ‚Äòmust‚Äô try.

The hospitality was very warm and authentic by Patrick and Ly. We had such a great time and really enjoyed this place so very much and highly recommended ‚ù§Ô∏è

Location is great and close to the foot of Brooklyn bridge. Dumbo area.

Staff are ver friendly, prompt and attentive.

Food was amazing, simple and tasty. Definitely worth the price and the amount can be shareable or when famished one can finish the meal. But all our meal came out on time and the food was very tasty!

Today we tried Vietnamese food for the first time! We somehow never explored Vietnamese cuisine before. Em Vietnamese is in the heart of Dumbo and was the perfect spot to start. Their Coconut Mussels are amazing, but my favorite dish is the Beef Noodle Soup (Pho Bo). üç≤ I also like their Pineapple Express drink. The owner came to greet us and he was very kind. It truly makes a difference when food is great and the people are just wonderful.

Amazing service, delicious food, and a fantastic location just a few blocks from Dumbo! üåü Definitely worth checking out.

My favorites tonight? The pho, garlic butter clams, and shaking beef ‚Äî absolutely delicious! ü•¢‚ú®

We walked into this restaurant from strolling around the DUMBO area and it was awesome! The interior is beautiful and the service was great!! I ordered the Vietnamese beef stew which was both light yet comforting and rich at the same time with tender chicks of beef! Once our food arrived at the table I asked for a side of rice because I didn‚Äôt realize it was just the stew with a delicious piece of bread and I usually crave beef stew over some white rice. Our server brought this out super fast and didn‚Äôt even up-charge us for it, he also recommended fresh noodles in the pho which are thicker and absorb the broth more than the classic ones. We appreciated the knowledges and guidance our server provided and were very pleased with the food!

I‚Äôve had this place on my list for years and boy did it exceed my expectations. This was hands down the best Pad Thai I‚Äôve ever had - we got the beef. It was so juicy and flavorful as was the fried pork belly and steamed branzino. The drinks were nicely sized and delicious. I loved the ambience - felt like an episode of white lotus. Hands down my new favorite Thai spot.

The experience dining at this restaurant was really lovely.

Food: I ordered the Khao Soi Gai with a Thai Iced Tea. Everything tasted delicious and fresh. The food was filling and well seasoned.

Staff: The staff was very friendly and attentive.

Price: The price was great for the location, service, and quality of the ingredients.

It was easy to make a reservation at this restaurant (recommended). I enjoyed sitting next to the big floor to ceiling windows.

I would definitely visit again.

Absolutely delicious, pre-Broadway dinner here. Servers were very sweet and attentive. The drinks were awesome and also came in fun themed glasses. They serve my favorite Thai dessert which many places don't carry, the coconut pudding but this one had shredded/toasted coconut on top too! Yum!

The much-hyped Flying Tiger at RedNote turned out to be surprisingly mid, despite its beautiful presentation. The dish itself was bland, almost tasteless, and served only lukewarm. Definitely overrated in my opinion.

That said, other offerings like the Khao Soi Gai, Green Curry Duck, and Moo Deng were truly outstanding. The Khao Soi Gai, in particular, stood out. I love how the yellow curry was beautifully balanced, with just the right mix of coconut sweetness and Thai chili heat.

I visited the place with a large party of 6. Not to my surprise the restaurant was crowded and very loud. I‚Äôll come again but definitely not with a bunch of friends.

While not exactly traditional Thai, the flavors were creative in a positive way that worked. Overall I enjoyed the experience.

Delicious Thai Food at LumLum

LumLum offers an authentic Thai experience with bold flavors and fresh ingredients. The Pad Thai is a perfect balance of sweet, salty, and spicy, while the Green Curry is rich,creamy. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. Whether you're a Thai food enthusiast or new to the cuisine, this spot delivers a memorable meal.

I stopped by Wah Fung No.1 Fast Food early in the morning right after they opened, and there was already a small line forming‚Äîwhich is always a good sign! This local spot is known for its Chinese-style roasted pork, duck, and chicken, with a very simple menu. But don‚Äôt let the limited options fool you‚Äîthe food is amazing.

One of the biggest surprises was the price. It‚Äôs incredibly affordable, which is rare in Manhattan, especially for the amount of food you get. I ordered a large roasted pork and a large roast chicken‚Äîand they didn‚Äôt hold back! Each box came loaded with flavorful meat, steamed cabbage, and a generous serving of rice.

The wait was about 15 minutes, but it moved quickly since the food is already prepped and ready. Everything was fresh, hot, and absolutely delicious. I highly recommend grabbing your food and enjoying it at the small park right next to the restaurant. Eating it while it‚Äôs still hot makes it even better‚Äîdefinitely worth every penny.

I went on a Saturday at around 2:10 and the line was to the corner. I ended getting my food around 4:00, that‚Äôs almost 2 f‚Äôin hours. The cashier was very polite and so were all the staff. Once you have a bite of the food it makes up for the long wait times. I would definitely recommend either going right before they open up or maybe late in the day when it‚Äôs not so busy. I also recommend eating the food fresh and not later in the day, it‚Äôs just not the same.
I was with my wife so thank g-d she waited on line and I went to North Dumpling on Essex street to get some juicy fried dumplings to hold us over until we got our food. You can‚Äôt beat 10 dumplings for $4.00.
I ended up ordering a small duck over cabbage and rice and a large pork over cabbage and rice. The duck was good but I am not a fan of all the fat and bones. The pork was out of this world! No fat or bones and cut up into little slices of pure heaven.
I think the large at $9.00 is a great deal and if you don‚Äôt eat like a pig it can be shared amongst two people.
They only take cash as form of payment.

The first time I heard of this place was from watching a YouTube video, I instantly knew I was going to give this place a try. Been to New York many times and did not had a chance to try it out. Finally this time I made a visit. Upon arrival, the line was only filled with few customers ahead of me. I understand why lines form, because this place is basically a hole in the wall. Once I entered I  smelled the aroma from the barbecue which made my appetite even bigger. I was in and out very quickly thanks to their friendly and well trained staffs. I highly recommend this place who is hungry wants an affordable meal. Definitely will be back for more delicious meals.

This spot is an institution for their Cantonese style roast meat. The char siu is perfection and hard to beat in Manhattan in terms of value. Yes, the name suggests fast but be prepared for a wait. It‚Äôs that good. On my recent visit on a Saturday afternoon, it was about half an hour to get my lunch - but absolutely worth it!

Stopped here for a quick bite. It's not a place to sit and eat but there is a nice little park across the street. The food is hot, good, and plenty in one little box. We paid about $25 for 4 of us and that was with a drink. Highly recommend!!

Tatiana‚Äôs in NYC is a vibe for Caribbean inspired dishes! Scored a late reservation for a group of five, including two birthday celebrations, and everything from the service to the music was on point. We were seated within minutes and taken care of all night.

Food highlights:
‚Ä¢	Curried goat patties ‚Äì absolutely the best dish of the night, would return just for this!
‚Ä¢	Jerk lamb ribs ‚Äì flavorful and juicy.
‚Ä¢	Chopped cheese special ‚Äì another top favorite.
‚Ä¢	Mom Duke‚Äôs shrimp ‚Äì big, bold flavors (but still in the shell).
‚Ä¢	Fried branzino ‚Äì tasty but be cautious of bones.
‚Ä¢	Cornbread with honey butter ‚Äì simple but delicious.
‚Ä¢	Short rib pastrami suya and bodega dessert ‚Äì skips for me, but not deal breakers.

It‚Äôs lively (sometimes loud), but the energy is great. Highly recommend if you can get a reservation‚Äîperfect for a fun night out or special occasion.

Somehow snagged a 5:15pm reservation on a Wednesday, so it was an early dinner but worth it. Our waiter first checked with us if we had a show to attend - we didn‚Äôt, but this was a thoughtful touch. Two of us ordered 2 small sharing plates and 2 large plates. I think we could have done three small, 1 large as the chicken especially had a much bigger portion than expected.

Definitely get the curried goat patties. I also really liked the crispy okra. The oxtail was delicious, but surprisingly I preferred the sofrito roasted chicken. As for dessert, you know we had to do the cosmic brownie. I don‚Äôt know how they make the ice cream taste like powdered donuts‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a culinary feat!

The only con for me - I thought the host service lacked a bit of professionalism. We were seated at a table for two and asked to move shortly after. When I asked why, they said the table needed to be pushed together with the one next to it so that four people could sit there. The tables were never pushed together, nor was a party of four ever seated - only 2 separate parties of 2. Additionally, when we got our coats from coat check, they didn‚Äôt realize I had left a bag with them as well. I slightly had higher expectations of that service for such a highly sought-after restaurant, hence the 4 star review. The food definitely earns 5 stars though.

I thought the food was amazing. It‚Äôs exactly my palate. We got the cornbread, okra, goat patties, pastrami and oxtails.

The pastrami is one of the best bites I‚Äôve ever had as someone who loves pastrami sandwiches. Okra was outstanding.

The other dishes were great though not as perfect as the other two. The cosmic brownie desert is excellent and an absolute must. The portions are relatively large though on the pricey side.

This place is pricey but it is significantly upleveled food. Felt like a Masterchef finale 3 course meal for someone showing an NYC experience. Would 10/10 come back.

Mission impossible! I got Lucky w standby reservations the weekend while visiting nyc ‚ÄúTatiana‚Äù was the only food spot on my to-do list & it did not disappoint. We tried curry goat patties, chopped cheese, oxtail dish, rum cake!  The patties were my fav, goat seasoned and cooked to perfection. The truffles gave the chopped cheese a really nice flavor. Now about these oxtails:  mines had more fat then I‚Äôd care for, I need my oxtail in a stew or ragu‚Äîoff the bone w a hint of veggies at that price point. I dont want to clean spiced sticky sauce from under my nails for $130 a person!! The gravy was decent but very one note and the rice portion was slim considering my hubby is Jamaican and these are shareable portions. Rum cake was 10/10. Very pricey but the vibes & atmosphere along w excellent service measures up. Lower rating of my experience due to oxtail preparation‚Äîit was giving someone ran out of time.

Tatiana's 100% lives up to the hype. Upon arriving the staff is friendly and ready to greet you with a warm smile. Servers were extremely attentive and personable. Curried Goat Patties stole the show out the gate. Crab Rangoon I could live without but the pastrami is definitely worth ordering. The Bodega Special with a coffee was a perfect send off to an amazing dinner. Can't wait to go back.

Shukette serves fine dining quality food in a casual and fun setting. With music blaring and conversations rumbling, it‚Äôs hard not to at least order a NA beverage or a cocktail to get into the mood of the place.

The food service was shockingly quick and there was plenty of staff to make sure that we had everything we needed. They were also well in tune with the allergies the table and were accommodating to our requests.

Let me just say this: if you make your own bread, I will love your restaurant. So you might of guessed it, I love this place. With a handful of Middle Eastern classics to choose from, it seems like it‚Äôs hard to go wrong. On the flip side of this, I wasn‚Äôt crazy for the Fava Bean dip, but, the smoked trout was delicious and I‚Äôd eat it on just about anything.

Every protein was expertly seasoned and/or marinated.

I‚Äôd I only had two major qualms with the service:
1. Serving kabob skewers straight off the grill looks really cool presentation wise, but that requires customers to handle hot metal sticks.
2. The service itself was a bit chaotic, and while the staff did a great job clearing plates, they lost track of what we had ordered at a point and looked to us to tell them what else was missing

And not really a third but kinda a personal thing is that the Tahini Ice Cream was really weird.

That‚Äôs all.

My experience at Shukette was truly one of a kind. We arrived earlier than our reservation time‚Äîsomething I recommend doing, regardless‚Äîand still got seated promptly. The heated patio was indeed warm and completely covered. While the interior can be a bit cramped and loud, it still creates a pleasant atmosphere for dinner.

Regarding the food, everything we ordered was amazing, but I highly recommend trying the hummus and cauliflower; they are must-haves. However, we did face an unexpected issue when two of our meals were delayed and arrived about 45 minutes later than the others.

Fortunately, our waitress, Hailey, went above and beyond to address the problem. Not only did she apologize, but she also brought us an extra mezze to try, comped one of the delayed dishes, and treated us to the famous tahini soft serve. Despite the mix-up with our meals, we ended up having an extremely enjoyable dinner with some delightful extras!

If you haven't had the chance yet, I also recommend checking out their sister restaurant, Shuk! Both places demonstrate that affordable small meals can be incredibly delicious!

Came here for dinner a few weeks ago and loved everything we had! I will say the small plates felt more varied and diverse in flavor than the main entrees but the mains are quite good, as well. The frena is amazing - fluffy, garlicky, and delightful. We tried the hummus, the arctic char, the chicory salad, butter beans, seasoned fries (perfectly crisped), and lamb skewer. I'd say the lamb skewer was incredibly well seasoned and cooked perfectly - would recommend. We had the tahini soft serve at the end which was good but maybe way too much on top of what we already ate - worth trying but would sample the other sorbet instead.

A memorable and decadent experience for the books! Coming into this vibrant and bustling Middle Eastern restaurant, you‚Äôll see quickly why this restaurant is so popular. Food is delicious and flavorful and cocktails were creative and tasty. Plates come out very quickly, so be prepared! Service is quite good, considering how busy it gets. The environment may be a bit too loud for some but personally I didn‚Äôt find an issue with it. Reservations may be difficult but worth it!

My boyfriend and I passed by this place so many times since it is right down the street. We decided we had to try it out since every time we passed by it was packed. We finally got a reservation and decided to try it out.

The portions were all very big and tasted very good. We definitely understood why the wait is so long and why this place is packed. We ordered a fish which came out undercooked. We brought this to the staff's attention and they immediately took it back to make us a new one. During the wait, they served us (what I think is) Frena. It was absolutely delicious and understand why each table has an order. We also got dessert on the house which was also very good.

The service was on par and was beyond outstanding for a place so busy. My boyfriend tried coming back on a weekday and the wait time was 2 hours. So try to get a reservation so you don't have to wait.

A very popular place for its size. According to the host, this place is very busy throughout the day and always has a line. My husband and I put our names on their waiting list at 10:30am (2-4 hrs wait time) then went on to explore Chinatown. We received a couple texts from Golden Diner while out-and about that required our response to stay on the waiting list.

A nice welcome when we returned! Finally sat down with menu at 1:50pm. All the staff were very friendly & helpful. The place is very clean, charming and inviting. My husband and I ordered the Honey Butter Pancakes and the Korean Barbecue Wings. Both were delicious but the Honey Butter Pancakes were the star of the show and so fluffy! Note: Pancakes are available with Berry Compote topping. Looking forward to returning soon for the worth-the-wait pancakes!

Additional note: Definitely recommend visiting further Chinatown spots immediately after putting your name on the list then working your way back toward the area.

They now are holding barstools just for walk-ins and some tables + they added outdoor seating, so your odds just got better! I pulled up at 9:41, seated by 10:05‚Äîworth every minute.

The Honey Butter Pancakes were fluffy, buttery pancakes and topped with lemon zest (def shareable), crispy wings with and without the gochujang sauce, juicy inside, and sangria on the side (could‚Äôve been sweeter, but still a vibe). Service was fast, friendly, and no rush.

Pro tip: Get there 30 mins before open, especially on windy days like yesterday‚Äîfewer folks in line. As of April 12, 2025, they accept reservations on @resy for all business hours. They are only 28 seats inside but with outdoor it‚Äôs 52 in total. I was 15th lineand still got in! I know I was lucky, usually it‚Äôs a two hour wait and I chanced it.

Can‚Äôt wait to go back for the sandwiches next time.

The wait was WORTH it. Showed up at 9:15am on a Wednesday and I was 3rd in line. By 9:45 there was easily 20 more people behind me. The pancakes were so delicious! Nice, warm and fluffy. The honey butter sauce complimented the pancakes nicely and they were not too soggy. The addition of lemon zest was a nice touch too. 10/10 recommend.

Golden dinner is a cute little spot in Chinatown that is going viral for its fluffy pancakes, which were so good!! We heard you need to get there early to get a table if you don‚Äôt have a reservation. We tried booking a table online but it‚Äôs fully booked a month out. They open at 10am but if you get there at opening there will be a line outside wrapped around the building some times up to 2 hours before opening. We got there an hour early and we were the first ones in line, I read a review that said if you are not one of the first 15 people in line you won‚Äôt get seated the first round. The pancakes were delicious and are very buttery with a hint of lemon, definitely worth trying. But my favorite dish was the fired Korean chicken wings!! You have to get them tossed in the sauce, and they were so tasty. We also tried the katsu chicken
sandwich which was good and also the breakfast sandwich was also pretty good as well. Honestly this place was delicious and worth checking out I think we will definitely be back to try more tasty food!!

It was good food, but not worth the hype or the wait. People are lining up at the door at 7:30 AM and they don‚Äôt open until 10. We waited an hour and as we were ushered in to diner, there were people who were looking at 2 1/2 hour waits to get in. Why you may ask? That‚Äôs a very good question that only the Spin Doctors of social media could fully explain. Was it good? Yes. Was it great? No. Was it worth a one hour wait? No. Would it be worth a 2.5 hour wait? Definitely not. Blue ribbon in New York City used to do pancakes for brunch, and those pancakes were far superior. I wound saying there is no wait, go in, if there is, then keep walking.

Had a great experience at Sukh! We sat at the bar and started with the coconut slices and curry samosas‚Äîboth packed with flavor and a perfect intro to the meal. The real standout, though, were the mains: the khao soi and ribeye steak from the winter special. The khao soi broth was rich and creamy, with super tender chicken (I wouldn‚Äôt have minded a few more potatoes!). The ribeye was perfectly cooked and full of flavor. Will definitely be coming back!

We went for the lunch special and it was very good.
We ordered some entries and salad and were phenomenal.
My main plate was a chicken pad thai and ohh boy this is the best pad thai Ive had in my life. The service and atmosphere were very good.
I will definitely come here again.

Second time and same tasty food and friendly service. The resultant itself is very cute, resembling a train at the bar and booth area. The menu is quite extensive with many options to choose from. We ordered a bunch and they were all very good. My favorite was the braised duck, which was so soft it melts, and full of flavor. The clay pot glass noodles were very spicy so be careful if you want to order this dish. Very authentic dishes overall and will be back again.

We visited here on a Friday night and had a reservation for 8.30. When we arrived our table wasn‚Äôt ready and we were told that we had to wait outside, and where then left waiting for 20 minutes (and it was pretty cold). Although it‚Äôs a good sign that the restaurant food must be good to be that busy it did put a bit of a dampener on the start of our experience at Sukh.

Once we finally got seated though the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant was lovely, and the food we saw coming out looked and smelt amazing. We ordered the Hor Mok, curry samosas and fried crab rolls (Hoi Jor Poo) to start. All the dishes were delicious but the Hor Mok was the standout dish, really different and tasty (a must order).

For mains we ordered Kang Keaw Wan, Khao Pad Rod Fai and the Ped Toon. We had also ordered another dish but this didn‚Äôt arrive (we didn‚Äôt realise initially so didn‚Äôt mention it). All of the dishes were great but the Ped Toon (a duck dish) was the standout for us, would definitely have this again if we revisited the restaurant.

Between 4, with us all having a couple of alcoholic drinks, the bill came to c$360 (including tax and tip). Not cheap but we felt for the quality of food it was fairly priced. A couple of niggles around service but we would return, although maybe at a time where they are not so busy.

Came to Sukh with my family for a late lunch and was absolutely blown away. What caught my attention to make a reservation was both the beautiful interior resembling a railway car and the authentic Thai menu with dishes that I have never seen before. As a new york native/local, there are a ton of Thai restaurants with your standard menu items like pad Thai and drunken noodles and while Sukh also has those staples, there were so many dishes I personally have never seen before.

Pompom, our waitress, was fantastic and did a great job helping walk us through the menu and gave delicious recommendations! There wasn't a single dish we ordered that we did not like.

Honestly, you won‚Äôt be disappointed with ordering any of their dishes.

10/10 would recommend and will definitely return!

We celebrated our wedding at this restaurant ‚Äî and it was absolute perfection!
The food was incredibly delicious and abundant ‚Äî every guest was blown away.
The service was exceptional: warm, attentive, and thoughtful. Everyone made us feel so special and truly cared for. And the ambience created (flowers and candles) was just so touching!
We‚Äôre endlessly grateful to the entire team for making our celebration unforgettable ‚ù§Ô∏è

Everything about this place was superb.

The interior is absolutely breathtaking and caught my eye first. Stopped here for a quick bite before heading to the airport.

Had a glass of white wine and some cream of mushroom soup.

Everything was so good.

The staff was very friendly and professional. They were quick to serve, attentive and good at explaining all the options.

The interior decor in this place takes the cake though. Perfect atmosphere for a date or a casual weekday dinner meet up with friends.

The lamb stuffed grape leaves were AMAZING! Gosh, I could eat two plates on my own as a meal.

The mixed grill plate is SO good. It is a lot of food but just get it to go!!
All the meats were very well cooked - a tad bit salty on a small portion of the grilled meats but that‚Äôs ok! The dish as a whole was so good.

I wouldn‚Äôt order the salad again as it was nothing special.

The service was fine - took some time to get our servers attention a couple times when we wanted to get more drinks and the bill. But the front staff and we think the manager or the owner of the restaurant were very nice.

A Must-Try Georgian Gem in Brooklyn, NYC

This is hands down one of the best, if not the best, restaurants I‚Äôve eaten at in Brooklyn, New York City, from an ingredient quality and flavor perspective. The Georgian Salad is absolutely sensational‚Äîfresh, vibrant, and full of flavor. The bread with cheese (a mix of four different cheeses and egg) was good, though slightly overrated in my opinion; it could benefit from a bit more seasoning to balance the cheesiness.

The Khinkali with lamb was decent, but the lamb could use more seasoning, and the dough could be thinner to enhance the overall experience. On the other hand, the cabbage dish was out of this world, and the chicken was fantastic‚Äîtender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. The Georgian wine was another highlight, and I would highly recommend trying it.

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, making it a great spot to hang out with friends. The staff were incredibly hospitable and provided excellent service. While it is a bit pricey for the portion sizes, the overall experience makes it worth a visit. If you‚Äôre in Brooklyn and looking to try authentic Georgian cuisine, this place is a must!

The food was tasty and it was put on our table rather quickly regardless of how busy the place was. I‚Äôm a big fan of khachapuri so definitely recommend it if you like h cheese. Love the potatoes with the sauce, it‚Äôs kind of sour so if that‚Äôs not your thing then keep it in mind.

We had a great time at Tara M√≥r Irish Bar in NYC! The atmosphere was lively with live music, and we really enjoyed the unique cocktails, especially the Club Orange and Club Lemon with tequila and gin. The ‚ÄúFloozie in the Jacuzzi‚Äù cocktail was also a favorite with its delicious foam topping.

The food was amazing, from the shishito peppers and arancini to the tuna tartare, fried calamari, and crab cakes. The buffalo chicken sandwich and fish & chips were perfect, and the cr√®me br√ªl√©e cheesecake was a great way to end the meal.

Highly recommend this place for great drinks, food, and a fun atmosphere!

A great little spot to grab a beer and some. Warm and welcoming atmosphere that is cozy and quaint. Several Irish classics to fill your appetite. Service was friendly. Prices were reasonable. Located across from the Marriott and easy to get to. Parking is tough. I really enjoyed the curry fries. Go here to grab a pint.

I went after 2pm, and before 4pm. It was quiet and not busy. I had the fish and chips and a mexpresso martini. The food and drinks were great. The ladies there were very nice, friendly, and kind. Very relaxed and cute atmosphere. Would definitely go back!

My friends and I had an incredible time. I loved the pickle martini, one of the best martinis I‚Äôve had in the city! Can‚Äôt recommend that enough. We also got Floozie in the Jacuzzi and I typically don‚Äôt like berry flavoured drinks but this one was so good that we ate the blackberry foam right off! The concept is like a typical night out in Ireland and you start with light drinks and work your way up. We also ordered a low ABV hazelnut espresso-tini and Sam Said So. The ricotta and sourdough and the burger are a must! Honestly can‚Äôt wait to come back and try out their other drinks.

Loved our date night at the new iteration of Tara Mor in midtown.

Love the concept of a modern Irish experience in NYC with whimsical Cocktail options and some delicious Irish and American classic bites.

The space is gorgeous and a great spot to celebrate St Pattys day coming up

We loved the Alligator sausage, Lamb Chops, the cheeseburger and their pasta dish, everything was legit delicious

My friend and I decided to check out Lucky Rabbit Noodles after it was hyped up on social media and had very good reviews. We went when it opened at 11am on a Saturday. They are trying to go with hole-in-the-wall vibes with their interior, but the pricing is not aligned with that. The interior only seats about 5 people at a time, so try to either get takeout for the park or go at an off time.

My friend got the braised beef and noodles ($26), and I got the garlic noodles ($18). There is a 5% service charge, which I wish they disclosed, because I would have paid in cash if that was an option (it may not be). My friend commented that the noodles were almost gluey (maybe undercooked), the beef was nice and tender with nice flavor, but nothing else aside from the meat had flavor. The garlic noodles were very dry and also severely lacked flavor. I forced myself to finish it because of the price.

Location-wise, I understand why this place needs to have their prices so high. However, your food needs to justify those prices. Truthfully, even if their prices were lower, the noodles were not good. I think they should bring a few people in for taste testing and revamp their menu. The owner also has some rude replies on Google reviews (telling a reviewer to kick rocks), which I think is poor customer service.

What a cozy place on a cold & rainy day! Spontaneous visit today after seeing the great Google reviews. My husband & I came here after seeing a local art show. I ordered the Garlic Noodles with Chicken & my husband had the Signature Dish, Braised Beef & Noodles.

We were both pleasantly surprised by the fresh homemade noodles which were soft, delicious & chewy. Also, we were very impressed by the combination of tasty flavors. My husband even commented that he was having a ‚Äòspiritual experience‚Äô while enjoying his food üòä Great to see there are vegan options as well. Staff were all friendly & greeted us when we arrived. Definitely will be back to try some more dishes & dumplings.

Note: Large parties, the place is very small with limited seating.

Disappointed after a long wait and high hopes. We ordered a good portion of the menu and waited quite a while, so we were really expecting something special. Unfortunately, the experience fell short. The curry tasted more like something from a packet than a freshly made dish, and the dumplings were cold in the center‚Äîdefinitely felt like they were frozen and not properly cooked. The buffalo rice with ‚Äúhomemade buffalo sauce‚Äù also didn‚Äôt deliver; it just didn‚Äôt have the flavor or freshness we expected. For the wait time and price, the quality just wasn‚Äôt there.

Stumbled across this place as it had great reviews. The seating area is super cute and small. We had to sit outside but that was okay. I ordered a bunch of dishes to try. Food came out quickly and looked great but after eating them, I couldn‚Äôt finish because it was so heavy and oily. Might just be the dish choices I ordered but probably wouldn‚Äôt come here again.

Braised beef noodles were delicious! No complaints on the portion size. Super thankful for the service! I also had a Thai milk tea to begin with. They have Vegan beverages so there was no regular milk in it, after expressing that I didn't like my drink due to the previously unknown coconut milk in my Thai milk tea, they gladly swapped it out for a passion fruit green tea. The green tea was delicious! Definitely gonna come back on another day to try out the dumplings!

Shu Jiao Fu Zhou is a standout culinary gem tucked away in New York‚Äôs Chinatown, delivering authentic Fuzhou flavors with unbeatable value. Visitors consistently rave about the steamed dumplings and pork & chive dumplings, praised for being juicy, flavorful, and affordable. Many have pointed out that even during rush hour, service is impressively swift‚Äîone diner mentioned being in and out within five minutes.

The peanut butter noodles are another fan favorite, striking a perfect balance between savory and comforting. Several reviewers mentioned how these dishes transported them back to their childhood in China, which speaks volumes about the authenticity. The restaurant‚Äôs prices‚Äîoften under $10‚Äîmake it a haven for food lovers on a budget. One guest exclaimed their meal was cheaper than a latte, and another said they could feast for less than $20.

Despite being packed most of the time, customers appreciate the fast service and piping hot food. While the atmosphere varies in reviews‚Äîsome find it cozy, others note it could be cleaner‚Äîthe food consistently earns top marks. There‚Äôs also a cash-only policy, so visitors should come prepared.

Critique: The only downside? Their official website seems to be down, which is inconvenient for those looking to preview the menu or plan their visit. Hopefully, they get that fixed soon.

Nothing here is worth going out of your way for unless you're willing to sacrifice cleanliness, flavor, and quality ingredients for a very inexpensive meal. I wouldn't go out my way to eat here. The restaurant is filthy. The kitchen looked clean. But the front of the house is another story. Four stars because it's cheap. The wheat noodles in peanut sauce was just ok. The beef soup with noodles was flavorless. The meat was suspect. Skip the Hot and Sour soup. No flavor and way too much corn starch. It was gelatinous. I had the pork and chive dumplings and I think it was the shrimp and spinach dumplings. They were ok. They serve watered down Sriracha on every table. A lot of other cheap dumpling places in Chinatown do that and it's simply off-putting.

I can't believe how good and juicy the dumplings are. They're for a good price too, for those on a tight budget such as myself. Not to mention- They worked so fast, I was in and out within 5 minutes during dinner's rush hour. The soy sauce has this kind of tongue-tingly kick and it's addictive, like oh my god.

Definitely coming back to try other dishes, this is a must try for those who want quick eats along traveling for your money's worth.

The wheat noodles üçú were better with the peanut sauce. The thick rice noodles were like spaghetti, but softer. It was ok with the peanut sauce, both of  it did needed a extra kick to the dish, like a little hot sauce and Housin, or hot sauce and a little bit of sugar with maybe a slice of chopped up cucumbers mixed in and some cilantro. Was a place big, for a small shop. Understandable for the crowds. Multiple tables was great, during winter. High hopes here.

Super affordable you can get full on less then 5 bucks. That's hard to beat. You can go crazy for less then 20 bucks. Peanut butter noodles are good. Fried pork and chive dumplings are good. Nice sitting area but took mine to go and it was still hot. Would recommend definitely if you're on a budget.

A very chic and wonderful restaurant. The food was truly delicious and very good. We came here without ordering and were seated immediately. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. We felt very comfortable here and had a great meal. We can absolutely recommend this restaurant. A special attraction is the bookshelf. But we don't want to give away any spoilers.

I had an amazing experience at 5ive Spice Taco & Banh Mi! The food was incredibly fresh and flavorful‚Äîevery bite of the banh mi had the perfect balance of crispy baguette, tender meat, and tangy pickled veggies. The brussels sprouts were a standout, perfectly caramelized and packed with flavor. To top it off, the Vietnamese iced coffee was rich and smooth, the perfect complement to the meal.

The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it a great spot to enjoy a casual yet delicious dining experience. Service was friendly! Definitely a must-visit for banh mi lovers and anyone looking for a unique twist on Vietnamese flavors!

I have often dined here with my boyfriend or alone (it wasn't awkward at all). My favorite dishes are Bun Bo Hue and Classic Beef. Service was quick and prompt; I didn't feel rushed at all. The portions and price were reasonable. I highly recommend it.

A cool Vietnamese taco bar. We stopped in after seeing some nice reviews and we're glad we did! The service was friendly and the place was  clean, very interesting hidden bathroom. We really enjoyed the lemongrass chicken Vietnamese Taco.  Great place to stop in for lunch, we will definitely be back.
Got the lemongrass chicken vermicelli bowl‚Äîexactly what I was looking for! Fresh veggies, great flavor, and super fast service. The hidden bookcase door to the restroom was a fun touch.

Excellent neighborhood spot.  Food was delicious and everything we ordered was pretty good.  Nothing out of the ordinary but the quality of the food was really good and menu had a good variety of items.  The steak, halibut and zucchini flowers were probably the most memorable dishes. I thought the pastas could have been a bit better seasoned.  Really enjoyed it and would recommend and go back!

Evelina nails the ambiance‚Äîit‚Äôs a beautifully cozy, dimly lit spot that feels effortlessly romantic, perfect for date night or an intimate dinner with friends. The service is warm, attentive, and genuinely welcoming, adding to the overall great vibe of the place. Unfortunately, the food doesn‚Äôt quite live up to the setting. While nothing was outright bad, most dishes felt a bit underwhelming and lacked the flavor or finesse you‚Äôd hope for at this price point. The crudo was a bit meaty and chunky and the bread and dips felt more like a greek dish than an Italian one which felt out of place. The tiramisu was great. Still, if you‚Äôre looking for a charming atmosphere and great hospitality, Evelina is worth a visit‚Äîjust don‚Äôt go in expecting a culinary knockout.

This neighborhood spot has such great charm to it. We came on a snowy night and it had such beautiful cozy vibes. The art and the decor was lovely. The service was really great, we came with the party of four and we were there just under 2 1/2 hours. Everything is very unique, I think our favorite was the mushroom pasta, as well as the olive oil cake.

I had an amazing dining experience on my first visit here! My date and I shared the scallops, tartar, and zucchini flowers as appetizers, and each dish was packed with incredible combinations of flavors.
