For the main course, we tried the halibut and red snapper, both of which were cooked to perfection‚Äîjuicy, tender, and absolutely delicious. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a memorable experience.

Ambiance is good. Good service. Ordered the zucchini flowers as an app, was unimpressed. No bread or anything for the table. Then we got the mafaldine with pesto and the ragu pasta. The pesto was not flavorful, in fact it tasted like soap. The ragu was good but was not wowed. We ordered the tiramisu and the olive oil cake, those were the highlights. At the end, there was some spilled gelato on the table and they cleared plates but did not bother to clean off the table. Overall, I was pretty unimpressed by the dishes even though they looked great reading off the menu.

Came in for the chicken Parmesan based on other reviews and was told they don‚Äôt make it. Sad.

Plenty of other options in the regular and specials menu.

I opted for the wagyu beef lasagna ($30). Sounded like a good comfort food option with a quality meat.

First came the bread and olive oil. Was nice to have an option with nuts and raisins, something you don‚Äôt see all the time. Bread nice and soft too.

Lasagna had good taste but had no structure that lasagna should have. It was a mound of dough, sauce and cheese instead of a crafted structure.

House made desserts sound nice but didn‚Äôt have time to try them out. Next time!

Food was lovely and flavorful. We ordered the frito misto which had a mixture of calamari, zucchini rings, shrimp and onions it was all well seasoned and lightly battered. We ordered two pasta dishes and they both were delicious, the pasta had a good texture. I would go back to try the lamb entree. Don‚Äôt skip dessert here!! The tiramisu was so good it had a drizzle of raspberry jam on the bottom which elevated the coffee flavor of the tiramisu. They had a good selection of other desserts.

The staff and service were outstanding. We went on a Wednesday night without a reservation and were seated right away, might need a reservation if you go on the weekend. We ordered everything at once but they waited for us to finish each course  until they brought out the next, it was a little detail but I really appreciated it.

We had dinner at Da Claudio while staying in the finical district and truly enjoyed the experience. It restaurant has a relaxing, non-pretentious vibe. The food was simple and tasty‚Ä¶made with fresh clean ingredients. We enjoyed the beef carpaccio, arugula salad, squid in pasta with shrimp, and bolognese. All very good! The staff was friendly and easily accommodated food allergies (dairy). Highly recommend.

TRY THE VONGOLE!!!!!!!!!! THE VONGOLE AT THIS PLACE IS A MUST-HAVE!!!!!!!!!!! YOU WILL BE HAUNTED IF YOU DON‚ÄôT DINE THE VONGOLE.

If you are in nyc and don‚Äôt go for the vongole this restaurant serves, I SWEAR you are missing out a HUGE part and will regret for the rest of your lifetime.

My husband is the type that has ONLY eaten vongole throughout his whole life (trust me when I say he has eaten at least 10,000 plates at different restaurants) and he literally teared up at how insanely delicious the vongole at this restaurant was.

SO TRY THE VONGOLE.

Not to mention the staffs were extremely friendly and the atmosphere inside was super cozy with just the right amount of heat and light:)

Food and service were great!
Especially appreciated the attention to service. Dirty dishes?...gone! dropped fork?...immediately replaced.
The perfect balance of checking on things, but not being annoying.
We really looooooved the bread!
Enjoyed well made drinks and quality dishes

My friend was craving some oysters after an early Saturday night dinner. We found Upstate and it was still pretty packed at around 8. We were able to put our names down for 9 PM for three seats at the bar. We ordered:

-Oysters (Sea Kist, Wellfleet, Wave Lengths, Upstate's Own, Blue Whale) - these were all east coast oyster because the west coast ones were sold out. East coast oysters are priced at $2.85 each, which is reasonable IMO for regular pricing. There are some types of oysters that are plumper than others, so you can always ask for recommendations. All of the oysters were pretty good but I did get a few that weren't properly shucked
-Little neck clams - I love a good clam, and these were nice and fresh. I might have liked them even more than the oysters
-Escargot (snails slow cooked in basil and parsley butter) - this was probably one of the worst escargot I've ever eaten. It didn't really have much flavor, and the butter tasted like movie theater popcorn butter
-Uni (Maine uni, quail egg, salmon roe with toast points) - this wasn't what I was expecting. It served on some sort of cauliflower puree (?), which masked the flavor of everything else. The bread also tasted a bit stale

For drinks, I had the dragon stout, which reminded me of a Guinness Extra Stout. It was pretty good. They also have a nice variety of other beers on draft. If that's not your thing, they've got some wine and a few cocktails, but none of the cocktails appealed to me that night.

The food menu sounds really good but if it's similar to the two dishes we ordered, I probably wouldn't try it. I would come back for more oysters/clams though!

This place is small but cozy. I love the waiter as I felt so welcome by his passionate service. Oyster is so fresh and cheap. They have a happy hour price, so if you order oyster before 7pm. You will get a great price with the drink. We ordered 2 rounds and we just loving it!!!! Will definitly visit again for sure!!!

This was my second visit! My first experience was okay, but today was so much better!

Since it was a Sunday night, we had to wait a bit longer than expected, but despite how busy it was, the male waiter was incredibly welcoming and kind.

All the food we had was great‚Äîespecially the happy hour oysters, which are a must-try! I also recommend the wild shrimp. The tuna was a little salty but still delicious.

Amazing experience, our server was amazing and gave us some really good suggestion on the oysters. The happy hour deal is amazing, you get 6 oysters and a beer for 12 dollars.
I would recommend this place to anyone that wants to try some good oysters in a classy restaurant that also offers other seafood plates.

This oyster bar offers four main categories on the menu: appetizers, main courses, oysters, and beverages. They provide a small order slip where you can write down the quantity of oysters you'd like. The main courses are generously portioned, priced between $20 and $30. Oysters are divided into two main types: West Coast and East Coast, ranging from $2.85 to $4 each. West Coast oysters are rich and sweet, while East Coast oysters are refreshing and salty. We ordered 10 East Coast oysters and 2 West Coast oysters. Personally, we preferred the West Coast oysters as the East Coast ones were a bit too salty for our taste. The interior is dimly lit, romantic, and cozy, with four bar seats where you can watch the kitchen in action. Overall, this oyster bar offers excellent value for money and comes highly recommended!

Found out today our favorite neighborhood bar (that has great food in the evenings) also has a banging brunch! Large portions, friendly service, 10/10.

Evenings ‚Äî drinks are expensive but very good. Daily happy hour 3-6.

No reservations.

Love this spot! So nice to have a solid neighborhood bar/restaurant so close by. Best thing is that the food and service are top notch. I've been here in the mornings a few times and am always happy to see Cesar, who is super friendly, greet me. I've had the chilaquiles, chorizo egg and cheese, and bloody Marys and you cannot be steered wrong! Definitely check out Nobody Told Me!

Nobody told you? Well, then, let me tell you.
The steak Chilaquiles was a little bit of beef shaved on top of a mountain of tortillas chips. I only ate the beef, because personally, I don‚Äôt like tortillas chips, and especially so when it is soggy with sauce. The smoked salmon were not very fresh. It seemed dried out a bit. Now, the burger hit the spot. And the grapefruit lemonade also hit the spot. The three stars are all for these two items. (No photo of the burger because it just looks like a regular burger.)

Nice neighborhood bar with some good food and drinks options. The spicy chicken sandwich is pretty amazing to be honest. Also, love the newly opened outdoor area.

One critique goes to martinis. They should be either served in smaller glasses with the current 3 ounce pour OR upgraded to 4.5 ounce pours using the same glasses. It just looks weird when your martini comes served half full.

The burger. Believe the hype. This burger has the top-notch ingredients and char of a first-class burger, with the compact, juiciness of Shake Shack and the special sauce and toasted bun of In-N-Out. The potato bun is also buttered. The patty itself is so delectably season and the whole thing is this juicy, creamy, cheesy amazingness. The fish tacos are also pretty good and our waiter was the kindest. That burger though‚Ä¶ damn.

5 stars!!!!

Had a very good brunch on our last day in the city. My partner had chicken and waffles and said they were the best he has ever had. I had the soup/sandwich combo and the soup was very good but I wasn't a big fan of brioche for a grilled cheese. More of a sourdough girl. No fault of the restaurant, just my preference. Service was excellent and the bloody Mary was also excellent. Would recommend!

My girlfriend introduced me to this place and it's great. I've had almost the whole menu and everything is great. The bartender Adva makes amazing drinks and delivers perfect service. Before meeting her I never liked margaritas and now it is my to go drink. Adva makes the best drinks and is very kind!

Carlo & Tiffany are truly AMAZING!!! He took care of us the whole night long and made sure our cups were never empty!!! Such a great environment after work wind down! Amazing music! And everyone was so friendly and great! WILL DEFINITELY BE COMING BACK! I am obsessed!! So glad I found this spot! ü©∑ Thank you Carlo!!!

My small family of 3 were in town visiting and gave this place a try given its proximity to our hotel and let me tell you we made the right choice. The food was really good but the atmosphere was great and the staff was among the best I have ever had. Carlo was out waiter and he gave recommendations and was extremely personable. Top that off with our daughter spilled her lemonade (6 YO) and she began to cry because she was embarrassed and upset. Carlo heard the crash and came running. He said it‚Äôs not a problem and tried to comfort my daughter. Within seconds another staff member was next to the table assisting. They moved us to another table to keep our dinning experience moving while they cleaned up the mess. It was a super compassionate gesture that got our daughter to calm down and our night moving on smoothly. Really appreciate the staff and Carlo for being so amazing.

Drinks were amazing
Buffalo chicken dip was awesome and full of chicken
Chicken sandwich was good but a little dry
Prices were extremely reasonable for NYC
Food is ok, but the service was lacking and some items are incredibly overpriced (~$14 for tater tots). Everyone was generally happy with the food quality, but it's not a must try.

Still one of the best Mexican tacos in the city.

Los Tacos has been hailed as the best taco in the city for a long time, and I recently came here while the memory of Taquer√≠a Ram√≠rez was still fresh. Funny enough, my first-ever taco was actually from Los Tacos No.1 at their Chelsea Market location almost a decade ago. Back then, it didn‚Äôt leave a huge impression, but I wanted to come back and see what I might‚Äôve missed.

Like TR, it‚Äôs CDMX-style with nixtamalized corn tortillas, but the overall vibe here leans more toward a classic Mexican street taco. The meats here pack more smokiness, while the tortillas at Ramirez still win for texture and flavor.

Nothing I had here topped the tripa taco from TR, but both the Adobaba and Carne asada were excellent. While Adobaba and Al pastor are both marinated pork, it‚Äôs hard to compare them directly. But personally, I prefer adobada for its juicier texture and that smoky finish. Bonus points for the guac here too, which you won‚Äôt find at TR.

I get why people are complaining about the price. Are the portions small for the price? Sure. But in a city where mediocre tacos cost just as much, this is still top-tier. If you want smoky, well-balanced flavors with good corn tortillas, the wait is worth it (line moves pretty fast, 15-20 minutes wait)

In spite of the reviews I thought this place would be over hyped but I was pleasantly surprised. I wasn‚Äôt wild about a standing room only restaurant that looked like it could fit 50 people when at least 100 were there. The service however was fast, efficient and friendly. The tacos were exceptional and the value was solid. As busy as it was the staff still managed to keep the place clean. I‚Äôm from Colorado and love Mexican food. This place is definitely 5 stars. Don‚Äôt let the long line dissuade you.

Los Tacos No. 1 in Manhattan really surprised me‚Äîin the best way! From the moment I walked in, it felt like I had stepped right into Mexico. The atmosphere is lively and full of energy, the staff is friendly, and the food is incredibly authentic. The tacos are full of flavor, the salsas are bold and spicy, and even the music adds to the whole experience. It‚Äôs rare to find a place that captures the essence of Mexico so well in the middle of NYC. Definitely worth the hype!

We recently ate at Los Tacos No 1. And let me tell you they are the best tacos I have had the establish is small. It has no chairs you eat standing up. For a place being in New York it is very clean very well. Kept the employees are always being very helpful. Wonderful staff highly recommend.

I'm no expert on NYC Mexican food but I can easily say these are the best tacos I had during my stay in the Big Apple. This place is always busy, so you may have to queue. It's worth the wait. Cheap and good. *****

I would highly recommend their food and cocktails. My friend and I had an amazingly delicious dinner though we greatly underestimated its portion sizes. My favorites were the spare ribs and spicy mushroom dish.

The staff were very attentive, quick to give us spare utensils when we dropped it and swift with other accommodations despite the restaurant being packed.

10/10 recommend, would definitely come here again ü§ó

I‚Äôd definitely go back and would recommend to friends. We went as a large group but I think you could go with a small group as though but should definitely at family style. I didn‚Äôt find anything super spicy unless I ate straight pepper. The purple rice, fried rice, and sweet maybe gel potato noodles were less popular. The scallion pancake, beef pancake wrap, spicy chicken something, and lamb with onion were all very popular.

Really great Szechuan food, but small portions.

Really enjoyed the flavor of the spicy cumin lamb, but the lamb was in small bits and there wasn‚Äôt much meat. The fragrant fish fillet was also very good! Fish tasted amazing and had a great silky texture. Chungking spicy chicken was okay, nothing too special.

Overall a great dining experience!
We ate mostly off the dim sum menu and everything was delicious.

We had:
Pork Soup Dumplings - amazingly delicious, savory, juicy dumpling served with a tangy vinegar & ginger sauce.
Beef pancake wrap - savory flakey crust surrounding tinder juicy beef, with fresh scallions & cilantro.
Dan Dan Noodles - spicy noodles with sesame paste& minced pork. My kids especially liked it but it does have a slight spicy kick but not strong. Beware this one is oily, it was crunched in oil, see my pictures.
Pork Pot Stickers - these were very flavorful & cooked to perfection, nice juicy dumplings with a slight crunch in the bottom.
Scallion Pancake  - flakey & soft, flavorful with a tasty dipping sauce. Tasted like the wrap on the Beef pancake wrap.
Egg Yolk Buns - steamed delicious soft black bread with a juicy combination of egg yolk, butter and sugar. Be careful how you eat this one or you‚Äôll get the liquid hot insides squirting all over your evening frock üòÜ
*the above are all dim sum sized portions, small in size but big in flavor.

We shared a chocolate mousse for dessert, which was chocolate creamy deliciousness covered in shaved chocolate but with a denser frozen white cream in the center. Not your traditional chocolate mousse center but still very delicious (see pictures).

I had the ‚ÄúMisty Rain‚Äù cocktail, which is a mixture of flavorful gin, longing tea & pear syrup. It was a refreshingly delicious well balanced simple tasting, lightly sweet drink that I would recommend. Be aware though that it is not served in the style of glass pictured in their drink menu  illustration. The picture shows it being served in a standard 8oz acopa cocktail glass, but it was actually served in a 4 oz tea cup. I would have preferred the glass they have pictured on their drink menu.

Next time we‚Äôre going to try more of the main entree dishes from the menu. We saw others enjoying what looked like really delicious food. We headed to a music show & my kids wanted a lite meal and could not resist ordering all the dim sum dishes.

Tips: we were a group of 3 and if you have less than 4 people you aren‚Äôt able to get a reservation after 4:30pm. So we ate at 4:30pm. It was a bit early, next time we‚Äôll invite someone to join us & get a later reservation.

The food was reasonably priced for the area. We paid $127.61 including tax & tip for the food & drinks I listed (see picture of receipt for more details).

I would definitely recommend this place for your next meal. The service was prompt & on point, and the decor was 1930s China, a beautiful eclectic mix.
The beef soup is pretty good, but other dishes are okay. Service is okay. The food is a bit spicy. If you don‚Äôt have spicy very often, ask for less spicy.

Small Greek restaurant in a quiet neighborhood. Great selection of appetizers and main dishes. I appreciated they also had gyros and souvlaki sandwiches, not just the typical chicken kebab and rice. The octopus is a must try grilled to perfection with lots of lime. The mezzo platter was good too I liked how the pita breads were grilled and crunchy.  The souvlaki was a big portion and love the fries inside with. If chunks of chicken. The lamb shawarma looks amazing too, the lamb was overflowing from the pita breads. falafel came with 6-7 huge pieces and fried to crispiness.  They have happy hour on weekends too! The beer mugs were frozen so the beer tastes even better

5 stars on everything! The food was fresh and great tasting, the menu is excellent.

The service was so warm, friendly and cheerful. The manager is also very pleasant, this restaurant holds themselves to a very high standard and that‚Äôs exactly what was needed in the area.

The decor is so calming as well, I‚Äôm already planning my next visit!

A lovely establishment with excellent food choices and quantity options that make it manageable. It also has a mini-bar and I‚Äôve only visited during lunch time, but will try an evening visit soon.
Update Nov 23‚Ä¶service excellence again and again‚Ä¶this time I included some pictures
fantastic kalamaraki, and my first experience with moussaka. Lovely atmosphere and owners were so nice they didn't kick us out despite us loitering after closing.
Chic, clean interior. Food is decent. The chicken souvlski was very good. The chicken gyro was a bit too burnt. The pita bread was a bit stale on the ends. The Greek coffee was nice.

Super cute place on second story of this apartment building. The food is definitely not fully authentic japanese. Its more like a pan asian twist on japanese izakaya classics. For example the chicken katsu don came with a sunny side up egg instead of the typical omelette/egg scrambled on top and they didnt put any onions in either. The breading on the chicken was unusually sweet as well it had almost that thai sweet chili flavor to it. I didnt mind it in the end but it was just unexpected and threw me off a bit. The dish costs $17 which I do think is too much for the amount they give you. It should be like $14 at the most for the portion size. The beef skewer was good but it was on the smaller side portion wise and it came with a heavy cumin seasoning which again was unexpected. I thought the flavor was good but again you dont normally expect to see cumin on japanese food. My wife liked her salmon don bowl. I appreciated how the beers were priced reasonably for example I got a kyoto matcha IPA bottle for $9. Most places in the city try and gouge you for this same beer at like $12-14. My other complaint is that they dont have any normal chairs. All of the seating is just wooden stools which although comfortable are no substitute for a proper chair with a backrest. Overall this is a good spot and is a nice addition to the montague street dining scene, but dont come here expecting it to be a 100% authentic japanese food experience.

I came to this restaurant after finding it on google maps and saw how well rated it was. I am now adding my two cents for this place because the food, presentation, service, and overall ambiance was very good! This place feels like a lowkey hole in the wall type of place that plays 80s-90s Japanese city pop and it‚Äôs very inviting. I recommend to get the sets because they‚Äôre very well worth it!

Staff was really friendly.  The food was very tasty. And the atmosphere was really chill.  The mushroom skewers were a little tough to chew fyi but well seasoned.  The vegetable tempura could have used season on the batter.  Really enjoyed the rolls and hot sake.
Recommend for large groups. Great atmosphere and love the Japanese decor. Skewers were a bit too much cumin flavor if requesting spicy option for our taste

The ambience was amazing and cozy, not too many people. The food was delicious, I really love the katsudon, and the mini don sets were beautiful and easy to share with my friend. Highly recommended for great food and a nice peaceful place to dine with friends.

This is a great spot for a bite to eat and they have awesome cocktails. A pretty decent sized menu and friendly staff. Loved the bang bang shrimp and the pork belly bao. Seems to get pretty busy but there is a nice, small outdoor seating area for when the weather is nice. Will be back and definitely recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

Now for my standard comments. Location is clean and well kept, at least in the outdoor seating area.

When I walked into this bar  I thought I made a big mistake..had a bad vibe from the bartender & the place in general did not make me comfortable..I Am happy to report I was wrong. Bartender was on point , drinks were great & the food & service was on point. Def recommend this little slice of heaven. Come by and have a bunch. üç∫üçªüç∑üç∏üçπüçæP.S food was delicious.

Absolutely gorgeous bar with great service and an amazing selection of crafty cocktails. Our bartender was meticulous and made an incredible drink. The Christmas decorations were perfect and set an amazing ambiance for a late night drink, meal, date, or party. I highly recommend stopping by especially during the holiday season.

Dutch Fred pub is an upscale haven in Hell's kitchen. Our server Abby was helpful, efficient and quick. The pub is decorated in a quirky but classy style and the music was great too. They have a large bar and space for a private party too. I really liked the menu which had something for everyone including vegetarian offers. I had brie  cheese quesidillas and arugula flatbread. They were both very  yummy.  I  would definitely  recommend this restaurant/ pub to couples and friends anytime! Also  Shane answered the phone and helped me make a reservation! Very good customer service.
The Dutch punch is delightful and packs a punch.  I love it .. nice current music and old school tunes also.  Great mature crowd and vibes .  I love it here first time in this spot

We visited this chinese restaurant for a friend‚Äôs birthday and had a great experience. Since we had a large group, we ordered a variety of dishes to share ‚Äî mostly spicy ones. Fair warning: the spicy dishes here are very hot, so order with caution if you‚Äôre sensitive to heat!

The restaurant had a fantastic atmosphere with beautiful decor and lively vibes. Service was good, and the quality of the food was excellent across the board. I‚Äôd definitely come back ‚Äî but next time, I‚Äôll go a little easier on the spice!

Wow, this place is absolutely beautiful once you walk in and get's better. Came here with a friend for a early dinner / lunch, the place was on the quieter side and the staff were extremely attentive and nice. We stayed rather long and did not feel rushed as the place began to pick up. Our server answered all of our questions and gave us great recommendations. We ordered a little of what felt like everything, started with dumplings, dan - dan noodles which were SPICY for me even though we got mild. They were accommodating enough to withhold meat. We ended with the fish blossom which OMG? The presentation insane. Everything was absolutely delicious and would definitely go back.

This restaurant definitely lives up to the hype. The food is absolutely delicious, loved the crab toufu, cold noodles, and fish stew in particular. Decent drinks as well and our waiter was nice and friendly. Beautiful restaurant too but a little slow in the kitchen.
Moderately priced considered how much we ordered. Definitely going back.

Antidote really impressed me with its solid flavors and overall vibe. The dishes were well-executed, with flavors that hit the mark. My grandparents, who are very traditional when it comes to food (and *very* Chinese), absolutely loved it, which is no small feat! It‚Äôs always a good sign when even the most discerning palates are on board.

The atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a casual yet elevated meal. And the cocktails? They were fantastic! I was pleasantly surprised by how creative and refreshing they were.

Definitely a great spot for anyone looking for a nice balance of good food, great drinks, and a comfortable setting.

Love their Chinese food here. Perfect Asian amount of spice, offers variety of Sichuan/zhejiang dishes. Also has great cocktails. Great vibes! For two people, 3 dishes is the perfect amount of food to share.

8282 is a modern Korean-inspired restaurant and a true local gem. The space is small but has its own charm, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. The restaurant was full when we went, so I‚Äôd definitely recommend making reservations to avoid waiting.

The food was outstanding ‚Äî every dish was full of unique flavors and interesting combinations that I really appreciated. The portions were decently sized, which was a pleasant surprise for a spot like this. One of the highlights was their ice cream topped with shaved Parmesan, which was unexpectedly delicious.

The wine menu was on the smaller side, but it had enough variety to complement the food. The customer service was decent ‚Äî not amazing, but certainly not bad. The music playing in the background added a nice touch to the overall experience.

I would definitely recommend 8282 and will 100% be returning!

Tuna tartare and sea bass were my favorites at the restaurant. Thought the duck sauce reduced too much and became too thick. Perilla noodles were very good too. Service was friendly and helpful. Decent spot for dinner!

Great dining experience with very friendly attentive staff! We were genuinely so impressed by our meal here! Small intimate vibes with a great playlist all night!

(complimentary) Birthday Shot -- coffee liquour,banana liquour, oatmilk! Thank you to our waiter for these off menu shots!

5/5 Chawanmushi -- very umami, generous seafood!
4.5/5 Clam sujebi -- lovely mesty clams, chewy sujebi, a bit of a citrus kick from the broth!
5/5 Scallop Boribap -- perfectly cooked scallop, usually not a fan of barley but this was done so well.
5/5 Dakgalbi Kimchibap -- so rich and flavorful!
4/5 Perilla Pasta -- brazino was great, pasta sauce was a bit watery for my preference.

Special shoutout to whoever was on DJ duty!

Great food, great service and a great vibe.
Me and my brother and mom went here for dinner. Ate at the bar and had a great time. The bartender was super friendly and the food was phenomenal! The vibe is great and very social and casual.
Would def recommend it.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city ‚Äî I‚Äôve been back multiple times and each time is better than the last. I preferred their seafood dishes over anything else, but you really can‚Äôt go wrong here. Excited to go again!
Great service and lots of choices on the menu. Solid neighborhood restaurant. My friend had a very colorful and tasty shrimp salad. I liked the my ziti with very creamy whipped ricotta.

My Aunt and I stumbled upon this place while hanging out in DUMBO and so happy that we did! The food, ambience, and service were excellent. The specials were fantastic! Really enjoyed the rabbit with polenta dish. Our waiter Chris was fantastic. Thank you!
The food and service was great, except we waited almost an hour and a half for our food. They had two big parties going on. To make up for it they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine.

We had our rehearsal dinner here in 2021. The food from that rehearsal dinner was wonderful and abundant. Ever since then we wanted to come back. The brunch menu was equally great. I love my ‚ÄúEgg in the cloud‚Äù dish. The ricotta crostini was great.

Came here around 10:30 on a Saturday night after visiting from out of town and this being near our hotel. We were promptly seated and drink orders taken. Both cocktails were fabulous and for dinner we both ordered a pasta which were both delicious. Server was very attentive! Overall loved our dinner and if we were ever in the area again would check out!

Westville DUMBO is my go-to spot for fresh, healthy, and consistently delicious food. I‚Äôve ordered delivery and dined in, and every time the experience is excellent. The staff is always friendly and welcoming, and the vibe is relaxed but vibrant. Whether you‚Äôre grabbing a quick bite or sitting down for a full meal, everything is packed with flavor and feels good to eat. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a wholesome, satisfying meal in the area!

Delicious! And the people are so courteous and sweet.

It was my first time here from India and so got their classic margarita and Asian Crispy Chicken, it was yummy.

The vibe is amazing and Miss Jessica got me a free chocolate cookie on the house because it was my first time in NYC. Can‚Äôt get better than that.

Highly recommend!

Food was absolutely delicious!!!! 100% recommend especially if you want fresh produce prepared in the most delicious way. Didn't take long for food to be prepared. A bit pricey but the portions are pretty big. It was my first time visiting and the waitress could have done a better job with recommendations or explanation of the dishes. She also took quite some time to take empty dishes away or go bring the bill.

Didn‚Äôt plan to come here but crossed the Brooklyn bridge and got a little hungry. This was a wonderful find; great fruit and veges market platter, and the best sweet potato fries. The buttermilk chicken burger was a bit dry but still tasty. Would come here again!

This could be one of my favorite places in new york.
The food is not salty but savory, the beer and espresso martini was perfect. I was so touched by the bartender's kindness. Thanks to him, my friend and I (from korea) made a great memory.
I recommend the burger with cheeze, It was sooo nice:)

We found our favorite pasta place in Brooklyn! Not only it‚Äôs the best deal in town but it also has the best quality and taste.
Fresh pasta dish is $14 and and you can add gem salad or kale Caesar salad for $3 (even on Saturday)
Staff were friendly and efficient. Line moves pretty quick.
My husband (he‚Äôs a chef) said it was one of the best Pappardelle Bolognese he ever had. Pasta was cooked perfect and so flavorful.
This place knows what they are doing!
Salad was soooo good!
Can‚Äôt wait to come back to try other pastas and desserts!

DO NOT HESITATE TO EAT HERE. One of the best dining experiences ive ever had in New York. Absolutely incredible how their pasta is the price that it is. It's fresh handmade pasta and you can see them making it in the front. The texture is absolutely perfect, tastes so good.
This place blew my mind.
The bread that comes with the soup is so damn good it's one of the best breads that i've had in my life. Imagine if milk bread was Italian... so plush and scrumptious.
For a small place, the ambiance is soo nice. So much natural light in a tucked away seating area in the back. Clean as can be.
Service makes this place though. Shout out the owner who must keep their employees very happy because the energy in this place set the tone for my day. I was like sad to leave because I was having so much fun and felt so much joy eating there and being taken care of in a genuine way.
Forgot to snag a pic but their tirimisu is also made in house and is impeccable. Not too much alcohol flavour if any at all, perfectly whipped marscapone and evenly soaked ladyfingers.

Forma i love youüòÇü´∞ü•π

Absolute best arancini I‚Äôve ever tasted! Their sauces are rich and deep and so flavorful.  Gluten free spaghetti was perfectly cooked. Gem salad was tangy, crunchy and refreshing. Artfully crafted.

The servers are very warm and personable. You can tell they really care about their work.

It‚Äôs a bit small inside in terms of seating but the food more than makes up for it.  Wish I lived closer!

Came for dinner on a Wednesday at 7:30 and it was pretty crowded but we were still able to find a table quickly. Super fresh pasta and delicious sauces! Got a small piece of focaccia with our food which was nice. Service is very quick and friendly - will be coming back to try their other dishes!

Very quick service, kind and friendly staff, extremely delicious foodüî• I was waiting for my pasta for 6-7min, took some to go. Nicely packed, super fresh. I ordered their pasta with shrimps, it was fantastic, will definitely come back for lunch!
They are making very fresh pasta!!! And the prices are surprisingly affordable
A great place to enjoy a tasty Buffalo Chicken Mac & Cheese and Hot Honey Chicken Sandwich combo, paired with delicious waffle fries. The service is fast, and the staff is very friendly!

I had the basic mac and cheese which was so incredibly bland. It litteraly tasted home made in a bad. So bland, just straight up mozarella cheese, cheddar and penne noodles. I wouldn‚Äòt even consider this american mac n cheese tasted like a broke college meal

Try this place! Best Chicken sandwich I've ever had. Definitely recommend the hot honey sandwich, might be kind of dry without the sauce on it. Everything tasted very fresh and homemade. Great bang for your buck.

The food was fantastic. I shared an order of the biscuit honey chicken with a side of macaroni. The biscuit wasn't the freshest but the honey chicken and homemade sweet-spicy pickles that accompanied it made it all work. The macaroni was great. The fried Oreos (qty:4 for $7.00) were great. I did not like the cream that came with it, but that wasn't a deal breaker. I removed a star for the service. The girl behind the register was extremely unprofessional. She treated us customers as though we were inconveniencing her. She had her personal phone out hiding before the stand-up menu by the register and was scrolling through it. When customers asked her questions she acted like she didn't understand. The people were speaking clear English, the worker just didn't care to do her job.

We were hungry while in the area and also wanted to check out the market as well. While perusing, Jacob's Pickles caught our eye. We came on a busy weekend so it was hard to find seating. The food took a bit of time as well (likely given how busy the whole place was). Overall the food was good but maybe a bit overpriced? Still enjoyed the experience!

Went for Brunch, which had a different menu from dinner but still had a great time and everyone really enjoyed the food. We ordered the Tater Tot Dan Bing, Stuffed Shrimp Toast, BDSM Chicken Sandwich, Lo Ba Beng and Lil Flemming Fried Rice + Hertitage Pork Jowl. I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu but I recommend trying the Tater Tot Dan Bing, as it was very creative and flavorful.

Food 9/10
Solid Taiwanese food. Âç§ËÇâÈ•≠ was so gas and the portions were quite large too. The shrimp toast was also very unique, I liked the consistency of the shrimp inside paired with the crispy crunch of the exterior. The popcorn chicken was also quite a delight, with the right amount of seasoning that makes you want to keep on eating more.

Atmosphere 9/10
Plenty of natural lighting in the restaurant, with a good number of seats. I thought the menu was super cute too.

Service 9/10
Friendly!

I didn‚Äôt know what to expect, but I gotta say this place is pretty good. The floss shrimp lettuce wrap is very authentic and tastes very good. The popcorn chicken and fried tofu were great as well. We also had the cold sesame noodles. The bathroom was lit, playing all the hit Chinese songs. Overall a great experience! Would come back to try more items !
Good food and friendly staff. You can't go wrong with the popcorn chicken and the sesame noodles. The highlight for me was the San Bei GG cocktail though. So good.

Hipster style Taiwanese restaurant. The savory soy milk tasted just like what I had in Taiwan (except 11-12 times more expensive). Brunch menu was a bit limiting for vegans or vegetarians but I did also enjoy the crispy tofu and the fly's head with lettuce cup made with soy beans. Food was on the salty side though.

The best experience at Tin Building by Jean George. We bought ciabatta which was out of the world! Baked good were such high quality. It was like eating at Jean George‚Äôs restaurant.
We bought skate and it was the best quality skate we ever bought !

So many beautiful restaurants serving quality foods and the market had so many interesting imported goods. We enjoyed coffee and some pasta we bought from the market.

After seeing the market you can walk around the South Street Seaport. You will surely have a magical time.

The Tin Building by Chef Jean-Georges is an absolute gem in Seaport! This culinary destination has everything you could possibly want: dozens of dining spots, a vibrant marketplace filled with fresh produce, meats, fish, seafood, and a variety of pantry staples. I find myself going there a few times a week, whether it‚Äôs for the bakery, to shop at the market, or just to treat myself to some delicious ice cream.

From multiple restaurants with open kitchens to innovative retail concepts, there‚Äôs always something new to try. The central market is impeccably stocked with local seafood, meats, cheeses, seasonal produce, and rare ingredients that make cooking at home feel like an elevated experience.

With its inviting atmosphere and even more beautiful Easter decorations, the Tin Building is the perfect spot to indulge in both your foodie cravings and your sense of wonder. Highly recommend it for anyone looking to explore New York‚Äôs culinary scene in a truly unique setting!

A UNIQUE MARKET and FOOD HALL INSPIRED by JEAN-GEORGES‚Äô WORLD TRAVELS, LOCATED in NEW YORK CITY at the HISTORIC SEAPORT. We come often since it opened, we have enjoy shopping and diner at Tin Building. Classic interior style, and professional lighting design. You should come to explore fine dining, quick bites, and takeout & delivery.

We take a bus down to the Seaport on a regular basis to walk around and eat. Usually we go during the week to beat the hoards of tourists. But today we went on a Saturday.  It was pretty busy but just wonderful what a great renovation and destination for fun. We had a delicious ham/cheese baguette sandwich and then coffee and an almond croissant. Yummy.

I love the Tin Building and have tried most of the restaurants there, all of them with great food. (House with the red pearl, abcv - closed now, the brasserie, the oyster seafood bar, the pastries). It‚Äôs such a pleasant experience to be there also because of the location. Pier 17 has the best view of Brooklyn bridge. This place never fails to impress me and every NYC visitor I bring here.

~Little Lebanese gem but big taste~
What a wonderful little restaurant! Falafel and Chicken sandwiches are delicious. Fattoush salad is fresh with a nice touch of pomegranate. Would love to try other dishes in the near future.
Atmosphere is rustic farmhouse filled charming little flowers and plants. Waitress is kind and welcoming.
Got the chicken shawarma wrap. It was super super dry ‚Äî would not recommend. My friend has the lentil soup and the eggplant. Said he felt queasy after. A skip for us!

We had a delightful Sunday afternoon at SALMA. with our group of five, including a furry friend. Despite not having a reservation, the staff kindly accommodated us with an outdoor table. We ordered a variety of dishes, including the Mixed Appetizer Platter, Lentil Soup, Eggs Your Way, Falafel Platter, and Kafta Kabab Platter. Each item was flavorful and generously portioned. One strange thing is when you scan the QR code for the food, it automatically downloads an app on your device. That was a bit creepy. The atmosphere was pleasant, with perfect sound levels for conversation. The staff was exceptionally friendly, making it an ideal spot for group gatherings or casual meetups. Overall, a wonderful experience that exceeded our expectations. Will be back if in the neighbourhood!

The restaurant is cute and I love the decor however there are only a few tables so maybe make a reservation before you go.

There was only one person working so there is a wait time to get your order taken etc.

The food quality was average and the menu is very simple.
We went for valentine‚Äôs day and had a great experience. A lot of different appetizers on the menu, chicken was great and hummus was on point.

Their Michelin star is well deserved!  Outstanding service.  The food is well prepared and very tasty. Kudos to the sommelier on the extensive wine list.  The cocktails are also very good. The grilled octopus was cooked to perfection. The tortellini pomodoro were light and fluffy.  The driver sole was excellent.

Review:

I had an unforgettable dining experience at Torrisi in New York City, and a huge part of that was thanks to our incredible waiter, Fernando. From the moment we sat down, he made us feel so welcome and comfortable. His recommendations were spot-on‚Äîevery dish he suggested was absolutely delicious, and his knowledge of the menu was impressive.

What truly set Fernando apart was his personality. He was warm, attentive, and made our dinner not just seamless but genuinely fun. He had the perfect balance of professionalism and charm, making sure we had everything we needed while also adding to the overall enjoyment of the evening.

If you‚Äôre dining at Torrisi, I highly recommend asking for Fernando. He elevates the entire experience, and I can‚Äôt wait to come back for another fantastic meal.

Torrisi was such a great experience. The atmosphere was lively and the service was excellent. The prosciutto with warm dough puffs was seriously good ‚Äî definitely a must-try starter.

The pasta dishes were solid, but what really stood out were the desserts. The affogato was amazing ‚Äî rich, layered, and not your typical affogato. Also, they served a cherry sorbet at the end, which was super refreshing and the perfect finish.

Overall, everything was well-balanced and thoughtful. Would absolutely recommend, especially for the desserts and that prosciutto starter.

I can save you the FOMO and anticipation - Torrisi is average, very very average.

I seriously question if the people that leave glowing 5 star reviews have ever been to an actual nice dinner.

From watching Instagram videos you would think The tortellini was the best pasta dish in the world, it‚Äôs not, It‚Äôs basic, just as I expected.

The drinks menu was awful. No cocktails. Just the basic old fashioned drinks. So if you don‚Äôt like martinis or manhattans you won‚Äôt find anything you like.

The duck, was another ‚Äúmust get‚Äù but it was a 6/10. They don‚Äôt properly render the fat, it had a thick gelatinous fat layer on it that made it unappealing.

The $22 affogato, two people at the table hated it. The proportions are off, It really just tastes like coffee ice.  But when you get a perfect bite of the fudge, ice cream, and a little bit of the ice, it‚Äôs a great bite. If they sold them on the street I‚Äôd buy one, but I‚Äôd never sit through another $640 dinner just to get one.

People are brainwashed into thinking this is good because they are told it‚Äôs good. If you have NO budget at all and are with a group, it‚Äôs a fun splurge meal. But if you are going for food you will pay the price of a 3 Michelin star dinner, for essentially another Carbone style of food - over priced, average food, with good, not great service.

The pastas were up there with  the best.  We had the the beef ragu and clam linguine. Both perfect. The portions are small that‚Äôs my only complaint. The crispy skin on the duck was also excellent. It was juicy and fatty and perfect with the jus on the plate. The spritz also hit the spot. The almond cheesecake was also quite good but not a must order

I attended the restaurant for a private dining event. The restaurant is located in a shopping area in the city and is easy to access. The private dining area has a beautiful city view and is intimate yet spacious for a large group. The service from the restaurant team was great - they were prompt with attending to any requests or filling an empty glass without being asked. They weren‚Äôt intrusive while our party was conversing and enjoying our meal. Great service! Every dish we enjoyed during the lunch was great - full of flavor my favorite were the greens and basque cheesecake. The dessert options were so good light and refreshing for a spring lunch. The red wine option was full bodied and fruity a perfect pairing option for our lunch. I would definitely visit again!

Everything was SO delicious. Nina was our server and she was so attentive, great recommendations, and wonderful energy to be around! The rigatoni & crab pasta were so tasty. The onion torta is a don‚Äôt miss & the escarole salad was such a great balance. Somehow we ate dessert bc it was my birthday but I‚Äôll be back over and over again!
Incredibly huge well designed space for Italian cuisine. We had various pastas and the appetizers. The French onion soup pie appetizer was a standout. Service at the bar was friendly and generous!

Ci Siamo is the kind of place that just gets it classy but not stiff, stylish without trying too hard. The vibe is smooth, the service is on point, and the food? Mostly incredible.

Let‚Äôs start with the winners. The smashed potatoes were next-level crispy, buttery, and loaded with flavor. The prosciutto? Silky, rich, and exactly what you want from top-tier cured meat. And the pasta? No notes. Just pure, authentic perfection, the kind that reminds you why fresh, handmade pasta is worth the hype.

The lemon tart wrapped things up on a high note bright, tangy, and just the right amount of sweet. It was the kind of dessert that makes you consider ordering a second round just because you don‚Äôt want the experience to end.

Now, for the one miss: the carrots. Way too much happening. Over-seasoned, overthought‚Äîlike they were trying too hard to make a simple vegetable exciting. Not terrible, but definitely the weakest link.

The staff were so warm and clearly happy to be there, which made the experience relaxed and welcoming. The rigatoni? Hands down the best I've had‚ÄîI'm still thinking about it.. The braised lamb was pure perfection. The service was fantastic too, with some great conversations that made dining alone feel like a treat rather than a chore. Ci Siamo is a necessary stop on any New York food tour!

If you come, must try the eggplant dip and pomegranate ribeye kebab - truly delicious. However, some dishes felt egregiously portioned for the price (looking at you, catch of the day - $45 for a piece of fish that could barely satiate a single person). The lamb shank, a signature for this restaurant, sadly wasn't our favorite, lacking the rich flavor and tenderness we were hoping for.

Tldr; good food, but there are a myriad of better restaurants out there for the price (close to $100pp). 3.5/5

Tahini & date salad was a little spicy and sweet at the same time. Roasted eggplant with crunchy bread for appetiser was excellent.  For a main dish we had duck in sour walnuts sauce and lamb with beans. For dessert we chose ice cream with roasted pistachios, saffron and rosewater. By the way, portions were big enough, so we could split it for two people. I love food and service but restaurant is quite busy and loud.

Sofreh is really a vibe! I went for a small birthday dinner with my wife. We had communal seats, but the manger Emir told us some bar seats had opened and let us move. That was very kind of him. We met the chef who was very sweet and kind as well.

The food was awesome. We had the meatballs, salad, the mushrooms, herb rice, and lamb shank. We were stuffed. Also the cocktails were perfect. I would recommend the SEKANJABIN MARTINI‚Ä¶ Fire.

Oh and the ice cream cookie ü§åüèøü§åüèøü§åüèø

We will definitely be returning

Our experience was exceptional. We arrived ten minutes early and were promptly seated. The food was served quickly, and I highly recommend the eggplant and whey dip! The service provided by Emmanuel was outstanding. Don‚Äôt forget to look at the dessert menu!  I look forward to returning to explore more dishes.
PS: we had trouble finding parking around the area probably best to commute if you‚Äôre not from the area.

Sofreh is a cozy spot with a lovely ambiance and authentic Persian food that goes beyond the usual kabobs. The dishes are thoughtfully prepared, full of rich flavors that feel both traditional and elevated. The staff are warm and welcoming, making the experience even more enjoyable. It‚Äôs a great place to explore Persian cuisine in a relaxed and inviting setting.

Went there for Mother's Day brunch. It was a tad on the pricey side, but as they say, you get what you pay for. We ordered the fried calamari appetizer; shrimp & grits; steak & eggs; french toast, bacon, eggs & grits; also the bacon egg & cheese sandwich. Everything we ordered was spot on delicious. Waitress was very friendly & attentive, she took real good care of us. Definitely will come back.

OMG. A friend recommended this spot & it did not disappoint! The vibe is incredible (GREAT playlist!), the service was great and the FOOD!! It was divine. Drinks, appetizers, entrees and dessert: not one thing passed my lips (and I tried it ALL) that was not incredible. So glad we went, check it out!

Overall they give great portion sizes but everything else falls short in taste. The lemon sole was a 6/10. The ambiance is lovely but peaches isn't worth a revisit. It's a good option if you are looking to watch your salt and sugar intake because of the lack of it in the food. Our waiter Noel was kind and a gentlemen

Grabbed a quick bite before a show at the theater around the corner. Really kind server helped me select items to accommodate a vegetarian and gluten-free diet. The saut√©ed spinach and potatoes were fresh and delicious. Would love to come back and explore more of the menu.

I've been here twice so far (once for brunch, once for dinner) and both times were spectacular. Great service, nice atmosphere, and fabulous food.

We've ordered their:
- OXTAIL FETTUCCINE oxtail bolognese, allspice, scotch bonnet
- SPICY RIGATONI San Marzano tomato, Tito‚Äôs vodka, cream, ricotta (v)
- BRAISED SHORT RIB 12 hour short rib, whipped potatoes, salsa verde
- PRIME FRIED CHICKEN Whipped Potatoes, Market Greens

Definitely looking forward to returning soon.

I didn‚Äôt know I could eat Thai food for brunch.

Thai food in NYC is already some of the best, but I rarely go to a spot where everything on the menu slaps. This is one of those spots.

From the Thai iced coffee to the babka French toast with Thai tea butter the whole meal was extremely flavorful and light.

The Thai coffee is super smooth and the breakfast wrap is so flavorful while being a lot lighter than Win Son‚Äôs scallion pancake wrap. This is a breakfast item I‚Äôd eat regularly.

The disco fries and drunken dumplings were fun takes on more traditional Thai flavors and we really enjoyed them.

However, the coconut chicken which was basically a Thai schnitzel was the star and the lamb larb really balanced the richness of lamb with herbs, lime and heat.

They highlight my favorite element of Thai food which is that the food is flavorful but also light. We had so much food yet we didn‚Äôt feel heavy like we would after brunch.

Also the service was quick! We asked to be out in an hour and we were out!

If you‚Äôre a large party (7+) your wait time on a Saturday afternoon can be up to 2 HOURS as they do not take reservations. Now that I‚Äôve mentioned that, let‚Äôs get into the actual experience. The restaurant is a big, busy kind of vibe with beautiful decor. Our waitress Bella was amazing !! She‚Äôs very honest and knowledgeable about the meals and drink options. She provided great service to my party and I. Now let‚Äôs get into the food. EVERYONE loved their meal. I wish I had pictures of everything we ate. Pictured below are The duck dumplings, their specialty fries that comes in a curry sauce & the oysters that comes with a spicy cilantro sauce ALL 10/10. We also had crab rice 10/10 & the snapper 10/10. Let‚Äôs go back to the oysters for a second. I‚Äôve never been a fan of those. I‚Äôve tried em at a few restaurants before and just couldn‚Äôt get into it. I decided to try them again and now I‚Äôm hooked. The oysters were so fresh. The combo of the sourness from the lime and the spicy taste of the cilantro is genius. I can now only have oysters this way and this way only lol.

This place is a gem! The place is gorgeous, the waiters are attentive kind and personable. The food is I mean wow! So delicious and fresh! It‚Äôs a place you want to keep coming to again and again! I came here for brunch and had the brisket. The layering of flavors is so good. Their meat is so tender. 10/10 recommend.

We used the Michelin guide to find this place. Although the food was great, I must be honest and say that I wish it was more authentic but Thai food is my favorite so my opinion is based off some smaller, family owned home style Thai restaurants. Definitely try this place because it‚Äôs an experience. We ordered 6 different items off of the menu and the only thing I can say was not great was the Thai tea. The service was great, the atmosphere is great.

so yummy!!! i went once on the weekend and there was an 1-hour wait and today i went friday afternoon no wait. rlly cute decor love the interior and the bustling atmosphere as well. onto the food, the crab fried rice & short rib pad thai are my top picks.. just so much flavor, absolutely delicious! loved the banana pudding and lobster omelet too! however, i would skip the disco fries (too soggy) and the thai tea french toast.. other than that cant wait to try more items from the menu!

I got the chance to stop in at this restaurant for dinner. When I arrived I parked on the street nearby. I walked into a nice ambiance. Jenny was my nice server! I had:

Midnight Margarita
Old Fashioned
Ma-La Trio (chicken, cucumber salad, duck)
Din Sum Platter (chicken, shrimp, vegetable)
Perking Duck
Yunnan Basil Lettuce Wrap

I loved the margarita and the dim sum platter! The dumplings were so good! Everything was great at this restaurant!

Incredible food on all levels along with creative, beautiful cocktails. We had no misses but particularly loved the pork slice appetizer and the signature braised beef. Flavors are bold and can be quite spicy. They have a large private event room in the back as well. It can be pricey for a large group (plus lots of food served family style), so recommend bringing a group and making a reservation.

We enjoyed a fantastic Chinese meal featuring cucumber salad, shrimp dumplings, the chef‚Äôs special tiger shrimp with potatoes, and mapo tofu. Every dish was delicious, and the service was fast and attentive. Highly recommend this spot‚Äîit‚Äôs easy to see why it‚Äôs rated so highly

If you‚Äôre looking for bold, modern Chinese flavors in NYC, Chi Restaurant & Bar in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen is the spot. From their perfectly spiced ma-la trio and dimsum platter to the rich truffle beef tenderloin, every dish hits the mark. The sleek, cozy ambiance makes it perfect for date night or dinner with friends. Whether you're a fan of bold spices or just love discovering new foodie gems, Chi hits all the right notes.

Accommodating restaurant for 7 people! I liked the Szechuan food here - the cumin lamb, spicy chicken, the truffle fried rice were all stellar.

The soup dumplings were great, the Peking duck was decent but I‚Äôve had better. I liked all the veggies, the eggplant and cucumber salad and all.

Dining at Jack‚Äôs Wife Freda felt just like eating at home‚Äîcomforting, satisfying, and full of warmth. The food was simple in the best way possible: flavorful, fresh, and made with care. Every dish we ordered had that homemade quality that makes you want to come back the next day and order it all over again.

The service was absolutely fantastic. From the moment we walked in, the staff was friendly, attentive, and genuinely welcoming. It‚Äôs clear they care about creating a positive experience for every guest.

The atmosphere is casual and laid-back, perfect for everything from brunch with friends to a relaxed dinner. The space is surprisingly big for a city restaurant, so even when it‚Äôs busy, it doesn‚Äôt feel cramped or chaotic. There‚Äôs an energy to the place that feels vibrant but never overwhelming.

If you're looking for a spot with a cozy vibe, great service, and food that tastes like it came from a family kitchen, Jack‚Äôs Wife Freda is definitely worth a visit.

Mediterranean Flair Meets Manhattan Cool

Tucked away in the stylish streets of SoHo, Jack‚Äôs Wife Freda is one of those places that feels like a well-kept secret‚Äîyet everyone seems to know about it. With its Mediterranean-inspired menu and effortlessly chic vibe, it‚Äôs the kind of spot that makes lunch feel like a little escape.

The atmosphere strikes the perfect balance between cozy and buzzing, with friendly staff who greet you like a regular‚Äîeven if it‚Äôs your first time. Whether you're sitting solo at the gorgeous wood-and-marble bar or catching up with friends at a sunlit table, you‚Äôll feel instantly at ease.

The avocado bowls are a standout: fresh, nourishing, and beautifully presented, especially when paired with one of their vibrant, cold-pressed juices. It's clean eating without ever feeling dull.

For those looking to lunch in style while soaking up a slice of Manhattan charm, Jack‚Äôs Wife Freda delivers every time.

We were walking around in SoHo the other week and then met a friend at this restaurant for lunch.  It was busy and crowded with mostly a younger group of people.
We order three different dishes, a draft beer and a fruit drink.  All were very tasty.  Looked and sounded like everyone was having a good time.  My only minor complaint is that it was quite noisy and a little hard for we older people to hear.  But still quite a nice experience.
BTW, the bathrooms are  old but nice and clean.

First time being here! We came to celebrate my birthday at brunch time & the experience was amazing! Love the decor & the atmosphere. The food was beyond delicious! We order the Rosewater Waffle & Chicken Prego Sandwich, for drink Mint Lemonade; everything tastes fresh with great quality ingredients. There is indoor & outdoor seating.All staff were super nice & friendly! Excellent service! Totally recommend it! This became one of my favorite restaurants in the city, I can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Ordered the Grilled Eggplant Baguette and The Tuna Salad for Lunch. Great service even though there was a line out the door! We were seated fairly quickly. Would definitely recommend and come back again!

Everything, every single moment was incredible about this place and their hospitality! For the Second time, we just went there for the perfection! And of course it was our best decision to make! Thank you for your generosity :)
business_name: Ali Baba Mediterranean And Turkish Cuisine

text: Came on a weekend, still spots opened at 7 so didn‚Äôt have to make a reservation. I had my eye on the appetizer platter that comes with five different dips. The Muhammara was hands down my favorite. The taziki tasted more thick and creamer than the ones I‚Äôm used to, tasted like there was heavy cream added. The babaghanoush  was tasty too. I wanted a chicken skewers with rice. My partner asked for recommendation and the staff noted he recommends eggplant so he orders that. I was asking how the h ch sicken shish kebab and adna would be different. Then he asked if I also like eggplant so I respond sure, not thinking he was gonna put the same exact dish on the order and just swap out the lamb with chicken. The dish was great but I was surprised how the staff just went and decided to bring the exact same main menu with a different protein inside. We also asked for another puffy bread and waited for a long time until the waiter came and told us that one isn‚Äôt available, but he can bring pita bread instead. Could‚Äôve been lost in translation but the other table received the puffy bread right after they finished their first one‚Ä¶ so I was a little confused. The food was great, just the service was off
business_name: Ali Baba Mediterranean And Turkish Cuisine

text: We were greeted with a smile by the host. The ambiance was lovely, dim lights, cloth table coverings. Our waitress Daria was extremely kind and gave us her honest opinion on which portions and if amounts would suffice for our party of two. Speed, presentation, and service were outstanding! Honestly I was surprised by how quick we were served without compromising the quality of the food. Also Farhat (I‚Äôm assuming the manager) walked by saw us eating our kabobs the traditional way, using our hands, he was so intuitive and attentive he brought us napkins and kindly placed them on our table which means he has a great eye for detail and his customers. I‚Äôm visiting from Florida but I know I‚Äôll definitely return when I come to the city and recommend  it friends as well!
business_name: Ali Baba Mediterranean And Turkish Cuisine

text: worst turkish restaurant ive been too. came here after seeing it online. service was horrible. waiter did not even help. we didnt even get the drinks we asked for. we ordered soup and asked for bread, she didnt bring it until 15 min later. I originally asked for pide and the waiter said they are not taking lahmacun or pide orders at the moment but the table behind us ordered it which makes no sense. so i ordered lamb adana and it was burnt. My dad ordered kofte and it was raw! crazy place! will never be coming here again.
business_name: Ali Baba Mediterranean And Turkish Cuisine

text: My boyfriend and I were in the area and wanted to get some Mediterranean food. He told me that this place was delicious and I'm not usually a fan of Mediterranean food so I was skeptical and just wanted to take the food to go so that I could cook something at home in case I didn't like it, but the staff were all really nice and polite, even though we were taking everything to go and they even served us water while we were waiting for our takeout. The restaurant itself seems very clean and has a very homey vibe, kind of like your local neighborhood spot but a bit more elevated. It felt like a family place but not  super loud and noisy. The seating is nice, and there's a bit of outdoor seating outside too. They packaged all of the food for takeout really well, and we got the meat platter (the one that comes with lamb chops, chicken, steak and all for around $38) everything in the platter was delicious. The veggies were really delicious as well! We were not worried about anything spilling because they packaged everything so well as you'll see in the photos. We had a great time even just waiting for our food and each member of the staff was so nice and helped us take our food to go and check out. I'll definitely order from this place again or return if I'm craving Mediterranean food! Five stars!üåü
business_name: Ali Baba Mediterranean And Turkish Cuisine

text:
It‚Äôs become one id my favorite Korean restaurants!

Firstly, such beautiful interior and atmosphere!! The food is great as well. Highly recommend Galbi Jim - infused with flavor and proper texture. Mushroom sotbap with truffle is also really good. The serving size is great. Nice service as well. Will go again and try other items!

I had the most amazing time of my life here. We got a bunch of small dishes to try and with my party and they all tasted superb. I was able to try new types of food which I never would. The interior was hands down vibing with my aesthetic!

The beautiful interior design was definitely more memorable than the food. It‚Äôs a very special space, renovated from an old church, which leaves an ethereal feel with the high ceilings and ceiling mural.

On to the food. I liked the fried chicken. Not too heavily battered and the portion was very generous. The grilled squid was a lighter appetizer that paired well with the chicken. Uni rice was good, but not a standout among Uni dishes at other restaurant. The braised beef dish was way too sweet for me. That was the low point of the meal. The persimmon tart had a really hard crust, felt like something pre-made that‚Äôs been sitting out for a while.

I‚Äôve been a huge fan of Chef Kim since my amazing experience at Jua. The moment I spotted the three-course menu on Instagram, I knew I had to book a table.

From the very first bite, every dish was bursting with flavor and totally hit the spot. The portions were super generous‚Äîwe tried our best to finish everything because it was all so delicious, but we just couldn‚Äôt manage it.

If you‚Äôre into Korean food, you‚Äôve got to check this place out. I‚Äôm already planning my next visit!

I'm Korean (grew up in Seoul till I was 16!) and this is my new favorite Korean spot in town!

Recommendation

- 100p recommend!
- Great date spot / place to celebrate a birthday/promotion/life.

Vibe

- In an ex church stained glass ceiling tastefully classy clean decor, friendly service, very high ceilings. Not cheap but all in all SO worth every dollar, honestly isn‚Äôt that expensive considering what you‚Äôd drop on a random dinner in WV. Cuz it‚Äôs so much food and portions are big and the food is so tasty.

Dishes

- Loved the kimchi (complimentary), so light and punch of flavor
- Spicy Fried Chicken ($22) was bomb
- Galbi-Jjim ($48): Was very clean but I kinda like / am used to something a bit heavier and sweeter but I can see how this is classier
- Pyeongyang Cold Noodle ($20): ppl in the comments were disappointed with it, but we loved it especially given that it was a hot day, the flavors are subtle but we liked it cuz it was so refreshing given all the other dishes.
- Hoe-muchim ($24): I think that was my favorite dish (it was salmon that night).

100p recc! They‚Äôre doing a $50 off $150 order till 5/11/25 I think (download the inKind app, it's on Moono's website)

If you found this review helpful, let's keep in touch!
IG - TikTok - YouTube (@rhaimekim)
Blog (yourlocalsguide.com)

Had lunch with coworkers here and I ordered the BLT chicken sandwich with fries (additional cost since it normally comes with a side salad) which was tasty and was informed that it‚Äôs their best seller. Coworkers ordered the fennel sausage flatbread, french dip, rigatoni, rib eye, and a burger. Everyone enjoyed their meal. Service was great and the server came by frequently to refill our waters and check in on us. Our food did take some time to come out but was fine given we were just catching up. Would recommend if you‚Äôre nearby.

Parker and Quinn, located on 39th Street in Midtown Manhattan, offers an exceptional dining experience.
The restaurant blends vintage charm with modern elegance, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.
The menu is diverse and thoughtfully curated, featuring dishes that cater to various tastes. Whether you're in the mood for brunch, dinner, or cocktails, Parker and Quinn delivers. The truffle mac and cheese and steak frites are standout dishes that you must try.
The staff are friendly, attentive, and professional, ensuring your dining experience is perfect. Their knowledge of the menu and willingness to accommodate special requests make the service exceptional.

The decor is a beautiful mix of vintage and contemporary styles, creating a cozy yet stylish ambiance. The lighting and comfortable seating make it ideal for both intimate dinners and larger gatherings.
While Parker and Quinn is on the pricier side, the quality of the food, excellent service, and charming atmosphere make it worth every penny. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this restaurant offers a memorable dining experience that will leave you wanting to come back for more.

Our server Chad was the best! I would recommend to visit just to be served by him, attentive, empathetic and kept serving us water. A retsaurant adjacent to a hotel, came for the first time on a Friday night.  We started with the artichoke and spinach dip. I appreciated the bread crumbs on top as usually these type of dips are too creamy and heavy for me. This one had actual artichokes used relative to just heavy cream. I also liked how the pita bread on the side was crispy and baked.  I had to order the French dip sandwich with fries which was juicy and the dip was perfect.  We also ordered the lamb burger which was volumy and packed with flavor. The salad on the side had a orange dressing which matched well with the burger

(This is a review of the food)
All in all, I would say that this is a great place to try if you are in the area and want to go out with a group of people - just be prepared for the high prices.

When we arrived, the location was pretty busy, so we ended up sitting at the bar and had no wait time, which was great because it was very cold outside and we wanted to sit down quickly.

Our bartender was very quick to get to us, very pleasant, and was making funny banter with the other customers seated around us as well and made it an enjoyable experience to be there. The location and decor were nice, but there was kind of a weird smell that lingered in the air, sort of funky like musty garbage.

The food was expensive, but for being so close to grand central and other tourist locations, it is to be expected and not out of the original. My only issue with my food was that it was not warm, with everything just being kind of room temperature, which was very saddening.

The food was cooked very well, and all of the flavors were what I wanted. The chefs did not disappoint. I unfortunately think the food would have been much better with drinks, but thinking about adding that price on top of the already expensive meal is painful.

With all that said, I can suggest going here if you are visiting and want to host friends at a nice location where you can then immediately go and see some nice sites in the city.

It was ok. It was close to my hotel and had really good reviews. When I got there, it was 11:20am, and even though google said they were open, the hostess told me that it would not open until 11:30a. She wasn't very pleasant when telling me this. I asked if the bar was open, and she said that they opened at 11:30am, as well, but her tone was as if she had to reiterate the information to an idiot. It was just a question since she said the kitchen was closed, I wanted to know if the bar was open. They serve brunch and have a brunch menu, so I thought they would have brunch hours.  I had the fennel sausage flat bread, and it was good. Nothing to write home about. The waitress was nice, so at least there was that. I mostly went to have a Bloody Mary, which looked good in the review pictures. Mine did not look like the pictures, and it was not good, in my opinion. I only drank half and only because I felt bad about ordering an expensive drink and not drinking it. Overall, it was mediocre at best and very overpriced. I don't mind spending money on food and drinks, but it sucks when you spend money and you end up disappointed.

Good for walk-ins. Seafood was very fresh! We could tell from the texture of the fish steak and scallops. Duck was very tender with a lot of flavors. I talked with the owner and she said that her husband, the chef, fused his French cuisine experience into the dishes. I haven‚Äôt been to Cambodia but these were really delicious to me.

Our favorite wa unanimously the bistec or lok lak. The marinade/sauce had good umami to go with the sweetness. The beef was so tender that someone thought it was chicken. Really impressive.

The amok was decent, the red curry mellow and the fish wrapped around the shellfish. However, I would say this dish is not as precise as the lok lak. The fish needs more punch. The red curry is actually too much, making the dish sloppy. I actually wonder if this would be better with the curry separate. At the least, the curry needs deeper flavor too, I want to tell the spices apart.

The frog legs were quite good, with vegetables that were crisp and frog legs that were moist. The sauce I think was a little too sweet, I could've done with more pepper. But I like the concept of the moist meaty frog legs - way better than chicken drums or flats - with crisp stir-fried peppers and onions. A better dish is there but this is decent.

The appetizer was a crudite and I remember liking the fermented fish and the steamed egg. But I didn't quite know how to eat the dish. The julienne was nice but the ergonomics was hard. Maybe scoops would have been better?

From the dessert side, the pudding was too sweet and the tapioca was better but the black beans were a little annoying. That being said, I think Bangladesh has a soft-and-hard custard like this so that maybe the style.

Overall a good place with a very special dish in the lok lak. I want to go back for other traditional meat dishes.

There are many good restaurants in New York city, but few that are like Bayon. The ownership and atmosphere at Bayon are unparalleled. Lots of Asian restaurants in New York are now owned by restaurant groups, but Bayon is owned and operated by their very own head chef. Minh has roots in Cambodia but has spent time growing up in Thailand and Vietnam, which makes his cuisine a one of a kind gem. Minh was also thrilled to speak Khmer and Vietnamese with our table. You can be sure you‚Äôll enjoy a flavorful and authentic evening at Bayon.

The Prahok was the perfect tang and fermentation. The nem nuong is a refreshing Cambodian flair on a Vietnamese dish (more savory). The desserts was yummy too! We got the sago and the pudding. Thanks for a great evening!

This is such a great addition to the neighborhood and a hidden gem! Cozy decor and great service. We were able to slip in early, but you should probably make a reservation. It‚Äôs been a while since my visits to Cambodia, but the food all tasted very authentic and really, really good!  The duck salad was good, fish cakes wonderful, but the grilled amok next level delicious. So happy to have a place like this in the neighborhood!

The service and the atmosphere were great. The staff was always available and the many cultural items of decoration were very welcoming and intriguing as someone only superficially familiar with Cambodia. I liked the preparation of the food, the portions were filling, and the arrangements with many small dishes made me feel like I was at a feast. However, the flavors were too subtle, in particular the crepe was quite bland.

I enjoyed Otis so much that I think I need to come back and try out a few more of their options. The food is simple and typical if you ask me but something stands out about it - the freshness and the quality. My favorite thing was the carrots because I never really had a dish like that before. The pasta was good but a bit too rich for my taste. Looking forward to coming back again in the near future!

We came in on a Sunday during my birthday weekend and I will 100% be back. I haven't stopped thinking about the Buratta and Pork Shoulder Pasta since I left.

I also tried a few of my husband's Mussels ‚Äì can't remember the last time I had mussels that good. The Mezcal cocktail was great too, and they brought me a little ice cream with a candle + a round of aperitifs for my birthday ü•πü´∂üèΩ Wish I could give 6 stars for the service! This is now in my top 3 fav Bushwick restaurants.

We had a big group to try out all the dishes they have on the menu. Overall it was great! My favorite is their breads: so soft and fresh. The grilled shrimp dish is also amazing. My least favorite is mussels because I have had elsewhere better. Most of the dishes are on the salty side, with a lot of sauces (especially for the salad) and it‚Äôs not really exactly my preference.
Staff is attentive. Drinks are bomb! Will try to come back!

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîthe burrata and short ribs were a perfect 10/10. My server was incredibly knowledgeable and gave excellent recommendations, which made the meal even better. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

Ok, the burrata is actually really amazing. So is the beet salad and the mussels. The service, open kitchen, brick walls, intimate  lighting, amazing but low volume playlist make up for the blackened bass and lamb shank being a little too salty and not as mind blowing as we imagined haha. But still, really amazing food.

Wow.
These folks earned every star ‚ú®

The SERVICE was consistently phenomenal from the time we walked up to the time we left.
There are few times I've had service this good.

The food was amazing too.
I tried the ever-popular Crispy Calamari appetizer and the Truffle Shuffle pizza.
Delicious! ü§§

The vibes were calm and welcoming, a warm and relaxing respite from an otherwise busy city. üòå
This restaurant is a part of an indoor collection of shops resting by the port.
There is a good view of the Brooklyn bridge from the other side of the building. üåâ

I highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner.
Bring friends and family because they could use a little more love!

The Frenchman‚Äôs Dough is located on the second floor of the Tin Building!

Got the mushroom pizza but forgot to take photos. Pretty good but pretty pricey. Plenty of seating on a Wednesday around 1pm. I think most restaurants in the Tin Building are pretty empty during lunch on weekdays. Service was solid, our servers were great.
