Note that the restaurant is in the ‚Äúopen‚Äù part of the Tin Building, so depending on where you‚Äôre sitting, there could be lots of people walking by.

The squash appetizer was interesting, I‚Äôd recommend! I thought I was biting into a fried mozzarella stick (but it looks like an onion ring).

I had the pleasure of dining at Frenchman‚Äôs Dough inside the Tin Building this week, and I can‚Äôt stop thinking about how delicious everything was! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a cozy and inviting atmosphere that made it the perfect spot for a relaxed meal. The open kitchen vibe added to the charm, making it feel like an immersive dining experience.

The food was absolutely amazing. The calamari is hands down the best I‚Äôve had in NYC, crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and perfectly seasoned. It was light and flavorful, without being greasy at all. If you‚Äôre a fan of seafood, this dish alone is worth the visit!

But the real standout for me was the Truffle Shuffle pizza. The combination of rich truffle flavor with a perfectly crispy crust made each bite feel indulgent and satisfying. The flavors were balanced so well, and the toppings were fresh and high-quality, making it one of the most memorable pizzas I‚Äôve had in a while.

I‚Äôve been to the Tin Building multiple times, but this visit to Frenchman‚Äôs Dough really stood out. Whether you‚Äôre popping in for a casual meal or enjoying a special evening out, this place has it all: delicious food, great atmosphere, and exceptional service. Highly recommend it to anyone in the area or looking for a great dining experience in the Seaport!

Had dinner at Frenchman‚Äôs Dough after a colleague recommended the Tin Building. Great atmosphere both inside the Tin Building and around the area. Service was great from start to finish. Got a seat at the bar and was able to watch them stretch the dough and assemble the pizzas. A little dinner and a show action. Definitely recommend checking out when back in town.

My visit was on a quiet yet cold Sunday. It proved to be a perfect time to grab a table for two for lunch.
The staff was very professional and as usual the service was on point.

The only real issue we experienced was that the bread we ordered with our appetizer was served almost cold. It would have been so much better served warm or hot. That said, the Frenchman receives a 5 star review for utterly delicious food.

Our shared elections included fried calamari, fresh bread and oil dip, Ceasars salad, and branzino. We finished our meal with a Basque cheesecake and an affogato.

Highly recommended.

Visited to try out the new brunch menu and everything was delicious! Especially recommend the disco fries and breakfast empanadas. And always with a sangria on the side.

Location is cozy and intimate, great for a date night!

Small but quaint tapas restaurant. Excellent wine list and cocktails. We were a large group and sampled everything. It was all yummy but stand outs were Brussels sprouts, patatas bravas, chicken milanesa, and steak. Staff was so accommodating to our large and spirited group. Can‚Äôt wait to go back and enjoy again.

Went here for dinner with a friend, and had a lot of delicious food! They don‚Äôt skimp out on portions, and the vibes were great. If anything the inside area got pretty toasty because of the open kitchen.

The dishes we got were:
1. Manchego and Marconi almonds ‚Äî recommend
2. Croquetas of the day (Ham) ‚Äî recommend
3. Gambas (Shrimp) ‚Äî recommend
4. Roasted cabbage ‚Äî do not recommend

A cute date night spot located inside the made hotel. I stopped in for tapas and the lovely gentleman with the amazing curly hair and glasses served us. 1 star removed because of the poor energy from the manager who did not acknowledge us until the second time she passed us entering and then seemed to interrupt our waiter while he was closing us out to rush him to close o it another customer. If it were not for the amazing service from others, I would give this place even less stars.

Was here for dinner. The food was okay. It took a really long time to come which our server had warned us but it took extra long to come because they gave our food to another table. The server was very apologetic and offer to give us dessert and so we got the churro. We got the octopus it was a littler bitter. The pork loin was good but the ends were a little dry. The patatas and pct was good!

Very good Peking duck. Best in the area.

The soup dumplings weren‚Äôt too bad but just average overall.

The fried fish was excellent. Perfectly crispy.

The rice bowls are massive to be sure to share.

It gets extremely busy for very limited staff so service can take long. It was also extremely hot inside.
business_name: Chef Huang Jian Bing & Peking Duck

text: This is one of my dad‚Äôs favorite restaurants and he wanted to have his birthday dinner here. I called and made same day reservations, requested 7:30 but was offered 8:15. We got to the restaurant around 8, there is street parking to be found in the area after 7pm. It was my first time here‚Ä¶the restaurant is cute but tiny‚Ä¶7 tables in total and one additional table in a private room..expect a lengthy wait‚Ä¶it was a bit disappointing that even with the reservations we actually didn‚Äôt get our table until 9, which means we were sitting around waiting for an hour, not ideal especially with little ones! The staff did their best to accommodate, and put our order in while we were waiting so that our food arrived shortly after we sat down, which was amazing given that we were starving by then. We got the table in the back in the private room and it‚Äôs a great place for a celebration. The food was worth the wait!! The duck was amazing, definitely the highlight here‚Ä¶crispy skin, tender meat‚Ä¶really good flavor! My son loved the soup dumplings‚Ä¶The scallion pancake was less oily than what I am used to but nothing special. Would recommend the mashed garlic cucumber as an accompaniment: so yum, we should have ordered two!! The beef ribs with crispy crust were good but heavy‚Ä¶really tasty with the pineapple on the side. Dessert was delicious too and really fun for the kids we had the chocolate ice cream shaped as different animals. My 9 year old proclaimed this was the best meal she‚Äôs ever had and she loves to eat out so that says a lot! Not the best meal I‚Äôve ever had but I would definitely be back for their duck‚Ä¶wouldn‚Äôt bother making reservations next time and would just walk in expecting a long wait. Overall great dinner experience, worth the wait!
business_name: Chef Huang Jian Bing & Peking Duck

text:
The only way to celebrate Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year for all you PC folks) is with a big group, so that's what we did at Chef Huang.

'Twas 'sokay.

We got a lot of food, so I won't laundry list everything, just group them for your reviewing pleasure:

The Great: House Special BBQ Lamb Kebab (so good we got it twice))

The Good: Pork Ribs Shanghai Style, Crispy Salt Roasted Boneless Sea Bass, Sauteed Pea Shoots with Garlic, Fried Sweet Tang Yuan

The Meh: Mashed Garlic Cucumbers, Sauteed Shanghai Vegetables with Garlic
House Special Noodles, House Special Big Mouth Bass with Vegetables, Chef Special Crispy Boneless Chicken Steak (suuuuper dry), Animal Ice-Cream (not chocolate, boo!)

Bottom line: It's not bad if you're in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
business_name: Chef Huang Jian Bing & Peking Duck

text:
Cozy but with a great ambiance and absolutely delicious food. I recommend specifically a famous Pekin duck ü¶Ü
That spot would become one of your fav as it became mine ü•∞üòé thank you üôè
business_name: Chef Huang Jian Bing & Peking Duck

text:
This place specializes in bbq-inspired Chinese. We loved it.

The Peking duck was as good as it gets outside of China. Lamb skewers were tender, fatty, and well seasoned. The highlight was the beef brisket roll. Not quite sure how authentically Chinese it is (it probably is and I‚Äôve just never had it), but it was so tasty - reminded me of a beef Wellington.

The veggie dishes (Mapo tofu, pea shoots), though not the highlights, were also great.

Highly recommended.
business_name: Chef Huang Jian Bing & Peking Duck

text: One of my best experience ever! I walked in without a reservation, but the waiters didn‚Äôt take long to find me a perfect table. Everyone was super nice and polite. The cocktail, I ordered a Lycee Martini, was absolute pleasure for the palate. The food, Mantia, and the classic Albanian bread were delicious!!! I finished my dinner with my favorite dessert: Trilece, and an espresso. I‚Äôll definitely come back!

We came here for dinner last weekend and were very impressed. The service is very friendly and the atmosphere is so warm and inviting. I love Eastern European food, especially during the colder months, and this is definitely authentic. We had a stew of sausage and white beans - rich and heartwarming, so perfect for the season along with a platter of grilled meat. Both delicious! I‚Äôd also be remiss if I didn‚Äôt mention the bread - similar to pita and steaming hot, it was the perfect accompaniment. Such a great find in Midtown. I‚Äôll definitely return!

We were curious about Albanian cuisine, came to try it and were not disappointed. We loved their bread with dips, especially Ajvar. Then we liked their specialties Fli and Lecenik. Worth mentioning is also the Sesame Baked Cheese and Grills. Finish your meal with the tasty Baklava. Service was friendly and the atmosphere was very warm and cozy. Highly recommended!

Really loved the food here!! Lamb in yogurt is super soft and tasty and sausage in 3 cheese is also flavorful. Atmosphere and interior are cozy and great for friends or family occasions. The service is meh‚Ä¶

You might not be able to pronounce the name, or many of the food items but you don‚Äôt have to because pretty much everything on the menu is delicious.

I‚Äôve been here at least 4 times with a group of 6-10 and they‚Äôre always very accommodating.

For appetizers the baked cheese has been really good, however the sesame baked cheese which we got this time was a lil too sesame for the group. The flavors of cheese, sesame and honey show the influence of Greek, Ottoman and even Arab food.

The manti are the best thing on the menu, both the baked ones and the ones in the tava. For desis this word might be familiar as this refers to a clay dish in which things are baked in an oven.

The cevapi are mini minced kebabs also so simple and delicious. Those with their fresh pita and some ajvar (an eggplant and pepper dip). This is def the iconic combination at any Balkan restaurant, including this one.

Also there are rumors that Dua Lipa loves this place.

Okay wow.  Great space with a variety of smaller rooms & different seating, the brussel sprouts are a fave so we ordered and they were perfect. The calamari was quite tasty and the sauce out of this world. The shrimp cashew in a sweet and sour sauce with an amazing blend of veggies was my personal favorite.  Cooked to perfection, each piece of the largest shrimp held great flavor. The service was coordinated nicely.  All of the staff from checking us in until we left, were friendly, helpful and pleasant. The overall vibe is calm, though the music has rhythm and the variety of guests, varied drinks flowing, and quick moving wait staff keep it interesting and exciting. Both tables next to us seemed equally happy with their food and drink.

Came here for Sunday brunch and we were the first party to be seated. Overall experience was decent but nothing that would make me want to come back. Service was patchy and they couldn‚Äôt serve some drinks because they didn‚Äôt have hot water. Food was decent but nothing I couldn‚Äôt find in most other Thai restaurants of a similar type. Guess it‚Äôs nice to go if it‚Äôs convenient/available!

Wow this is a great vibe and good Music and great Cuisine with authentic Thai that reminds me of Thailand and the flavors  like the Yum Nua Yang - BBQ Beef salad and the pla Muk Tod Fried Calamari and pad Prik Khing string Beans and Kanang Pad Krapow - Brussel Sprouts and Crab Fried Rice.
I have been there 3 times. Each time I always order the vegetable curry. I called it Thai style of the ‚Äúratatouille‚Äù. The fish is also so delicious.

after being intensely influenced by ronnie chieng to come visit his favorite restaurant, we came on a random saturday night and we're welcomed in by the warm hosts who gave us seats at the bar. despite not having reservations. the overall vibe in ambiance was great and the staff there seemed genuinely part of the culture. so I definitely respect that aspect of it, however, I think I've come to realize that legitimate thai food is not my desire, I like the americanised thai, so I'm fully aware that my review would not be an objective description of how the food should taste. however, we had a few drinks and some entrees and they were overall decent quality but not our cup of tea. for drinks we had the sway wayla which was nice but a bit sweet, and golden cassia which was like volano smokey. we also had the papaya salad which was spicy and not flavored like salads enough for our taste, the branzino which was fried and pleasantly easy on the palette, and veg curry and it had the variety of veg but still not superior to the standard green curry chicken we get from other places but like i said im aware im not legit thai at all. thanks for the hospitality nonetheless

Wow ! what an amazing dinner! My experience at Au Za‚Äôatar was already great because of the delicious food, but what made it truly stand out was Gio, our server. He was super friendly, helpful, and really made us feel welcome from start to finish. His recommendations were perfect, and he checked on us just the right amount without ever being overbearing. You can tell he enjoys what he does! If you ever go, ask for Gio, you won‚Äôt regret it.

We had the lamb hummus, arayes and jwaneh for lunch, it was amazing.
And then we returned for dinner w friends.
We had the hummus mezze, royal platter and the lamb shawarma which isn‚Äôt on the menu.
They slice it for you at the table or you can do it yourself.

The platter was awsome.  All the different meats were cooked to perfection.   The lamb shawarma as seen in photo looks good but it was too dry.  We couldn‚Äôt eat much of it.

I went to Au Za‚Äôatar with a group of 10, and they were able to accommodate us easily. We made a reservation in advance. The food was amazing! I honestly liked everything we ordered. One standout was the kofta Eggs Benedict, which was new to me and really tasty just a little bit spicy. Some of the dishes come with vegetables on the side, so keep that in mind before ordering extra sides. We ended up with way too many veggies! The za‚Äôatar mint tea was delicious and refreshing. The only thing I didn‚Äôt love was the falafel.It was a bit dry for my taste. But overall, a great experience with good food, friendly service, and I‚Äôd definitely go back.

Had a great experience at Au Za‚Äôatar in Manhattan. The Lebanese food was absolutely delicious‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and the service overall was very professional and attentive.

The only small point was that I was asked a few times whether I was going to stay or leave, which felt a bit much. But aside from that, everything was perfect. Definitely recommend it for anyone craving authentic Lebanese cuisine in NYC!

Modern authentic Lebanese dishes, would highly recommend. We sampled numerous items and all were top notch. Flavors stood out, additional sauces as well as garlic paste and pita bread were provided. Kufta with hand cut fries in sumac were excellent and the shanklish was on point.

We came without a reservation and were able to get seats at the bar after a 45-minute wait. I definitely recommend booking ahead! The dishes were delicious, the salad was super fresh, and the cookie dessert was more like a real cake‚Äîamazing. I‚Äôd recommend visiting at least for the authentic American diner atmosphere!

Perfect in every way! The bartenders truly elevated the experience. Stopped in for lunch and ate gooood!! Chicken liver mousse was a treat and the burger was delicious. A big fat, juicy burger is hard to find nowadays with the smash burger being the trend. So good and so worth it. Fantastic spot!

We dined in the dining room with the seasonal menu. The atmosphere of this restaurant is incredible. Loved the decorations, lighting, and perfect temperature. It‚Äôs dinner and a show because watching the perfectly timed execution of courses being served to tables near you at the same exact time is magical. Loved watching the service staff execute to great standards and seeing two people go to a table at a time to clean plates off at the exact same time. Some of the courses weren‚Äôt outstanding, but the dessert was by far the best course. The truffles at the end were a sweet touch and we were sent home with a lemon poppy seed muffin to take home!

We had a very important business lunch.
The staff was wonderful.
One of the staff members noticed that we were both Capricorns born on the same day.
The food was great.
The atmosphere was warm and inviting.

It's been about a decade since we've been here, and it's just as good now as it was the first time we came. While we were happy with all of our dishes, the complimentary bread it actually what we'll remember about this meal. It was so fluffy and tasty! I got the dark chocolate cake dessert and my favorite part was the candied chestnut. I could eat a whole bowl of those - so good.
The service was also good - friendly and helpful; but not stuffy.

Chama Mama transports you straight to Georgia with its beautiful decor and a cozy, heated backyard perfect for a scenic dining experience.
We kicked off our meal with drinks, and
Ajika Mary was an absolute standout. It‚Äôs a Georgian take on the classic Bloody Mary, packed with bold, spicy flavors. The mocktails, Figgin Fresh and Tangerine Trip, were equally delightful, offering refreshing and well-balanced flavors.

For appetizers, we started with Spinach Pkhali, a rich and earthy Georgian dip served with freshly baked bread and a side of Ajika. The creamy spinach paired with the spicy ajika gave each bite a flavorful kick.

Next up was the Chiji Piji with Adjapsandali, a shakshouka style dish that was hearty and comforting. Next we tried Adjaruli Khachapuri, a  boat-shaped bread filled with molten cheese, butter, and a raw egg yolk, straight from the Adjara region. A little cheesy and might put you to sleep but it was a decent delight for the taste buds.

To wrap up this Georgian feast, we indulged in Pelamushi, a traditional grape pudding topped with glazed walnuts, along with a warm and comforting Cappuccino. Didn't find the dessert to be very good, it was okayish

The staff was helpful and sweet, adding to the warm and welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant. This place is a must visit for anyone looking to explore the rich culinary traditions of Georgia or looking to try something different.

A favorite in Manhattan. The atmosphere is casual chic, the staff is amazing, and the food is delicious. We had the Georgian samples, fantastic, the pan fried mushroom dumplings, yummy, and of course the cheese boat, great bread. The tap sparkling water is just $5, includes refills which was a delight. Please vists, try something different from our day to day.

It was my first time exploring Georgia food. Overall it‚Äôs great.
The pork skewers are very tender and juicy, together with pomegranate and the special sauce. The Georgian soup dumplings - I‚Äôd recommend the steamed ones, which do hold soup inside, while the fried ones are a bit dry inside. The cheese boat and the chicken liver pate are both very good in flavors. The grape pudding is sweet sour, good as an end of a feast, and the napoleon is different from the French one, good to give it a try.
Service was quite friendly. They recommended the above dishes, which were all quite good and special.
Atmosphere wise, good for gathering of a small group. Cute decors.

Having a mixed set of feelings about restaurant's menu, this time I realized what is it I am coming for to Chama Mama. Traditional dough items. They offer one of the best Imeruli Khachapuri I've ever tried: juicy, with a right amount of white cheese and thin well-made dough. I recommend having this in your order list regardless of what you pick.

+ the latest addition to mine is an entr√©e called Wild Mushrooms With Eggs And Potatoes - delicious!

How many accolades can you bestow on a restaurant experience? Never having experienced Georgian food, our expectations were non-existent. Everything about this place is great! We were fortunate to have "Marita" as our server. She is a genuine Georgian and navigated us through a wonderful sampling of their best. The vibe and decor were hip with some excellent Soulful House music playing in the background. One minor issue was our timing. We booked a 1:00PM lunch on a Sunday and the place was packed...which meant noisy. One hour later, the brunch crowd was mostly gone and the experience became more comfortable. They have different menu options based on the mealtime. We enjoyed the brunch menu but will definitely return for a dinner.

Rogue Panda in Time Out Market Brooklyn is a bustling spot, especially on a Sunday afternoon around lunchtime! Be prepared for the crowds and a potential 20-30 minute wait, with lines forming at almost every stall (and even the restrooms!). While the egg fried rice with chicken I ordered was decent ‚Äì served hot and a good portion ‚Äì I've definitely had better. However, Rogue Panda is a solid option for a quick bite while showing friends around the city. Plus, you can't beat the incredible views from Time Out Market! My tip? Try visiting on a weekday for a more relaxed experience and to better enjoy the food and ambiance.

Time Out Market was extremely crowded during the weekends. Tried The Rogue Panda on the 5th floor and the food was quite nice. Tried the dan dan noodles, mapo tofu, pork dumplings and shiitake truffle fried rice. The pork dumplings were excellent and I love the firm texture of the dan dan noodle.
The Rogue Panda is on the Fifth floor, had great asian options, dumplings were good, but took too long even though place was not crowded.

The sign says that this is a fully plant based menu and yet they transitioned away from being plant based without updating the sign and so I just ate real orange chicken. I am very upset by this situation and though they apologized afterward, it happened. I would recommend everyone to be careful when ordering. I would truly give this experience 0 stars if I was able to.

The place is enjoyable because of the view but I expected more of the food and service. You place your order through a QR scan. I ordered a sesame chicken that is served with rice. The waiter forgot the rice, I asked him about it and he later brought it over but the sesame chicken already got cold and as you can see, part of the rice was not fully cooked, somewhat of a risotto watery texture, and part of it was drier. We were on the same floor as the restaurant but it did not work out well.

Cute and authentic Vietnamese spot. We ordered the Special Beef Pho, Grilled Pork Vermicelli and Viet Coffee. The broth was homemade and the portion was big. The pork was grilled to perfection. Would 100% come back and try other items on the menu!

Great staff, even better food and a cute space that felt authentic and modern. Most people are used to Southern Vietnamese food so it was a surprise when it turned out to be Northern! The pho broth was excellent and homemade, not the cubed broth flavoring a lot of other restaurants use. The appetizer portions were quite large for lunch and our group realized halfway through that we might have ordered too much! I would definitely return.
Soup was not bad, the noodles were chewier than what we are used to. Was a bit slow though. Chicken wings could‚Äôve used more flavor on the inside.

very good pho! I loved the flavor of the broth-it was slightly sweet but still complex and didn‚Äôt need any additional sauce/seasoning.

everything else was good too! my only complaint is it‚Äôs a slightly smaller portion of noodle than other restaurants, but I don‚Äôt mind that too much.

would definitely return!
Really enjoyed this Vietnamese spot! The pho were amazing and hearty, came in generous portions as well. Not too many tables so be prepared for a bit of wait during the weekend.

If Ondo seems like it'd be right at home in Manhattan, that's probably because....it would be. From the luxurious decor to the beautiful plating to the refined flavors, this place is so Korean chic, you might be tempted to check your GPS to make sure you didn't wind up on the wrong side of the river.

Everything we got was stellar. The Truffle Mushroom Rice (albeit cliched) was perfectly sticky and flavorful. The Bossam pork strips were cooked perfectly.

Our Grilled Branzino was tender enough to eat with a spoon, while the Bulgogi Cream Perilla Pasta was sweet, rich and creamy without ever being overwhelming.

And my favorite part of the meal was our dessert: a light, airy chiffon-esque Banana Cake that perfectly captured this underrated cake flavor without ever being too sweet. I mean how much is a banana anyway? $10?

We sat at the bar, and service was as gentle and friendly as the general ambience. We even got a free Tiramisu Martini because apparently they made extra. Woot.

The prices and portions might make your halmoni tsk tsk, but I'd wager even she would relent after trying that cake.

Had a lovely impromptu lunch at Ondo in Jersey City, and I simply can‚Äôt recommend it enough! Days later, I‚Äôm still thinking about the meal and can‚Äôt wait to go back.

We tried the Korean Fried Chicken lunch set, fried shrimp dumplings, galbi-jjim, and bulgogi cream perilla pasta. No single standout because every dish was a star! The Korean Fried Chicken was crispy, tender, juicy, and packed with flavor. The lunch set with kimchi, soup, and banchan was perfectly balanced and memorable. The galbi-jjim was a work of art‚Äîtangy omija sauce with a smooth chestnut puree for the perfect bite. The bulgogi pasta? Absolutely exceeded expectations‚Äîrich, robust, and soul-warming. Even the fried shrimp dumplings were perfectly dressed and delightful.

For dessert, we had the honeycomb panna cotta (good, but I‚Äôll try something new next time). The curated wine list was the perfect touch‚ÄîI loved the orange and burgundy wines alongside the meal.

This meal was nothing short of magical, and I can‚Äôt wait to bring friends and family. Ondo is an absolute 10/10!

A truly exceptional experience! If you love elegant Korean food this is for you

Get the short rib or the branzino! Gorgeous atmosphere

Great atmosphere, wonderful service
The food is delicious
I got the beef tartar box that came with an assortment of sides- everything was very tasty
My friend got the Mushroom rice that looked and tasted wonderful
We shared kimchi tofu hummus that was very light and great as a starter
We ordered some cocktails to wash down the meal
For dessert we had the honey panacota and some lemon yuzo sorbet that were delightful
Definitely recommend if you are in the area!

Excellent food and service! The staff was friendly, catered to our every need, and the food was pretty good. The meat was tender and had no grizzle or chewiness to it. The banana cake was also great. I could've had 2-3 of those. Honestly, my only complaint is that it doesn't follow the standard Korean set up. Normally you'll get complimentary side dishes that they refill like kimchi, Sotteok, Korean green salad, etc. You won't get any of that here. It's pretty much you get what you order and the side dishes such as rice surprisingly cost extra. It's more of a modernized Korean restaurant and not standard. A little annoying considering it's already pricey. If I could, I'd give it a 4.25/5.0.

My wife and our two boys went there and we enjoyed the experience very much.  We booked online the Moet on the Hudson menu.  Except the Ribeye steak, which were burnt and has too much charcoal flavor, our other food were all very good.   The lobster and the lamb are better than a lot of places.  The outdoor igloo was a bit tiny, so I don‚Äôt think it is for everyone.  Honestly, for us with kids, it is perfectly ok, and kind of fun and private.  The staff were all very friendly and genuinely attentive.

We did reservation for 35 people not knowing that it's a small place. So there was a wall between the other half of our guest. It wasn't a private room.  We had the staff and other customers walking through our party to get to the outside tables. The staff was nice but having people constantly going through your party wasn't nice. It's a great place for small party, but remember there's no private party room.
Now for the good part the food was amazingly good, the appetizers were lamb meatballs, mozzarella in fillo, and crostinis all of it was great. I found that there wasn't enough beef for the entree put out for the amount of guest that we had. The food serving is family style. The desserts were so sinfully delicious.
The staff were polite and very attentive to our guest need.

Had the most incredible date night at Mezze On The River, a stunning waterfront restaurant with breathtaking views of the Hudson! Whether you dine indoors or in a cozy private igloo, the experience is pure magic‚Äîespecially with a glass of champagne in hand.
Set against the glittering NYC skyline, the ambiance is unmatched‚Äîsophisticated, romantic, and oh-so-indulgent. The food? Absolutely delicious. The service? Impeccable. If you're looking for the perfect date night spot, this is it!

Celebrated our wedding anniversary here this weekend and had an awesome time! It‚Äôs right next to the Hudson River with a beautiful view of the Statue of Liberty in the distance. We chose to sit out in an ‚Äúigloo‚Äù outdoors which was cool but it was super sunny and windy so it felt both steaming hot and cold at the same time. We had the Mo√´t on the Hudson prefixed brunch meal. All the food was super tasty. The staff were friendly and very efficient. Our server Alejandra gave great recommendations on our food choices and cocktails. Enjoyed a great meal with a great view. Will definitely be frequenting here again in the summer!!

Brought my best friend here for his birthday and it was a hit.

The food was great, service phenomenal and ohhhhh mannnn look at the views!  We very well enjoyed our time. I‚Äôd definitely be back in the summer time.

We didn‚Äôt order dessert because we truly were stuff but the staff brought out some to celebrate his birthday any way! Couldn‚Äôt be more thankful. You all rock!

The donuts here are amazing! I think we got 5 in total today and they were so fresh. Everything was delicious!!! Def recommend coming here. The ube donut and apple fritter donut are a must. All the donuts were so light despite the fillings and weren‚Äôt overly sweet. Hoping to stop by soon again.

What a great experience! It was my first visit and worth my morning walk. I anticipated a long line and was welcomed by the owners. They show how much they truly appreciate each and every customer. My favorite was the ube latte and ensaymada croissant, but all of their drinks and baked goods are phenomenal. I can't wait stop by again and try some more treats. Their entire team are so kind and make the wait worthwhile. I appreciate how organized the entire visit was- from the line outside, inside the store, the kitchen, check out, etc. They put a lot of thought into making it a seamless and enjoyable experience.

Had to try this place because of their flan, and they delivered.

I'm not a fan of donuts, but I was surprised about the flakiness of the dough, also not too sweet nor greasy, paired with a good and firm flan.Definitely a must try.

The lemon cookie was a last minute addition and tasted good. The Ube was also a nice surprise as it was the mango float (I wish they could make a plain custard one!).

The only complaint is in the matcha cruller, too greasy for my taste.

They open late and there are plenty of people in line even during the week. It's easier to get pastries later in the AM but past 11:30 AM they might be sold out. Kudos to one of the owner for trying to make sense of the line outside.

Ok, so I‚Äôm not the person that likes standing on a line for something, but I‚Äôm so happy I did. While waiting in line, someone kindly came and spoke to us and shared some
Expectations such as respecting the neighbor businesses by leaving space open for the doors. Super sweet. Anyways, once the bakery opened their doors, they had us come in groups to keep order and give us a good experience.  They have a huge window so you can see them preparing the goods. Everything looked amazing so I had to buy a few different ones to try. Faves are the flan one and the ube donut. Everything is tasty and beautiful.  I also tried one of their signature drinks and even though I don‚Äôt like coffee, this one was amazing. All this to say, this place is beautiful, the staff is super nice and the goods are amazing. It‚Äôs a must and it‚Äôs worth the hype.

Saw this place being advertised as great donuts so I had to try them . My first bite was a very long brown hair that wrapped around my tongue
It was so disgusting, I had to unwrap the hair from my tongue. The taste was good though but with that experience. No thank you.

I‚Äôve been coming here occasionally for a few months now and WOW! Every visit is consistently amazing. The food is phenomenal in both taste and presentation, the wine list is stunning and the incredibly friendly staff is always around to answer any questions or help you find the perfect wine pairing! The pictured nutella pizza was a gorgeous valentines surprise that we cannot recommend enough!

We came on a Saturday night at 7:00pm without reservations. Our party of 5 was seated immediately. The restaurant has a great atmosphere and the service was fantastic.

We ordered a couple of appetizers. The fried zucchini was probably the best I've ever had and there was plenty for 5 of us.
For the main course, highly recommend the lasagna and salmon.

Great dining experience. Will definitely return.
This place is delicious and has a great atmosphere. Andrea is an amazing server - he had great recommendations for the menu. A+ all around!

All of the food we got was amazing, drinks were great, atmosphere is beautiful. Our only somewhat of a complaint was the service was friendly but a little slow to greet us and then to come back after we got our food and to get the check. Would still come back.
Excellent place to go to for an informal diner. Good food & fine wines. Recommended for the friendly and informative staff. I will come back someday.

We had an amazing experience tonight at this restaurant.
Even though at the begging (having a reservation), we had to wait for a little while and it was a bit chaotic, the general experience was more than amazing. It showed that this is definitely a popular place.
When we sat, they were extremely apologetic and made sure that we were happy with the seating and even gave us a glass of Prosecco and a delicious cannoli at the end (on the house).
The food menu is very interesting, a lot of delicious choices. We shared a vitello tonnato that was amazing, very flavorful and spectacularly presented. We shared some pastas and they were al dente and very flavorful too. I would definitely come back to try many other dishes.
The wine list is well curated with reasonable prices.
The service was great too. We learned some Italian words and the proper way to eat a cannoli. It was a very enjoyable experience.

A high end 2 level italian restaurant on midtown. The balcony seems a lovely place to spend an afternoon. The dishes were excellent though a bit expensive. Tableside tiramisu was interesting performance. Service was attentive good spot for a date night.

Piccola Cucina Uptown is a lively and popular Italian spot in NYC. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was buzzing‚Äîdim lighting, shelves filled with wine and Italian goods, and a packed house that gave the place an energetic, almost festive vibe. Our waitress was just okay, but the busboys were attentive and helpful throughout the night.

Our family shared several dishes. We started with the Piccola Cucina Salad‚Äîa vibrant mix of baby spinach, beets, oranges, avocado, toasted nuts, and dried fruit. It was super fresh and well-balanced, the perfect light and colorful way to begin the meal. But the pasta dishes were the real highlight. The Tagliatelle with rag√π and truffle was rich, earthy, and deeply flavorful, with perfectly al dente pasta. The Rigatoni with lamb rag√π was bold and indulgent‚Äîthe richness of the lamb stood out, but the mint added a refreshing brightness that balanced it beautifully.

We also got to watch the cheese wheel pasta experience at a nearby table, where hot cacio e pepe was tossed in a giant wheel of Pecorino right in front of everyone. It was such a fun, theatrical moment and added to the overall experience.

For dessert, we shared the pistachio gelato and raspberry sorbet. The gelato was massive‚Äîsuper creamy, intensely pistachio-forward, and surprisingly salty in the best possible way. The sorbet was tart and refreshing, served with fresh berries, and made for a light, clean finish to a rich meal.

Overall, the food was thoughtfully prepared and full of flavor, and the atmosphere made the night feel special. I‚Äôd definitely come back and would recommend it to anyone looking for a cozy, energetic spot for truly satisfying Italian food in the city.

Food 10/10. Bread & spread blew me out of the water. Pasta dishes were authentic and flavorful.
Service 10/10. I rarely tip more than 20% but I did this time. Incredibly friendly yet professional staff. Even provided backgrounds on each dish.
Great Sicilian / Italian cuisine with amazing service especially from Julio and Erica. We used it recently for several corporate dinner and it felt like being at‚Ä¶ home! Highly recommended!

I was lucky to attend a private event downstairs, so I enjoyed an amazing platter of cheese and meats and nibbles prior to our family style meal. The pasta here is exceptional, and the short rib agnolotti was the highlight of the show. Exceptional and professional service and a broad menu to enjoy. Beautiful space inside, looking forward to coming back!

We celebrated our engagement here, and I can‚Äôt speak highly enough of the staff at Scarpetta. They made us feel very special by giving us the best seat in the house and some complimentary champagne. All the staff were very helpful and friendly, and the food was amazing. Probably the best pasta I‚Äôve ever tasted. If we return to New York, we‚Äôll definitely be coming back to this special restaurant. Thank you for all that you did for us.

Made a reservation for an anniversary and it was very nice. Food was delicious, perfect portions, and served in a timely manor. Our waiter was one of the best in any restaurant. Very kind and welcoming as well as enthusiastic. The dessert came with a message because of our anniversary and it was very pleasant overall. Lighting and the decor was very cozy too. All of that said food was a tad too expensive for portion size and because there were so many people it was slightly difficulty to hear another person in a conversation.

Scarpetta was a vibe!
The pasta tasting was divine‚Äîevery dish hit the mark. Service was warm, the ambiance was classy but comfortable. Only wish? A tea box for more post-meal options. Still, a 10/10 experience overall!

Had the charred octopus and broccolini to start - both were great. Octopus was tender and flavorful, could‚Äôve been served a bit warmer.
Ordering family style is the way to go for dinner: for the entree, we shared the spaghetti (their most popular pasta), ravioli Cacio e Pepe, and the short rib/bone marrow agnolotti. The spaghetti is fantastic for what it is (it‚Äôs a pretty simple dish) - amazing sauce. The short rib agnolotti fell flat for me, hence my overall 4 star review. Something about the flavor was off.

Overall fun/vibey dinner experience - great ambience. We went on a saturday night and hopped downstairs to Seville afterwards (dj was playing hip hop/r&b)

I had a fantastic meal at Cha Long! From the moment we walked in, the cozy modern decor and lively atmosphere set the tone for a great dining experience. Por our server was super friendly and attentive, which made everything feel even more welcoming.

The food absolutely delicious. The deep-fried whole fish was beautifully presented and had a crispy exterior with tender meat inside. The stir-fried dish with shrimp and bitter beans packed a punch with bold Southern Thai flavors, while the fried rice was fragrant and full of texture. We also got the crispy pork belly, which had a satisfying crunch and a rich flavor that paired so well with the spicy dipping sauce.

The drinks were just as fun and flavorful as the food! Each one was beautifully presented, and I especially loved the one garnished with a spicy dried shrimp skewer‚Äîsuch a creative touch.

Definitely recommend this place if you‚Äôre in the mood for thoughtfully prepared Thai food with a chill but refined vibe. I‚Äôll be coming back to try more!

Heard so many great things about this spot. Finally had a chance to try it, the day I was running an errand in Hell‚Äôs kitchen. As a Thai person myself, I‚Äôve been to several Thai places in the city that people said were good, and I would say this is the best Thai food I have ever tried outside Thailand.
Dined in during lunch, and it wasn‚Äôt starting to get busy when we were there. The food came out impressively quickly. Two of us shared the shrimp tacos appetizer, they were so delicious, the crepe was crispy and as we bit on it the creamy sauce was introduced in with the best combination of taste, it was a little salty, nutty from coconut milk and sweet, the little fragrance from kafir lime leaves on top was just a perfect blend. Loved it so much! The branzino came indubitably fresh, and the Thai-style chill lime salad sauce brought the fish‚Äôs freshness to another level. I also loved the generous amount of herbs put in there. Another entr√©e was the braised pork belly, which was larger than the other dishes; the pork was tender, and the sauce was sweet and umami salty.

The service was great, attentive and friendly staffs. Nice atmosphere with beautiful decoration.

Will definitely go back to try the crab curry and other dishes.

First time trying Chalong and everything we ordered was tasty. The turmeric sea bass in banana leaves was a bit too salty but overall, every dish had a great balance between spices and flavors. The squid ink fried rice was one of the specials of the night and was very good. This is another great Thai places in the city that I‚Äôll add to my go-often list.

Heard good things about this place, so decided to make a reservation while in NYC. We were seated about 15 mins after our reservation and greeted promptly. Ordered cocktails which were tasty and unique. The cocktail with the shrimp paste is a must try. We shared the dumplings, which were good but could‚Äôve been better. For entrees we had the southern style pad Thai and the crab curry. Pad Thai was tasty but not overly exciting. Crab curry was delicious and would 100% order again. Perfect spice and lots of lump crab.

A neighborhood favorite. Best Thai food in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen? The food is spicy but packed with flavor. Our favorite was the shrimp taco thing. Also the goat curry with the roti bread thing was fantastic. Thai tea is also worth ordering.

Brunch was solid. Bit uninspired though. Steak was tasty, but too much butter and fat. Fries were below average. Mushroom lentil egg salad was nicely done. French toast crafted well - no syrup needed. Cocktails came off. Atmosphere top notch for a holiday brunch.

Very good food. The best onion soup I have ever had. The French fries was so good with the mustard dip.
The ambience is so fancy and cozy.
The service is top notch and very friendly and thoughtful.
If you are in the area and look for a very chill and nice place, you much come!

For brunch: Le Crocodile has the airy, well-adorned space of a great brasserie, but doesn‚Äôt quite have the food to back it up. Nothing is bad, but nothing truly shines either - the honey butter scone to open brunch was perhaps the highlight, with a tender crumb and well-balanced sweetness level, though it would have been notably better if it was warmed before serving. The eggs norwegian were slightly overcooked, with a flat flavor profile dominated by an overly acidic hollandaise. The fries are a miss - fried incorrectly for the thin cut, resulting in a slightly limp and bland disappointment. As a fierce lover of sticky toffee puddings, I found myself underwhelmed by Le Crocodile‚Äôs rendition - the banana was a good addition, but the cake‚Äôs texture didn‚Äôt have the sticky denseness and rich flavor that I expect

Service was good and the space is beautiful, but Le Crocodile‚Äôs underwhelming food coupled with their higher price point don‚Äôt have me excited to return anytime soon

Great restaurant for a date night dinner or to impress parents in town. You can expect Immaculate service, an expansive menu with options for every palette, a quiet yet vibrant atmosphere, and a food menu that doesn‚Äôt disappoint. Some favorites are the oysters, Waldorf salad, fritters, trout and halibut.

As a local, Le Crocodile is one of my absolute go-to spots in Williamsburg. It‚Äôs a rare gem that consistently nails the trifecta of excellent food, warm and professional service, and inviting atmosphere.

The cocktails are outstanding. The house Martini and Spritz are standouts, but honestly, you can‚Äôt go wrong‚Äîbartenders here know their classics. The wine list is well curated and approachable.

Regarding the food, I've stopped by for brunch, lunch, dinner, and even just dessert‚Äîand have never been disappointed.

During my latest lunch visit, I enjoyed a divine asparagus soup alongside their signature mushroom p√¢t√©‚Äîwhich never disappoints. I'm not even a huge mushroom fan, but it's just that good. Other must-try dishes include the roast chicken (a masterclass in simplicity), steak tartare, escargot, and smoked eel fris√©e salad.

Le Crocodile manages to feel both elevated and approachable, perfect for everything from a casual lunch to a celebratory dinner, and the staff is never short of kind and welcoming.

Thank you for so many years of good drinks, food, and vibes!

This establishment has a fantastic atmosphere and serves up great pub food. I had the chicken club sandwich during my visit, which was excellent, and the service at the bar was fantastic as well. The Naked Pig is really an outstanding East Side Midtown pub that is definitely worthy of its high Google review rating.

Was in the city for less than 24hours and just happened to find this place. What a great experience had reservations and was seated early. Great staff, amazing food, great place felt right at home. Emma our server was excellent.

The atmosphere is so cute. Love the Ireland flags:
The waitress was attentive and so sweet.
I cant recommend the chipotle honey wings enough. AMAZING!!!
Cesar salad was fantastic.
Loved the fries.
The French dip was delicious.
Will return for sure

I had cheeseburger slider which was amazing. Then i had the salmon well done which made it a little crispy on top. For dessert i had brownie dessert and also the apple dessert which both were good (both got ice cream on top). Only thing I don‚Äôt recommend unless your into that is the mesclun salad. Person I was eating dinner with had that and we both didn't like it at all. By the way they margarita pitcher of passion fruit was good and type strong !

I rarely give 5 stars across the board- this place deserves it. I had a 1 pm reservation for a party of 2 for two, my reservation was honored and I didn‚Äôt have any wait time. Not the most friendly/welcoming but that‚Äôs okay, they were swamped, parties constantly coming in to be seated and it was already full. Thankfully there were two people to assist with the process, but only one device to check the reservations so it was a tad slow.

I opted for the bottomless unfortunately my date did not. However, it‚Äôs rare to find a brunch place that allows it without the entire table opting-in. The table next to us with a larger party also had someone not opt-in. I had the boozy iced coffee which was perfect, not uber sweet which I was happy for and the alcohol was pronounced. I then switched to the Bellini, I was skeptical due to the tiny size of the glasses but they are crafted perfectly for the size glass. Not your typical watered-down brunch Bellini. My waiter was nice and insisted I have a refill which actually made the bottomless option a worthwhile choice for me. The waiter was great, attentive and did not make any mistakes.

Food- I‚Äôm not a big Eggs Benedict fan, I don‚Äôt like English muffins. But, I liked that this wasn‚Äôt a traditional preparation- it was served on a cheddar biscuit which appealed to me. I added the smoked salmon instead of the bacon. The portion-size was more than enough, I definitely couldn‚Äôt finish it all. Eggs were poached perfectly, the egg wasn‚Äôt too runny which was great and the fries were amazing (prepared how I‚Äôd expect in France), the menu stated they‚Äôd come with home fries (which I hate) so this was a pleasant surprise.

The music is very more which was great for conversation and there are 3 unisex bathrooms, kept pretty clean form my experience so that was a plus.

I‚Äôll definitely be back üòä great value, service and food.

Seemed very low key and we weren‚Äôt expecting much but the food was amazing! Very interesting and creative and delicious. The portions are extremely generous. The baby lettuce was terrific. The sea bass had a delicious curry sauce and the chicken had a wonderful taste and tons of delicious broccolini. But the absolute best was the cornbread!  So good!  Service was perfect. Atmosphere was super relaxed.

D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!!!!! Food was amazing, but the service was 10x better. Valeria assisted us and she made our experience worth wild. Suggested great dishes, was very knowledgeable, and helpful with accomodating our dietary restrictions. Try the crispy cauliflower, Brussel sprouts, and the fish. All their fishes are tasty. Will definitely visit again. Thank you.

Enjoyable experience that consisted of interesting cocktails and elegantly prepared foods.   The martini threw me for a loop but the infusion were spot on.   Veg options are "meaty" in preparation and flavor.  Chicken was well roasted but the fluke carpacio was just okay.  And of course the huge cheese-it is worth a try.

I found this restaurant googling dinner in Hudson yards. The restaurant was absolutely the best surprise. The food, the service and the atmosphere were all on point. We had their Friday special of ‚Äúfish and chips‚Äù which was one of the best fish & chips I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôve already told three friends who are going to the City in the coming weeks to checkout Greywind. Cherry on top? They gave me pastries to go. ‚ù§Ô∏è I will be back!

Lunch at Greywind, Out to lunch with and a friend. We were welcome at the door with smiles, and guided to our table swiftly. Our server was Kennedy, and she was super friendly, professional, making suggestions and reaffirming our selections of food and wine. Food was outstanding.

Amazing service, food presentation, and taste. The Whipped Ricotta Toast was my favorite! It was a great combo of salty, sweet, and chewy. Phewwww took one bite and suddenly understood peace.

The Swordfish Skewer had a beautiful charred smokey taste. It made me appreciate the flavor and textures of seafood again.

The Red Snapper Ceviche was delicious too. It was sour, fresh, and crunchy with added sweetness from charred pineapples. It felt like Lady Gaga was rah rah rah-ing in my mouth.

The lamb was the biggest dish and it was solid, but I didn‚Äôt feel like it was the main character. The four side sauces it came with were intriguing though.

We also got some other dishes like broccolini and this Monkfish Liver Hummus with pita which were delicious as well. Overall this was a great experience!

Recommend:
1.	Octopus ‚Äì It has a chargrilled flavor that‚Äôs outstanding.
2.	Hiramasa ‚Äì The lime perfectly balances the taste of the seafood.

Average:
1.	Ricotta Sourdough ‚Äì The whipped ricotta is fluffy, but best to share. I had about a quarter, and my portion was over-burnt to the point of tasting bitter.

Not Our Cup of Tea:
1.	Za‚Äôatar Kubaneh ‚Äì This pulled bread came highly recommended, but I found the dough not fluffy enough - overall, a bit disappointing. My favorite dip was the Schug, more than the Tomato Aioli or Harissa, but the overall vinegar taste was too overpowering.

Waiting time:
We came on a weekday to wait at 4:30pm and luckily got seated!!

It‚Äôs not too often that a restaurant compels me to write a review. Having seen all the rave reviews, I decided I would make sure to get a heavily in-demand resy. Verdict: this place absolutely lived up to the hype and did not disappoint. Mediterranean food is not one of my top 10 favorite cuisines, but I loved Theodora.

As always, my reviews and ratings will focus almost exclusively on the food.

Ricotta toast: I agree with all the reviews saying this is one of their best items. Creamy, delicious, and the sweetness with the honey is very nice. Don‚Äôt skip this.

Za‚Äôatar kubaneh: fluffy, soft, and a great vehicle for the 3 delicious dips that come with it. My fav was probably the harissa, but all 3 were good. I think most people would agree though that the ricotta toast is tastier, if you were only going to get one bread dish

Red snapper ceviche: I love ceviches, and I could not fault this one. The pineapple works well, and I‚Äôd say it was one of the better ceviches I‚Äôve had in recent memory

Octopus: the octopus was cooked very well, nice and tender, and the sauce very good. I think the sauce could be improved a bit even further, but still, a delicious dish

Golden tilefish: the fish was tender and well cooked, and the sauce was nice. However, this is quite a mild tasting fish, and the sauce by necessity also relatively mild as to not overpower the fish; as a result, this was probably the least memorable dish of the night, and one I would not particularly care to get again.

Swordfish belly skewer: Delicious! I had seen some other rave reviews of this, and they were well earned. The fish was so fatty and tasty, and the sauce went well with it

Chocolate cake: the cake was not too sweet (very important!) and the mascarpone on top a nice pairing. Fantastic way to end the meal.

Also shoutout to our server, I don‚Äôt remember his name but he was excellent, and he even comped a drink at the table next to us when he realized one of the women hadn‚Äôt received her drink for a while.

My only real complaint with this restaurant is that the portions are small (not uncommon for many nyc restaurants), so if you have a healthy appetite, you will be spending at least $200 for two people, and you may still not be completely full. Having said that, I would be happy to come here again and try some of their other dishes.

We went for dinner without having a reservation- we got there early before they opened and waited outside and got seated right away at the bar. It was definitely a solid meal and it was a fun experience that I‚Äôd recommend to others & GREAT service. The sourdough with whipped ricotta was the standout dish for me, it was amazing. I also really liked the hiramasa crudo (although it was a teeny tiny portion for the price) and the broccolini was yummy. We ordered the swordfish skewers which were good but not amazing. We also got the branzino which was pretty bland in my opinion. I‚Äôm typically used to having fish with a lot of seasoning and spice so I think it was just something I wasn‚Äôt used to but the fish was very fresh! The camembert cheesecake was yummy and not too sweet, would recommend! Overall, there were some hits and misses but it was a fun one- time experience!

One of the best meals I've had in ages. A Mediterranean restaurant with an emphasis on fresh grilled vegetables and fish. Everything was super tasty. The grilled sardines were perfect. Great breads especially the sourdough with whipped ricotta. Excellent cocktails including some delicious non alcoholic versions.
Try the spicy cucumber lemon. Also the Vodka shot with pickled mushroom was great. The cheesecake for dessert was not my thing but the fruit filled doughnut balls were yummy. It's a tough reservation but worth the effort. If you get there early you maybe can snag a seat at the bar. Also service is superb. Our server was truly incredible. Her knowledge and efficiency made the meal even more special.

Wonderful food in a beautiful, a little IKEA-like setting. Mimosas (rhubarb and lingonberry) were pleasant, potato waffle with gravlax flavorful and not heavy on the stomach, r√§kmacka (toast with mixed greens, boiled egg and cold water shrimp) delicious and refreshing. Will definitely try the desserts next time.

As a life-long vegetarian and one who is allergic to tofu and soy, it is a constant battle for me to find any sort of dish that is hearty, delicious and doesn‚Äôt make me feel sick to my stomach.  However, let me just say now that I have discovered this gem I can whole-heartedly state to others in the same predicament, look no further than Bj√∂rk Caf√© and Bistro at the Scandinavian Center right in the heart of NYC.  My Mother has been raving about the place for years, Swedish by decent she often attends concerts there then follows by having a meal of meatballs at the Caf√©.  Also, side beat here, this isn‚Äôt just for vegetarians, my Mom who has been consuming Swedish food since she was a child eats the traditional meat ones and professes her love just as much as I do at their flavorful-savory balls of joy. But, I digress back to the message at hand and my experience- despite my lineage it must be noted that I never really understood the whole meatball thing. That was until I tried these vegetarian meatballs and now let me just say they are on my ‚Äúdeath row‚Äù food list.  Balls of mixed veg that feel hearty, but with the right consistency of what a meatball should be. A bit chewy, yet with a toothsome-tasty bite that comes in a hot skillet bathing in a sea of mushroom gravy.  Two heaping sides of mashed potatoes, lingonberry and a small heap of cucumber salad make this the Swedish dish of the year. So warm and comforting, yet you don‚Äôt leave with a belly bomb rather a feeling of satisfaction that your satiated your hunger and body with great, healthy ingredients that are not only delicious but good for you too. Not to be missed either, is their infamous princess cake. Another Swedish delicacy I ordered one specifically for my sister‚Äôs birthday with many a friend asking me, ‚Äúwhy on EARTH would you get your sister a green cake for her birthday?!?!‚Äù All were immediately silenced once they sampled the light as air confectionary at her birthday party. My phone continuing to beep more than a drug dealer‚Äôs pager on New Year‚Äôs Eve for days later with friends raving about it and still does to this day. Ulrika (the head chef) and her team just know how to do it right.  This wondrous establishment isn‚Äôt just for those from Scandinavia, it‚Äôs for anyone looking for great quality food at a reasonable price all throughout the day. Lastly, they are perhaps the kindest kitchen team I have ever come across. As a former food blogger and culinary consultant and marketer, never have I experienced such gracious generosity as I did recently with Bj√∂rk Caf√©.  I sent them an off-handed emailing thinking nothing of it, describing how my family and I were holed up in Long Island during the holidays which was a difficult time for us and how we so missed having their traditional food.  Meant more as a compliment then anything else, yet no sooner had I sent the email did my inbox ping with a reply that they would only be more than happy to find a way to deliver us a meal. Keeping in mind that this is at the height of their busiest time of year, with yule boards and the Santa Lucia festival. Even still, they made and took the time to carefully wrap, package and send three orders of their vegetarian meatball meals to me and my family in Long Island. I have never in my life been so touched by the gesture or the food. At a relatively painful time for us, the savory aromas and fond memory-inducing fare brought sweet moments of joy and reflection.  It is true what they say, ‚Äú"Food, in the end, in our own tradition, is something holy. It's not about nutrients and calories. It's about sharing. It's about honesty. It's about identity." - Louise Fresco. This could not be truer for  Bj√∂rk Caf√©, head chef Ulrika and her wondrous staff. If you ever find yourself in the area, right on Park Ave. in NYC stop in for a meal that will not only leave you gastronomically satisfied but with a true sense of hygge like a warm hug from a long-lost Norsemen gnome of a grandparent.

Absolutely delightful experience at Bjork for lunch.  My meal was fresh and the flavors were wonderful. The presentation is beautiful.  Tea and dessert was also fabulous.  Service is friendly and excellent.  Super.
A quiet little place with delicious Swedish treats and coffees. Laptop-friendly, which is always a plus.

First time trying Scandinavian cuisine and it was spectacular. Didn‚Äôt know what to order so I got the herring platter which is a staple in Scandinavian cuisine. Interesting contrast of flavors and the apple cake was also great . Good service

This was a nice place just a bit overpriced. The portions were good for someone with a small appetite. But for the price and portion definitely overpriced.

The croissants were a big disappointment. Costco croissants were better than this. I guess I had high expectations and Buvette just didn‚Äôt meet it.

The place was pretty loud. Since we sat at the bar it was easier to talk to each other but if you were sitting at a table indoors I feel like it would be harder.

I would recommend this but would not be the first on the list for brunch options.

Went there for brunch and was really impressed! Get their signature egg toast with berries and chocolate mousse. The salmon toast with egg is also great, especially the egg. So soft and creamy, a texture you‚Äôll come back for. The atmosphere is quite chill. We were seated at the back garden, which is a bit crowded but still nice~

Had breakfast here this morning and it was absolutely worth it! The food was delicious and beautifully presented, and the coffee‚Äîjust perfect. I was alone, so I grabbed a seat at the bar and ended up taking pictures of almost every order that came out. Couldn‚Äôt resist! Posting some of my favorite shots below. Highly recommend this spot!! French toast is to die for!!!

Such a charming venue with amazing menu. The location is right down the street from the building featured in the Friends series.

We arrived at just after 2p and the place was still packed. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and got us a seat out in the open air patio. We ordered everything from their dessert menu and honest to goodness, enjoyed every single bite tremendously.

Highly recommend the Creme Brule.

Definitely a must try when you're down in that area.

I had huge expectations for this place and I felt it didn‚Äôt quite hit the mark.

Croque madame was a little pricey for the small portion size. Nothing too outstanding for me.

Cafe Miel was surprisingly good though. This was my first time ordering it.

Waiter felt a little aggressive, but the overall ambience of the cafe is lovely, definitely reminds me of the Parisian vibe.

Went in for breakfast and it was fantastic. Named after the Linden trees that line New York‚Äôs streets, this modern American restaurant is ‚Äònice‚Äô.. not cheap but worth it given quality of ingredients

Got the three egg omelet but scrambled. Came with goat cheese, caramelized onion, parsley.. and it was AMAZING. The best part? The house made slightly spicy lamb andouille sausage. WOW.

Fresh squeezed orange juice was tasty. But tiny!

A Hidden Gem with Burgers Worth Writing Home About

Tucked away in the heart of the city, Linden‚Äôs American Restaurant isn‚Äôt just another spot trying to slap ‚Äúgourmet‚Äù on its menu ‚Äî it means it. From the moment you walk in, there‚Äôs a cozy yet confident vibe that makes you feel like you‚Äôve discovered something special. But let‚Äôs cut to the chase: the food is where Linden‚Äôs really shows off.

First up: the burger. This isn‚Äôt your average patty-on-a-bun situation. We‚Äôre talking perfectly seared, juicy beef that‚Äôs seasoned like someone in the kitchen really cares. The bun is soft but holds its own, and every topping ‚Äî from the melty cheese to the tangy house-made sauce ‚Äî adds something real to the bite. It‚Äôs the kind of burger that demands your full attention. And yes, you will find yourself thinking about it later.

Now, let‚Äôs talk fries. These golden beauties come out hot, crisp, and salted just right ‚Äî none of that soggy, over-seasoned nonsense. They‚Äôre the kind of fries that dare you not to finish the whole plate before your main even hits the table.

And then there‚Äôs the steak ‚Äî tender, flavorful, and cooked to that perfect balance where it practically melts in your mouth. It‚Äôs clear Linden‚Äôs isn‚Äôt cutting corners; everything from the quality of the cut to the way it‚Äôs plated shows care and craft.

Whether you‚Äôre looking for a casual dinner or showing a friend your new favorite spot, Linden‚Äôs hits that sweet spot between comfort and class. Go for the burger, stay for the steak, and don‚Äôt even try to skip the fries ‚Äî trust me.

A pretty good experience, I would say borderline 5 stars to me given the price. The fig punch cocktail was amazing all the way from the way it was served to the flavours. Orange marmalade sangria was not as much to my taste unfortunately and the flavour was not as rich as I expected. The cheeseburger was very solid. It was perfectly balanced and they added some spicy elements to it too - definitely a very good one. The French fries were good although a bit salty to me. The truffle aioli was great. The portion size was super large! Overall the food was good but it had pretty straightforward taste. So definitely this place serves good basic food but I personally did not find anything special. The staff members were really welcoming and polite.

Decent restaurant in the neighborhood for some New American cuisine. Thought the oyster mushrooms were good, and the spicy sausage pizza and branzino to be above average and interesting dishes. Drinks here were unique and tasty.

As heads up, the online dinner menu is showing outdated prices. ie. the oyster mushroom was 14$ online and 20$ at the restaurant.

Aside of that, we had a great dinner, really enjoyed the house rolls, striped bass and warm plate of cookies. Jasmine was a fun and friendly server, went above and beyond, didn't rush us and was kind enough to provide two cups for the floral fig cocktail/give us good recommendations for dessert.

I also recommend the cauliflower plate if vegetarian, it was crafted well, fun crispy textures from the quinoa and good use of herbs and spices for flavor. It was a memorable restaurant and would love to come visit again.

A specialty store for food from Spain. Extremely authentic with many hard to find items. The meat and cheese selection was very good, with samples available. If you have a chance, stop in the cafe and sample a chorizo sandwich and sangria. Most items are also available on their website.

This tapas place is absolutely amazing! What can I say? Just great!! The staff is friendly, the food is delicious, and the prices are reasonable! It‚Äôs not a full-sized restaurant, but it‚Äôs perfect for catching up with friends.

This is a gem!  The music selection " rock en espa√±ol" was great. But you want to hear about the food...yea the food is delicious...and the staff gave some recommendations and they were right on...cannot go wrong.

Fantastic food just like Spain!  And drinks are also authentic including delicious vermouth on the rocks and tinto de verano.   Only problem is that there are steps to enter, but staff helped carry wheelchair inside.
Every single course was delightful. But the shrimp ensaladilla was to die for. The paella was chefs kiss. From the decor to the service. This place is magical.

This is a cute French cafe in FiDi. I went on a Saturday afternoon, and while it was busy, the wait for a table for two was short (I would recommend joining the waitlist ahead tho). The staff was friendly, and the service was fast. The Croque Madame and French toast were well-made and tasted great. I‚Äôd highly recommend this place to anyone looking for brunch or a quick bite.

Absolutely love this place. The french toast is something to brag about. Fluffy with some sort of cream filling. Delicious. Just wish they had cream to serve it with. Had eggs also but they could either only boil them if fry them. No scrambled, unfortunately. Will be back for the French toast though, for sure. Good price point also, very affordable.

Wonderful French bistro, with actual French staff (though without the French attitude - they were super nice)!  I had a Pat√® En Croute, which was a special of the day.  It was very tasty, though a bit of a small portion. The others in my group had French Toast and a Goat Cheese salad, which were reported to be excellent.

Came here at open on a Sunday morning. Sat at the bar stool next to the kitchen. Great service and food. As a former restaurant employee was awesome to watch the lone cook crank out all the food for a full house of brunch enthusiasts. They managed to misplace my order and offered me complimentary French toast and a mimosa. Great service recovery.

Lovely french atmosphere but upbeat and not stuffy. No more scaffolding on the outside as of Nov 3, 2024 ( there is on the google maps pic). So sitting outside would be nice on a warm day as well.

Food was delicious and service attentive but not overbearing. Don't hesitate to go, but get there early on the weekend!

Amazing French cafe ! Great French food along with wonderful coffee. I had the French toast with a latte. Great combination! Food was delicious and didn‚Äôt hold back on blueberries! Service was great, def recommend this cafe for a nice time !

My partner and I had our engagement party at The Little Pig, and it was incredible. The staff were amazing, the food and drinks were outstanding, and the cozy backyard created the perfect atmosphere.

Nick and Chad went above and beyond to make everything seamless. Our guests are still talking about how great it was. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough‚Äîwe‚Äôll definitely be back for casual drinks or any future events!

Really my favorite bar in the neighborhood, the people who work there and friendly and fantastic, and the vibe is genuinely wonderful. Made a reservation, Joseph the bartender was absolutely lovely and gracious, and the drinks were fantastic! Please support this local spot :)

My food stars are for the cocktails as the kitchen was closed. I went to this place 2 days in the row and the staff is awesome. Shoutout to Chad for the restaurant recommendations as their kitchen was closed.

I‚Äôve walked place this particular establishment quite a few times and finally made the time to stop in after work. Upon walking in the bartender instantly greeted me with a warm welcome as if we were olde friends. I was presented with a glass bottle of water accompanied by 3 menus. The bartender was great with figuring out what drink I could have that was less in sugar. Yes, I was that person lol. The drink she made was great, however the bar menu had a Gin drink with lemon that I hiiighly recommend if you‚Äôre a gin lover.
I ordered the buffalo blue chicken sandwich. It was okay. Felt like it was frozen with the breading prior.

Overall, I recommend stopping by for the atmosphere, great drinks, and wonderful service.

A cute little bar with good drinks and really huge portions of truffle fries. The ambiance is fun and quirky. But somehow the acoustics of the place amplified the crowd noise so much that it was impossible to hear my friend sitting next to me.

Jasmine continues to live up to her title as the Legend! The moment you come in, she is quick to help, then prepares the best food you will ever eat and brings it over to you with the biggest smile and sweetest energy. It is always a pleasure to stop in for such a refreshing and delicious meal. The bathroom and tables are kept clean, and the environment is just so full of life and warmth (Nadia did a beautiful job decorating for the holiday season). Every time I come to the city, I make sure to stop by here! The limited time snow crab is the best!!! I wish they always had it!

Hand Down one of the best experiences I‚Äôve ever had in the city!  The soups are incredible!!!  the lobster and crab rolls are so fresh! I will seek out all their locations.  The Jason‚Äôs squared were amazing from the time we entered!  It was my daughter‚Äôs bday and they made it so memorable!  She loooved everything!  So looking forward to return! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Gluten free lobster rolls.  Sign us up! We had the flight.  If I went back I would go traditional.  The flight comes with chips and drink.  We also ordered the salad.  The place is small.  The staff were very helpful and nice. I would come again.

Cute place with cute christmas decorations during my visit (in December). About 10-20 seatings available.

First time having a lobster roll and it tasted just as expected. Some bread filled with lobster. I don't think it's this place making an unimpressive version, I rather believe that lobster rolls are generally overrated.
The poppy seed coleslaw was too acidic & mustardy for my preference.

Rolls were ok, packed with meat but somewhat lacking in flavour. Atmosphere was poor with out of order drinks machine and ongoing maintenance. Could have forgiven this but the miserable way we were served left a ‚Äúbad taste‚Äù in our mouth. Gruff and disinterested means after spending $40+ on a couple of sandwiches we won‚Äôt be back. Shame as having read the reviews we had expected more. Ah well.

Hey Jason, just saw your reply to my review. To be honest the maintenance was less of an issue‚Ä¶. As I said in my original review above, this would have been forgiven if it wasn‚Äôt for the appallingly rude service we received from the lady serving behind the counter, (we only ordered food, no questions or other requests but the server tutted, sighed and looked totally annoyed that we had ordered anything - unfortunately I didn‚Äôt get their name). As some of the other reviews have stated, this person has an attitude problem and does nothing to enhance the experience of your establishment. Would suggest focus on managing this issue otherwise others will experience the same). Up to you however seems in the two months since I visited other customers have experienced the same.
All the best.

This is the best Mexican food I‚Äôve had in Brooklyn so far. They absolutely deserve that Michelin star ‚≠êÔ∏è
The service is excellent, and the food is absolutely delicious. The ambiance is nice too, though it can get a bit noisy indoors‚Äîsomething to keep in mind if you‚Äôre looking for a quiet dinner. I totally recommend it!

After having the chocolate cake for dessert‚Ä¶ I immediately ordered another one. No exaggeration it was that good. The ice cream on it, the mousse. Insane!! The swordfish and lamb tacos were delicious! The meat was seasoned so well. Also got the tuna tostada and the mushroom tlayuda. Loved everything. Drinks were great too.

Joined for brunch for the first time and food is amazing. Extremely flavorful tacos. We got the charred beet ones and lamb ones, both sooo good and the lamb ones were fire. The potato dish was good but nothing special either. Will definitely come back and try dinner as well.

It's a Michelin Star restaurant for a reason. Its elevated Mexican food without being pretentious. The food is top notch,  the service is top notch, and I love the ambiance. The Soy Marinated Tuna Tostada was just so good ü§§. My second favorite was the Lamb Tacos. The smoked mango for starters was just as good. The Michelada was fireeeee.

Not the biggest fan of the shrimp tacos and the milk cake tho.

Still coming back tho!

Me and my family visited Oxomoco for the first time last night and absolutely loved it. We took a chance and came without a reservation, and they were luckily able to seat us really quickly. The guacamole with smoked tomatoes was insanely good and they have a great selection of drinks (the frozen Ixmand was delicious). I got the lamb barbacoa tacos and my parents got the swordfish. Both were phenomenal. The portions were slightly small but very satiating. Our waitress was really amazing and super knowledgeable about all of the menu items. The interior is beautiful and the ambiance on the patio is perfect. Overall, the quality of the food, the service, and the setting is totally worth it.

This vintage-style bagel totally stole my heart. The decor is elegant and nostalgic, like stepping into a beautifully preserved moment from the past. It‚Äôs clean, cozy, and filled with this lovely old-school charm. The staff were super friendly and made me feel really welcome. The selection of pastries isn‚Äôt huge, but that actually makes it feel even more special‚Äîlike a thoughtful tribute to classic, timeless flavors.
It‚Äôs such a cute spot. Totally worth checking out if you‚Äôre nearby!

Super fantastic. The lox was amazingggggg. The fish was actually perfect. The bagel was pretty good (9/10), and likewise the cream cheese, but the star is the fish. I had the pastrami salmon. Totally fantastic.

Lovely shop that feels rooted in tradition / history. It‚Äôs a bit chaotic inside but that adds to the flare. Great selection of fish, bagels, sweets, dried fruits, drinks and more.

You can ask for fish samples

My regret is not trying a more interesting bagel flavor - like pumpernickel

Is this the best bagel you will ever had ? Now that I had it once, am I willing to  pay top dollars for this bagel next time I am in NY?

This location is literally next door to Katz, also be prepared for crowd and also to spend  top dollars $22 per bagel.

IMHO, the bagel ( lox / salmon with capers tomatoes and onion) is good but nothing exclusive that you cannot find easily.

I had a great experience with the server, overall a pleasant experience but nothing memorable and I can find a similar experience very easily for less than half the price without having to travel 3.5 / 4 hrs to get here.

One of the best Bagels ever, fresh, delicate and delicious!
Pretty busy but very well serviced.
Highly recommended!
No room for dine in!
A couple of benches outside. So perhaps, take away can be the better option!

This is the famous Russ and Daughters location on Houston St.
