Be prepared to pay top dollar in this Jewish Deli.
I got 1/2 pound of both Sable and Sturgeon; $70 bucks.
In addition, also got the Salmon Roe at I believe 18$ for 5 oz..

Everything tastes great, but would I pay this level of price on a regular basis, probably not, its a try 1 time and move on kind of place.

I will say I grew up in Brooklyn working at a deli in my youth, and used to make bagels at the deli I worked in so have some experience; and based on this experience, I felt the bagels at Russ and Daughters is quite average.

My opinion is that bagels are better elsewhere, but the cured fish I got was tops.

Best soup dumplings I've ever had. This place is better than all of the restaurants I've gone to anywhere and I've eaten a lot of soup dumplings. They are a lot bigger here and have a lot more soup. Incredibly flavorful. The scallion and peanut noodles were delicious too. Steven was an amazing server. Very friendly place. Can't wait to be back and try more things on the menu too

Food: 4.5/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 4/5
Value: 3.5/5

A solid spot for soup dumplings in the Upper Brooklyn area!

Soup Dumplings 4/5:
Flavorful and on the sweeter side with a meaty filling. The only downside was the delicate skin tore a bit too easily.

Pan-Fried Buns 4.5/5:
These were my favorite! The texture was chewy, smooth, and slightly thin--almost like they used tapioca flour.

Mushroom Buns 3.75/5:
Unique and cute. While they weren't super juicy, the mushroom filling was tasty

Shanghai Beef Fried Noodles 3.5/5:
Not bad at all, the beef was tender, but it leaned heavy on noodles with not enough meat and veggies in the mix.

Incredible soup dumplings!! Really enjoyed our dinner here after a quick decision in the area for a late meal.

Quick and friendly service. There is also a booth in the restaurant where you can see them rolling out and making the dumplings - nice touch to walk by.

Definitely get at least one order of soup dumplings (we went with pork but there were a few different options) and the saut√©ed green beans were top notch.

If you‚Äôre in the area, definitely worth the stop in for lunch or dinner.

Absolutely the best Chinese restaurant around this neighborhood. Everything was so delicious and flavorful. We only had the pork soup dumplings, the string beans and the rice noodle soup with beef. None of the dishes disappointed us. We will definitely be coming back here to try other dishes.

A true hidden gem.

Steven provided amazing service at the restaurant. Authentic Chinese food, great price, great location, very friendly-feels like home! Anybody should come in for a delightful meal with Xiaolongbao and Noodles, fast service and quality food! Definitely my favorite spot to go to in the neighborhood. üíØüíØüíØ

Very good food, cute atmosphere.
I am taking off a point to make aware of a dinner combo that makes no sense. $30 for Trappizini and 1/2 Pasta. The combo does not make it clear that it is a 1/2 Pasta. Ordering a Trappizini and full pasta would also be about $30 or less in some cases and you would get more food. Very bizarre decision by management.

Our server was very lovely and comped our bill partially to make up for the confusion. So if you come here, don't order the combo, just order the items separately.

I got the Pesto pasta and Oxtail Trappizini along with broccolini to start (very good).

Ended up here while waiting for a table at Russ & Daughters nearby. We stopped in for some coffee and small bites while we waited. Oh man, I wish we were hungry enough to go back afterwards. This place was one of the best food experiences we had while in NYC. Coffee was outstanding, desserts were fantastic (particularly the olive oil cake), fingerling potatoes were perfect, and the Cacciatora Trapazzini was out of this world (my picture doesn't do it justice; it's a small handheld sandwich). If I ever returned to NYC I would go here in a heartbeat and wished I had more time to go back on my trip.

I stopped by while out enjoying my Saturday and luckily grabbed a spot outside (it‚Äôs usually pretty busy!). The trapizzino, a triangular Roman-style pizza pocket stuffed with classic Italian fillings, was unreal. Proper comfort food. I‚Äôd give it a solid 4 stars.

It‚Äôs a great spot for a quick spritz or to cozy up with a few small dishes and soak in the vibe. As night falls, it really gives those Italian caf√© feels. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre nearby!

My girlfriend and I were waiting on a reservation at Russ & Daughters so we sort of stumbled across this place. We tried the ricotta toast with pistachio and honey, and the espresso.

Everything was great, and the location was a nice little spot near Beastie Boys Square (before the scaffolding went up).
Great option for a quick spritz stop or just to cozy up with some dishes to whet the palatte and enjoy the atmosphere. Gives italian cafe vibes especially as night falls.

Carmine‚Äôs in Times Square is a fantastic place for anyone who loves classic Italian-American food served family-style. The portions are huge‚Äîperfect for sharing‚Äîand the atmosphere is warm, loud, and full of energy, just like a big family dinner. We ordered the chicken parmigiana and spaghetti with meatballs, and both were delicious, rich in flavor, and clearly made with care. It gets busy, so making a reservation is a smart idea, especially if you‚Äôre with a group. Service was friendly and fast despite the crowd. A great spot for a hearty meal in the heart of NYC.

Came here for my daughter‚Äôs 26th birthday while visiting NYC. Our server Linda was great. She gave suggestions from cocktails to food. The stuffed mushrooms were so delicious. The Sauage and peppers used to stuff the mushrooms took the flavor to another level. The shrimp with angel hair pasta white wine & garlic was mouth watering. Chicken Scaloppine w/ Lemon & Butter was the best I‚Äôve had. We will definitely be back when we return to NYC. 10/10

Had a nice time at this New York institution. The food is pretty good and the portions are enormous. In hindsight would have been better to go in a bigger group to get more value from the meal.

The service is excellent and the restaurant decor captures that old school Italian American vibe.

A Family Feast at Carmine‚Äôs Times Square ‚Äì NYC Perfection!

Carmine‚Äôs in Times Square was an absolute standout during our family‚Äôs spring break trip to NYC, and we‚Äôre still talking about it! This place is a masterclass in hearty, delicious Italian-American dining. We shared the seasonal Misti Salad with Fruit, which was fresh and bursting with flavor, the Shrimp Parmigiana that had us all swooning, and a massive plate of spaghetti with marinara sauce and meatballs that stole the show. Those meatballs? Amazing doesn‚Äôt even cover it‚Äîtasted incredible, perfectly cooked, moist, and so flavorful they‚Äôre hands-down the best meatballs I‚Äôve ever had. The portions? Enormous! Between the four of us, we could barely make it through half, and we were stuffed to the brim with every bite being worth it.
The meal kicked off with some of the best bread we‚Äôve ever had‚Äîwarm, crusty, and downright addictive. The staff was super friendly, making us feel right at home with their warm smiles and top-notch service. A word to the wise: make reservations! We heard they were turning away walk-ins that night, directing folks to their sister restaurant because they were only seating reserved parties. Lucky for us, we‚Äôd booked ahead and snagged a spot in the lively, welcoming atmosphere. Carmine‚Äôs is an absolute must for anyone visiting NYC. We can‚Äôt wait to come back!

This is a busy location of course. We were greeted properly and taken straight to our table. We were with a large group, and it was super busy. All dishes are family style which is great for parties. They were able to accommodate our party of 27ppl. Reservations were made of course. For starters caesar salad which was great and fresh. It had a nice pepper kick to it and the lettuce was chilled. Calamari was next, lightly breaded and they were so delicious .  For mains we went with chicken parm, bolognese, penne a la vodka, and three cheese ravioli. All were good the bolognese was a bit bland. Nonetheless it was a good experience, our waitress was very efficient. Thank you for a great experience.

We came on a Friday night and the restaurant was at capacity. Highly recommend getting a reservation in advance. The food was great! The bread was sooo warm and yummy! I also really liked the beef pie and the cod. The vibe of this place was also nice and it had good acoustics. It‚Äôs perfect for a date night or a group.

The good: Excellent hospitality. The hamachi and seafood bouillabaisse udon (weekend only dish) were highlights of the evening. Cocktails were unique and well made.

The not so good: The potato mille feuille was well executed but bland. The beef pie, a total overhype. While the beef was tender, the curry was too watery and too sweet. It was also not accompanied by rice, a small bowl came at an extra cost ($5) honestly‚Ä¶kind of wild. The flan dessert was terrible.

I‚Äôm not sure how this place has 4.7 stars. I came here a while ago back in November. The crispy chicken dish was crispy but very bland. And the whole time I was eating the duck dish, I was like why did I get this. The sweet sauce/jam completely overpowered the already lacking flavours of the duck. The sticky toffee pudding was also a let down. It was so dry, the cake has to be soaked in that toffee. The crispy potatoes with caviar was okay but again the potatoes tasted quite bland. It was the worst birthday dinner I‚Äôve had so far in nyc. This place is overpriced for average food But at least the service was very good

Some of the best pancakes I‚Äôve ever had for brunch, it was dense but crunchy at the same time.

Fried chicken sandwich was good but a bit too sour for me and the crispy rice was good too. Hokkaido milk bread was lukewarm at best and could‚Äôve been more golden
Excellent food. Great service! The lingo beef pie is unique and delicious. The pancakes are perfection. The sticky toffee pudding is unlike anything else; the lime ice cream makes it one of a kind.

Cute atmosphere and live music, superb service. The food was beautifully cooked but the portions could have been better for the price. I got the lamb and beef pilaf and it was only a couple of chunks of meat sitting on top. The umeks were good but they were smaller than I am used to from other places. The tea selection was phenomenal and although pricey, one pot is easily enough for 4 people.

It was a wonderful experience. On this cold evening, being able to enjoy such delicious barbecue really helped me forget the tension brought by the cold. This is a place well worth visiting again. It's suitable for gatherings and family outings. By the way, there's a band performance every night from 7 to 10 p.m.

Loved everything about this place. They have an extensive, detailed menu), but we still asked the waiter for his recommendations. We got basically everything he suggested and it did not disappoint.

There was also some live music but not too loud that you had to raise your voice. A very warm and cozy environment. I felt like I was in someone‚Äôs dining room slowly eating a home cooked meal.

Really enjoyed my experience at Farida and will definitely go back!

I had a wonderful experience overall‚Äîthe ambiance was refined, the service attentive, and the food truly enjoyable. One small note: I ordered a gin Martini, but neither the bartender, the front-of-house captain, nor the waitress seemed familiar with it. Since it wasn‚Äôt listed on the menu, I switched to an Old Fashioned, which was crafted very well. That aside, everything else was excellent.

Iv been to this restaurant many times before (including their previous location in midtown) and it was always amazing! Both good and service.

This time we got 3course lunch special and sizes of servings are huge even though it‚Äôs lunch special

The place is lovely, love the high ceilings and the vibe. The food was pretty good. I‚Äôd highly recommend the lamb‚Äôs neck even though I‚Äôm typically not a fan of lamb. The portion is huge and meant to be shared with a decent sized party. The hummus was delicious and so was all their breads.

Great spot for dinner with a group or a fun date. We came for an early dinner at 6:30 to a weirdly empty restaurant, but it filled in and the vibe got busy and fun around 8PM. The service was nice, food was delicious, and I loved the vibe inside once the restaurant was full.

Standouts for me were the pita bread, octopus, and lamb. All cooked to perfection, fresh, and flavorful! The table side hummus confused me‚Äî it was delicious but why is this man coming to my table to assemble already-made hummus? I might be the only one that felt silly watching it but it certainly tasted goodüòÇ We ended with the kiss dessert, which was delicious and creative! I‚Äôd come back again.
Gorgeous interior, high quality service and the food is both beautiful and delicious. Every item is delicious, the leftovers are to die for. The seating is spacious yet cozy at the same time. 1000/10

Wow! What a fantastic dining experience we had last night at Mesiba at the Moxie Hotel in Williamsburg. Mesiba means party in Hebrew and they really know how to throw one! The decor is gorgeous, service was good but the food is divine! LOVED the msabbaha cart which delivers hummus to your table which is silky smooth and full of flavor accompanied with fresh, warm thick pita bread that you could literally make a meal of. We also sampled the latke special and grilled charred octopus for our appetizers. Our cocktails were made perfectly and for our mains, we had the butterflied Bronzino and Musakhan Chicken, which was served over flat bread with spinach, onions and sumac rub. I could dip all night!!!!! I would have rated the service excellent but we were in a back room which the waiters didn‚Äôt walk into that often. We had to remind the waiter to send the cart over.

Overall rating: 4.8

Unfortunately I don‚Äôt have any more pictures but the food was delicious! Admittedly I didn‚Äôt know this was the bottom of an apartment complex, so it actually wasn‚Äôt that crowded. But don‚Äôt let that deter you. The staff is so friendly and so helpful! I would totally come back again if I‚Äôm in the area. I read the low reviews and I didn‚Äôt experience any of it. But I just went with a date and didn‚Äôt have any expectations. I enjoyed the food and staff. I went April 2024.

Loved the ambience of the restaurant‚Äîbeautiful space and stunning plating, but unfortunately the food didn‚Äôt quite live up to the aesthetics.

We started with the house-made focaccia with olives, which was a solid start. The crispy potatoes and meatballs were tasty, but nothing that had me craving more. The mushroom risotto was a bit underdone, with some grains noticeably firmer than others.

The highlight was definitely the ragu‚Äîrich, flavorful, and comforting. While I enjoyed that dish, the overall experience felt hit or miss. Not sure I‚Äôd come back to explore more of the menu, but glad I gave it a try.

I have friends that really like this restaurant so we checked it out.

Overall the food was just okay especially for the price. It seemed formulaic without a lot of delight  The best dishes were the crudo and the tiramisu.. Crudo was beautifully presented with nice bright, contrasting flavors! The tiramisu was perfect. Not too sweet, very well done.

The carrot salad looked great but did not come together well. The raw carrots were pretty but not nice to chew. The ostensibly cooked carrots were also pretty undercooked so the whole thing just didn't work for me.

The lasagna looked fantastic but it seem to be lacking in cheese on the inside and not a lot of sauce so it was kind of dry. There was plenty of cheese on top but it didn't carry the dish .

The cauliflower dish was fine but nothing interesting about it.

The fried artichokes were also just fine.

It's not that it's a bad restaurant at all. Service was great. There was a Latina waitress who lit up the room!

It's just that there is a bunch of other Italian restaurants in New York City that are the same price point that just nail every dish.

I had a great experience at this location. I had dinner with friends, waitress was so kind and friendly.
I had a cosmopolita which was great! Also had change to try lasagna, artichokes as appetizer and I can say everything was delicious.

Had a chance to drop in to Carlotto - I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. We were lucky to get a table but the hostess was incredibly accommodating in getting us in!

The appetizer was spot on - I had the Meatball special and warm olives - the focaccia bread was delightful. Order a Negroni - the classic was delicious and hit the spot before my Ravioli came. I have to say the beef short ribs was the star of the show - so soft and fall off the bone ... mixed with some parmesan fries and broccolini.

Finally no Italian dinner is complete without a Tiramisu dessert. Decently priced for the quality and service - we left promising to return!

Excellent food, excellent service! We had a large party of 7 and the waiter we had took the best care of us. Every dish we ordered was incredible. The most unexpected delicious dish was the cantabrian anchovies & butter, give it a try even if you aren‚Äôt an anchovy fan!

Tough one here for me, going to have to come back for sure. The tldr - everything is great.

Vibe and service is top notch, grab a reservation and get there early to check out the whole restaurant. The cocktails are spectacular as well.

Food. So the food is really really good. I think that the kabob wasn‚Äôt as tender and hot as I expected, maybe it was busy so the plate sat for a bit, I understand. However at these price points I expect it to be close to perfect, especially in this area.

The yogurt + bread combo was out of this world. I liked the saffron chicken, but maybe needed a little more salt or spice to cut through the sweetness of the other ingredients.

Overall very happy and will be back as mentioned.

I loved the atmosphere and really enjoyed the experience. Very conversation friendly.
Everything we tried was good, but the lamb ribs were my favorite, very flavorful and tender.
The ice cream sandwich was good but the rose water flavor was a bit too strong for my taste.
I tried the Sekanjabin cocktail, it was refreshing but lacked a distinct flavor.
I preferred the Havig cocktail, which had a more unique taste.
Also loved the calligraphy on their menu, and the writings on the placements.
I will go back to try other items on the menu as well.

Enjoyed staying in here. Very good foods, kind services, vibe was awesome. From entering the restaurant to leave their doors, enjoyed the every single moment. One of my friend cannot eat lamb but their lamb steak was so good that she asked for more. The vibe and wait staff were very kind and made us happy with all his smiles.

Went to Eyval with a couple of Persian friends who swore by the place‚Äîand they were absolutely right. The food was great ‚Äîflavorful, fresh, and clearly made with a lot of care. We shared a bunch of dishes, and honestly, everything that hit the table was a win. The kebabs were juicy and the small plates had so much flavor packed into them.

The vibe was really cool too‚Äîlively without being too loud, stylish but not overdone. It felt like a great mix of traditional and modern. Definitely a spot I‚Äôll be coming back to, and if you‚Äôve got Persian friends who are picky about food (like mine), this is the place to take them.

Though not the most convenient location for a midtown manhattanite, the unique flavors of this Persian restaurant make this place worth a visit. We ate primarily vegetarian but did have the short rib which was delicious. Breads and feta dip are a must. Very creative desserts.

Tucked away in a cozy little space, this Japanese eatery feels like a hidden gem. Every dish is crafted with such care ‚Äî not only delicious but also a feast for the eyes, each plate like a small work of art. The warm smiles and thoughtful service make the experience even more memorable. A place that lingers in the heart ‚Äî I‚Äôll surely find my way back again.

Authenticity and exceptional flavors. No notes. Just plan ahead to book reservations especially on weekends as they only have 12 seats (4 at counter and two tables up to 4), absolutely worth the trip. Had been for ramen a few times and finally got to taste their breakfast.

I stopped by this place because I wanted to start my morning with a Japanese home-cooked meal during my trip. All of the food was beautiful and seemed to have been prepared with thought and care. I highly recommend it.

This was my third time here, and everything was still amazing. I was also told if I would like to get all of their amazing flavors and stay gluten-free, to call them at least a day in advance, and they would prepare all of my meal ahead of time 100% gluten-free with all of the normal seasonings.

I love these little gems, and this is one of my most favorite of all!

Timing really is everything. I wasn‚Äôt aware how important it is to secure a reservation due to their limited seating. Having walked by several times over the years but never had the chance to check them out. This past weekend I decided to dine in and try their Japanese Breakfast. The host/server was very gracious and allowed me a seat without a reservation. He explained the menu options very thoroughly. Everyone was warm and welcoming. Now onto the food‚Ä¶ It was delicious! The flavors, the aroma, the textures‚Ä¶ everything came together in this beautiful synergy. Even the tea was superb. The fish (I believe I had the mackerel) was cooked to perfection. The Onsen egg with rice was incredible. I feel very fortunate to have been given this dining experience. Thank you to the staff who did an exceptional job. I am so excited to try out their ramen one of these evenings.

We absolutely had a great experience at Kahlo! It‚Äôs aesthetically pleasing. The food was absolutely incredible - each dish was bursting with sensational flavour. We had tacos, guacamole, branzino, drinks etc Everything was scrumptious! Our server, Kira, was outstanding; her recommendations were spot on, and her attentive service made us feel truly valued. If you‚Äôre looking for delicious food and exceptional service, then you must visit Kahlo!

I recently dined at Kahlo Restaurant with friends, and we were blown away by the exceptional service and delicious food and drinks. The ambiance was cozy and intimate, with dim lighting and comfortable seating.

Our server, was attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. They helped us navigate the menu and made excellent recommendations.

The food was outstanding, with each dish presented beautifully and bursting with flavor. The Arrachera steak was a highlight, with tender meat and a rich, savory sauce.

Overall, I highly recommend Kahlo Restaurant for a special occasion or a night out with friends. Can't wait to return!

Modern Mexican restaurant with warm, romantic interior. Great place for a date. With Latin music in the background, you can fully enjoy delicious food and drinks. Ceviche was beyond delicious. Drinks are good too, bit pricy. Staff is very helpful, professional, and friendly. Will definitely be back.

Great staff and amazing food!
I loved thier cocktails and tacos!. Would also recommend grilled octopus, really flavorful.
There are 3 different types of guac and while the quantity is lesser than expected, the chips are amazingly fresh and flavorful
Wonderful, clean, fresh and beautifully decorated. The food was fresh, hot and flavor through the roof. Good service, clean restaurant but go there for the food that‚Äôs the gem of it.

Just had my first Bread and Spread sandwich and I gotta tell you, it was awesome! This was a late lunch for us and we knew we needed to save our appetite for dinner so we decided to split sandwiches. Though it was a big sandwich I was left wanting more than just a half. Between our party of 6 we ordered a dumbo cheesesteak and two short rib beef sandwiches. I am for sure coming back here to get a full sandwich. So tasty.

Very good, hole in the wall, place to get a sandwich.  It doesn‚Äôt look like much and you would most probably just pass it by if you didn‚Äôt know better.
They don‚Äôt have much on the menu- maybe half a dozen sandwiches. But the chicken caprese and the rib sandwiches were very good.  Each sandwich is around $15.
Stop in for a sandwich.

Perfect combination, ciabatta was light and crispy, not typical heavy loaded with cheese sandwich. The Porchetta sandwich blew my mind. The breakfast sandwich used to be a good deal for me if I could add pork sausage, but they only have the vegan one now.
The breakfast sandwiches were amazing, especially the bread- super soft! But at 10 AM they only take cash, which was a bummer. And it's a breakfast-only menu before lunch.

Small hidden place with great sandwiches.

They have build your own breakfast sandwich, I got it with cheddar cheese and vegan sausage. And it was very filling and delicious.

My party got turkey sandwich, which was great too. The staff was also accompanied with allergies too.

Great place overall, recommend for a quick breakfast or lunch.

The view was absolutely breathtaking. Outdoor dining was undeniably the highlight of my experience. While the food was good, the slow cocktail service was a minor inconvenience. Watching the sunset during dinner was truly amazing. I highly recommend this for anyone who wants to savor a beautiful sunset or capture stunning photos. Honestly, the view was so captivating, I barely remember the taste of the food.

We had Easter brunch here; service was extremely slow and the restaurant not very crowded.  The manager was very nice, apologized and gave a complimentary glass of wine.  The drinks we had before our meal were excellent.  I asked for some sort of bread; none available?  I had been here 2 years ago for Easter brunch; it was superb.  For the price/service; this was average at best.  The view was stunning.  We won‚Äôt be back; we are locals here.

My boyfriend and I decided to go to The Fulton for our anniversary. Out of all the spots we hit in our 4 day trip, The Fulton was one of our favorites. Our service was intentional and thoughtful. The food was impeccable and blew us out the water. The view of the Brooklyn Bridge and overall atmosphere was irreplaceable. We were provided with a free appetizer and a free dessert because it was our anniversary. This made our trip!!! We have never had a treat like this from any restaurants EVER! 10/10 recommend for an upscale restaurant with great food, service, and view!

I came here with my husband and we had a great time having a delicious lunch, cocktails. Carly was our server and she was above and beyond. I will be back to enjoy this place again! Nice views and great food ü•ò

We went on one of the first nice days on spring. We were seated right away and greeted by our waiter Hemingway. He was very attentive and knowledgable about the menu. It was a perfect anniversary date. Food was fresh and tasty.

Tony does it Best ! All the freshest ingredients and the best fish and seafood in Brooklyn try the homemade wine too take a walk after dinner on Brooklyn promenade you will thank me great way to walk offf dinner

Excellent dinner place in Brooklyn!  We shared salmon, pasta, and chicken Milanese and these were all delicious.  The panna cotta was a great way to end the meal.  Cute atmosphere and we were lucky to get a table near the window.  No reservations, cash only but reasonable for 4 of us.

Hearty Italian with extremely friendly and accommodating service. All our dishes were excellent in terms of taste (including gluten free pasta which they paid extra attention to if there was gluten in the meatballs - thank you!), and were very generous in time of size. I'd recommend considering splitting a dish! It is cash only and marked clearly as such IMO. We definitely would love to come back as it feels like the family type of Brooklyn vibe we appreciate. A great spot in Brooklyn Heights!

I loved the mushroom pasta, and the ambiance. The garlic bread with spicy sauce was a great treat, at the same time crunchy and fluffy. The swordfish tasted really good, but it was a bit dry. The staff was friendly, but slow, very clearly overwhelmed by the number of customers.

Definitely worth the trip, although not a 5 star. As everyone noted, this is CASH ONLY. Before 10pm, nearest ATM is 5-10 mins, after 10pm it's 10 mins so do bring enough cash for a good tip.

We went without a booking at 9pm for 5 people. Indoors did have an excellent vibe but we were starving so were happy to sit in the outside covered section without waiting 40 mins. Even in December at 9 degrees (European) with the heater at the back it was definitely not even needed for jackets.

Front of house is amazing, so friendly and chatty. As we were outside, getting attention or staff became tricky but everyone was very nice when we did.

Despite it's reputation, we went for the garlic bread with homemade chilli oil, which is 100% a winner & still sad we didn't buy any. Do save some if you get pasta to mop up the juices as it went so well with the lasagne. The cacio e Pepe with asparagus & egg yolk went down very well, and the wine selection isn't outstanding but decent enough.

We skipped dessert but everything looked great. I'd 100% recommend this as a safe, delicious, and fun bet for a group dinner. Would definitely go back.

I love the vibe of this neighborhood spot. The Greek salad was great. Lamb burger was not something I'd order again, but the fries were great. I'd go back to try some other things on the menu. My friend enjoyed her pasta dish.

We stumbled upon this spot after a quaint afternoon visit to Central Park. Note you'll probably need a reservation because all the indoor seating was already full at 5:30pm. The outdoor section was great though, arguably better. Three cheese vide was spectacular and so was this pan seared salmon. Really good portion size and a pretty unique garlic butter mashed potato side too. The lamb shank was also divine, I ended up finishing my friend's portion. A great way to end off Easter Sunday.

Leyla offers a cozy and authentic Turkish dining experience. The warm atmosphere, with soft Turkish music playing in the background, made our visit even more enjoyable. The service was excellent‚Äîour server was very attentive and helpful with all our questions.

We tried the muhammara, Brussels sprout & mandarin salad, hazelnut lahmacun, spinach yarma, kataifi zucchini fritters, s√ºtla√ß, and tahini pide. Everything was delicious! Just a heads-up‚Äîthe lahmacun is made with lamb, as are most of the main dishes. Also, having a nice cup of tea was a treat‚ÄîI really missed that!

While most dishes were delightful, I found the dough of the tahini pide a bit firm and bland; however, the tahini and walnut flavors compensated for it. The s√ºtla√ß, enhanced with raspberries, was light and enjoyable‚ÄîI loved it!

Overall, a lovely spot for a warm and flavorful meal. Definitely worth checking out!

Visited Leyla with my family and had a wonderful time. From the moment we walked in, the staff was attentive and friendly, making us feel welcomed. The prices are reasonable, and their happy hour is the best in the UWS. We enjoyed Shakshuka, Atom, Humus, Fava Bean Bruschetta, and Kataifi Fritters ‚Äì all of which were delicious!
The fresh desserts, including Baklava, maras dondurma (mastic ice cream), and a special treat of profiterol, were a hit. We were impressed with the exceptional service and delicious food. Highly recommend Leyla!!!

What an awesome experience with our son and daughter-in-law.  Restaurant has a beautiful ambiance, wait staff was attentive and superb, and the brunch was excellent.  "The Turk" eggs and Turkish spicy sausage was yum!

A very welcoming ambience. Highly recommended by a local. It was her favorite ramen place in NY and it did not disappoint. Recommend to get a reservation as place really fills up quickly. Servings were generous and dishes were flavorful. Highly recommend the agedashi tofu. Love too how the facade of the building is so simple.

This is an excellent restaurant. We usually go to the one in the East Village, but this one is closer to the theatre district, and we had tickets to a play. We were seated right away. The staff was nicely friendly and answered all of our menu questions in a very helpful way. The desserts, from an in restaurant bakery, are delicious. We were in and out in about an hour, with an appetizer, main course and dessert. Plenty of time to relax and get to the show.

Nice ambiance, good service and food is average.

For appetizers, the Chicken Tatsuta-Age was good‚Äîhuge chunks of chicken, tender inside yet crispy outside, dipping sauce had a spicy kick. Pork Gyoza was okay, lots of onions though.  Spicy Cucumber was way too spicy.  Agedashi Tofu and Otsumami were decent.  For entrees, I did not enjoy the Donburi Katsu Don‚Äîthe deep fried cutlet was drenched in some sweet sauce, making the cutlet soggy and too sweet for my preference‚Äîportion was huge though.  My friend thought her Wagyu Sukiyaki Hot Udon was just average.

Walked in with a friend on a Saturday afternoon and waited only ~5 min before a table was ready for us. We were planning on just splitting one bowl of udon, since we weren't too hungry, but Raku has a one order per person policy, so we ordered an app + udon to share.
The Agedashi Tofu melted in my mouth - it's a soft fried tofu with a ginger soy sauce, topped with bonito flakes. The Yasai Kakiage Hot Udon came with a lovely plate of veggie tempura (carrots, sweet potato, onion, eggplant) + the broth was SO YUM!
Clear and not heavy at all.
Service here is fantastic. This is the only location I've been to where they had a separate dessert bar. If you plan to only have dessert, they give you bar seating at the front of the house. Great experience!

I was excited to try this restaurant and had heard good things about the East Village location but was very underwhelmed. The nice thing about this restaurant is that you can normally get and spot at the counter and maybe the bar if you‚Äôre okay waiting a bit. The communal table has a light and casual vibe. The udon is reasonably priced but the sushi is outrageous and the pressing makes the sushi less tasty somehow. I talked to diners next to us who go weekly and said that the noodles that night were not as good as usual so maybe another night or location would be better. The restaurant did not rush us but the udon gets cold quickly. When they send you the machine to pay, the tip suggestion is calculated on top of the tax so even if you tip 20%, you‚Äôre tipping closer to 25%.

As someone who‚Äôs never been to Saigon, I feel like I was teleported there today. This place is such a vibe, the food is great! Authentic and full of flavors. The snails stuffed with pork had me in an absolute chokehold. The coconut coffee was incredible and the pickled chicken feet omg I could go on and on. Every dish was great, really no misses. And if you come when the weathers nice out they set up little stools and tables outside too. The true Vietnam experience of eating on the street side.

PUT THIS ON YOUR MUST-EAT list in NYC! Every dish slapped so hard and the flavors were so balanced down to the last bite. We pretty much got everything on the menu besides balut. Loved the eggplants with jammy soft boiled egg dip, the crispy shrimp (eat them whole!), chicken with cartilage, both entrees. All the drinks were delicious and so nostalgic of Asian flavors (I'm from Taiwan). The service was half Asian sass, half home-y sweetness. Will definitely come back again!

We came for their pho but apparently it‚Äôs a winter menu only item. In my opinion, this makes absolutely no sense. Pho is not bound to the winter time. We tried their spring special and it was good, but I definitely need a broth dish. The snails and fried shrimp were good. The outdoor seating is unique and reminds me of Hanoi.

Mam blew me away with their Vietnamese small plates! Everything we tried was unique and delicious, lots of great flavor and texture. They don't have alcohol but there are some fun beverages to try. The tamarind pineapple cooler was a little sweet, a little salty, and the coconut Vietnamese ice coffee was basically a coffee milkshake, to die for. The snails were a miss for me but everything else was incredible: the fried roll, surf clam, prawns, eggplant and fried chicken cartilage were awesome! The bun plate was good but next time I would stick with the small plates

Loved the concept of the low stool and authentic Vietnamese street style dining - especially if you eat outdoors because the streets of NY are weirdly similar to the streets I remember in HCM and Hanoi. They change their menu seasonally and their current platter is unique and filling. I enjoyed it but the inclusion of blood sausages and intestines may be too new for some. Cash discount is great and it appears that service is included in the final bill!

I am a Vietnamese tourist, this is my first time in New York and I want to find the cuisine here. Surprisingly, there is a Vietnamese restaurant here and I felt great at this restaurant. The taste is exactly like in Vietnam. I ate a lot of dishes during the few days I was in New York. This is a Vietnamese family restaurant and they made me feel very familiar like in Vietnam. Thank you to the waiters at the restaurant, they are very friendly. I understand why this place is highly rated. Everyone should come and try it once.

Decided to come here on a Wednesday night and both of us were pleased with the pho! I ordered the beef brisket pho, which had an excellent broth, superb noodles, and very well marinated beef. I also appreciated that they had the chili flakes/oil, which gave the broth an additional kick. They were super quick to seat us, despite the fact that it‚Äôs a super small space so it does get packed pretty quickly. Great place for quick, casual Vietnamese meal in the city!

I had the beef pho, and it was tasty. The broth was flavorful, meat was tender, and I absolutely devoured it. (If you‚Äôve never had pho, the beef is rare at first, but it cooks in the soup. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs pink in the photo). The two friends I went with both ordered the chicken pho which they also loved.

I docked one star because the restaurant was sooo busy on the Monday evening when we went. We waited outside for 40 minutes, and I was getting hangry. In my opinion if you just want a plain bowl of beef or chicken pho it might be worth it to go somewhere less busy. As for their more specialized dishes, I would have to go back to try them!
The food it‚Äôs basic. The place is quiet which is nice. Not too many tables but service is fast. The biggest issue is the noisy customers that eat noodles like they are a wet vacuum cleaner.

My favorite pho I've had in New York so far. I got the eye round pho and the broth was light and flavorful, just as a good pho should be. Bonus points for having chili oil available at the table, they also had hoisin sauce and sriacha as well. I also had the spring rolls and they were made fresh and tasty.

The service was also very quick and the staff was friendly.

Loved it! The food was terrific, and the staff was so kind and patient. The decoration is simple, but it makes the place cozy. There is some space between the tables, so it felt like we had intimacy. We ordered the rijsttafel, the small dishes for dinner. All the dishes were good in their own merit, and the composition made it fun to try everything. Only the beef was a bit dry, but the lamb made up for it by being tender and delicious. I would go back and try a la carte as well as repeat the rijsttafel.

Sister wanted to eat here for her birthday. Ordered the rijsttafel as that allowed us to try tapas version of many of the dishes. Also got the lumpia, cumi goreng, udang goreng, and sage udang. Personally, I enjoyed everything. There were maybe two dishes in the rijsttafel that had too much salt but other than that everything was great and tasty.

Was seated right away. And sat outside as the weather was nice. Service was fine as well.  Very friendly as well. Wouldn‚Äôt mind coming back and ordering the bigger versions of some of the rijsttafel.

The most Authentic Indonesian food you can find in New York!
Soto Ayam was spot on.
Rijsttafel was a good value for the money with great selection. Enak Sekali !
I‚Äôm from Jakarta  so I know my food and this restaurant makes me feel like home.
Can‚Äôt wait to go back to try their Ketoprak!

The food was great, yeah very much! Every single dish has its own story to tell, i could definitely feel the mother‚Äôs touch for their own home food. I can‚Äôt believe i found out this place just now after 9 years living in Brooklyn. The owner is definitely not into promoting. It‚Äôs already been here for quite a time but i still want them to stay even longer. I will come back!
First time having Indonesian cousins. We both very much liked it.  Next time we're in the area we're like to try other dishes

This was my first time checking out Sir Henry‚Äôs! It‚Äôs such a cute spot. Great vibes, good music and you cannot go wrong with their $30 bottomless brunch drinks deal! The espresso martini was so good and their brunch flatbread, avo toast and brunch burger were all delish! Shout out to Jessica & Eli for the amazing hospitality! Check them out before a Broadway show or if in the theatre district area!

Unlimited cocktails? Say less. üç∏üí´

Your Broadway girl dinner just got way better‚ÄîSir Henry‚Äôs is serving up $30 unlimited cocktails for 90 minutes when you grab an entr√©e. Good food, amazing drinks, and the best vibes? It‚Äôs a must. üñ§

üìç When to go?
ü•Ç Wed-Sat: 5 PM - 11 PM
üç≥ Sat-Sun: 11 AM - 3 PM

If you're looking for a night out with good vibes, endless drinks, and limitless energy, Sir Henry's is the place to be. Their Broadway Girl Dinner offers 90 minutes of unlimited cocktails and drinks with the purchase of an entree. This place is always buzzing with a lively crowd, great music, and a vibe that makes you want to stay all night. From Espresso Martinis to their signature Broadway Girl cocktail, drinks are flowing without limits. Not only are the drinks top notch, but the food is absolutely delicious. Whether you're craving for tacos, handhelds, or salads, every bite hits the spot. Their friendly and attentive staffs make sure your glass is never empty and your experience is nothing short of amazing. Sir Henry's knows how to turn any outing into a fun, unforgettable experience. Definitely one of those ultimate go-to places that makes you want to keep coming back!

Stop here on a Tuesday while in town. The staff was amazing! Niamh was my waitress and she was the sweetest! Great customer service, always checked on our table in a timely fashion and just overall phenomenal service and lovely attitude. Patrick was great as well, he came by and checked on our table and made sure me and my sister was enjoying everything.
The shrimp tacos and chicken quesadillas were tasty. The guac and Pico that came on the quesadilla plate was tasty and fresh. I also added the 90 minute Bottomless Drinks to my tab and I am so glad I did! Every drink that Niamh made was great! My favorite drink she made me was the Watermelon Margarita.
Overall I would definitely come back here and I recommend this place to anyone visiting NYC

My friends and I stopped by Sir Henry‚Äôs for a little reunion and it was such a joyful time. Our server Jessica was so engaging and gave great food recs. The drinks were delicious, the food was filling and not overpriced ‚Äî best of all, the ambiance is a real vibe. Def will be returning (:

P.S. random but architecture is also stunning. We love the art deco ceilings.

Sooo sooooo good, I can‚Äôt believe how much you get for the price point, I didn‚Äôt know chicken could taste this good! The candied yams and collard greens were spectacular. Mouth is watering just thinking about it. Cannot recommend enough, the staff are also so kind!

Before we get to talking about the food, let‚Äôs talk about the service‚Ä¶ Southern Hospitality at its finest. Usually you come to a spot like this and they rush you out with your order. Excellent service. I wanted candy yams it near closing time and they had some cooking told me how long it would take and I waited. Family Run Black Business Love to see itü§© Now the food Sweet Lord. That turkey wing feel off the bone ü¶¥ Perfect amount of seasoning and sweetness. Candied yams is the best I‚Äôve had to date it wasn‚Äôt sickly sweet you had the sweetness of the sweet potatoes really shining through spiced perfectly; most places put too much sugar in their yams where it‚Äôs mushy n sugary this was not the case. Mac n Cheese solid. Cornbread was some cornbread alright üòÆ‚Äçüí® slightly coarse texture from the corn that made it very enjoyable and authentic. Turkey Chilli and white rice couldn‚Äôt go wrong with at allüî• Got Fruit punch and grape drink that was perfect too. The food is made with love you can really taste it. Looking forward to coming back and spending more. Got a customer for a lifetime. Big Thanks to Aunt Mel, Uncle Tony and Heaven you run a phenomenal joint üëèüèæüëèüèæ Can not recommend this place enough

-London Kat
one of my favorite places to eat in the neighborhood. They give a really good portion of food for what you pay. It does taste like heaven.
The food here is absolutely amazing. One of the best southern foods around here. Plus, the staff are consistently helpful and friendly no matter what time I go

Overall rating: 4.4

Of course I heard of this place through Keith Lee.. I went on a Saturday at 4 & everything was sold out. I wasn‚Äôt a fan that they wait to tell you this news until you‚Äôre inside (already in line) and at the counter. They should consider having a sign outside.

The location was in East Williamsburg which is a chill area. So I was surprised they had a ‚Äúsecurity guard/ bouncer‚Äù indicating when you can come into the room. The process was very confusing and I didn‚Äôt know even with his guidance on when it was my turn. It would be great if they clear signs in general on what was happening. Definitely felt out of place.

The food that was available was good! The Mac and cheese and fried chicken was good. And they do tell you how long to wait for the other items. I liked the food, but the service and experience was a bit of a turnoff for me. I live in deep Brooklyn and not sure if it‚Äôs worth the commute for me.

Lil Chef Mama catered a climbing event I went to in Gowanus and the food was so tasty that I had to try it again. I went with 3 of my friends. We ordered:

Pad Thai (Recommend)
Pork Sliders (Recommend)
Pineapple Fried Rice with Shrimp
Beef Red Curry (Recommend)
Chicken Wings
Beef Dumplings

Yuzu Soda
Orange juice
Butterfly Pea Lemonade (Recommend)

The atmosphere is beautiful, they made such creative and effective use of the space. The entrance is great for photos and you won‚Äôt feel crowded in this space. Vegan options were clearly labeled.

Travis and Joe were great and attentive servers, and not overbearing. I saw Lil Chef Mama on my way to the restroom and I had to say hi and she was kind enough to offer us complimentary mango sticky rice because she remembered me from the climbing event. She is an absolute sweetheart and please let her know how much you enjoyed the food when you visit.

We will certainly be back for the chefs specials, and some other items we had our eyes on. Definitely a place worth trying. I am confident this place deserves its praise.

And if you do happen to order the chefs specials, call to order in advance as they take ~30min to prepare

Chose this place for lunch based on top ratings. Thai cuisine.

They brought out three small bowls with different chicken and vegetable combinations, plus one with rice.

Each had a unique flavor. Everything was fresh. I especially liked the one in batter with sweet and sour sauce‚Äîfound the perfect balance of flavor for the first time.

I want to come back and try more. Thank you.

I love the food and hospitality here. The food was delicious; I ordered a ginger drink, shrimp and Thai handmade dumplings, and Pad Thai. I also had some of my friend's calamari, which was a light and crispy appetizer. Of the two appetizers, the calamari was the best. But the Pad Thai was the overall winner of the evening.

Had lunch here and went with the lunch deal (shrimp fried rice, chicken pad thai, chives pancake). It was good, but didn‚Äôt quite stand out compared to my other fav Thai spots. That said, I loveeeee the ambiance. It genuinely felt like being back home in Southeast Asia!

Truly a delightful restaurant! Very underrated. Food was AMAZING, service was OUTSTANDING, atmosphere was COZY. 100% recommend the food! You will not be disappointed. Both our appetizers and entrees were fabulous. The chicken skewered and pork dumplings apps were fabulous!

Everything was delicious and well-prepared. The dishes were flavorful and beautifully plated. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff were kind and attentive. Definitely a place worth coming back to!

This is a really really good place from the silent traveler to all of you, be safe, be well, be open. Ladies and gentlemen this is a place that if you want to experience Japanese culture or just Asian culture. This is a good place to do that you're going to experience how modern culture meets the past. When you walk in the door you're greeted with a big smile. The food is really good and there's a TV that is showing the chef and how he makes each dishes if you get in the right position and you can see it. You scan your QR code with your phone and you can get the menu right there or they can give you a paper menu but the latest and greatest is in scanning a QR code. Very nice quiet and quaint place for couples families and really good gatherings. Why we were there we had a chance to really watch and experience friends come together and having a really good time and celebrating something. I highly recommend this place inside and out. They have great Ramen and other great choices as well so if you're in the area and you're in the neighborhood please check them out you cannot go wrong.
absolutely delicious! i received a warm welcome and service was great. i did not wait long for my meal and the food was so yummy. definitely a new favorite spot!

Nice, hole in the wall Japanese eatery! The staff are friendly and attentive!! Food is delicious- definitely comfort food! I only had 2 dishes: squid tentacles and whitefish- very satisfying! Washed it down with a large Sapporo!üòÑ

Had this place on my list for years and finally made it. A very lively and bustling place. The food was decent. we ordered salmon carpaccio, karaage and a pasta dish. It was all delicious. servers were very very attentive. Highly recommend this place. CASH ONLY.

We booked over a month ago from the UK as we wanted somewhere nice to have my birthday meal on our first day in New York.
Jet lag got the better of us but we were welcomed two hours earlier than planned.
The atmosphere as soon as we arrived was beautiful. The waitress was attentive and informative.
I had the Pork chop from the specials menu and my husband had the lasagna,both were stunning!
Perfect start to our holiday ‚≠êÔ∏è

The location is easy to find and I reserved online which makes it easier. The restaurant is pretty small inside with lots of tables close together. It was very dark inside so I had to use a flashlight to read the menu. Mladenka was our server and she was nice difficult to understand at times but nice. Just as an FYI they don‚Äôt have a kids menu and when you do order spaghetti and meatballs for your children it‚Äôs very expensive. Pizza would be your best option. Also if you want bread, it‚Äôs $10 something we didn‚Äôt know. I did get arancine which was cold inside, obviously frozen then reheated which isn‚Äôt good.  Overall the food was ok. You can see what we ordered on the receipt. Overall the meal was ok.  Would I return - maybe.  The bathrooms need a bit of cleaning and upkeep.

The food here at Tavola is always good. However, our server interrupted my conversation with my friend (we were discussing which lunch menu we each want to get so that we can taste each other's food), telling us that we cannot order one brunch menu and share. I looked up and asked her if we had placed just one order since she was so adamant about it. She said no, but she started to keep repeating her statement. It was difficult for us to convince her that we were indedd ordering TWO separate menu. Let alone my friend and I were speaking in a different language before she approached us, so she seemed to have jumped to the conclusion that we were talking about ordering one to share. I felt offended and misunderstood. Throughout the meal, she kept coming over every 5 minutes to ask how the food was, while she only went to the other table next to us once. Overwhelming service really left a bad taste.
The atmosphere is cozy and intimate. Great for a date! There is a buzz of the Italian environment of gather together and eat great food. Service was very fast and food was tasty!

Ordered the spaghetti vongole for takeout. At 4pm on a summer Saturday the restaurant was relatively lively. Probably 25% occupied by customers, and the remaining 10% was kitchen staff having their lunch or something like that :)

Anyway, the food was good. Surprisingly a lot of clams for 25$. I counted precisely 14 clams üòÑ. However, some of them maybe MAYBE didn't smell too fresh. Perhaps I will pay closer attention next time. Also, I think it was slightly on the salty side, but not bad. Overall I give 4 ‚≠ê for the food.

Tucked in the quiet side of South Street Seaport, a table on the sidewalk  in a sunny late autumn day was the best for a leisurely lunch in busy NYC. Food was nice. Service was friendly. Price was reasonable. 2024.11.06

Everything about this place is A+. The salmon was great. It was tasty and full of flavor. The mac n cheese was also good. Check out their website for happy hour offers. The service was also great as well as the atmosphere.

The staff was so kind!! They came out with a sparkler and a beautiful dessert for my birthday! The drinks were so well made and well balanced. You can really tell the bartender knows what they're doing! Their new manager is from Barcelona and really made a point to make sure we were happy and taken care of. My partner and I will definitely be going back!!
Even though I probably could have made it at home, I quite enjoyed the "Croque Monsieur" ham and cheese sandwich. The cafe is very nice with cute outdoor seating on the sidewalk. Very nice!

Brought a small pack of kids here for dinner and the verdict: ambiance is classy and chic. Service is great. Food: typical kids fare but lacks an element of a kid‚Äôs meal. There is no drink or dessert option for them. This isn‚Äôt a diner.

Adult menu was delicious.  $$$ for a regular working family budget.

The details:

House bread. Warm. delicious.

Appetizers: Calamari. Grilled octopus. Calamari was shareable. Grilled octopus serving was more for a single or pair to share.

Main: I should‚Äôve ordered a salad because my main came no veggies.  My friends main was breaded chicken under a bed of salad. No starch. My hubbies seafood pasta was delicious. Worth it.

The bar section filled up to standing room only.  I loved our cozy booth. The kids could convene tightly together. Ambiance was lovely. Definitely a nice place to go on a date and even for families with children.

Picked this place out of all the Italian restaurants in the area and glad we did.  Service was great and we elected to eat outside, even in March.  Started out with the fresh bread and garlic sauce and it was delicious.  Our server was very informative and helped us decide on our meals.  I had the steak pizzeria and it was delicious, but the steak was tough.  The pasta dishes were some of the best I have ever tasted. Overall we were well pleased with our meal.

One of the many Italian restaurants at Mulberry Street.  Waiters stay out of the restaurant showing the menu to people passing by.
Inside the ambiance is cozy and traditional.  Waiters are patient and gentle.
Many options on the menu. Appetizers, pasta, meat and more.
I tried the lasagna. Not the best one I ever ate,  but still good.
I would consider it a good option if you are in the neighborhood.

Great little cozy restaurant in the heart of Mulberry Street‚Äôs Little Italy in NYC. We dined here for our family Christmas trip to NYC and it was perfect. The food was delicious, came out quick, and very affordable. We dined in with our 2 kids (10 &13) and they had a menu suitable for all pallets, which is why we decided to eat here. The atmosphere was perfect for Xmas with some nice lights dangling and decor. The only draw back was the seating was very tight and you‚Äôre on top of other tables. They do a great job fitting the tables into a small space, but don‚Äôt get up to use the bathroom during your meal. My wife and I both got the gnocchi bolognese, my daughter got Rigatoni a la vodka, and son got buttered spaghetti with meatballs. Portion sizes were on the bigger side. The pasta was definitely fresh and the sauces were delicious. Can‚Äôt forgot our fried calamari appetizer and house bread with oil and Italian seasonings.

We just happened to stop by here while walking around little Italy, and I'm glad we did. We got the cheesy break for a starter, and it was really good. My wife got the lasagna, and I got the fettuccine alfredo. They were both great and definitely worth trying.

This place was amazing. All five of us got something different. The carbonara was what dreams are made of. The lasagna was on point. And the dish that had part marinara and part Alfredo (can‚Äôt remember the name) was as phenomenal. We will be back!!
Dr. Wong is a great surgeon. He was very understanding. I was awake through my surgery and didn't feel any pain at all.
Dr. Wong is an excellent doctor he is friendly genuinely caring great bedside manners cannot say enough good about this doctor.

I recommend this doctor to anyone I know. He is very knowledgeable and understanding. Not only that he has wonderful bedside matters. I could not ask for a better doctor. Thank God he was chosen to be mine.
Couldn't have picked a better dr. Very understanding great bedside manners and most of all great surgeon. Thank you Dr Wong and staff.

Enjoyed delicious Thai cuisine!
It was so satisfying ~
Emmy was amazing! Her smile and attentive service were top-notch!!
We came here to celebrate graduation and would love to visit again. Thank you!
HUGE thank you to my server Popeye for being such a ball of sunshine and patiently explaining items on their extensive menu to me

Just Wow! This is the best Thai food we've ever had. It's rare for us to find a restaurant we would consider amazing on a scale that goes from good and very good to excellent and then amazing. Definitely amazing and a solid 10 out of 10. The ambiance and service only added to the outstanding food to make the total experience sublime. Our server helped us navigate the menu and had definite opinions when it came to narrowing down tough decisions between dishes that all sounded fantastic. No wishy washy, "It depends what you're in the mood for." She was confident in her choices and her recommendations were spot on. Now, it's entirely possible the entire menu is great, so I guess we'll just have to come back and try the other options to see. üòâ
Can't wait!üòã

One of the best Thai restaurants I have been to in NY. Less than 10% of my reviews get 5 stars.  The food was amazing! Our table especially like the Tom Yum soup- which everyone said was the best they've had. The short rib just fell off the bone. Naturally. I really enjoyed the stir fried seafood with basil. The only thing that was not exceptionally good was the papaya salad- but I'm very selective with my Thai food.

The service was super friendly and fast. The decor is nice. I would characterize this as modern Thai, not traditional, but you'll recognize some of your favorite dishes.

We tried this highly rated Thai restaurant last thanksgiving season. The interior and the vibe was very nice also the services. We ordered the Roti Massamun, a shrimp dish and a chicken dish recommended by the waitress. We really love the roti paired with curry, so crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, curry was so yummy. The chicken dish and the shrimp dish were really great presented but somehow looked better than they were tasted. Maybe we will come back and tired some other classic Thai dishes next time.

We enjoyed the food; most of the dishes were delicious and well-prepared. However, the service was disappointing‚Äîthere was a lack of attentiveness and professionalism. The staff showed no enthusiasm or smiles, which made the experience less enjoyable.

Had a wonderful Japanese dinner at Kaoru on East 46th off 2nd in Kips Bay.

An off-the-beaten-path, low key spot, they offered a very traditional array of sushi & sashimi.

We started with an order of edamame and kinpira (a salad of burdock, lotus roots, a carrots in soy sauce with sesame seeds) and moved on to some simple but delicious rolls.

The sashimi is really fresh here! Nice, classy-but-chill ambiance as well--it's a Japanese Piano Bar, which means that at night there's live piano music that sometimes people do karaoke to. I didn't drink any alcohol, but I really liked their Yuzu Soda. Food was high quality--don't expect your usual "bar food". Summary below:

-Edamame was tender and the portion generous. --a good snack.
-Sashimi--tried it for the first time and was VERY impressed. Very fresh (no smell at all!) and the manager was kind enough to recommend the best raw fish for a first-timer (amberjack).
-Cold Udon noodles were bouncy and savory and there was a fun texture from the little fried bits on top. Has a dashi broth, so if you don't like any seafood taste, I'd skip.
-Tonkatsu was Japanese-style thick and juicy and nice--a fresh and clean fry.
-Dumplings in Chili Oil were sooooo yummy and the chili oil was spicy, but the good kind of spicy that makes you want to eat more.
-Miso Pork Rice Bowl was kind of like a fried pork dipped in this miso-forward sauce--amazing and warm and comforting. They don't skimp on the green onion topping.

Other notes:
-Bathrooms were clean
-There's a karaoke room (I didn't use it, just saw it)
-Love that the bar stools are regular-chair height.
-Most staff seemed to speak both English and Japanese.
-Some food looked like it was only served in the evening.

Overall, I can't recommend this place enough. It feels like a hidden gem, tucked away across the street from the UN. I really enjoyed my visits!
When I want to eat real fresh raw fish I come to Kaoru. Place was totally busy but food was excellent. I totally recommend who wants to eat fresh raw fish in the NYC.

Came here with my daughter while on vacation. The food came super quickly and tasted good. I thought it was a bit too much rice for the amount of sashimi. The restaurant also smelled very oily for some reason. The price was reasonable, I would come back again if we were staying in the same area next time in NYC.
This is a Bangladeshi-owned restaurant. Chicken biryani was great! It's one of my two favorite restaurants to go to in downtown Brooklyn. It makes me feel as if I am in Noakhali, Bangladesh.

We enjoyed it! The Chicken Saag and the channa masala both had the perfect spice level. We got vegetable samosas too but I forgot to get a picture lol. They don‚Äôt have outdoor seating but they had the doors open since the weather was nice and honestly! To me, that‚Äôs better than the patio seating. Friendly service and the food came out quick! We will definitely be back!

Came here for family dinner. They accommodated our large group and had great service. The mango lassi and mojitos were excellent. We got different biryanis, butter chicken and the lamb vindaloo. All the items were great. Especially the garlic naan we got to accompany the mains.

I think it's the least tasty Indian restaurant I have ever tasted. Everything was disappointing. Quantity is really too less compared to the price but anyway that can be easily left as it won't taste good. Paneer tikka masala was so sweet. Malai kofta spice does not blend, it just tastes like some powder. It's not even worth discussing biryani. Paneer is so raw and has no taste. The best item that gave a lot of relaxation in this restaurant is water, yes, water.

Awesome little place. The samosas were delicious and I also tried a cold lentil bread and yogurt dish that was really interesting! I usually like curry to be a bit more spicy but it was good. The restaurant is clean and the staff is friendly.

A great place for a meal!

My only complaint is that the protein they serve is on the dry side. The salmon I had was particularly overcooked. I tried the chicken cutlet and it was fairly dry (not as dry as the fish however).

Despite the dry protein, the amazing veggie dishes certainly make up for it. The pesto mashed potatoes, roasted cauliflower with curry seasoning, and yucca fries were delicious.

The drinks are also made well and very refreshing.

The service was great and the restaurant was modern and charming.

I took a client from Supp who is a vegetarian for lunch at Westville | Chelsea, and it was just the perfect decision. Aside from the meeting going well, the space is bright and clean, and the servers are attentive and present. We sat at the bar, so shout out to the bartender, Jess‚Äîpersonable, smiley, and fun!

The menu has many options with genuine healthy ingredients, which is not always easy to find in NYC. I picked the soup of the day as a light lunch, and it was really yummy!

See you soon :)

Good no-nonsense food at a very good price point.

Some highlights for us - Burger is tasty and doesn't feel overly rich. Makes for a good guilt-free feed. You may want to consider asking for sauce if you like more flavour though. The base Burger was plenty for me however. French fries are cooked perfectly - nice and crispy, very hard to stop eating!

Cauliflower with tahini (market veges) was a good compliment to our mains.

I'll definitely be back for a casual meal and would recommend for anyone looking for a simple meal to drop by.

The service was good and place was clean. A bit small but it‚Äôs not a big deal. I loved the mashed potatoes, Kale and mushrooms. Steak was alright to. All in all this place is pretty good if you don‚Äôt wanna get anything special or too expensive

People who work here are very kind. However, 2 nights in a row I have ordered my burger medium rare, and got it well done. I really like your burgers, but I‚Äôm not gonna gamble ordering it anymore. It was dry and not red in the center at all! The burger was over cooked and the fries were undercooked and soggy. Gonna be taking a break from ordering from here, because it‚Äôs really always something.

Reserved a table for my friend and I! Not too far from Grand central. Such a cute spot. Calm atmosphere. Food was quick and we came in time just for brunch! Definitely recommend if you want a chill little spot to eat at.

The decor, atmosphere, and cleanliness (especially in the bathroom) is excellent. However, the food was just fine for the price point. I felt the pancakes, while by itself tasted good, could have used more syrup for the portion. The spicy burger was not spicy at all as well. Lastly, the service was slow and inattentive but not judging too harshly because you never know what can be happening in the kitchen/restaurant that day.

This is a popular restaurant with great music, festive decor, cute mirrors all over, and dim lighting. Seating is hard and not super comfortable. Staff is nice and attentive but could probably be a bit more attentive. I had the mezcal inferno drink and it wasn‚Äôt spicy at all which was kind of a bummer. Also a little too sweet for me. The truffle fries and pancakes were yummy, 2 of us got avocado toast and they finished those, one of us got a Caesar wrap with chicken and didn‚Äôt really seem to enjoy it/she had a lot left over. I liked that the pancakes weren‚Äôt overly sweet, I think they‚Äôd be even better with chocolate chips or banana. It was busy inside but not so loud that we couldn‚Äôt converse easily. Even the bathroom is nice, the lit candle was a nice touch!

Great atmosphere and place to chill by yourself or be with friends.

The hot chicken and waffle was so yummy‚Ä¶
But the buttermilk souffle pancakes were something special.

They came out so hot and moist and ooey gooey! Great flavor, not too sweet.

The cocktail ‚ÄúThe Winona‚Äù was cool but there was nothing special about it in its taste.

Vibes were immaculate and the food was very hearty and filling. We went during brunch hours and ordered the skillet, hot chicken & waffles, and the huevos rancheros.

The hot chicken and waffles were solid but the hot chicken could‚Äôve used more spice and flavoring. The waffle and sweet potato butter was really delicious though. Truffle fries were also a great side to order.

We had the drip trio of hummus, baba ganoush, and matbucha with the frena bread, and it was delicious. The bread was freshly baked and the dips were incredibly flavorful. Even sharing this between 3 people was plenty.

We also had the Roman style artichokes which were fantastic, the crispy zucchini cakes, and Madagascar shrimp kadayif which I'd recommend. The dessert - the halva silan sundae, was amazing. Everything was fresh, cooked well to order, and the kitchen accommodated making 3 of some items (like the shrimp) for 3 of us instead of their normal 2. And the waiters and manager were very attentive.

The manager, Ailin Yang, was also awesome and gave us fantastic recommendations. She learned that my wife and I recently got married and gave us complimentary champagne which was very sweet.

10/10 will recommend this place to others and will also come back for brunch!

I had the most wonderful birthday dinner at Frena! Every single dish was absolutely delicious ‚Äî I‚Äôm from Turkey and love Middle Eastern food, and I can honestly say I‚Äôve never had such incredible flavors in NYC before.

The entire team‚Äîwaiters, waitresses, everyone ‚Äî were so kind and warm. They all wished me a happy birthday and even surprised me with a gift of baklava ice cream, which made the night even more special.

The atmosphere was lovely, and the service was outstanding from start to finish. I can‚Äôt wait to come back. Thank you, Frena, for making my birthday truly unforgettable!

What an amazing dinner! The service was warm and friendly, and the cocktails were all delicious. We had the scallop special, shrimp dish, and lamp baked in the over with a bread crust. The fresh baked bread and the tortellini were the stars of the meal. All the dishes were wonderful and we can't wait to go back!

Really really good Mediterranean food that I recommend to anyone in the area. A little place on the corner that packs a punch in flavor. Frena is a great place for a nice dinner night or celebration as it embodies the communal aspects of Mediterranean food. The staff is good with attentiveness to needs and quick to help out those who haven't dined before. The food really packs in the flavor with some of the best hummus, babaganush, and other bread dips. The mains switch up here and there but sure to please. The octopus was very very good.

Delicious food and great atmosphere. Amazing complimentary pita bread with plenty of zaatar and oil. The burger was top tier and so were the brunch items. Crispy zucchini cakes with poached eggs were great for breakfast and the chicken schnitzel sandwich was big enough for 2-3 people easily. Highly recommend the duo of falafel and ending your meal with the donuts.

Great LES breakfast spot! Came in on Wednesday at 11AM. No wait, were seated immediately. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. The ambiance of the place was comfortable as well. My friends and I all got the "You Betty Be Ready". Classic American breakfast, you get a little bit of everything with this plate. The meal was yummy, my favorite part were the whole mini roasted potatoes :) I heard the waitress talking about how they are also a bar, so I'll have to be back to check that out.

A friend and I visited BETTY on our trip to NYC. The atmosphere is great and the staff were great too. We ordered the steak and eggs & the ‚Äúyou betty be ready‚Äù. We were pretty disappointed with the portions for both meals, especially for the price. The food tasted okay, nothing super special. The pot of tea presentation was super cute. Overall, I‚Äôd give our experience a 3.6/5
This brunch spot is such a gem! Loved every dish that we tried. The flavours were impeccable. Will definitely be coming back :)
Delicious breakfast!  The service was excellent!  Will definitely be back when in NYC again.  Recommend 100%.

food was great, could be a bit more flavorful but still tasty overall. service was fine but the interior of this restaurant is so charming and chic. would be a nice first date spot in my opinion. we saw the head chef (abby) sitting with a table with a glass of wine towards the end of the night which i loved haha, super cosy. we got the crispy tofu sandwich, the southern fried chicken sandwich, mac and cheese, and the banoffee pie which was really the star of the night.

First time experiencing Georgian cuisine. Everything was interesting and flavorful. The only lacking element was that the deserts were underwhelming. The staff were delightful, charming and helpful. Finding out that it was a birthday dinner, not only did the staff put a candle in the dessert we ordered, but they gave us a second on "on the house". Thank you!

We stopped by the restaurant as it was empty and seemed quiet, but quickly became loud within the hour.
The Taste of Georgia was the best dish following the shot of tomato juice. Each of these have strong and distinct flavors that left us guessing what's next. The pomegranate added minor twists along the way
The other two dishes were bland potatoes and salty pork which didn't live up to the expectations

Super busy, recommend making a reservation! Otherwise you‚Äôre awkwardly standing in a space that has no designated spot for it, so you‚Äôre kinda just standing in diners personal space for a while. But anyway, their wines and cocktails are no joke, I got the Ambe and my husband got a full bodied amber wine. It was SO GOOD. That alone had me so excited. Anyway, food wise, it was okay. The Mtsvadi was a tad salty, I wish there was rice to offset it, she did offer potatoes with it which was a 14 dollar up charge which was fine but they sort of did nothing against the strong flavor of the main dish. The Khinkali was AMAZING. The server taught us how to eat them (upside down with a dash of black pepper!) and to slurp the soup out because these were VERY soupy (I didn‚Äôt know a dumpling could hold this much soup, even a Xiao Long Bao would‚Äôve stared with wide eyes) the Khachapuri was good, one note but its cheese and bread, good. The potatoes were not great, it was mostly potato skins rather than actual potato itself. Next time I‚Äôll just go for the wine and the Khingkali.

Came for a late lunch and had a great time. Staff was super friendly, some nice tunes playing, and great food. Had the cheese bread, lamb dumplings, and the pork and beef kebab; and I would recommend all of them. Everything was cooked perfectly and had great seasoning.The amber wine was fantastic as well. Would try the lamb stuffed grapes leaves next time.

Really good spot for Georgian in Manhattan. Love the convenience and nice atmosphere, and the food was excellent, elevated versions of classic Georgian dishes. I especially enjoyed the seasonal khachapuri with smoked cheese and pumpkin seeds. Dish sizes were on the smaller side to what I‚Äôve had at other good Georgian places in the city, but that‚Äôs Manhattan.

The menu is very interesting. It's a fusion of Vietnamese, Mexican, and classic American. Well prepared, food came out very fast. The mint water was a nice, classy touch, but the place and tables are pretty small, so it gets a bit cramped. The prices were typical, and the portions average. We were surprised at the lack of attention however. Asked for napkins several times, had to ask for water to be refilled, but hard to get someone's attention. Also, cash only for some reason, even though they were filling many online orders and had an iPad terminal... not sure why that was the case. There is indeed a restroom, it's just hidden behind a false shelf. Quite charming, actually. Still, an interesting place to eat and hang out.

This place was incredible! I had the lemon grass chicken tacos and a drip coffee. The food was so fresh and incredibly flavorful. I didn't realize the coffee came with condensed milk but it sat at the bottom so only a gentle stir gave me what I needed. Everyone at the table loved their food.

I got the banh xeo tacos (fried fish), classic banh mi, and taro chips.  Definitely wanted more of the banh xeo tacos.  Also really liked the taro chips.

The classic banh mi was a mixed bag.  It had great bread ( but definitely thicker/denser than usual), lots of veggies (mostly carrots), and was big (about 10 inches).  But it only had one thin layer of Viet ham (ch·∫£ l·ª•a).  The rest was jambon (my least favorite protein) and marrow pate.  The "marrow pate" wasn't the usual kind--it had a different flavor and is chunkier.  Frankly, I'm not familiar with this kind of pate, and I don't prefer it over the regular kind.
So delicious!!! The vibe is so nice and the pho was amazing. The broth was so rich in flavor and the portion size is big! Spring rolls and fries were alright, nothing compared to the pho.
The Pho was decent. There were too many carrots on Bahn mi. Expect everything - broth and carrots to taste way sweeter. There's no bathroom. Just FYI.

I visited on a Sunday night and it was empty!
You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table. You clean your table/tray when you are finished.

I got the Nasi Lemak and it was really tasty, but the portions are pretty small. Prices are fine for the size of the dish, but I wouldn‚Äôt go here if I was super hungry. I really enjoyed the flavors in this dish- Malaysian food is new to me and this was a good introduction to the cuisine.
Good tasting Malaysian food. I always get their fish noodles, idk why. The Nasi Lemak is also good, just wish they served it with chicken wings (which you could separately). Kaya Toast is phenomenal.

I went to Kopitiam with a friend in a Friday evening and we both enjoyed the food. We tried the cold sesame noodles and the mushroom coconut rice. Flavorful!!!

I don‚Äôt usually have Malesian food so this was a great discovery!

Was craving for kaya toast and this restaurant came up. We liked everything, although I prefer the traditional kaya (coconut) and not the pandan flaviored one. The drinks in plastic pouches reminded me of how drinks are packed in SEA when I was a kid. Will be back to try their other dishes.
