Kopitiam is exceptional for what it is- quick and reliable comfort food with extensive appetizer, dessert, AND drink menus. I ordered 3 of those sunrise drinks man it‚Äôs that good. Fairly priced, cozy atmosphere for dine in, flavorful food, and thoughtful menu items- even for someone who often find dishes to taste generically bland. Only complaint is the online menu layout can seem a little confusing so I recommend looking through the Grubhub menu, which also has pictures.
One of the best South East Asian restaurants in NYC so far. Such a breath of fresh air among many mediocre and generic restaurants even above this price range.

We had a great meal with very attentive service (water glass filled continually and crumbs swept away). I was particularly happy with all the vegetarian choices. The dining room has a patio vibe with natural light from the skylights. We had the garlic roll and for entrees, wild mushroom ravioli and sea bass. For dessert, we split a tiramisu. All delicious.
Though the host made a pitch for the cocktails, I had a glass of wine.

Restaurant inside the Arlo hotel near PABT. They serve ‚Äúmodern American‚Äù food, though it seems to be inspirations from a variety of cuisines so more eclectic. My favorites were the starter bread (perfectly fluffy and seasoned with a delicious butter) and the artichoke tempura. The pistachio pastry dessert is also a must try if you dine here.

This place is highly recommended for going and enjoying the exquisite flavors of its dishes‚Äîa great result from a Chef who truly knows how to create experiences through flavors that dance together in a delicious balance. Excellent atmosphere‚Äîcalm, warm, and welcoming‚Äîjust like the people working there. I highly recommend it.

We stayed for 6 nights in New York and this Restaurant was our Nr. 1 Adress Here in New York for breakfast. We visited many other Restaurants during our days here too, but the Service and the quality of food here was outstanding. We recommend it, especially as a breakfast-location.
All around fantastic menu. Each cocktail was so tasty and well thought out, as well as each dish. Food was delicious and overall outstanding service!!!

Preshow dinner was excellent! We started with Caprese Di Bufala and selected the Tagliatelle Al Ragu (bolognese) and the Linguine Alle Vongole for our entrees. We thoroughly enjoyed all three! I wish I could have taken a pint of the complimentary tomato based dipping sauce for the bread home with us. It was just divine! We‚Äôll visit again next time we‚Äôre in NYC. With 2 alcoholic beverages each our meal was $70pp before tax and tip.

Great service but very cramped. Loved the salad, pasta was great, steak was not good, and the shoestring fries have no flavor, they're literally like eating fried crunchies that get cold super fast, I recommend swapping them out for something else. Tiramisu is a little too sweet.

This restaurant is elegant and lovely.  White tablecloths and slender table lamps give it old world charm.  The pear salad was fresh and perfectly seasoned.  The sun dried tomato marmalade for the fresh bread is delightful.  The pumpkin ravioli is perfect.  I ended my meal with lemon sorbet.  It was the right balance of tart and not too sweet, and was refreshing.  The service is attentive.  My glass of sparkling water was always topped off.  The staff are professional and yet warm . Overall, a very pleasant experience.  I highly recommend this gem.

My family and I recently had a fantastic dinner while visiting NYC.  It was the best Italian food we've ever had and the coffee was divine!  I couldn't stop thinking about it so I went out of my way to swing by a day later for dessert and coffee after eating lunch somewhere else.  The staff was incredibly friendly and efficient.  I will dream about the branzino carpaccio  (a special) and Strozzapreti Salsiccia e Funghi for years to come, I'm sure!  And did I mention the coffee?!  I hope to be back to NYC soon so I can return!  Thank you!!

This is one of our favourite restaurants in Midtown, New York! My SO is from Verona, Italy and enjoys the food. I love the bolognese - tagliatelle a ragu and he loves the scaloppine. The gelato is also a favorite. We love the environment, and the staff is friendly and attentive.

I went to celebrate my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday with a group of 14 friends, and the experience was excellent. The attention, service, and food were impeccable. I highly recommend it. Jose was super attentive, helpful, and always willing to assist us with any questions we had. I strongly recommend this restaurant. We‚Äôll definitely be back!P

This restaurant offers both Italian and Argentine cuisine. The pasta here is excellent‚Äîthe texture is cooked perfectly, and there‚Äôs a wide variety to choose from. We also ordered a fish entr√©e, which was delicious and generously portioned.

The decor resembles a cozy Italian family trattoria, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The service was great as well. It‚Äôs a wonderful spot for anyone in the LIC area craving Italian and Argentine food.

Intimate and charmingly rustic spot for good pasta. Discovered this spot on a whim while being in the area, and absolutely loved it. The orecchiette with the brocolli rabe and Italian sausage was excellent. The taste was reminiscent of a homecooked meal but very well done. If that wasn't enough, the extra grilled chicken side was also oddly very amazing, much more delicious than I thought a side of extra protein could ever be. Hands down, one of my favorite recent discoveries for sure. A strong recommend if you're in the area.

My dad and I stumbled upon this restaurant while walking around the area. The server who attended us greeted us with a warm smile and made us feel welcome right away. The service was perfect from start to finish.

When we asked for wine recommendations, the server suggested one that matched our tastes perfectly.

I also asked for advice on how much food would be enough for two people, and we followed the suggestion. We started with the fritto misto appetizer, and for the main course, we went with their recommendation of the pasta alla carbonara, which was simply outstanding.

We finished with a classic dessert, the flan, which was the perfect way to wrap up such a wonderful experience.

Thank you Jose for making this visit so special. I will definitely be back to explore more of the menu and enjoy the excellent service again.

Carbonara is one of my favorite pastas and it is a struggle to find a traditional carbonara in my opinion. I thought the sauce and flavor of the carbonara was very good and highly recommend! It is a smaller and more intimate environment but great service. I will definitely be back!
Small and cozy place with a tasty meals. Be ready to wait in line about 30 min on the weekends. Big breakfast was well cooked, love their cappuccino visual representation

We came in on Monday morning and were seated right away. I ordered a latte and my husband ordered a juice with beets and strawberries (delicious).

My MIL and I ordered the bacon and egg roll, my FIL and husband got the BYOB. Everything tasted good and came out quickly.

Small place and really cute in side.

A very enjoyable address for brunch. The employees are very polite, the prices are affordable. The location is also very convenient. I definitely recommend it. I had avocado toast and it was delicious. We ordered the sweet potatoes. Falafel wrap was also very delicious. Recommended for a pleasant brunch. 10/10

During a recent trip to NYC, we were delighted to be recommended this charming spot for breakfast‚Äîand it did not disappoint! This cozy, hygge-inspired caf√© was the perfect place for a late morning meal. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by the friendly staff and seated at a quaint little table.

We took our time exploring the menu, brimming with intriguing ‚ÄúBrekkie‚Äù options. Ultimately, we opted for the classic Two Eggs Any Style and the Bacon & Egg Roll‚Äîa hearty sandwich packed with fried egg, crispy bacon, pickled onions, tomato jam, and garlic aioli, all nestled in a fresh ciabatta roll. There was even an option to add mashed avocado, which sounded tempting, but the sandwich was already so generously filled! Honestly, it was so substantial that it could have easily been shared.

To accompany our meal, we ordered lattes that arrived beautifully adorned with intricate latte art. The atmosphere was made even more inviting by the walls adorned with paintings by local artists, a thoughtful touch that showcased and supported the creative community.

Outside, a well-shaded seating area offered plenty of space to enjoy a leisurely breakfast without feeling rushed. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you can truly relax and savor your morning. We‚Äôll definitely be returning the next time we‚Äôre in NYC!

Visited about 10 am on a weekday. Got seating after about 10 minutes.

When visiting their homepage, they have a slogan all over the place "delicious + healthy". That may explain the flavours I felt. I had french toast, that tasted "too" healthy for my preference. The texture of the french toast was as if made with multi-grain bread and the overall sweetness was low. I think it is better to have other options than the sweet one's for more flavour. The latte did not taste good.

We visited this well-maintained restaurant for dinner on a Thursday night. It was quite busy, with most tables displaying reserved signs. Despite the crowd, the layout was thoughtfully spaced, so it didn‚Äôt feel overcrowded. I appreciated the bench design with built-in storage‚Äîit was convenient for stowing our belongings. The BBQ was flavorful, especially the spiced pork belly, though the portion sizes were on the smaller side. A staff member handled the grilling for us and cooked the meat perfectly. We especially enjoyed the side dishes, and the waitstaff were happy to provide refills when we asked. Overall, it was a great experience‚Äîwe just wish the portions were a bit more generous.

Amazing Korean BBQ Experience ‚Äì More Than 5 Stars!

GUNBAE in Tribeca was one of the best dining experiences of my life! My family and I had the Combo C, and it was absolutely phenomenal. The flavors, the quality of the meat, and the whole experience were just perfect.

The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure everything was just right. The grilling at the table added to the fun, and the atmosphere was lively yet comfortable.

Even my family, who usually don‚Äôt say much about food, absolutely loved it! If I could give more than 5 stars, I definitely would. Highly recommend for anyone looking for top-tier Korean BBQ in NYC!

Love it! Went here for late lunch on a Subday and had the BBQ and chose wagyu brisket and ribeye steak. Loved the ribeye better. Wagyu brisket was good too, but I kept looking at the kalbi from my neighbors lol I also very much enjoyed the sides and the sauces. The kimchi, other lighter color cabbage, and onions are delicious. Fluffy eggs at the beginning were nice too. Even the Seoul Soul Ale beer was very nice. Ended up very satisfied but without feeling extremely stuffed.

One of the amazing restaurants in Lower Manhattan! We visited for my friend's birthday lunch. The atmosphere is so chic and modern. The decor is decent, and they have spacious tables for bigger groups. We indulged in fantastic cocktails such as margaritas, Manhattan, old-fashioned, and appletini, all expertly crafted and definitely strong. Our order included the Gunbae Hansang combo, veggie bibimbap, and Dduk Mandu Guk soup with veggie dumplings and vegetables - everything was scrumptious and delightful. A staff member even came to our table to prepare the BBQ for the combo, which was a fantastic experience. My friends and I had a wonderful time, and although they close at 3 pm, they didn't rush us; we left at 3:15. To top it off, they surprised us with a small ice cream topped with a candle to celebrate my friend's birthday. Excellent service, delicious food, and a nice place for Korean cuisine!
This place is the perfect spot for after work gatherings. The BBQ is amazing!. There is also Karaoke. Will definitely try it!

Great food with good portions ans a friendly staff. We had no idea the small sandwiches were so big. I had a chicken cutlet sandwich with roasted peppers lettuce tomato mayo. My wife got the Italian and she said it was grateful, my son loved the meatball sub and my daughter enjoyed the Buffalo chicken cutlet. There were so many options to choose from be sure to look ahead or plan to be overwhelmed by the options. We went during a time where it wasn't busy so we were able to get some seats at the picnic tables outside. Next time I want to try the Steak pizzaiola since it looked really good.

Decided to take a 35min walk from Brooklyn Heights and it was definitely worth it. Ordered the large Nicky Special and Roast Beef (with mozzarella and eggplant).
Both were awesome and huge. The Nicky had a great amount of meat and topped with a bunch of fresh veggies, the Roast Beef had only 3 ingredients which resulted in an outstanding sandwich!
Thanks to the friendly staff Defonte's, great job.

Top 2 sandwich and it‚Äôs not #2. Incredibly quick service and friendly staff. The ingredients tasted insanely fresh as well as the bread. The Red Hook special was phenomenal and could almost be 2 meals

That was an excellent fried eggplant, peppers and provolone sandwich on a fresh Italian seeded roll. You bite into it and the experience is pure delight! The eggplant, crispy, the peppers, sweet, the provolone, medium sharp, the bread, seeded and soft. Washed it down with some coffee soda...it was very amor√©! This is a great sandwich that's well worth the journey to Red Hook, Brooklyn especially for those discerning sandwich enthusiasts looking for a proper Italian hoagie! üáÆüáπ‚ù§Ô∏èüòã
Sandwiches are good, filling and have several options made to order. If you want the most selection, make sure that you arrive early.

Ate at Swoony‚Äôs with my husband for Valentine‚Äôs Day and we were blown away. The place is top notch. From the atmosphere to the food to the staff. It‚Äôs a classy joint. The burger is phenomenal, easily the best we‚Äôve ever eaten. The tuna crudo, the kale salad, the lobster orzo and the French toast dessert were all stellar too. We cannot wait to come back!

My boyfriend and I just ate at Swoony‚Äôs for our first time and it was a great experience. From start to finish the service was incredible. We arrived about 10 minutes before our reservation time and the hostess sat us right away. We never went without our water glasses less than half full and they did a great job coursing out our entire meal. Our server, Mesha, was very friendly and gave us great recommendations. The cocktails we ordered were delicious; we both loved the Swoony‚Äôs Spritz.  I also enjoyed the Waterfront Ember and my boyfriend thought the Casablanca was delicious. The highlights that we ate were the potato croquettes, the lobster orzo, and the burger. The whipped goat cheese with chili crunch was definitely the most unique dish we ordered and it was so tasty. We also had the casino clams and Brussels sprouts which were flavorful, too. We were too full to try dessert and happily took home some leftovers. We already can‚Äôt wait to come back and try some other things, especially the cheesecake dessert. Thank you Swoony‚Äôs!

My partner and I took a risk and tried to come here on a rainy Saturday night around 7pm and we were told we might be able to get bar seats in 45 minutes and were added to the list by the kind host. Only waited about 20-25 minutes before we got a text and they were able to give us a table!  We only had until 9 though until the next reservation, which was totally fine. We were very grateful!

We started off strong with delicious cocktails. I ordered the white Negroni and my partner got a Black Manhattan.

To eat we had the grilled prawns, PEI mussels, and burger. We both agreed our absolute favorite were the mussels. Absolutely loved the shells and the garlic mustardy sauce. The slices of garlic were plentiful and I ate every last one. We loved the sauce so much we dipped the fries from the burger in the sauce and ended up scraping the remainder of the sauce on top of the fries.

The burger was amazing too. The English muffin bun was so fresh and soft. The burger was two smash patties atop with cheese. Absolutely love the thousand island dressing on top!

We finished off the meal with the French toast and vanilla ice cream. Both of these dishes were amazing combined‚Ä¶. But the French toast is outstanding on its own. Perfectly caramelized outside atop with fresh maple syrup.

Overall, we love this new addition to the neighborhood and we can‚Äôt wait to come back!

I really enjoyed Swoony‚Äôs and am looking forward to returning. I really liked the wedge salad and whipped goat cheese to start. We had 1/2 other times which I don‚Äôt recall that were also tasty. The reason you‚Äôre most likely here is for the steak frites and the short rib au poivre does not disappoint. We finished with the cheesecake mousse, which we all enjoyed. The menu is littered with items you want to try that you don‚Äôt have enough room for so multiple visits are needed. The staff is friendly and the ambience is perfect, more upscale than a neighborhood restaurant but not stuffy or stiff. I can‚Äôt wait to come back & try more deliciousness at Swoony‚Äôs.

Good food and would definitely return.

Recommended:
- BRUSSELS SPROUTS
Horseradish sauce, shallots, breadcrumbs
- SHORT RIB AU POIVRE
Fries
- CREAMY LOBSTER ORZO
- CRAB LOUIE TOAST
Crunchy vegetables, egg mimosa, on a brioche

It's hard to get a reservation on a weekend. So we came here Thursday evening.
The pancake was so fluffy.  I chose a salmon burger instead of chicken, to my surprise it was so good!!!
Chicken waffles, their signature, don't need to say more, try it!
Truffle Brussels sprouts tasted a little bit
Salty. Double bacon, is pretty good like beef jerky.
We got 2 seasonal drinks, hot buttered rum and Mexican coffee.
Hot buttered rum, tasted strong and light at the same time, sweet and sour at the same time, very unique taste.
Overall, traditional American food, worth to come, don't forget make a reservation ahead

Went sun at 9am (it was rainy), waited in line for like 10 mins, put name down, table was said to be ready in 1.5h but was ready in 50 mins. That was not what we were expecting- I went back at 10 to change it, wait was ultimately 2.5h after that.

I think they can streamline their operations-if the estimates are so off, then let‚Äôs plz be able to see our positions.

Chicken & waffles were delish and good value for money. Chicken is huge. The hot sauce is rly good. I thought the pancakes were OK. Wouldn‚Äôt order them (friends ordered). Blueberries tasted artificial- but I think it might be me being against warmed blueberries. Overall, too sweet. Maple butter was good. Crispy potato pancakes were fine, not that crispy lol. Sour cream was essential for me-the apple sauce was good.

Vibes inside are good - like a diner.

Prob won‚Äôt be back given 1) unreliable line situation and 2) food was good but like not enough for me to return

Overhyped but solid brunch

I don‚Äôt recommend this place. Way too greasy. I ordered 2 plates of pancakes and 1 southern breakfast.
The pancakes were really good, but the rest was disgusting. Not to mention they messed up my order‚ÄîI asked for scrambled eggs, not an omelet, especially when you clearly don‚Äôt know how to make one. Instead of the classic maple syrup I asked, they gave me some kind of maple syrup + cooking oil mixture.
And on top of that, they imposed a tip even though I didn‚Äôt eat on-site.
Well, you got me once, but there won‚Äôt be a second time. I would like to come and get a refund, but I couldn‚Äôt be bothered to face the rain. So well done

I think if you can manage to get a reservation, Clinton St. Baking Co is worth a visit! I went with a group of 4 on a Sunday. We had to wait 15 min for our table to be ready, but once seated the staff really made us feel welcome.

We tried the blueberry pancakes, chicken and waffle, B.E.L.T., and Mexican scramble. We also ordered a side waffle and biscuit. The pancakes are fluffy and the chicken was very well seasoned. Overall everything was delicious.

I finally managed to get a reservation here, and the pancakes did not disappoint! I‚Äôd say they‚Äôre some of the best pancakes in the city. Even the chicken and waffles was really good. Unfortunately we were too full to try the desserts‚Ä¶ maybe next time!

Reservation tips: If you don‚Äôt mind having pancakes for dinner, weekend dinner reservations are much easier to get compared to weekend brunch times.

Celebrate a friend‚Äôs birthday here and highly recommend making a reservation as it tends to get full quickly! Food was delicious, the service a little slow (likely to it being busy), but overall a great experience. The chairs and tables are a bit close together but that didn‚Äôt affect our visit. Definitely stop in!

The food was absolutely amazing! I ordered the mango sticky rice, salad roll, and pad kee mao‚Äîeverything was bomb. The flavors were fresh and perfectly balanced. Service was also fantastic‚Äîfriendly and attentive without being overbearing. Easily one of the best Thai restaurants I‚Äôve been to. The interior is also beautiful and adds to the overall great experience. Highly recommend!

I had an awesome time at this Thai spot! The vibe was super nice and inviting, and I really liked how clean everything was. The food was delicious, though a tad sweeter than I usually like. The portion sizes were pretty decent too.
Overall, I had a good experience and would love to come back to try more dishes!

We had lunch here recently on a Saturday around noon. We were seated immediately. The place was nicely decorated. But the tables were a bit small and tightly packed. Service was friendly and efficient.

We ordered Pad Thai with shrimp and Crispy branzino with mango salad. The noodles and shrimp were perfectly cooked. Loved the mango salad. It was delicious and refreshing. However, the branzino fillets were over-fried and very hard instead of being crispy.

Overall, we enjoyed the lunch but would not order crispy dishes again.

Walked in without reservation around 2 pm and got seated promptly. This is not your typical mom and pop Thai restaurant. Beautifully decorated, inviting and cozy. We ordered beef panang curry, stir fried squid and crispy duck with pad Thai and they were all delicious

The food is very delicious as always. My go to order is Mala Beef and Dumplings in hot oil. I love dumplings in hot oil and I have tried a lot of it at different restaurants and this place is one of my favs. The swing pork belly display was unique and the taste was alright (only cuz I prefer  really spicy food) For those who can't handle spice well, I'd recommend getting coconut juice for these dishes. It goes well together. Their to-go boxes and packing is so cute. This place is about 45 mins away from me but its worth it. I'll visit again when I have time.

Incredible Szechuan food!  Extensive menu.  Highly adventurous menu offerings for those inclined - offal, frog, etc.  But many more accessible dishes as well. La Zi Chicken, Ma Po Tofu, Stir Fry Long Beans, Fish with Green Peppers all exceptional. At the top of many lists of Chinese restaurants, for good reason. Service is fast, thoughtful, and friendly. Setting evokes a peaceful mountain zen retreat...even in the middle of St Marks. Highly recommend!

‚ù§Ô∏è Overview:
My husband and I came here on a double date with my friend and her boyfriend. We had a great time! We made reservations and they said that we had an hour and a half to eat. Luckily for us, we were rushed out because they didn‚Äôt end up needing our table. The inside was nice and our server was very nice. Honestly, all the food was good. Nothing was that spicy (the server said we ordered a lot of spicy food haha). Overall, we enjoyed our meal here! üòä

‚ù§Ô∏èWhat was ordered:
FOOD: Dumplings in chili oil, La-zi chicken, Beef fried rice, Szechuan double cooked pork, Crispy sizzling tofu, long beans, fish filet, tofu &chicken tomato soup

DRINKS: Asashi

‚ù§Ô∏èStand outs:
Szechuan double cooked pork, La-zi chicken, Fish filet, tofu, & tomato braised in spicy & sour broth

‚ù§Ô∏èWould I come back/recommend:
Yes - I would come back
Yes - I would recommend

If you‚Äôre a fan of Chinese food, this place is a must-try!

The spice level is friendly, but it's balanced beautifully with depth and umami. ( there also several non-spicy food to choose) Service was quick and friendly, and the vibe was cozy but vibrant. Definitely coming back with friends!

Best dumplings I‚Äôve ever had, they were soft and chewy with a light, spicy chili oil. I wish I had ordered a second helping!

Wasn‚Äôt as big a fan of the La-Zi chicken, which I found kind of dry and chewy. But the atmosphere is very calming and this is definitely the type of spot I would come back too with a group

Loved the immediate service. The waiters were very attentive and provided a new drink even before I asked. Loved all the food and it was super cute and delicious. Was a great place to treat myself for my self care day. I liked their version of beer options which were unique and delicious. I will be back.üòç
This place is amazing. Everything we had here was delicious! Staff were friendly and fast. Came back a second time during our trip because it was so good. Highly recommend soup dumplings!

Everything from the Dim Sum, drinks, and services here were top notch. Normally Dim Sum tastes are similar across the board from across the world, but Hey Yuet adds a flair of taste to each of its dishes that stand out slightly above which is great! The service was perfect it could not have been better. Definitely would recommend coming for Asian taste palette and non-asians as well!

Food is always super consistent and tastes so good! Favourite chinese food in the area and my go-to place for dim sum. I‚Äôve probably come here at least 10 times. We got their crispy shrimp spring rolls, turnip cakes, soup dumplings, beef rice roll, and egg tarts. Everything was amazing! I also love their shrimp rice rolls and the sweet & sour pork is great too. Highly recommend coming here with friends or even alone.

My friends and I were pleasantly surprised at this sweet Chelsea spot- everything was super fresh, all of our dim sum came out quickly. Our server kept replacing our tea and let us hang out as long as we wanted. Both of my friends are vegetarian and there were plenty of options for them. I'm looking forward to trying some of the non-vegetarian options next time. We will definitely be back!

love, love, love this place. their pasta happy hour is the best and always has me coming back. they always switch up the pastas which keeps it interesting and fun. one of my favorites was their blue crab cavatelli (hoping they bring it back soon) and now currently, the beef cheek rigatoni. a must try and must get for us are their biscuits and home made butters. always looking forward to a meal at bird dog üê¶‚Äç‚¨õüêï

Did the Chef‚Äôs Menu which is a lot of food and great value imo - enjoyed the burnt bologna ends, all the pasta options and the ribs as well. Service is very friendly and helpful with navigating the menu. Would come back to try more options.

Anthony was very good at recommending good dishes for us. He was very nice and sweet. The Doritos were really good. We did the tasting menu which was a good deal to try different dishes. The fried chicken is really good too. The inside is really cute. We sat at the bar. Make sure if you want happy hour that you walk in instead of making a reservation on an app.

And absolutely superlative dinner experience. The chef's tasting was a spectacular experience I'll be telling all my friends and family about, the service was incredible and made for an incredible night out. I'll be going back again and again.

Oh. My. GUT!!!

Half-price happy hour pasta???!!!

Yassssss!!!

From best to less best (but still awesome), get the Spaghetti (colatura, clams, seabeans, garlic, breadcrumbs), the Mafaldine (red wine brisket rib ragu, parmigiana chive), and the Papparedelle (mushrooms, cr√®me fraiche, parmigiana, lemon).

But seriously, all were chewy, tasty and loaded with comforting flavor, and trying to rank them was like choosing between my favorite children. Just come here and gorge.

Pro tip: If you can make it before 5:30pm on a weeknight, you're unlikely to wait for a table. After that, good luck.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Carnegie Diner is a gem!

This is my third time visiting, and every visit has been wonderful ‚Äî especially because of Nick, our amazing server. Nick is consistently friendly, approachable, and attentive without ever being intrusive. His great social cues and excellent service always make our experience feel extra special. He even suggests desserts that are spot-on delicious every time!

This visit, I ordered the lobster roll, and wow ‚Äî it was HUGE! It easily filled me up. The lobster was fresh and generously portioned, mixed with a flavorful herb mayo. Normally, I prefer a classic butter sauce, but this version was still absolutely delicious ‚Äî creamy, savory, and perfectly balanced, allowing the sweetness of the lobster to shine through. Every bite was satisfying and memorable!

And don‚Äôt miss out on dessert ‚Äî Carnegie Diner has a huge selection, from pastries to cakes to milkshakes. Everything looks (and tastes) irresistible, so make sure to save some room after your meal.

Highly recommend Carnegie Diner ‚Äî and if you‚Äôre lucky enough to have Nick as your server, you‚Äôre in for an even better experience!

Dropped by for dinner with a friend on a whim - we were walking in the area and had an urge for diner food. We got there around 7pm and it was quite busy, but there were still a handful of open tables (turnover was pretty fast so l don't think I saw people having to queue in general, even though there was a pretty continual flow of people in and out).

I ordered the smoked turkey triple decker, which was really delicious. The turkey and bacon were surprisingly flavourful and not too oily, and the mayo and whatever other sauce they add fit really well. The bread was really oily, but this was more of an inconvenience in terms of holding the sandwich rather than the flavour profile.

My friend had the symphony breakfast with scrambled eggs. Overall, it was fine, but nothing particularly stood out. The eggs and hash browns were pretty meh, but the fresh fruit were a nice touch.

We also had an order of the caramel French toast to share. The toast itself was really yummy, but the sliced apples on top were bland (if not sour), which unfortunately did not serve to balance how sweet everything else was (incl the massive dollop of mascarpone haha).

Portion sizes, as one would expect of classic Americana, were quite massive, and I only ate half of my sandwich. We managed to get through most(?) of the french toast and my friend did finish his breakfast plate.

Price point was a bit high but not crazy for the amount of food and the location.
I'd probably be keen to come back again, their menu definitely had a lot of good options. (I'll have to make sure to order a more reasonable amount of food so I don't walk away feeling like l'm about to explore haha)

Absolutely fantastic food and large portions. Servers re super friendly and helpful. The manager was fantastic in helping me wrap some cheesecake in needed to bring my father in a nursing home over two hours away with traffic  and stops. He and the server packed it in a box filled with ice and aluminum foil ti prevent leaking. This Jersey location is a must go to diner and it will always be on my list.

Delicious coffee and big portions. Lots of people-watching out the big bay windows while you eat. They also serve breakfast all day! The 24 layer cake looked tasty too, but alas, we had no more room to spare. This will be our go-to spot from now on anytime we're near Carnegie Hall.

Raquel was a good server. She was nice but very busy. The food was INCREDIBLE! HIGHLY RECCOMEND the pastrami burger with Brussels sprouts and it comes with some greens topped with honey mustard.
My brassiere fish was good too but the potatoes with spinach, capers and tomatoes was EXCELLENT!
I did not like the strawberry fields salad due to the Parmesan on it.
Food was slow coming out do not expect a quick in and out

Edit to add: came here a Second day for breakfast and it was ALSO amazing. Krystal was our server - she was fantastic. Very attentive and quick. I got the strawberry Nutella pancakes with side of bacon, he got an omelet and added in pastrami. They must specialize in pastrami because it‚Äôs just üî•

The poke bowl was yummy, and the estimate time was about right. But there was still a lot of people waiting to get their orders, so I ended up waiting. The dinning space was kind of tiny, so I walked away to Chelsea piers. I loved the seaweed salad!

BSFR, I have never tried this store before but from what I heard they were giving out promos. When I placed my order at LIMESALT and had full anticipation of giving this store a good review. However to my deception when I open my order, the bowl was barely filled with food, might as well put me in a bird size diet. The rice was still cold, partially frozen & corn was bland. Definitely could have tried the chipotle bowl because this store was not it.
I loved Wonder, but prices have increased significantly since the first stores appeared. I think that prices have become unreasonably high. We definitely need to work on reducing the cost.

Wonder is not just basic fast-casual fare, every restaurant in their collection really has a soul and uniqueness. And it‚Äôs perfect for couples who like different types of food :) there‚Äôs something for everyone. The corn bread is a MUST! you‚Äôre welcome~

We ordered from Uber Eats and chose Bobby Flay Steak. While waiting, we had high expectations, and fortunately, the quality didn't disappoint. It was an amazing experience! The taste of the pork chop was unlike anything I've had before. The only downside was that they didn't include silverware or napkins, which prompted another trip to reception. However, overall, everything met our expectations.

Absolutely delicious and will definitely be back!

Had four people on a Monday night before happy hour ended. We got the following:
- Appetizer olives
- Nguyen wings
- Emmy burger
- Brender pizza
- Emily pizza
- Happy Hour cocktails, wines, and beer

All items were so yummy and delicious! Good portion sizes and flavors. Would recommend everything on the menu we had.

Service was efficient. There were only three-ish parties at the restaurant around 6:30pm on a Monday so they were attentive to our table.

On their windows they have a lot of accolades. We can definitely see why‚Ä¶ it was so delicious. Excited to go back and try their other menu items!

I ordered the colony for delivery (DoorDash) and needless to say‚Ä¶ I won‚Äôt be getting pizza from this place again. $26 for this??? Where is the mozzarella? And did they run out of pepperoni and jalepe√±os or something? And the honey??? Also, who cut this? Do you see how uneven the slices are? It looks like the even skimped on the sauce! How can you charge $26 for this??????

Idk if this is one of those places that are better in person, but after receiving this sad excuse for a pizza (and spending as much as I did!), I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll even bother paying a visit to the actual place.

Save your money. There are way better pizza spots around Brooklyn.

Incredible burger that I‚Äôll be thinking about for a while. I normally prefer smash burgers with thinner patties + more veggies, but this one won me over. The patty was impossibly juicy, the caramelized onions and sauce were dripping with flavor. And the pretzel bun was surprisingly a great addition. Fries were decent too.

This city has plenty of great burgers, but this was stands out in both uniqueness and execution. Will be back.

So delicious ‚Äî usually grab their pizza and every pie I have is amazing. They also have other delicious things like burgers and meatball. I went here for my birthday a couple years ago tooüòÖ Emily‚Äôs pizza is on another level of great pizza

Great service. Wonderful staff. Salad was too salty. Wings were amazing. Fries were perfect. Other members of my party really enjoyed the hamburger and pizza options. Chilled vodka shots for the win. Good hip hop and r&b music for the atmosphere. 5/5 final score.

What an absolute amazing experience. The staff are so very warm and kind and very attentive. The food first of all is presented as literal works of art incorporating colors and textures and divine smells. Every bite I had was a dance of my senses; the texture the flavors and the scents. Every dish I tried was wonderful and so tasty. The quality of the ingredients was of the best quality. Every dish was clean and beautiful.

Had a lovely sidewalk dinner here on a Friday night. The service was quick despite the place being packed, which we appreciated. And the food was solid. We had 2 appetizers: the lotus chips w mushroom cashew dip and a crab wrapped in tofu skin, both unique and flavorful. We also had 3 different entrees: a seafood noodle soup that was pleasantly sweet and savory, a salmon noodle salad, and a braised chicken curry. A good choice for a pre-Broadway dinner or if you're in the Hell's Kitchen area.

My friend and I were here for a quick weekend trip. Everything was delicious! The Thai iced coffee was perfect - sweet but not too sweet. For food we had everything crab - the crab fried rice, soft shell crab, and crab rice dumpling curry. We were sadly too full to try the dessert here but would definitely come back!

This is the BEST Thai restaurant I‚Äôve ever been to. This restaurant is meticulous in its experience. From the menu to the complex flavor of the dishes and the immaculate service.

My only regret is that I‚Äôm here on my last day, but you can be sure I‚Äôll be back next time I‚Äôm in town!

Amazingly delicious and well executed food here. Menu is so helpful with pictures and service was delightfully pleasant. Great food options to share or enjoy alone. Honestly best Thai food Ive tasted of the dishes we had. Beautiful presentation too. Highly recommend!

Enjoyed Sunday brunch here. The cocktails were strong and tasty! So I had two of the 'About Last Night' (Bourbon, passionfruit, lemon, bitters). üòÇ We had the chef special and mercato, which was the perfect amount of food for two. Ethiopian food is one of my favorites, so I came in somewhat skeptical that this vegan joint would be as good. And no joke, it's the best Ethiopian restaurant I've ever been to. Can't wait to visit again.

Although I‚Äôm vegan, I happen to have severe peanut and tree-nut allergies. My boyfriend (who has the same allergies) & I were so surprised when our server told us the entire menu does not use nuts! (Minus one drink). We both felt comfortable eating some of the most delicious vegan food I‚Äôve ever had. The flavors, atmosphere, and staff were amazing! I can‚Äôt wait to come back!

RAS was so so delicious! Great service and super flavorful vegan Ethiopian food. Very ideal for sharing, definitely worth a try!! We tried all of the Sambusas, the Kitfo, and the Piassas which ended up being a great assortment of different flavors and vegetables! Also the hot sauce was 10/10

I decided to try someplace new  from my bucklist for lunch and landed at Ras Plant Based in Brooklyn. It was an amazing experience. The restaurant is narrow and cozy, with an exceptionally warm and welcoming staff. The d√©cor is vibrant and deeply rooted in Ethiopian culture, creating an inviting and lively atmosphere.

The menu, though limited, is curated with an All-Star lineup of vegan, plant-based dishes, complemented by a creative and imaginative drink selection. Every bite felt intentional and well-crafted. The Mushroom Tibs were a standout‚Äîexceptionally prepared, well-seasoned, and hearty, with a slight kick of spice and fresh herbs. The brown rice was perfectly cooked, with a rich, nutty flavor. Portions were balanced‚Äînot too little, not too much.

Beyond the food, I loved the authentic presentation, from the dishware to the stemware, which added to the experience. Accessibility was another highlight‚Äîstarting with the wide, flat roll-in entrance, which made getting in effortless. The romantic, cozy ambiance and the genuinely welcoming service I received as a wheelchair guest made the visit even more special.

Ras Plant Based is officially on my list of neighborhood gems, and I can‚Äôt wait to return.

Never knew vegan tasted so good, very lovely setting, atmosphere and dining experience. The food was excellent and you never missed any meat. The food was well seasoned and tasty, we had the spicy sample platter and the Dulet.

Every dish we had was amazing. If I could make a salad that good, I would be eating more greens everyday. I would come back here 100%. Love that it‚Äôs local and in the neighborhood. Can‚Äôt wait to try other menus. They change their menus every two weeks!! The ambiance is also so cute.

Totally delicious! A beautiful menu, I loved not having to pick, quick and warm service, and large portions. I really liked our server. My cocktail was great (Persephone) and my fianc√© enjoyed the wine pairing. Would definitely return!

We got married at Dinner Party this week and we couldn‚Äôt ask for a better venue. The ambiance, the food, the staff were all 10/10! Mike, Hayley and Katherine are incredible, they are highly communicative and supportive. They let us choose cocktails, and food options for our wedding, they were so flexible and made every single guest feel welcome. We were honored to share our most special moments with Dinner Party. Thank you!

Wonderful date night spot. The food is delicious, but definitely overpriced. $100 a head for 4 dishes that are mildly inventive is simply too much. This should be 20% cheaper, especially considering the location. Vibes are great, but sadly will not be returning.

My partner and I visit Dinner Party regularly, and we recently hosted our rehearsal dinner there! We couldn't imagine a more perfect evening. The atmosphere is so beautiful and warm, with lovely flower arrangements, music, candles, and hand-written place-cards. The food is always incredible: delicious and seasonal, simple yet creative. The service is so thoughtful and kind, from the planning process until the end of the night, they made everything fun and easy. We're so happy with our experience!

This place is amazing‚Ä¶ almost as amazing as the service that Yoharelin provided. We came here on a whim as it‚Äôs dog friendly‚Ä¶ and when I say it‚Äôs dog, friendly, I mean, they even have a menu specifically for dogs! Their cocktail menu is super inventive and for how delicious they are, the price is not bad at all. We had the calamari but it was so delicious that I didn‚Äôt even snap a photo. We shared the Bronzino, Parmesan truffle fries (always a fan favorite), and the brussel sprouts. Everything was delicious but I can‚Äôt say enough about Yoharelin. She was very attentive, gave wonderful recommendations, and was so sweet with our pup. The dessert with a birthday firework was a really nice touch. We will definitely be back!!! Thank you Yoharelin for making our night memorable.

My mom and I stopped in here for a quick bite to eat after a long travel day. Loved the entire look and feel of this place. We sat in the heated patio type area and it was cozy. Service was great. Great selection of wine and snacks. We had Sauvignon Blanc and tried the Mahi Mahi tacos and tuna crispy rice. We talked about those tacos for days after, they were so good! Absolutely recommend and will return!

Carlos is the best server! Very friendly, efficient, and just all around wonderful! He had a very positive attitude and really wanted us to have a great time.

We ordered a few dishes on the menu, dessert and a couple of mocktails. Everything tasted amazing! My favorites tonight were the house pasta special with Italian sausage, ravioli, and the tiramisu. Everything in the pasta blended well together, the ravioli had the right amount of filling and was smooth, and the tiramisu was very sweet - you could taste the sweetness of the cream with a hint of coffee between every bite.

Thank you for a wonderful evening, Carlos! Hope to see you again soon!

Came for brunch by myself yesterday! They had yummy French toast (*I asked for it w/o yogurt btw) and peach lemonade! The space is gorgeous and the staff are friendly and attentive! Live the vibes and I would come back again!

This place is amazing! Our server Yoharalin was great. She was very attentive and made sure we were ok throughout our entire experience. Princess our 9 year old toy poodle had a wonderful birthday and enjoyed her food and her treats!

Unique dishes that pack flavor. Their signatures such as the lobster and chicken under brick are worth sticking to regular programming. Didn‚Äôt love the notkitori as it was on the saltier side. The Egg dessert is worth saving space for. Pretty good wine list here too.

This is not just farm to table. It's an experience. Firstly, finger foods literally is meant to be eaten with the fingers. Then comes everything else. The quality of food, the flavors and unique items. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The ambiance was warm yet upscale. Great birthday dinner for sure.
Delicious and fancy restaurant. Known for spectacular Chili Lobster, steak and chicken dishes. Highly recommend! New location has a great vibe.

I came to this restaurant last week and I can tell is one of my favorites In tribecca. Food, drinks, desserts, everything was delicious.
Also the place is fancy and has a great ambience.
Thanks to Luis for his attention, he gave us the best recommendations üçπ

Food and cocktails were excellent!! Even though our table wasn‚Äôt ready at the time of our reservation, staff were apologetic and comped a glass of wine and an appetizer for the wait. The atmosphere of this restaurant is very cozy and overall we had a great time! We would definitely come back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood. Their short rib hummus is *out of this world*. Their pita is perfection. We also really liked their take on caesar salad. The cocktail options were very interesting as well. Will definitely be returning again and again!

Went on a Friday night - at 7pm it was not so packed but by 8pm it was a full house!
A cute little spot in the neighbourhood.
We got the following:
Short rib shawarma hummus - yum! I wish it came with more pita. The pita was delicious as well!!
Falafel - our waitress told us it is not a traditional kind, it is creamy inside, and it surely is! And we don‚Äôt mind it, quite interesting and yummy!

Lamb shank - the price tag is high, and it is a tad bit salty but works very well with the cabbage and the mini pita breads!

We were so full so we barely ate the lamb and got it to go. The sad part was when we got home, we realised that the restaurant packed the meat but not any of the sauce and cabbage and hummus that we barely touched.:(

Drinks are alright - do appreciate a decent pour of the wine!

*VIBES*
Lovely restaurant! Great friendly and quick service with a cozy but spacious ambiance. Came here for dinner on a Friday night with a reservation.

*FOOD*
The mushroom hummus was my favorite, it was nice and garlicky, served with freshly made pita bread.

The brussel sprouts were roasted to perfection, but a bit too sweet from the honey.

I wouldn‚Äôt get the Blue Crab Kousa again, there wasn‚Äôt much flavor aside from the mint and the dish was mainly squash.

Also got a few drinks but they weren‚Äôt too special.

Overall would recommend this restaurant mainly for the hummus and nice atmosphere.

Food was great, drinks probably even better, but I feel cheated.

We tried many appetizers and all of them tasted great. I was surprised by how good some of them were.

Shawarma was okay, they just wasted good ingredients on an unbalanced dish that only sounds good on paper. The meat is too rich and the acidity of vegetables can't cut through all the fat.

Their pricing model of the dips felt like a scam. One costs $15 (which is already a lot) and it comes with a single pita. Inevitably you finish your pita before the dip runs out and you are now forced to order more pitas and they are $4 each. Instead of calling it a $19 dip which people would not buy. Instead, they make it seem like you ordered something extra.

Unlike most Mediterranean restaurants they don't have dip sets or a "5 pita bundle".

My experience at Boutros had such a strong start with the appetizers. The honey truffle labne was a genius innovation, and a clear standout for me. We also tried the blue crab kousa, which was a brilliant contemporary take on a Lebanese/Syrian classic. I also really appreciate the bread that‚Äôs made here, including the za‚Äôatar pita as they were so fluffy and delicious. Unfortunately, however, the lamb shank shawarma ended up being way too salty (and I have a very high salt tolerance), but I still ended up eating the whole thing.

This is a top 10 dining experience of my entire life. Hands down. Multiple things I ate here are some of the best things I have ever eaten. Hands down.

For $70 a person for the quality and variety of everything I ate, one of the best deals in this country. Worth every penny.

If you go, get the seafood noodles, honey butter chips, and cheesy grits. Life changing. And do the family meal.

KJUN has been on my "want to try" list since moving to New York, so I was very happy to walk in yesterday. Service was quick, attentive, and the food was just absolutely delicious. I've watched like 15 seasons of Top Chef in the past month so it's all begun to blur together a little, and I was so happy, when watching Season 19, to see that a contestant owns KJUN, and it just furthered my desire to go. And then yesterday, somehow, I had a complete brain fart and only remembered it was Chef Jae when I heard her voice. Chef Jae, if you ever see this, your food is phenomenal, and A+ service. This is what dining should be, comfortable, tasty, and so good for the soul. The menu tastes exactly as it's described: a Korean-Cajun mix. It was flavorful, bold, unexpected and just so, so, so satisfying on a beautiful sunny day. Highlights were the hush puppies, rice & beans, and fried chicken. So basically the entire meal.

I don‚Äôt know why it‚Äôs taken me so long to write a review! This place is really really special. My hands down favorites are the kimchi jambalaya, the shrimp po boy, and the gumbo. Also the tomato and okra kimchi are so unique and absolute flavor bombs. I‚Äôm obsessed. If you haven‚Äôt tried the fresh honey potato chips omg you have to.  The food is yummy, comforting, fun and so flavorful. You won‚Äôt find anything like this anywhere else and the owner is the absolute best. You‚Äôll want to go back again and again, or order delivery, which I do every time I get a craving. I‚Äôm a Korean and I approve

Incredible dining experience! Food, service, ambiance were 10/10. We did the dinner for 2 and everything we chose was delicious. Our server was very attentive and friendly. Chef Jae has created a masterpiece with this place. Can‚Äôt wait to go back and more items on the menu!

Updated review: the owner took the time to follow up and was understanding and apologetic. Even the best businesses have off moments, and I personally hold the ones who are receptive and responsive to feedback in very high regard. While the food was good, I wasn‚Äôt sure that I‚Äôd come back at the end of our meal; but will definitely give them another shot, and bring others with me for the experience.

Original review: If I were solely rating on the flavor of the food and service during our meal, it'd be 4 stars; but I'm taking a couple stars off for lack of internal communication which made for a rather stressful start to our meal, and a rushed end. We had a reservation weeks in advance for a larger party, none of us had been there before and this was a reunion of sorts. Not only this; but we had already paid half the bill (which included a 20% tip) up front. So when we arrived that were told that they were not expecting us, we were rather annoyed and disappointed. To be fair, the hostess did a GREAT job pivoting, contacting the manager and made it work in the end; but we were left with a little over an hour to dine, and there was some confusion at the end around the rest of the payment as well.
The food and food service itself was quite good, and while we left pretty satisfied, we were not quite full, which was a bit disappointing, as I was assured that the chef would take "good care" of large family meals, when I asked about how many dishes would be served. For example, we were only given one serving of the seafood jjajagmyun. We kept waiting for them to bring another as one serving seemed a bit silly to split amongst 7 people, but that's all we got ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
In short, the food was good, the people working did the best they could with what they were dealt; but the experience was a bit of a letdown.

Have been here for lunch and dinner. It gets busy during dinner time. Service was good and fast. Ive seen them explain to people how to eat certain dishes if they've never eaten it before, which is great because they want their customers to experience and enjoy the food.
Favorite dishes is the Bahn Xeo and Tet noodles.
The banh xeo is so refreshing to have as a starter. Perfect bite of freshness from the mint, pickeled carrots and veggies along with the seafood. The tet noodles buttery, garlic, and savory.

This place was a great surprise for us. Probably the best Vietnamese food I ate all year. The tastes were really authentic, gentle and yet forceful.
We had the spring roll, the papaya-shrimp salad and the crepe for appetizers and two pho and garlic noodles for entree. Everything was tasty and recommended.
The service was exceptional, the food came in minutes!

Came here for lunch with a friend and was very much delighted! I ordered the vermicelli noodle bowl with spicy lemongrass beef which was delicious in every bite. A great balance of tender meat, the sour and savory flavors of Vietnamese cuisine. The servers also tended to our table just the right amount (clearly were there without being overbearing). A good spot for a reasonably priced lunch without breaking the bank!

Madam Vo is a gem of NY city! My husband and I used to come here for 7 years already and even after we moved states whenever we come visit it‚Äôs our number one spot for multiple reasons. Starting with amazingly delicious food that never disappoints, we met with an owner and his sweet wife and you can see in their attitude how much they care for their food to represent their family values and recipes. Our favorites are beef and vegan pho, rice with shrimps and fried spring rollsüôåüèª
Team who works there is always incredibly nice and considerate and majority of servers been there for years which  is telling and creates a feeling coming back to a family! Jack, Kidd and Base are absolute starsü´∂üèª
We always recommend it to our friends visiting the town and it becomes their favorite place too!

This spot has become my go-to for Vietnamese comfort food, and it never disappoints. This time, I tried their Mushroom Pho, and wow‚Äîit was absolutely delicious! The timing couldn‚Äôt have been better; it was raining outside, making the warm, flavorful broth even more comforting.

The restaurant is spacious, perfect for accommodating large groups. I was there with a friend, and since it was busy, we opted to sit at the bar. The service was impressively quick, and the staff was incredibly warm and welcoming. Bonus: the portions are generous, and the pricing feels very fair for the quality and quantity.

The brunch experience was incredible. We took from the classic temaki selection and everything we tried was absolutely delicious (salmon avocado was the best). Those house made crispy rice chips were seriously addictive. Ambiance was warm and inviting & service was very kind. Will definitely be back !

We went on a busy night with no reservation and they were able to put us at the bar! The bartender was so kind. He made us great drinks and helped us with the menu. Everything we had was amazing! We each got one of the samplers and an added one. I highly recommend getting a variety. The atmosphere is very ascetically pleasing also! Very cute and clean!

Good food, good ambiance, good service. Didn't try the drinks menu. Hot green tea was nice. Tempura a little undercooked inside on the calamari but we didn't come there for the appetizers. Hand rolls were good. Staff friendly. The whole menu is a la carte, only the 3 sets at the bottom of the menu are fixed price. A tad confusing because at the top of the temaki section the menu says "choose any five".

The restaurant is cute and cozy, and the staff is friendly. The ambiance can be a bit loud, so you‚Äôll need to stay close to talk, but overall, it‚Äôs a great spot for a casual dinner. The seafood is fresh, and I love the combination of different ingredients‚Äîit adds more layers to the roll. My favorite is the salmon skin. All the appetizers we tried were great. I‚Äôll definitely come back!

Specializing in hand rolls, this restaurant was a good take on sushi! They have a unique serving technique to keep the nori very crisp so when you take a bite, the nori crunches apart like a taco shell.

The combinations were great with a good variety of flavors. The tempura and mushroom dip were great appetizers and the clam soup was fresh.

Inside, the vibe is modern but relaxed. No need to dress up or wear anything specific.

Definitely come check it out! Fun for something new and would recommend for any sushi lovers.

I really liked their broccolini. Surprisingly, it was spicy and seasoned with cumin, which made it really interesting and flavorful. The steak and chicken were also good, though the prices are on the higher side. The chicken was a bit dry, so I‚Äôd recommend the steak over the chicken. Also, a small tip: when ordering, it‚Äôs better to ask for a level of doneness that‚Äôs slightly rarer than what you actually want. For example, if you want it medium, order medium rare to avoid it being overcooked.

The restaurant‚Äôs environment is nice. The high ceiling gives the space an open and airy feel, and the colorful bottles and books on the wall look really cozy and relaxed under the sunlight. It creates a very laid-back vibe. That said, if you‚Äôre not ordering drinks, don‚Äôt expect much extra attention from the staff. The service is fine, but i feel the place leans more towards being a bar. If you‚Äôre hanging out on Roosevelt Island and want a spot to chill for a bit, I‚Äôd still recommend stopping by.

I believe this place is inside some hotel. We found it through Google maps when visiting the island, just wanted to eat and rest a bit. I have to mention pleasant and well drilled staff right away, so hat off to the manager. Place is lovely inside and out, unique look of a library mixed with a bar and hotel lobby. View was nothing special but it had plenty of light. Food was great, I had their burger ( brunch menu, I believe) with tater tots (top notch). They forgot to add bacon, but I wasn't upset because I still got STUFFED, plus they didn't charge for the bacon so that's nice. Draft beer was good, wife was raving about her cocktail and I pecked at her ceasar salad which was perfect with added grillef chicken. Pleasant music added to the ambiance. Joint bathroom, while clean, is kinda weird. It had tiny waiting area with 4 doors that lead to small cabins, waiting area also had the sink and hand drier, it was kinda cramped and a bit weird because its unisex and everyone is shuffling around. Anyway, its not restaurants fault, its the hotel design. When I'm visiting the island again, and I'm hungry or just want a drink, I'm definitely popping back in. To good times!

I saw some low rated reviews and decided to write a review.

I‚Äôve been going Anything at all for several years now. There are ups and downs in taste and service. I mostly had good experiences though.

Food:
I figured the taste is different in a good way and a bad way depending on the time I dine in. They try to use seasonal ingredients and it changes the vegetable and fruit components on the dish. I think this is good try and not a major change of the main flavor.
I assume there are different kitchen staffs and differently cook meats..? Sometimes, proteins are burnt till taste bitter. Especially, on my last visit, I only tasted bitterness from my sandwich. I think the consistency of taste is really important. Like, I expect to have the same burger whenever I go to this place but it is disappointing when it doesn‚Äôt taste the same.

Service:
Most of staffs are friendly and willing to explain things according to customer‚Äôs needs. But, I had some staffs who didn‚Äôt explain delay on the food or rush out to eat or not getting what‚Äôs asked for.

Overall, I had better experience brunch than dinner. Apparently, their burger is my and my husband‚Äôs favorite burger in New York City. We always bring people when someone visits us. 70% was successful. Everyone was impressed with the taste, atmosphere, and service. However, we sometimes regretted bringing people and having such an important occasion here due to the inconsistencies I mentioned.

As if they can keep the consistency of food and services, I can say they have beautiful aesthetics and atmosphere. I love how their food is organic and high quality.

Slow service and at times bizarre! But the food was always delicious! Had breakfast, lunch and dinner here while staying at the Graduate for 5 nights. The burger is so so so good!!!  The atmosphere is cool, the big windows and the books and the danish modern/mid century modern decor is stylish and comfortable. Didn‚Äôt know until the last night I stayed they have dessert!

Located at 22 N Loop Rd, New York, NY 10044, Anything At All is a charming venue that offers a warm and inviting atmosphere. I discovered this hidden gem through a recommendation from the hotel where I was staying, and it turned out to be a wonderful way to start my day.¬† The area surrounding Anything At All is serene and picturesque. Nestled in a quiet neighborhood, it provides a welcome escape from the bustling city. The peaceful surroundings create a pleasant ambiance that complements the cozy atmosphere of the venue.¬† Upon entering, I was greeted by friendly staff who exudes warmth and hospitality. Their attentive service made me feel right at home. The pleasant interactions and promptness added to the overall positive experience.¬† Now, let's talk about the highlight of the morning‚Äîthe food! Anything At All boasts an amazing variety of breakfast foods that cater to all taste preferences. Whether you're a fan of sweet or savor

Visiting this restaurant was an unforgettable experience!
The breathtaking panoramic view of New York City alone is worth the visit ‚Äî it feels like you‚Äôre dining among the stars. The food was absolutely exquisite: every dish was a masterpiece, beautifully presented and bursting with flavor.
The service was impeccable ‚Äî warm, attentive, and genuinely caring. We were also surprised with thoughtful compliments from the chef, which made the evening even more special.
A perfect place for anyone looking to combine world-class cuisine with an unforgettable atmosphere. Highly recommend!

The food here is unreal, but the view puts it over the top. I loved everything about this experience. The service was great, the cocktails delicious, and the decor of the dining room was stunning. It was definitely worth the price tag.

I visited a couple of months ago, and it was definitely a surprisingly great dining experience. Every dish was impeccable - texture, taste, everything hit the spot. Also the view is amazing. You can see the Brooklyn bridge if you are seated at the right table. Although it is a bit loud and crowded, I would definitely recommend this place. This would be the ideal place for you, especially if you want to do fine dining without spending like $200 or $300 per person. Good place for special occasions!! Highly recommend. I've been living in the city for almost 10 years and can't believe I just finally checked this place out!!

We tried out Manhatta restaurant when visiting New York City this time - 4 years after living in the area. We were recommended this modern restaurant, perched sixty floors up in the financial district of the city, by a few friends living in the area still. I can highly recommend it. The food was exciting, tasteful and delicious, the service great and the view breathtaking. If you do not want to go for a several course dinner, it's possible to order a hamburger in the bar or drop by for a drink too. I do agree that Manhatta is a love letter to New York City.¬†We will be back for sure ü•∞

We came for dinner to celebrate our anniversary. From the moment we arrived, the staff were professional and attentive, making us feel truly special.
The food was absolutely phenomenal. Each dish is a work of art, both in presentation and flavor. The staff described every course.
Breathtaking views, delicious food and the best service made the experience unforgettable!
Highly recommended!

I‚Äôve been wanting to go to Rampoldi for quite some time now and I decided it was the perfect place to have dinner for my 30th birthday. It was the cherry on top to my absolute perfect solo day. Milena and Cristian were fantastic and checked in with me multiple times throughout dinner. When I was seated at my table to the hostess handed me the history book about the beginnings of Rampoldi and I can‚Äôt decided what was better: the food or learning about the history. Every was so delicious and I felt so welcomed. The absolute great and perfect ending for my birthday. Thank you for having me!

I recently dined at Rampoldi New York, and was thoroughly impressed by the experience. The restaurant‚Äôs ambiance is stunning, creating a luxurious setting. I sat by the bar and the staff were attentive and ensured a seamless dining experience.

The highlight of my meal was the John Dory which was delicious and light. I also sampled the Tuna Carpaccio as an appetizer, which was fresh and beautifully presented.

We went here to celebrate our anniversary (not a big milestone), and I was truly impressed by the decor. The restaurant has a beautiful and elegant interior with red and pink shades.
We had :
Salmon tartare ‚Äì flavorful and beautifully presented.
Crispy calamari with zucchini ‚Äì tasty and cooked just right.
Scallops ‚Äì tender and generous portion (we got eight!).
Filet de b≈ìuf  with mashed potatoes and creamy sauce ‚Äì perfectly cooked.
Chocolate cake with ice cream ‚Äì absolutely delicious!
The service started off friendly and attentive. However, as the evening progressed, our server became less attentive, focusing more on other tables despite the restaurant not being particularly busy. Our wine bottle was placed on a stand near our table, so we ended up pouring our own glasses. This wasn‚Äôt a major issue for us and perhaps even allowed us to enjoy our meal at a more relaxed pace.
Overall, it was a good dining experience with tasty food and a lovely atmosphere.

Unforgettable Valentine's dinner, every moment felt special, and I couldn't have asked for a better evening. Exceptional cuisine, attentive service, and magical atmosphere. A heartfelt thank you to Rampoldi for an impeccable Valentine's dining experience, plus the live music on that special night.

We celebrated my friends birthday here and I loved this place.

It feels soooo European (in a good way).

For food we ordered bunch of stuff for the table - salmon tartare, buratta , pizza with truffles, terrin, shrimp cocktail.

For main course - salmon, beef, duck and like 80% of our table got scallops which were delicious!

Nice music , nice atmosphere, good service.

Petra and Sergio are amazing!! The food is unbelievable, the salt and pepper shrimp, scallop risotto, key lime pie, and lettuce wedges are insane. The ambience on the patio, and the service are highlights of this restaurant. We are from Seattle and researched a lot of restaurants before we came and we are so glad we chose this one. The highlight of our trip!!

I visited Traif on a very busy Saturday evening shift so your service experience might be very different if you visit on a quiet weekday.

We tried the set menu, the pricing is amazing, $58/p for an eight course meal (that‚Äôs about $80/p after tax and 20% tip before drinks of course). Some of the dishes were good including the scallop risotto, but others felt like too many different flavors. Ex. The gnocchi with coconut, mushrooms, spices, etc. Also some of the dishes were lukewarm or cold. Ex. The pork. And the presentation was not there. (I might be asking too much for a $58 meal).

My biggest issue was with the speed. We felt like we were being rushed as they have to go through 8 courses in less than 2hrs and turn tables. Some courses came before we were done with the previous one. The service level felt more like a diner. In some ways it was like an America tapas place without the relaxed atmosphere.

It will help the restaurant to reduce the number of courses to four or five (still charge the same price) so the quality of dishes can improve, severs are not rushing and costumers can slowdown and savor the chef‚Äôs vision.

Great service and vibes. Food however was mediocre. It‚Äôs a very affordable pre fixe for a reason‚Ä¶ you get 8 entrees and 2 desserts. Each ‚Äúentree‚Äù is a small plate (tapa style) shared between your group‚Ä¶ as opposed to each person getting their own small plate despite paying their own $59pp.

Loved the rib and scallop. Great panna cotta and doughnut. Most entrees missed. The pasta tasted like out of a box, including the sauce. The fried shrimp was something I could‚Äôve gotten from Panda Express. Most dishes were overly sauced - couldn‚Äôt even taste the tartare!

I was hesitant to get the tasting menu at first because I wasn‚Äôt too hungry, but I‚Äôm so glad I did! Every dish was exciting and different. I‚Äôm glad I got to try so many dishes I would‚Äôve have ordered a la carte. The tasting menu (8 dishes with 2 desserts) is the most affordable one if seen in New York. Will definitely be back - even to sit at the bar and get a few small bites. Two chefs and a bartender. So simple yet so great

We opted for the Chef‚Äôs selection and it was very reasonable for the amount of food!
We had 8 dishes and 2 desserts and they were portioned accordingly for 2 people. Photos shown are for 2 people. Great selection and quality of food. A lovely treat during our trip to NYC!

Overall rating: 4.6
Price: $61.38 per w/ tax & tip

It‚Äôs very rare for me to see fancy Mexican. So I was very excited to try this place. I got a reservation around 7, but it definitely isn‚Äôt needed & a walk-in is easily attainable. The restaurant is absolutely beautiful and reminds me of my time in Mexico City. This is a weird statement, but I‚Äôm obsessed with the bathroom. It‚Äôs so welcoming and warm and it smells lovely. Really good job.

I came with a new friend so when I saw bar seats available I immediately took them vs going for a table. While the restaurant is rich in culture, around the corner of the bar was what felt like storage or trash. Since it‚Äôs a fancier place, they should consider hiding that in a closet or in the back versus next to a bar.

What got me here is watching a TikTok talk about how & how long they make their corn tortillas. So when I learned happy hour is until 7pm & it includes a free steak taco, I was very excited. Unfortunately it was hard and not good. I can do simple items when the seasoning is there. But it wasn‚Äôt. Extremely disappointing. Should add an avocado crema or something.

We ended up only getting guacamole & the tuna tostado. The guacamole was big and a great portion. The tuna tostado was very tasty and a nice redemption. But I definitely want to come back & try other items before a fair review. Also just noting there was only one waiter and one bartender. The bartender additionally acted as a waiter and the waiter also acted as a hostess. It‚Äôs a big place, so was a bit surprised they didn‚Äôt have a 3rd person.
Had an incredible meal here. Truly a gem in Bushwick. Our Server Dannie was very attentive and took such great care of us. Every dish we had was flavorful and unique. A  must visit. Thanks again!

First and foremost, the food was totally out of this world. It was creative, uses of chicken, liver pate on a tostada, it was innovative, pork shank with fall off the bone, fat and meat. Everything they‚Äôre doing is creative and culinary and delicious. The vibe was fun, funky fresh, and the service was great.

A Hidden Gem of Mexican Cuisine in Brooklyn!

At first glance, you might be tempted to judge this restaurant by its exterior or the surrounding area ‚Äì but don‚Äôt make that mistake! Once you step inside, you‚Äôre greeted by a warm and inviting interior. The d√©cor is simple, yet filled with charming Mexican accents that set a promising tone for what‚Äôs to come.

The staff here is exceptionally friendly and attentive, making you feel genuinely welcome. It‚Äôs not just about great service; it‚Äôs an experience that makes you feel like you‚Äôve been taken to Mexico.

The menu is thoughtfully curated ‚Äì not overwhelming, but with enough variety to offer some truly unique dishes and creative combinations. Every dish I tried was absolutely delicious, and, without a doubt, among the best Mexican food I‚Äôve ever had.

And the best part? The prices are quite reasonable, especially considering the high quality of both, the food and service.

In summary, even if you have to travel a bit to get here, and even if the area doesn‚Äôt initially seem appealing, the exceptional food, outstanding service, and fantastic drinks make it all worthwhile. A huge thank you to the chef and his team!

This is a place you‚Äôll want to return to, again and again.
I wholeheartedly recommend Sobre Masa ‚Äì give it a try, and I promise, it won‚Äôt be your last visit!

We had the Carnitas, Guac with salsas and chips, Gordita, and the mole with broccolini, cocktails and beer.

We felt the food was only OK. The flavors were good but not incredible, for the price point we expected better flavors and quality. Our favorite dish was the carnitas tacos, the tortillas were freshly made but were served lukewarm, and the carnitas were perfectly fatty and flavorful with the toppings. We were excited to try the fresh, home made chips but they were a bit stale, they may have been made earlier in the day or the day before. We were expecting piping hot out of the oven chips with a lot of crunch.

The restaurant could work on perfecting their flavors and improving the serving quality (increase the food temperature). The experience was short of our expectations but again the food was not bad, but it was only OK. Ambiance was good. Service was incredible - kind and warm, and attentive to our needs.

Absolutely amazing experience! Loved our server Caleb! He did some soju bombs with us! The whole place was a vibe and the food was stellar!!! Definitely make reservations we'll in advance. It's not a large place but it's well worth the experience to get a chance to eat there! The popcorn chicken, mushroom bibimbap, and the Seoul'sbury Steak were to die for! I loved it all and well definitely go back if I get a chance!

A fresh and casual spot serving up some great tastes! Restaurant fills up quick, but the space has decor and nice service. The popcorn chicken was simply awesome and a great starter to pair with the mushroom bibimbap or the toast roll. The Deli bagel is super creative dessert and a memorable one for me.

The most amazing dinner I have had in awhile. The korean-twist on the dishes were so genius and tasted so good, neat, and not too salty either or greasy. Our server Caleb was incredibly friendly, funny, and welcoming with welcome shots too! Would def recommend and come here again !!

The popcorn chicken was delicious. The ribs were so soft and juicy, they were falling apart from the bone once I tried to grab them.
Everthying else we had was amazing, super tasty.

My best friend and I were in the city to celebrate our 40th birthday. We were supposed to go to another restaurant, but they had an issue and had to close for the day. The other restaurant ensured we wouldn't be left empty-handed, talked to Anne from C as in Charlie, and got us a reservation that night.

As you can see from the photos, the food was delicious! There was not one thing we tried that was not good. Add to that the AMAZING and sometimes PHENOMENAL and over-the-top hospitality experience from everyone on the team, and you have got yourself a must-visit place.

Thank you, Anne and the C as in Charlie team, for making this night memorable. We will definitely be back.

This restaurant is absolutely fantastic and beautiful! We chose it to celebrate our engagement, and the team truly went above and beyond to make our evening special. The atmosphere is incredible ‚Äì a truly high-end and elegant setting. The staff is extremely attentive and made us feel so well cared for. They even surprised us with a bigger table and some complementary food items, which was such a thoughtful touch. Everything we ordered, from the classic Caesar salad to the perfectly cooked bacon-wrapped scallops and the absolutely delicious steaks, was phenomenal. Seriously, it was some of the best food I've ever had! This restaurant definitely made our engagement celebration unforgettable.

An early mother's day dinner ended amazing. I want to thank our server Dino for making it an wonderful dinner. He was attentive to our needs, knowledgeable about the menu, and made excellent recommendations. Food was 5/5. Service 5/5

WOW!!! We had an amazing meal at Bourbon Steak. The food was sensational - you must try the French Onion Soup, the Porterhouse steak, Brussel Sprouts, and Banana Tart. The steak in particular was out-of-this-world: juicy, tender, and perfectly cooked to our preferred medium rare. A dollop of truffle butter really elevated it to the next level! The service was also lovely - Nora took really good care of us, and made us feel welcome and at home. Definitely one of the top steakhouses in NYC. Can‚Äôt wait to come back again!

Experience was a 10/10 overall. The service was fantastic. The food was spectacular. The ambience was great. Every dish that was served me was fantastic with a glass of Dom & then tried some wine whites and then into some burgundy. My favorite was the ribeye. I dined here on Christmas evening so I had the prefixed Christmas 2024 menu. Everything was truly delicious, I cannot wait to return.

Wonderful eating experience and atmosphere. The restaurant is located inside of the Marriott across from Central Park. The food was incredible and the service was top notch. I went all out and had the 14oz wagyu and it was absolutely delicious. We got dessert as well but I forgot to take a photo of it because it was so good.
