We came here Sunday for brunch and we were greeted by the most pleasant host and hostess, it was a quick 10minute wait and we were in! Waitress was great too and as soon as we sat down we were handed menus and given water. She was able to switch out my water glass that appeared a little run down making it look dirty. No prob!
Food came out quick and hot and most importantly it was banginnn! We had huevo rancheros, chicken and waffles, the kale Caesar salad with anchovies (best part!) and for dessert the key lime pie and a cappuccino. We wouldn‚Äôt order the key lime again because it didn‚Äôt quite taste like your typical key lime pie and it was orange hue that we were told was that color because of the eggs. ü•¥
Overall we really enjoyed this place and will return.
Go here!!!

I have been here many times and always bring friends and visitors to eat here. Everything on the menu is delicious, I‚Äôve had pretty much every dinner option. Tonight I had the halibut and was not disappointed. I tell everyone about this establishment.

I only took this one photo because the food was generally uninspiring, particularly for a semi-expensive hyped up restaurant. I can‚Äôt speak for the brunch, and their drinks are decent, but what we had off the dinner menu was truly mid. Parts of the steak was sinewy and inedible, and we ordered the au poivre sauce which was bland, too pale in color, and lacked the peppery kick that au poivre is meant to have. It ended up tasting like mid buttery mushroom gravy. Thankfully service was good and very accommodating and let us switch to the chimichurri sauce. Fries were good but they had no aioli, just mayo (which we had to ask for). The gem salad was overdressed and unrefined‚Äîfelt like something you‚Äôd slap together at home. There were random big chunks of celery and fennel in it that were not cut in an enticing enough shape for a $16 salad. And the chicken pot pie lacked oomph and richness‚Äîthe puff pastry crust was too flaky, as in it basically shattered and dissolved into ultra thin flakes that were unable to carry the cream sauce, and the chicken filling was also kind of bland, lacking that classic comforting celery salt flavor and mostly consisted of big chunks of mushroom. I don‚Äôt mind mushrooms in a pot pie but this was too mushroom forward, and also I prefer when there are green peas in a pot pie. Overall I‚Äôd say if you‚Äôre looking for fort green vibes and you‚Äôre happy to drink in some ambience and have mid food then you‚Äôd like it here. Plenty of people do. But for the price and what it promises we were disappointed.

A decent eatery near the park, open relatively early, we walked in around 4pm on Saturday for early dinner. They had a very limited early menu (the main dinner menu starts at 5pm) - the raw bar and a burger were available. The burger was good but with a hard chewy pickle, my friend's poke was not much different from a regular tuna tartar and quite small. The gluhwein comes from a pre-made mixture (white wine based) and gets warmed with a coffee machine steamer, it was way too sweet. But wine selection is decent including interesting orange wines.
Overall a casual neighborhood vibe with a local crowd of all sorts.

I came here for Sunday brunch with my friends. Our reservation was for 11:45 AM - by about 12:15 PM the restaurant was very busy. We sat in a comfy booth - we all loved the fried chicken & waffles. We also tried the French dip sandwich with fries - we liked it but wouldn‚Äôt order it again. We loved dipping the fries into the French dip! We indulged in mango mimosas and mango lemonades with rum. The drinks were amazing! I cannot wait to return next time I‚Äôm in Brooklyn.

Wait time wasn‚Äôt too bad, and service was splendid. I had the Gang Pu(high spice level) and fried it oyster mushrooms that were both packed with flavor. The coconut curry was smooth, creamy, and spicy, and the grab was tender and juicy. Fried oyster mushrooms were crispy, and the sweet chili sauce complimented the mushrooms. Mango sticky rice for dessert. Did NOT disappoint at all. Will be back for certain.

I‚Äôm not a local of Brooklyn, but this restaurant is absolutely worth the trip from Queens! The food here is incredible, and as someone from Thailand, I can confidently say it‚Äôs authentic. I highly recommend the Yum Mangosteen‚Äîit‚Äôs such a unique dish that you can‚Äôt easily find anywhere else in NYC. The other dishes I tried were also amazing. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back next time!
Follow for more @notsoniaa on my instagram ‚ù§Ô∏è

I order for delivery this time and food still delicious as before. Even the restaurant is kind of far from my home, but food came on time and everything was correct. I still ordered Hoy jor, that is my favorite appetizer, Gai tod, Veg Dumpling: Rice dumpling with peanut, shallot, radish, cilantro, fried garlic and spicy sour pork salad.

My big bro is the only friend I have who can eat as much as me. Whenever we get together the amount of food we consume is biblical.

We have been trying to expand our search for good restaurants outside of our normal stomping grounds, and decided on Tong, as it has been on the Michelin guide list 4 years in a row. 4-peat is crazy. Although, what does the Michelin man really know about food?

We hopped off the L-Train in Bushwick and made the short walk to Tong, through brightly painted warehouses that you can‚Äôt tell if they are occupied or empty. Bushwick is so unique.

We arrived ready to EAT. We sat down and deliberated over the menu for longer than I care to admit, and decided on the following:

Beef tartare, Yum Naem, Oysters, Beef Pad See Ew, Crab Curry, Chicken Green Curry, Massaman Brisket, Fried Branzino, and the Fillet Branzino. A laughable amount of food. I don‚Äôt know why we thought we could eat all that.

When you sit down, the servers first question is ‚Äúare you guys okay with spicy food?‚Äù Big bro confidently nodded his head with a look of slight disrespect on his face as if to say ‚Äúdo you know who I am?!‚Äù Next thing I know he‚Äôs running to the bathroom to go splash some water on his face after 1 bite of the crab curry. Food can be SPICY in here so if you can‚Äôt handle the heat, get out of the kitchen.

I normally only highlight one dish to try and keep these reviews short, but this food was sensational, so imma highlight a few. Our favorites were the Fried Branzino, Massaman Brisket, and the Pad See Ew.

The Fried Branzino is really what will bring me back here. It will keep me up at night thinking about how good this was. You get the entire fish seasoned with turmeric, black pepper, fried garlic, and lemongrass. It was the perfect dish.

The owner, Pat, came over to our table to talk to us for a bit. She was such a sweetheart, and so passionate. She also told us that they order the Pad See Ew noodles fresh every single morning from this market close by. Running a restaurant must be so hard, so shout out to Pat.

We pride ourselves on never taking leftovers, but we took a huge L here. We walked out of here like a couple of DORKS with bags of food. I felt like a little kid bringing my lunch to school smh.

Great service, great people, and great food in here. I‚Äôll be back.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

Ordered to go items from here (been ordering from here since it opened) and was greeted by a curt and not very polite worker. The restaurant got my to go order wrong (definitely not crab fried rice or Pad Pak) and when I called to let them know, the same person who gave us the bag with the wrong food in it was not very apologetic, and just explained I can either get a  refund or go back to the restaurant to get the food‚Ä¶ as if I wasn‚Äôt already there to get the food in the first place. Sad that this is the service we received when we often go here and recommend it to others. That won‚Äôt be happening anymore. Go to Chachawan on Woodward Avenue instead! Amazing customer service and the food is always top notch. Tong is an expensive restaurant with mediocre service (and sometimes too salty of food to be honest).

Stop by after service and was looking for some Red Snapper to go. They didn't have it, but I still ordered.  The shrimp tempura sandwich and I had 2 orders of their 6 piece oysters.  They were excellent.  Tess, the bartender, was very good and made the perfect old fashion. Ella, who seated me, was fun... great staff and atmosphere.  Forgot to take pics of my food but compliments to the chef.

Overall rating: 4.6

I‚Äôve been wanting to go here for ages very excited to try Cambodian food, but never had the time. Whenever I looked the reservations were always booked, so when I went I got one of the earlier times. NOTE: do not let the lack of resos deter you and just walk-in. My friend and I shared appetizers & got the following:
- Lady lime oysters: 3/5 ehhhh nothing special for the price
- Stir fried morning glory: 4/5 good
- chicken: 3/5 ok. This doesn‚Äôt seem to be on the menu anymore.

I can‚Äôt say I really felt like I got a unique Cambodian experience. Def more fusion than I wanted & there were more drink options vs food. I was missing different dishes . I loved the drinks though! And they have some type of happy hour deal on Wednesday bc the recent graduates were everywhere. Don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be coming back but it‚Äôs worth checking out!

Delicious food and good vibe. Was here for a special guest chef menu of nouveau Cambodian. Calling it a Cambodian food is not quite fitting and neither can I distinguish the subtle flavour or characteristic found in the typical cuisine ( lack of knowledge therefore)

So what is it exactly? I just know that we clean the plates and wanted to come back and sample the regular menu next time. Portions were definitely on the smaller side.

Unfortunately the short rib was unavailable but overall the meal was good.

Fried chicken and the duck were great mains and the morning glory was very flavorful. I think the crab fried rice was a slight miss because it lacked flavor and the fried rice noodles was interesting but definitely too saucey.

Overall cute restaurant and would recommend.

Lula Mae is the perfect mix of great food and great atmosphere. The Menu has a great mix of shareable dishes and the staff is very knowledgeable in terms of making recommendations.

During my visit I sat at the bar so I was able to take advantage of the happy hour specials (select $10 drinks and dishes). On the happy hour menu the Cha Kwai is a savory almost beignet style fried bread and the wings have a distinct flavor profile as well.

As a main the Duck Salat was a perfect way to end with an entree sized portion dish.

While the main dining room is pretty standard, there is a back room that it has a lounge vibe which also hosts a DJ on select nights. If looking for more of a intimate date vibe, definitely try to get the back room if available.

Firstly, the waitress from Venezuela was superb: she aimed to please, she was friendly and witty. The young man who greeted us was from Colombia. Both were amiable. Architecturally, they try to give you a Mediterranean vibe. On food, if it had matched the quality of service this place would be five stars. My guest enjoyed his meal. I was told I must come here for brunch which I have not done and since I live in Chelsea I will give it a try. For the price the food was good.

What a beautiful surprise!! Absolutely loved it‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è
Food was really good (though rations are a bit small for the prices). Atmosphere was great and service was awesome. Daniela was our server and was really attentive and suggested just the right thingsü´∂üèª
Would definitely recommend and return!!

We love Zizi! Food, drink, service 10 out of 10!!
The owner is super nice and gave our puppy some delicious chicken from the kitchen.

We ordered the eggplant carpaccio, overnight lamb, and Moroccan sea bass. So yummy üòã especially the lamb.

For cocktail, I had the gin martini- forgot the name but very delicate and balanced as well. Would recommend this place for sure if you want authentic Israeli/ Mediterranean food.
Amazing adorable food option! We ordered Halloumi pesto, crazy baba, shawarma, and a side of veggie sticks and everything was delish! We would order exactly the same food next time ‚ò∫Ô∏è!

Went with a group of friends last night, this was my third time eating at zizi‚Äôs they are one of my favorite restaurants in the city. They constantly change their menu, but have loved the food each time. Yesterday I got their cucumber martini (happy hour ends at 6:30) it was delicious and refreshing, for the table we ordered the fennel/labneh which was very underwhelming in my opinion, but for my main I ordered the branzino carpaccio and it was truly incredible, such a delicious mix of flavors, surprisingly filling, with a side it‚Äôs perfect! The dessert also fell flat for us this time, was supposed to be lemon-y but was mostly just a cr√®me with salted crisps

Walked in on a friday evening with no wait, but would recommend booking in advance just in case. First of all, loved the focaccia. The chicken was really good too and the black truffle pasta was tasty. The drinks were also standard, no complaints there. Portions were small though, so I didn‚Äôt come out feeling full.
All the food was amazing. Evan and Rick were really really nice too. They helped us out with all the questions we had about the food. All of the food tasted fresh. Thanks again guys
Everything at Cucina Alba from the bread to dessert is absolutely incredible. The ambiance is warm and inviting, the staff are all friendly and kind. It was a wonderful meal!

Beautiful and modern Italian food with expansive decor. Recommend if you‚Äôre in the area!

You have to get the baked ravioli and the fresh focaccia with whipped ricotta

The pasta dishes here were absolutely amazing. The artichoke appetizer is properly fried with a nice dipping sauce, it‚Äôs a must try. Spinach flan is amazing. Served with some toast, must try.
Crudo is a must as well.
Papppardelle is a superb dish, it is stuffed with caramelized onions, adding a right amount of sweetness to the dish.
TBH, we were not fans of the Arrabiata pasta. It was very sweet, and the server was kind enough to exchange that for us. I really appreciate that.

Looking forward to dining here again

Cucumber cocktail is housemade and delicious

This place used to easily be a 5/5 a few years ago. Quality has gone down steadily to the point where my chicken was actually bloody raw today. Also I don't know why they changed the way they do their fries but they're terrible now.

This was our first trip to Brooklyn, and we were satisfied a lot with this cozy and amazing restaurant, PeriPeri Grill House. The chicken was perfectly cooked, and the tangy sauce was absolutely delicious. The price was reasonable, making it a great choice for both your taste buds and your wallet.

The staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming, adding to the overall great experience. I‚Äôd definitely go back for more.

We ordered are food online on the keypad. And are food was ready in ten minutes. However‚Ä¶ when receiving are order they not only forget are drinks but also the extra cheese on are food, so we went back up and told them what was wrong. Instead of just placing cheese on are burgers, they waited until all other customers orders were done‚Ä¶ so we ended up waiting another 40 minutes waiting for food. When we went up for a refund the ladies at the front gave us aditude and told us the food already being made‚Ä¶
Finally after waiting another 15 minutes we received are food and it was wrong once again! I will never be coming back here again!

I ordered 6 peri peri wings, with a side of fries (although they sent rice) and corn on the cob. The wings were meh. Not a ton of flavor and pretty dry. I had ordered the fries, but they sent rice. The rice was good, though, so no complaints. I loved the corn on the cob! They sprinkle peri peri seasoning on it, and it‚Äôs so good! Prices are pretty reasonable. Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt order chicken from here again, but might try other items.

Nahhhhh this food slappppps! Lol my friends and I went and ordered a few Peri Smash Burgers, Chicken Burgers, Wings ( Hot & Jerk BBQ), fries and mac and cheese.  Everything was great! The side sauces were unique and flavorful. The burger patties are slightly seasoned w herbs and spices. It was authentic flavor that wasn‚Äôt over powering which I loved. The wings were cooked well and the wing sauces were sooo good! The fries were crispy w balanced seasoning. Overall, really good spot.
Great food and service! I have been to three locations, all of which stand for excellence! Highly recommended if you want to taste a delicious Cuban dish around the New Jersey area.

Amazing food for a great value. We spent $25 less than the $100 I thought we would. We had 2 dinners, 3 appetizers, a cocktail, and a sangria.

The food was phenomenal, the prices were mind blowing.

Hi!
It became Almost Personal the Day I first walked in in this Place. The Food very Authentic, Fresh, carefully seasoned for Spanish cuisine.
One of my Most appealing to this date, It‚Äôs the Staff‚ùóÔ∏èthis guys seem to be cut with the same Scissors. Starting  from Management, Peter, Stevan, Christian, To members like Rosio, Alexis, Leticia, Kevin, Juan, Lorenzo, David, Juan, Julio, Rafael, Maribel. To the guys that pick up the plates from your table. They All Treat You With the Most respect kindness, Like if you was part of their family.  Ohhh And Please Don‚Äôt Forget Their Drinks.
Amazing.

I've been here several times but, this was the first time I asked for veggie paella & asked them to add shrimp ¬∞‚Ä¢~ It was so good !!!

I also had Ceasar Salad & Shrimp Ceviche which was also good with lychee martinis ü•Ç.
Beautiful place perfect for couples. Food is delicious and the price is good. 100% happy with the service.
A little pricey for what it is, but delicious. The cheese bread is killer and the park is nearby, which is nice since there‚Äôs no seating.

Placed an order for 3 cheese empanadas. There was a couple behind us but no line. As we were putting the phone number in for the receipt, the man behind the counter changed the screen so we couldn‚Äôt get the receipt. He said 5 min for the empanadas. We proceeded to wait 16 min for the empanadas and when he opened the window, he was looking for that couple who ordered AFTER us. He then asked if we ordered‚Ä¶ I said yes. Anyway we finally get the empanadas , refused to explain anything except ‚Äúit‚Äôs Saturday we are very busy‚Äù. We get all the way home and the empanadas are beef‚Ä¶

Growing up with this, my godmother & sister always treated me to these amazing treats, I first found them a few years ago at the smorgasburg so I was so happy to see something I grew up eating.
The empanadas were so crunchy and flavorful, we got half cheese and half spinach coxinha, and OfCourse the churros!

Delicious, fresh Coxinhas. The spinach had an amazing cheese pull, the pic doesn‚Äôt do it justice! I had spinach and chicken, and I will be back to try all the other flavors. The staff was very friendly and was happy to answer all my questions and give recommendations for my first time there. Also I don‚Äôt know what the green sauce was but it was amazingüòã

I really enjoyed the cheese pastel cheese coxinha. They are the authentic and tasty pastries.
Just a little disappointed about brigadeiro, which is my favorite treat. I‚Äôve tried the tradicional, coconut and both texture were a kind of hard. Brigadeiro usually has a softy texture.
Also did not like the fact that everything must be to go since you don‚Äôt have acess to the store ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èOrder through the window. Since we are not at the pandemic it make no sense.
I recommend the pastries.

I had an absolutely outstanding dining experience! From the moment we walked in, the entire staff was warm and welcoming. The food was nothing short of incredible‚Äîeach dish was full of flavor, beautifully presented, and cooked to perfection.

But what truly made the evening unforgettable was our server, LANCE!!!. He was exceptional in every way‚Äîattentive without being overbearing, incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, and genuinely invested in making sure we had the best possible experience. His timing, professionalism, and thoughtful recommendations made us feel truly taken care of.

Lance and the entire team went above and beyond, and I can't wait to return. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for not just a meal, but a memorable dining experience

Stopped into the perfectly located Acadia after a lovely day spent in the city & Central Park, to be greeted by the most friendly staff, welcoming atmosphere, & a beautiful ambiance. We‚Äôd heard the Israeli food here was incredible but it blew any expectations out of the water. The portions were generous, plating was beautiful, and the dishes were bursting with flavor. Everything from the mezze, hummus (made table-side!!), to the tuna crudo, branzino, & crispy lamb were exceptional - each dish unique in its own way & brightening our eyes with each bite.

What makes a restaurant & dining experience truly memorable, however, are the staff, how you are treated & leaving with the feeling of ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt wait to come back.‚Äù

Alan was our server for the evening - he was knowledgeable of the entire menu, suggested the restaurants cocktails well, but piqued our interest in the perfect wine pairings with our entrees to tie into our dinner perfectly. We were able to enjoy an amazing dinner curated by a fine dining professional. Attentive, friendly, & charming - we can‚Äôt wait to see Alan at Acadia again.

Jordan checked in on us throughout our dinner & made sure everything was to our liking. We were happy to see him & share some conversation when he passed by.

Our experience at Acadia was remarkable - we can‚Äôt wait to visit again to try more of the dishes that caught our eye & see the staff again!

If Google had the option to give a million stars, that‚Äôs what I‚Äôd give it!

WOW! Absolutely incredible experience at Acadia! The Mediterranean cuisine was outstanding‚Äîevery dish was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The service was impeccable, with special thanks to Jordan, the manager, who went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the entire staff was attentive and professional. Highly recommend for anyone looking for top-notch food and service in NYC!

Amazingly delicious Israeli breakfast. Atmosphere relaxing, the service caring, the way in which my meal was presented so pleasingly on the plate - wonderful.  My eyes were closing with each bite and my taste buds were happy!  It was a great breakfast and start to my dayü©∑

Martina was an absolutely incredible server who made our dining experience wonderful. She included our daughter in the table side hummus presentation. I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better evening for my family. Our food was spectacular as well as our cocktails from the bar. Highly recommend if in the manhattan area.
Such a small cozy spot. It can fit a group or you can fly solo.  Order at the bar and have a seat. Drinks are kinda expensive but the vibe makes up for it.  I would come again!
Decent spot for a wee dougie to put the shine back in your step again after a hard day trudging around the big apple. Decent terrace and good happy hour offers, Friendly service too
Excellent food, better drinks, nice quiet atmosphere with great music. Will definitely visit again! Turkey brie sandwich was off the chain!
I really enjoyed stopping in here ahead of seeing a show at Pier 17! Cozy bar with decent food, the kale Caesar salad was a definite win! They also have happy hour until 7!

Small, unassuming, lovely little place. The music was good, food tasty, and prices very reasonable. While I didn‚Äôt have their happy hour specials, they did have them. Came here on a recommendation, and am glad to have had the chance to visit.

I made a pre-show res for dinner for two at The Elgin, but an oops on my part, we went in April, but I made the res for May.  The place was mobbed, a couple with no res was turned away, but a server knew of an empty table upstairs and hooked us up right away.  Kudos, and sigh of relief.  So first off, if you're looking for a quiet spot for dinner, this is not it.  It was noisy, but somehow added to the good vibe.  We needed a drink after that close call, and had two House Old Fashioned in front of us in minutes.  The good service continued throughout.  As for the food, the Humus Trio Plate to start was the star of the show, subtle different flavors between the three servings of humus with pita and veggies.  My Ahi Tuna Sando was a shade overdone, but good nevertheless.  My wife's Turkey Sandwich was average.  We let our server know we had an eight pm show, and she paced everything nicely.  I would definitely return when we are in town.  Two blocks from Radio City Music Hall by the way.  Cheers!

If you weren‚Äôt sure if you should dine at Elgin, let this be your sign. My husband and I were spending the day in the city to later go to a jazz club to celebrate our anniversary. I searched for weeks to figure out where we should eat prior, and being that we would be in a tourist-y part of Manhattan, I didn‚Äôt want anything gimmicky. I looked for a good menu with nice reviews and a cool looking ambiance. This. Place. Is. It!!! The Elgin exceeded my husband and I‚Äôs expectations. We sat at the bar, ordered delicious specialty margaritas, which I may add, were perfectly crafted! We ordered the Saigon wings, tuna poke nachos, and we split the burger. All 10/10. Everything was perfectly seasoned and had great flavor. Aside from the food & drinks being fantastic, our bartender, who we later learned was the manager, Conor, will be the reason we continue coming back anytime we‚Äôre in the city. He went ABOVE AND BEYOND for us. Great conversation and was incredibly hospitable not even knowing we were there to celebrate an anniversary until later. Conor was engaging and you could tell he was extremely passionate about the restaurant and cocktails, educating us about the liquors and processes of making each drink. When learning it was our anniversary he brought us a dessert and champagne to celebrate. He was incredibly kind ‚Äî people like Conor are truly the reason I enjoy going out. Good food and drinks are great, but nothing will make me want to come back soon other than people like him! He truly made our experience one of a kind and so memorable. You have to go!!

Ate lunch here while in NYC.  The decor is beautiful with a cozy feel.  There is wood everywhere and a nice bar area.  The dining area was kind of small.  I was disappointed with the food.  The menu looked promising.  It might have been my food choices which caused the disappointment.   The Bao Buns were tasty.  There was a good amount of meat filling.  The Elgin salad was not really good.  I didn‚Äôt care for the combination of items or the dressing.  And dessert‚Ä¶why would you add crushed Fruity Pebbles to ice cream sandwiches.  This was just wrong and it added nothing to the dish.  Will not be visiting again any time soon.

This bar is a gem! The drinks were nothing short of perfection‚Äîbeautifully crafted, balanced, and packed with flavor. Whether you‚Äôre into classic cocktails or creative, one-of-a-kind concoctions, they‚Äôve got you covered. The bartenders here truly make the experience unforgettable. They‚Äôre not just skilled; they‚Äôre also friendly, attentive, and clearly passionate about their craft. Watching them work is like watching artists create masterpieces, and they‚Äôre happy to customize drinks to suit your preferences. The vibe of the bar was incredible too‚Äîgreat music, welcoming atmosphere, and just the right energy to keep you hanging out for hours. This is a place you‚Äôll want to return to again and again. Highly recommend!

The food was pretty good, the decor was done very nicely. You definiatly felt the price of the food in the design of the restaurant.
The drinks were somewhat expensive for what was served.
Would I say I'm in love with this place? Not my top choice. But definiatly a cool laid back vibe spot for some good food and drinks.

I had a good time at Bea. Went for friend‚Äôs bday brunch. The pre fix is a great deal; $30 and get appetizer, main and side. The best sides were the fries, the worst? The sausage (2 small links, nothing impressive). I‚Äôm not a big eater so I had the huevos rancheros, they were tasty. If you order the pre fix you get the bottomless for $30; good deal, the mimosas were refilled on time. I wish they had a little more cocktail variety? Maybe I was missing a drink menu. The patio is just gorgeous; it was rainy so you could see through the glass roof and it gave a nice ambience. I would come back for sure

I recently visited Bea and had a wonderful experience. From the moment my group and I arrived, we were greeted by the incredibly friendly host (who resembled Zachary Quinto), making us feel immediately welcomed. A warm reception always sets a great tone and that definitely added a positive vibe to our brunch. The restaurant‚Äôs interior was chic and cozy, with thoughtfully chosen decor that created a pleasant atmosphere.

The dishes were flavorful and well-seasoned. The avocado toast and granola parfait particularly stood out for their richness and freshness. Everything was delicious; however, we did notice that the food wasn‚Äôt as hot as we had hoped when it arrived at the table.  That said, the flavors were still excellent, and the service was friendly and attentive. We also felt that the cauliflower could have been roasted a little longer. While it was tasty, a slightly crispier texture would have enhanced the flavor even more.

Overall, Bea provided a fantastic dining experience with friendly service, flavorful food, and a beautiful setting.

Loved this restaurant. The wall decor was cozy, aged, and they were screening several movies on the walls with projectors.

I loved the vibe and the cocktails (specifically the Maracuya mama) was fantastic.

Will definitely return !!

Cute vibe, great drinks, food was above average but nothing spectacular. the table we sat at was so small, it made it a little uncomfortable. We tried getting another table, but was told there were reservations, but notice they didn‚Äôt get filled til we were leaving .
Great food in a brunch spot in the Theater District in Manhattan. Enjoyed the brussels sprouts with bacon! Staff was friendly and nice!

Great spot! Incredible tequila selection (only part of it is pictured)! The food was delicious. We had queso fundido and the steak with a twice baked potato and spinach‚Ä¶simple but wow. The flan was tasty but the texture was a little sturdy. Not too too busy on a Saturday night but it was starting to get busy around 7pm. We will definitely be back.

I visited this place for the first time nine years ago, and I was impressed by their drinks and starters at that time.

Before I share my experience, I want to give a big shout-out to the warm and friendly service. The staff is incredibly nice and always there to help ensure you have a great experience. They are polite and treat you well, making it easy to consider coming back.

Now, let's talk about the food. The whole experience was fantastic, but I want to highlight the dishes we tried that day.

**To Start:**
We ordered fish tacos and classic guacamole. I‚Äôm not a big fan of fish, but those fish tacos were really, really good. The guacamole was fresh and tasty, a perfect match with their totopos.

**Main Course:**
I really wanted to try their Pollo en Mole Poblano, but we arrived too early for it. However, it was very kind of them to open the lunch menu for us before 4 PM.

**Enchiladas Suizas:** Five stars! I loved how they were prepared. They had the perfect level of spiciness, enhancing the flavors without being overpowering. This is exactly the amount of spice I enjoy in a dish.

**Huarache de Camar√≥n:** This dish included masa dough, grilled shrimp, bean pur√©e, Swiss cheese, and roasted salsa. The roasted salsa was incredible‚Äîso rich in flavor. Five stars!

**Branzino Veracruz:** This dish featured Branzino with Veracruz sauce and Mexican rice. It had incredible, rich flavors. It was lightly spicy, just enough to enhance the experience. Five stars!

I am a big fan of desserts and always look for something interesting and memorable.

I ordered their Tres Leches cake made with pulque and corn flour. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was very happy with my choice. The flavor was different‚Äînot too sweet, just perfect. It was a unique experience that I really enjoyed.

Will I come back? Absolutely! I can‚Äôt wait to try their Pollo en Mole Poblano. I highly recommend this place!

Had a reservation at 7:30pm and didn‚Äôt realize there were two entrances. Went to the right side and the host let me choose which table I wanted to dine in (the left or right entrance). Decided to go with the left entrance given it was more quiet and less busy. Ordered our drinks at the bar while they got our table ready. We got the El Mixteco which was tasty and a classic Pina Colada. Got seated at a corner table next to the window which was pretty small and tight. We shared a guacamole and chips, birria tradicional de res (which we had no idea it was a stew) and enchiladas de camaron with a side of rice and beans (extra cost). The entrees were pricey given it didn‚Äôt come with any rice and beans (which was $6 extra). The enchiladas tasted better than the birria. The service was great though and very attentive.

I promise the service is 10 STARS and I could not give a better recommendation. The food is supper WOW! I recommend the carne asada tacos (it comes with rice and beans) you will be full when you leave! COME! You will not be disappointed
Totally brilliant boutique Mexican joint on the LES. Great Guacamole, Great Frozen Margaritas, Great Tacos, and great atmosphere/service. Just go. And get the spicy salt on your marg.

Service was great food was even better. Definitely try out the French Toast!! Fresh fruits and overall a bagging French Toast.

Took pictures of my steak with scrambled eggs, salad, and french fries. Was also amazing!

Sweet water is beautifully decorated and very intimate. The food is great and the service went above and beyond. The chive gnocchi was perfectly cheesy and seasoned. My partner really enjoyed the lamb burger and the salad that accompanied it.

While he did find a piece of plastic in the patty towards the end of the meal, the manager was extremely apologetic and offered us plenty of their amazing desserts and even comped the burger. He checked in on us numerous times along with our server. Despite this experience, my partner, friends and I still had a great experience and enjoyed the food+drinks. Would recommend :)
Great classic bar feel and atmosphere! Sat at the bar. Tye the bartender was a gem! Great draft beer and cocktails. Yummy calamari. Sweet locals sitting at the bar and speaking to the history.

Had the best experience tonight!!! Food was on point!!! Mussels, crab cakes, the drinks, everything was perfect including the service, very attentive, our waiter was just so fabulousüëå Had an overall fantastic time!!!
Perfect place for brunch! So yummy üòã i recommend getting their crabcakes and lamb burger!

Went here on a Thursday after work was told they only had bar seating due to many reservations but we stayed 2 hours and those tables were never filled.

The food was good, basic mexican with margaritas to match.  I petsonally had the Sangria which was good but not strong compared to other Sangrias I have had, possible store bought.

Music was good, but not appreciatedby the crowd it could of been a vibe if it was.

Overall, a good quick spot on the fly not reservation worthy in my opinion.

Foods are amazing! I tried brisket taco  and smokey taco. Next time, I will try shrimp taco. But the top food is definitely corn. Corn is so delicious. Staffs are also so caring and kind. I liked  the music and decoration, too. Prices are also reasonable.

In NYC on vacation and popped in here for lunch. WOW, am I impressed. The staff is super kind, the food and drinks are reasonably priced AND I enjoyed everything I had.

Their Hibiscus Passionfruit Margarita is the best margarita I have ever had- hands down. I would definitely come back next time I‚Äôm in the city!

We came here with a large group for work dinner. Food was great and service was excellent. Food was ready very fast and the atmosphere was nice for chatting and group dynamics. Tacos are delicious and have an American twist! Try it if you are in the neighborhood.

We came for restaurant week back in July summer time of 2024.
We had the guacamole which was interesting bc it had pomegranate seeds and green apple slices in it. The chicken quesadilla portion was huge, and the drink I ordered had a huge gummy on top! Love that.

The complimentary chips were sprinkled with spice and huge, great to share!
The street corn was shaved in front of u, which we loved a good presentation. It was creamy and buttery luv. My pulled pork was yummy it had good flavor and the jalape√±os was guuud.

The bathroom was ok.

Food ordered:
- uni and crab tartlet (appetizers)
- chutoro laab (appy)
- lin yang (appy)
- pork jowl (entree)

Service was great, all the food was phenomenal. Each dish has a signature Thai component to it while still being creative and modern. Our favorite was the Lin Yang - beef cheek with Tamarind sauce. Very savory with a hint of spiciness. 10/10 would recommend.

This restaurant is absolutely top-notch! It was my second visit, and every experience has been exceptional. Each dish is bursting with flavor and carefully prepared, every bite incredibly delicious. I especially loved being able to see the open kitchen and watch the chef‚Äôs attention to detail in every dish. The dessert was a delightful surprise, so tasty that it brought back memories of my time in Thailand. Don‚Äôt forget to try their drinks, they‚Äôre so good! My favorite is the Mango Flame. On top of that, the service was amazing, adding to the overall fantastic experience.

One of the best dinners I've had recently and will definitely be back. Scallop ceviche was super unique with the watermelon shavings that had a spicy kick. The pork was so flavorful and crispy too. Those two dishes are a must.

The cocktails were also really nice. Sometimes a cocktail can overpower the flavors of the meal, but in this case it was really well balanced and complemented the dishes nicely since there were some savory flavors in the cocktails too.

I celebrated my birthday here and they gave me a scoop of ice cream with a sparkler too which was very sweet.

It‚Äôs def interesting experience here! Loved ambience, food is amazing, Margarita was on point! I think the chef s genius. However, the waiter (Asian guy) was push us so hard to order more and more, kept saying what we ordered is not enough for 3 ppl (we r petite tho). But the overall is good! Def come back!

Finally got to try this place! I came here with a group of 3 and we ordered a bunch of different things to share. The portions were definitely on the smaller side.

Small plates
- Uni and Crab Tartlet
- Yum Khai Dao
- Hokkaido Scallop Ceviche
- Chutoro Laab (my personal favorite of the night)

Large plates
- Pork Jowl
- Beef Cheeks Massaman Curry
- Ba Jang Lobster
- Chilean Sea Bass

Dessert - Pandan cake

My friend RAVED about the uni and crab tartlet even though she isn't a huge fan of uni. I really enjoyed the Chutoro Laab, definitely my favorite dish. It had a ton of flavor and quite the kick that did not leave my mouth for a good 15 minutes (my spice tolerance is on the low side though). I also loved the dessert, it was really unique.

Everything else was cooked well and the scallop ceviche tasted really fresh. Service was great and everyone was super friendly. After drinks and tip/tax, total came out to around $415

Great little noodle spot in what I consider a dead zone for food. If you‚Äôre near grand central and don‚Äôt fancy a chain or something worse walk down to Lexington and enjoy this hidden gem! Service is prompt and food is equally fast yet still delicious. The place was packed when me and my friend came but we were seated promptly and in and out like a proper fast lunch. I shall return! Well done

This place is a small hidden gem! My friend and I walked in on a Saturday night and it was fairly empty. I got the vegetarian spicy oil noodles and it was amazing. The noodles are fresh and chewy and service is lightning fast. Worth the price and would definitely go back.

Visited Dunhuang on Lexington Avenue and was thoroughly pleased with the experience. The staff here are incredibly friendly, making you feel welcome from the moment you walk in.

I went for their signature dish, the beef with wide noodles, which was a delightful choice. The noodles were not just fresh but also served piping hot, and the broth had a rich, flavorful depth that complemented the beef perfectly.

The ambiance was cozy, with seating that felt intimate yet comfortable, which added to the overall dining pleasure. They also had sparkling water on hand, served beautifully cold, which was a refreshing touch.

The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is because I felt the beef could have been slightly more tender. However, this minor critique doesn't overshadow the overall wonderful experience at Dunhuang. Definitely a spot worth visiting for some authentic flavors in a welcoming environment.

So happy to have stumbled on this place. I tried their Signature Lanzhou Beef Noodles. The noodles were fresh, broth was cozy and a good spice level, the beef was tasty, and the radish and other garnishes added a nice flavor as well. Service was very quick and friendly. Amazing place!

Amazing delicious food for reasonable prices especially the area it‚Äôs located. I loveee the cold chicken, that was delicious. Spicy noodles was so good. Honestly every dish we had was delicious. Highly recommend!

Lovely neighborhood spot that has a very cozy ambiance and really decent food! I‚Äôm no pasta connoisseur but the food here is comforting and done well and perfect for a date night or little weekend dinner.

I imagine the place looks very different during the daytime, but when we went at night it was very intimate and not too dark (which is my issue with a lot of spots). The staff is friendly and the food is good, nothing to complain about!

Lovely neighborhood Italian restaurant, with delicious food, good selection of wine and cocktail, plus friendly services and welcoming atmosphere. Love to come here with walking distance, and enjoy nice food and relaxing drink.

Came on a Thursday night and it was very chill. Service is amazing and very quick. Loved the complementary bread. We had the Agnolotti and burrata. I would probably choose another pasta next time but it was pretty good!

I was so excited to finally go after reading all the reviews but since I live nearby I kept postponing it. And it was a real disappointment, I really wanted to like this place but the food was just so mediocre, from bread, salad, pasta, I had zero interest in desserts after all the food we were served. Don‚Äôt mind paying $30 for pasta if it‚Äôs good but everything felt like some went to trader joes and added 0 value to it. Clearly this place just takes advantage of the location. The cocktails were actually nice but not the reason I go to Italian restaurant. No way I would recommend or go back, many other places that are worth going in the neighborhood, this ain‚Äôt it.

An absolute treasure in Greenpoint. My wife and I can‚Äôt wait to live closer and frequent this restaurant more. The decor / atmosphere was simple, clean and lovely. Our waitress was very sweet and helpful. The overall service was very professional and attentive, keeping our glasses full and plates clean between each course! The chicken was unbelievable, probably the best chicken dish I‚Äôve had so far in NYC. Order it asap. That sauce, wow‚Ä¶. The fried eggplant and burrata starter with parm and balsamic glaze was inspiring. The two pasta dishes we ordered were delicious as well and not too salty (usually restaurants are too salt heavy handed). A real gem of a place. Photo credit: wife ‚Äúsnake‚Äù

We found our favorite pasta place in Brooklyn! Not only it‚Äôs the best deal in town but it also has the best quality and taste.
Fresh pasta dish is $14 and and you can add gem salad or kale Caesar salad for $3 (even on Saturday)
Staff were friendly and efficient. Line moves pretty quick.
My husband (he‚Äôs a chef) said it was one of the best Pappardelle Bolognese he ever had. Pasta was cooked perfect and so flavorful.
This place knows what they are doing!
Salad was soooo good!
Can‚Äôt wait to come back to try other pastas and desserts!

DO NOT HESITATE TO EAT HERE. One of the best dining experiences ive ever had in New York. Absolutely incredible how their pasta is the price that it is. It's fresh handmade pasta and you can see them making it in the front. The texture is absolutely perfect, tastes so good.
This place blew my mind.
The bread that comes with the soup is so damn good it's one of the best breads that i've had in my life. Imagine if milk bread was Italian... so plush and scrumptious.
For a small place, the ambiance is soo nice. So much natural light in a tucked away seating area in the back. Clean as can be.
Service makes this place though. Shout out the owner who must keep their employees very happy because the energy in this place set the tone for my day. I was like sad to leave because I was having so much fun and felt so much joy eating there and being taken care of in a genuine way.
Forgot to snag a pic but their tirimisu is also made in house and is impeccable. Not too much alcohol flavour if any at all, perfectly whipped marscapone and evenly soaked ladyfingers.

Forma i love youüòÇü´∞ü•π

Absolute best arancini I‚Äôve ever tasted! Their sauces are rich and deep and so flavorful.  Gluten free spaghetti was perfectly cooked. Gem salad was tangy, crunchy and refreshing. Artfully crafted.

The servers are very warm and personable. You can tell they really care about their work.

It‚Äôs a bit small inside in terms of seating but the food more than makes up for it.  Wish I lived closer!

Came for dinner on a Wednesday at 7:30 and it was pretty crowded but we were still able to find a table quickly. Super fresh pasta and delicious sauces! Got a small piece of focaccia with our food which was nice. Service is very quick and friendly - will be coming back to try their other dishes!

Very quick service, kind and friendly staff, extremely delicious foodüî• I was waiting for my pasta for 6-7min, took some to go. Nicely packed, super fresh. I ordered their pasta with shrimps, it was fantastic, will definitely come back for lunch!
They are making very fresh pasta!!! And the prices are surprisingly affordable

Impeccable service & amazing food!! I stumbled across this place while in New York seeing a play on Saturday and it has to be the most amazing food I‚Äôve had in a long time. When I walked in despite them being absolutely packed they managed to find me a nice seat at the bar. Not only that they very graciously offered to charge my phone for me (which saved my life)! My server Arturo was a delight he made sure to check in with me and his suggestions were absolutely fantastic. I‚Äôm vegetarian andnonalcoholic, both with his suggestions for a drink and the main meal were absolutely amazing! I enjoyed it every bit. But the most amazing part had to be seeing the team and the way worked together! I have worked in restaurants my whole life and it‚Äôs really hard to get a team that not only gets their job done but also helps their colleagues without asking. Not a single minute was being wasted standing around! Everyone was either attending their tables, helping their coworker or checking in on diners. Despite being packed not a single customer was ignored, one had to simply look in the general direction of a sever and they would make sure they got you what you needed. Needless to say I will be returning and telling everyone that they absolutely need to eat here!

I like to jokingly say that this restaurant was imported from Mexico because the decor seems so authentic (see my photos). I had their strip steak ($45) which was very enjoyable. The fact that this restaurant is all that there is in this two story building is not common.

Came here for dinner after a Broadway show and was a great way to cap off the night. We got there a little early and so they sat us at the bar while we waited for our table to be ready and we ordered some margaritas to start things off. I had the tamarind and my girlfriend had the strawberry, both delicious and you can tell that they use real strawberries too, not just some mix, was the freshest I've ever tasted! Once we were sat, we started with chips and guac, and they give you more than enough fresh chips to snack on. For dinner my date had chicken and steak tacos and I went for the beef short rib quesadilla with a side of sweet plantains. All of it was fresh and delicious and left you feeling satisfied without feeling too full. Service was great, both at the bar and at the table, and even just waiting for our table, they definitely made sure we were taken care of at all steps. Its a little expensive, but for the quality you get and being in midtown Manhattan, you can do a whole lot worse. Would be happy to come back to this place for some upscale Mexican fare and cocktails anytime.

Went there for a personal occasion on a Sunday and it was quite full.
Good location - Close enough to broadway and all the action.
Loved the food and the drinks. Not a large menu but quite authentic. Ordered the open quesadilla which was very nice. Tacos were better than average but not out of the world. The drinks were great.

Came for lunch and it was really good. A huge fan of the short rib tacos, they literally melted in your mouth. Unfortunately there's only 2 but they did come with a side of rice and beans. The birria tacos were also very flavorful. The guac was good and fresh. However, you must made room for the churros. They were so yummy especially with the chocolate and caramel sauce.

Had a really great experience here end-to-end. We came for my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday and I really appreciated that they wished him happy birthday on the walk in, had a card at our seat at the bar and poured us glasses of champagne as we sat down. It made the dinner feel very special before we even made it to the food.

The food was delicious! Every sauce and broth was so unique and well curated. Each dish got better and better with each bite. I know I‚Äôll be craving another visit very soon.

My personal faves from the night were the sardine toast (I called it a sushi toast) and the mafaldine which had notes of almost a seaweed like flavor, but everything was great. My only note was with the asparagus and salt cod dish the flavor of the asparagus drowned out the cod - I appreciated the cod and the ramp more on their own or with the sourdough. Definitely get the sourdough to sop up any and all of the leftover sauces. They‚Äôre that good

We had such a lovely dinner at the restaurant! We were greeted with sparkling wine and a surprise birthday card at the beginning when we entered this cute and intimate place. The waitress was kind, pretty, and attentive, making us feel like friends. The food and wine selections are creative and unique. It was overall a special evening for us. Thank you so much!!

Over salted over seasoned over priced and OVER RATED. All these 'overs' and its still not enough. I have no reason to recommend this place to anybody i know who enjoys good food. It is entirely mediocre. Any flavour that is highlighted in a dish is way over done. Be it salt, acid, alium, etc. the best thing we had of our 8 dishes was the bread and blue cheese (both not even made by the restaurant)
The flavours are so flat. This is so depressing. This is the last time i go to any of these internet hyped restaurants. Always such a scam.
If you do come, the squid is pretty good.
Mussels, beans, and ESPECIALLY the maitake mushrooms are a no.
The mushrooms are just deep fried with no flavour except the black garlic sauce (nothing special)

We had an amazing experience at Place des F√™tes! We went for a birthday and they were so thoughtful by leaving a card on our table and giving us a glass of sparkling wine.

The service was impeccable. Our waiter was so friendly and helpful! Her suggestions were fantastic and really made our meal what it was.

The mussels were fantastic and were prepared in such a novel and delicious way. The squid and celtuce salad was so amazing. I have no clue how they were able to create so much flavor in such little space.

For our mains, we had the potato dumplings and the bucatini special. The potato dumplings were so well executed. The sauce that they served it with was so delicate, but so impactful. Amazing mouth feel too. The bucatini was fantastic. For once, it was better than a pasta you could make it home.

What a great experience and I will definitely be back again

Some of the best seafood in the city comes from the PdF kitchen and everything else, especially the desserts, are great as well. The price lends itself to a special occasion but it‚Äôs worth stopping by even to just enjoy some great cocktails, the strong Spanish-focused wine program, or some exciting after dinner drinks. One of my favorite spots in NYC.

I wasn't planning to eat at The Landing from the beginning. After searching and this restaurant quite interesting so I give a chance to try. I came a bit early lunch time so when I got there was no customer. The host asked me if I wanted to get a table, but I just want to chill out and enjoy some snack, so I prefer to sit at the bar. The bartender was friendly and nice conversation. I had a little Gem Salad and a glass on Passion Elixir. It was a yummy snack. The place got busy during the time. I was glad I went early. They told me they close on weekend, that make sense because the area mostly office.

Our drinks were perfectly mixed- so delicious. 3 of the 4 of our dishes were great. The French dip sandwich was so tender. The salmon entree was perfectly cooked and the sauce was amazing. The steak with the steak frites was very good. The lobster roll was kind of lackluster and was also a little chewy- would not get it again. The location and atmosphere of this place is great, would definitely come back for a drink and to walk around the open lounge area. The service was excellent- our waitress was very nice as well.
Santiago was amazing - his drinks were next level. I tried a clarified Pi√±a Colada for the first time, and it was out of this world. The food and service were also great!
Great atmosphere with prompt service and quality food.  Definitely a new vibe place.  Recommend you stop in for a drink if not a meal.

This place is awesome. Food is really delicious. We ordered burger and main plate with chicken - it was sooooo goodü§§
The vibe here is so comfortable and relaxing! The service here is excellent, I really enjoyed my visit!
Guys, thank you so much for such cozy dinner! I was celebrating my birthday today at the Landing and I‚Äôm really happy that this special day was with great people!

Right up there with Akab (London) - incredible serivce, wine list, stunningly delicious food and massively memorable evening.  This wasn‚Äôt just good food‚Äîit was storytelling. Every bite felt rooted in Palestine, Lebanon, and Syria. You could taste the care, the history, the pride. It was one of those meals that lingers in your mind for days. Thank you for keeping the soul of the Levant alive on a plate.

- First time visit for myself & my partner for the Valentine‚Äôs Day Prefix menu & we were absolutely delighted!!

There‚Äôs such a romantic intimate vibe at this location the moment you step in; Equipped w/ dimmed lighting, a rustic aesthetic, plenty of wood finishings with gold accents & it smells pleasant!

The service was absolutely superb, hostess was the sweetest, the waiters were very helpful, attentive & charming however, at some point felt like they were stretched thin between the amount of tables occupied!

The food was absolutely delicious!

Highly recommend on any of their regular evenings where there isn‚Äôt a prefixed menu so you can rejoice in their delightful options!

Ciao mi gente! ‚ú®

Tasty little neighborhood spot, super fresh ingredients made with care and time, decent wine selection not amazing but gets the job done. I do think the lamb meatballs should come with at least rice. Felt more like a side dish than a main. Overall pleasantly happy with it! Our French native speaker server was super helpful and kind! Great work!

A quaint neighborhood spot that serves the most delicious middle eastern food. The inside is dimly lit, with flickering candles on each table. A sleek bar is in the center of the main dining room with candles on the shelves with wine, and spirits and liqueur and the counter, it is very inviting and makes you want to sit down for a drink. There‚Äôs also a back room for larger parties.

The menu is a beautifully curated fusion of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean flavors with a contemporary twist. The dishes are vibrant and feature a mix of traditional ingredients like labne, harissa, and sumac, elevated with modern techniques and unexpected pairings. The culinary experience was amazing and makes this restaurant a must-try!

Starters & Small Plates
‚Ä¢	Pita
‚Ä¢	Smashed Cucumbers: A refreshing and smoky starter with creamy labne and aromatic chamomile.
‚Ä¢	Batata Harra: A bold dish of crispy shredded potatoes enhanced by spicy harissa and tangy labne.

Vegetarian Highlights
‚Ä¢	Charred Eggplant: Smoky and earthy, complemented by garlicky toum and aromatic nigella seeds.
‚Ä¢	Carrot Salad: A sweet and savory combination of zucchini, golden raisins, and honey-sumac dressing.
‚Ä¢	Freekah: A hearty grain dish with layers of nuttiness and crunch from pistachios and pecorino.
‚Ä¢	Charred Malfouf: A standout, featuring caramelized cabbage glazed in harissa and paired with the creamy nuttiness of ajo blanco.

Seafood Delicacies
‚Ä¢	Crudo: A refreshing plate of fluke with an aguachile kick and the sweetness of gold rush apples.
‚Ä¢	Kalamari Mishwi: Grilled calamari atop creamy hummus and a tangy olive vinaigrette.
‚Ä¢	Samak Bil Warak: An elegant branzino dish wrapped in grape leaves, elevated by a rich b√©arnaise sauce.

Meat Specialties
‚Ä¢	Kibbe: A classic Syrian meatball dish with sweet-tart pomegranate and pine nuts.
‚Ä¢	Shish Barak: Decadent beef-stuffed tortellini in a tangy yogurt sauce with a hint of spice from harissa oil.
‚Ä¢	Kebab Karaz: Tender lamb meatballs paired with sour cherries for a rich, sweet-savory profile.
‚Ä¢	Msakhan: A luxurious take on duck confit, with sumac and tahini lending depth to the traditional taboon bread.

Pasta & Baked Goods
‚Ä¢	Macarona Bil Toum: A comforting Levantine pasta dish with a bold, garlicky lemon sauce.
‚Ä¢	Rakakat: Crispy filo-wrapped Syrian cheese, drizzled with hot honey and muhammara for a spicy-sweet balance.
‚Ä¢	Fattoush: A fresh winter salad featuring seasonal chicories, persimmons, and a pomegranate vinaigrette.

This menu is perfect for diners seeking rich, layered flavors in a refined yet approachable format. It celebrates regional Middle Eastern traditions while embracing modern culinary innovation.

This restaurant is the best spot for romantic dates, intimate celebrations, or indulgent evenings with good vibes. The desserts are also very good and worth trying. The presentation of the dishes were 10/10. The team also provided exceptional service!!!! We can‚Äôt wait to come back and try more dishes, I also want to give a shoutout to the Head Chef, Omneyah!!!!  She was incredibly warm and gracious, taking the time to personally explain some of the dishes when we inquired. My favorites were the cabbage (charred malfou), and the crudo!!! :)

Where do I start??? I came here for a fundraiser iftar and was so happy the entire time! Delicious plates were served throughout the evening and each one was INCREDIBLE! After a day of fasting, the flavors are so enhanced but Huda‚Äôs team truly went above and beyond! The ingredients were so fresh and felt so carefully crafted! My favorite was the Rakakat and Kebab Malfouf!! I can‚Äôt wait to return!!! üíñüíñüíñüíñüíñ

I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever given a restaurant 5 stars in every category, but here I am giving Metropolis one of the best reviews I‚Äôve ever written. Already, upon entrance, I was smitten with the atmosphere and decor. Not only was it extremely lively, but it was filled with attentive waiters, a spectacular DJ, and Marcus Samuelsson himself! He introduced himself to each table, neglecting no one! We ordered so many dishes and each one kept getting better as we went. Personally, the brisket was by far the star of the show! We ordered extra bread on the side just so we could dip each plate‚Äôs sauce into it. The flavors were that delicious! Thank you for a wonderful evening and we will definitely be back!

Overall rating: 4.4
Price: $156 w/ tip (split for 2)

I walk by this spot on my way to work weekly and have been wanting to check it out for awhile. I‚Äôm not familiar with the theater which is my mistake, bc I did come in thinking the audience would be more‚Ä¶ cultured. When I sat, it felt like I was with a few tourists to realize it‚Äôs the lobby of the theater inside.

My friend and I had a reservation around 6 which I understand is early for the crowds. Okay. But we didn‚Äôt get served until 6:25 and it took a lot of eye contact with the host, waiters, for someone to come by. I am not still fully convinced we even had a waiter assigned to us because there were a few other times it was questionable. Things we ordered:

- Oysters: 0/5 - do not get. These taste weird.
- Fluke crudo: 5/5 - absolutely delicious
- Brussel sprouts: 4/5 - nothing special
- Seaport lasagna: 6/5 - mouth-watering so good
- Crispy snapper: 4.5 / 5 - good but the curry was meh

I also went online and just noticed we didn‚Äôt get served their happy hour menu. Very interesting. I‚Äôm glad I went because I would always wonder, but this place isn‚Äôt worth it to me based on the poor service.

Literally a dining experience of a lifetime, that's how good the food is here! Relaxed, open, and informal atmosphere, yet "elevated" as the food is. The whole dining experience was excellent from start to finish. The oyster cart was an experience in itself.

Metropolis by Marcus Samuelsson delivers a chic and elevated dining experience with modern decor and a prime location inside the Performing Arts Center (PAC) easily accessible by public transportation.

Service was exceptional, with a standout performance by our waiter, Dorant. His professionalism, deep menu knowledge, and impeccable hospitality made our visit truly memorable‚Äîa 10/10 service experience.

The seasonal menu offers creative takes on classic dishes. I started with the Yes Sir cocktail, a refreshing blend of chamomile-infused rye whiskey and lavender syrup. The oysters were beautifully presented and well-executed. For my entr√©e, Sugar Hill Nights‚Äîa unique take on chicken and dumplings with fried chicken‚Äîwas visually stunning and expertly cooked, though the sauce was just satisfactory. The saut√©ed kale, a modern twist on collard greens, was a flavorful complement.

The highlight of the meal was the banana pudding cart dessert, an absolute 10/10.

As soon as I walked in, live music/band were playing and it was absolutely welcoming. The host was just as welcoming and accommodating for me.
My waitress, Nellie (spellcheck), was attentive and inviting. She helped add to the great experience.
The food I ordered:
- Corn bread 10/10 (we got two orders)
- M Steak 8/10, the steak was a little cold when it arrived, but the sauce was delicious and the steak cooked exactly how I wanted it!
- Coconut Rice 6/10

Overall, a wonderful experience. Thanks to the kitchen and staff for a memorable birthday!

A thoroughly charming and intimate American bistro in the West Village. Food couldn't be more delicious. And the service was as good as it gets. The roast chicken was sublime. Try the spicy green beans as well. This is sometimes a tough reservation to get but keep trying. You won't be sorry. A New York classic.

Food and service was exceptional. The atmosphere is loud but it was expected. Little Owl is a cozy, charming restaurant offering delicious, high-quality American cuisine. Known for its intimate setting and warm atmosphere, it serves flavorful dishes with a creative twist. A great spot for a memorable meal!

We spent our Christmas Eve dinner this year at Little Owl and absolutely loved it. The food was fantastic‚Äîtender and flavorful pork chops and perfectly grilled sea bass. We finished with brownies topped with gelato, which was the perfect end to our meal.

The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the limited and pricey wine selection. We wish they had more affordable full-bottle options.

We‚Äôll definitely be back!

We originally found this restaurant bc it‚Äôs below the Friends apartment, although the show used the exterior and was not filmed in the apartment.

We thought we were being seated in the restaurant and they took us to their secondary location, just a store or two door. A little disappointed since the reservation was made in advance and one of us was a huge Friends fan.

The food. Good to great. There are limited vegetarian items and you need to ask, bc depending on your strictness, some things container chicken broth, oyster sauce, etc. However I was happy with their accommodations. I had the burrata and a salad. The rest of the table had a variety of items, their overall favorite were the French fries. Would maybe come again.

Little Owl, located in Manhattan‚Äôs West Village, is a charming and intimate restaurant that boasts a cozy, neighborhood vibe. Its iconic corner exterior is instantly recognizable as the apartment building featured in the TV series Friends, making it a must-visit spot for fans of the show.

The menu is Mediterranean-inspired, with standout dishes like the Gravy Meatball Sliders and the perfectly cooked Pork Chop. The quality of the food is complemented by warm, attentive service and a relaxed yet upscale atmosphere. While the space is small, it adds to the intimate charm, though reservations are highly recommended.

Overall, Little Owl is a delightful mix of nostalgia for Friends enthusiasts and an exceptional dining experience for food lovers.

Typically I don't go to AYCE Korean bbq spots but this one I would highly recommend! From the popular Jongro BBQ team the all you can eat menu is quite extensive with similar cuts they use at their original location, like usda prime beef and premium Omaha pork. We loved the marinated hanger steak (the perfect substitute for kalbi!), the premium pork belly, the chewy marbled pork jowl and even the marinated shrimp was quite good! The sides / apps were also great - mool NaengMyeon cold noodles with caramelized pork jowl was the perfect way to end the meal.

I‚Äôve never been disappointed with Jongno BBQ or Jongno Gopchang, so I‚Äôd been looking forward to the opening of Jongno Market for a long time‚Äîbut today, I was extremely disappointed. It‚Äôs run by the same owner, but how can it be this different, even if it‚Äôs an all-you-can-eat BBQ place?
The meat quality was terrible, the sliced pork belly wasn‚Äôt fresh so it smells bad. All the side dishes were generally too sweet. Even the kimchi jjigae was too sweet and kimchi also.

Naengmyeon took an unusually long time. The server said the order hadn‚Äôt gone through. Then he came back and said it was taking longer because they ran out of broth and making new. Now???? But when the naengmyeon finally came out, it felt like they had prepared the noodles way earlier and only made the broth later ‚Äî the noodles were hard and clumped together like a rock.
On top of that, while they made the naengmyeon noodles fresh, the broth tasted like beef dashida (instant broth powder) with a massive amount of sugar dumped in. The spicy rice cake, tteokbokki was also sweet, but at least it was tasty.

If you are searching for an AYCE place and want that Jongro taste look no more. The beef flat iron steak is definitely a must (mid rare) dont forget the premium pork belly and kimchi stew. This location includes their own branded beer one of pale ale and wheat both great choices but leaned towards the pale ale more. Overall great price and great food right in the heart of k-town.

Since we were sleeping close to Koreatown, we decided to try our first Korean BBQ. A bit overwelmed at first, but the waiter was really kind and gave us some good tips.

Everything was really tasty and we had a great evening. It's AYCE and so were really full.

I would recommend this place to my friends ;)

Seeing Jongro opened a new AYCE kbbq spot, I was excited to try. Having been to their other location, I had high expectations for the meal.

The food was pretty good overall. The pork jowl was the highlight of the meal. The beef cuts were pretty good, but I did not like the bulgolgi at all. It was sour and mushy.

We made a reservation in advance for dinner on a Thursday. We were seated promptly with no wait. Service was ok but they were not very attentive. We had to call out to the servers a few times to place more orders and to change our grill. The food took a while to come out at times depending on the order.

Overall, it was a decent experience for AYCE kbbq. I think the price is a bit high for what is offered.

the brown rice ball was chewy with just the right amount of bite! While the seasoning was spot-on‚Äîsubtle yet flavorful.  It was the perfect combination of healthy and delicious. Filling was not too heavy, great for a quick snack.
üç£ üçô salmon and tuna mayo was by far the fave

beef and scallion miso was okay.
Cute little place! Hours aren‚Äôt always the most convenient, but check them out if you come across them. Fresh and delicious grilled rice balls. Very chic decor. Good quality and reasonable price.

The bento box portions are fantastic for the price. The quality of the ingredients is perfect, the flavor is on point, and I feel quite joyful having been here. Perfect for a satisfying lunch and quick tea.

Note: they only have oat milk for the lattes so if that‚Äôs not your speed be aware; however, the iced barley tea is refreshing as is so if you are here during the summer months it‚Äôs worth it!!!

Love this place, highly recommend

Finally got a chance to get lunch here this afternoon. I got the chicken bento box, which comes in a small takeaway container and has a protein, two rice balls, and two sides. It is deceiving because it is definitely very filling, comes with more chicken than shown in the picture (was under the sides and balls)
I was a little worried because some of the reviews said the flavors were lacking, however, as someone who loves overly flavored food, I can say the food delivered! Did not seem under seasoned at all. I got the Ume plum paste and the scallion rice balls, both were delicious and had flavor throughout. The chicken was so delicious, can tell they have it marinating in the sauce for a while. I got the Gomaae and Hijiki for sides, both were great. Overall highly recommend! Cute quaint neighborhood spot!

Salmon Rice Ball + Grilled Beef Rice Ball - 7/10
The rice balls were pretty standard with the fillings being quite light in flavor. Definitely would go for the bento box.

Grilled Chicken Bento Box - 9/10
The grilled chicken was extremely moist and the lemon scallion sauce was the perfect pair. Loved the side veggies they provided as well.

I visited Jajaja Mexicana and appreciated the effort they put into catering to diverse dietary preferences. The staff was incredibly friendly and courteous, which made the experience pleasant. They even have a separate Jain menu for those who avoid onion and garlic‚Äîjust ask for it!

We tried the Pepita Hummus and Crispy Pescado Tacos. While they were decent, they didn‚Äôt stand out as anything extraordinary. The flavors were fine but not particularly memorable. My biggest concern was the portion size, which felt quite small considering the premium prices they charge.

Overall, it‚Äôs a nice place and thoughtful menu options, but I wish the portions and flavors offered more value for the cost.

I did get a lost looking for the location. Which is located on the second floor, past the cheese and in the corner in the back. The food did not disappoint. I love the chunk birria tacos. The steak is seasoned to perfection with spices and the sauce on the side adds an extra kick.

Service is great. Food is nothing to get excited about. We tried their No Onion No Garlic items are thy were bland, tasteless, and honestly a complete waste of money. It‚Äôs best to avoid this place. It‚Äôs expensive for a casual sit down self serve spot. 100/100 to our cashier!

What a find. Got the vegan chicken mole enchiladas and they were great. The rice that comes in the side is also better than most Mexican restaurants for some reason. Cocktails, beers and wine in a bright little cafe space with enormous windows on the upper walkway. Will be back for sure, and take photos.

It is inside the Whole Foods. Great for lunch, but not a quiet dinner. That being said, order at the kiosk and drinks/food is delivered to your table. Everything plastic and cardboard.
The food is really good and service was good. Love the beet & pumpkin empanadas.,
Near LIRR, NJ TRANSIT & subway.
Drinks have alcohol as opposed to most trendy cocktails.
Def recommend!

Great restaurant.
At first we were only looking for a place for noodle. It turned out we found this place with dating atmosphere.
The plants are designed with eastern elements. The roof provides just enough lighting.
Braised pork is tender as expected.
Chicken noodle soup is delicious and I could see great ingredients. Even though I would prefer white pepper instead of black pepper because the latter is stronger.
The stir fried cabbage is awesome. The crispness is perfect! Combined with the savory sauce It's just on point.
Also the price is unbeatable. 75 for 3 dishes more than needed for 2 people.

The restaurant had been on our list for awhile. And I‚Äôm so glad we checked it out, it was a great experience.

Ambiance: they gave this really airy spacious vibe that makes you feel comfortable. Tables can also be far away enough in corner areas to give you an intimate set up. They also have a lot of plants which adds to the ambiance.

Price: it‚Äôs fairly reasonable considering NYC prices.

Food: We got the eight spice crispy tofu. It was one of my favorite items. The tofu inside was super soft but there was a soft crispy around it. I did expect it to be crispier but the flavors were on point. I really liked how well the sauce completed the tofu. The crispy pickled cucumber was my second favorite item. It seems so simple but was so flavorful and felt fresh. The vegetable spring rolls were average, felt oily.
We also got the Shanghai scallion oil noddles. They were really good, more flavorful than I expected and not as oily.

Service: staff was very nice and patient especially when we were deciding what to get. They checked in on us often.

Insta: @TheShahLALand

Beautiful ambiance and good food. Next time I have to come back for the noodles üòÖ
We had the ma pao tofu, shrimp dumplings, snow pea greens, and whole sea bass with pickled topping.

There‚Äôs a complimentary snacks / refreshments station near the front which is super cute! We ordered the cilantro beef, the rice cake with shrimp and egg yolk, and the pea shoots. The rice cake is my #1 - it was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the shrimp was so flavorful and juicy. Would totally recommend!
Came for dinner on a Wednesday night! Was very tasty. Recommend the wood ear salad, soup dumplings, and the pea shoots!

Absolutely obsessed with this cozy spot! The vibe is super chill, and the owners are the sweetest couple ever‚Äîlike, you walk in and instantly feel at home. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you actually want to stay and work all day‚Äîgreat coffee, comfy seating, and just the right background buzz.

Oh, and do not leave without trying the egg tart.

Cute new Asian-inspired cafe with great quality beans and Chinese pastries. Got the tiramisu latte and pineapple bun. Both were well-balanced and not too sweet.

The vibe inside was cozy as well. Nice place to have a convo since the music is at a comfortable level

Very cute shop. Amazing lattes and matcha. Coffee beans were grounded per drink. The matcha was just the right amount of sweet. All the pastries are fresh. I bought a few pastries and they toasted it for me. Four counter seats and 3 tables available. Would come again!
Great new coffee shop around the corner! I love the chill vibes, perfect for relaxing and enjoying good coffee. The egg tarts are delicious!
Very cute newly open coffee shop. Nice coffee nice people, nice space. Will be my Spot for coffee break.

This is an amazing spot to dive into authentic Georgian cuisine! The chicken cheese boat was absolutely delicious‚Äîrich, cheesy, and perfectly baked. The borscht soup was another highlight, bursting with hearty flavors and warmth. Also the hummus was outstanding. While the spinach cheese boat was just average for me, the overall experience was fantastic. The cozy vibe and friendly service make it a great place to enjoy something unique. This is definitely a restaurant I‚Äôd recommend to anyone looking to try Georgian food, and I‚Äôll certainly be revisiting soon to explore more of their menu!

Been to this place twice now - one for dinner one for takeout and both times the food was amazing.
I love Georgian food & was so happy when another spot opened!
The dumplings are some of the best I‚Äôve had - they are super doughy but they also are NOT shy with the filling. The shkmeruli chicken is rich and decadent and divine. The cheeseboat selection incredible & the flavors S tier.

The only reason I knocked off a star is the service. It‚Äôs slow slow. I ordered wine and did not get it. I waited long after I sat to be greeted.
Still worth going.

ü•üWe absolutely loved the food! I‚Äôve never tasted such delicious Georgian cuisine in New York before. The bartender was incredibly helpful in choosing the perfect wine‚Äîhe understood exactly what we wanted with just a few words. We will definitely be coming back. Thank you for such a wonderful experience!üç∑

One of my absolute favorite Georgian restaurants! Everything is delicious! The atmosphere is wonderful, and the staff is incredibly warm and welcoming. Among the more modern dishes, the steak khachapuri is a standout. Also, the borscht is phenomenal‚Äîone of the best in the city!

Cheeseboat in New York, NY. Come have Mama Cheeseboat cook some authentic Georgian food for you! I never had Georgian cuisine before and it did not disappoint. The fresh flavors were absolutely delicious-especially the CHEESEBOAT! Make sure to try some Georgian wine! Located in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen and Williamsburg-Cheeseboat has you covered!
