üåÄKartvelian Salad-Fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions with fresh cilantro, herbs, ground walnuts, homemade sunflower seed oil & Georgian spices.

üåÄCheeseboat-Classic, traditional Cheeseboat (Adjarian Khachapuri) Caldron of cheese in bread w/ egg and butter.

üåÄKhinkali Soup Dumplings-Stuffed w/ ground beef, Georgian spices & herbs, served w/ traditional garlic Neeor'tskali sauce.

üåÄGeorgian Lula-Kebab- Ground beef on a skewer cooked with the addition of barberry, which gives freshness and juiciness to the kebab. Served with Tkemali green plum sauce.

üåÄNapoleon- Very thin decadent puff pastry cake with homemade rich custard cream in between the layers served with sliced fresh strawberries.

A nice and cozy place to have a bowl of ramen.  The ramen is tasty.  Noodles are perfect, broth is flavorful and the egg is perfect.
But you have to eat it quickly. As soon as you are finishing eating one of the waiters come and leave the bill. I was drinking my Coke and the waiter kept coming to ask if everything was fine and if I needed anything else.
Honestly it made me feel uncomfortable and I felt some pressure to finish drinking and leave.
So eating was a good experience, service not that much.

Amazing ramen restaurant. The staff were attentive and welcoming. The food was top tier. We got the cucumber salad and the gyudon to share. For ramen, the kin kara ramen was rich, spicy, and smoky. Definitely recommend adding the soft boiled egg. The drink menu had an array of fun cocktails. The most interesting was the Kirei because of the jelly!

I want to try the curry ramen next time. 10/10 we will be back!

In my opinion I think KIN RAMEN is The Best ramen place in NYC! The food is unbelievable great and has so many great things to choose from. This beautiful restaurant located in the heart of Midtown NYC. It is very easy to find just a few minutes walk from Central Park. Aura is beautiful, super friendly, and super kind. I highly recommend this place if you looking for a great food and beautiful setup. I for sure will be back again when I‚Äôm back in town!

Really great service, they were accommodating to our baby and child, and had small-sized cups, bowls, and plastic silverware for them. The food was AMAZING. All the flavors were spot on, and really fresh. We loved the ube tempura (that wasabi dip - YUM), the buns, sashimi salad, salmon tartare, and of course, THE RAMEN.

Our first dinner out in NYC! A friend recommended it here and it was good! It's a tiny but really fun space. Had both the cabbage and softshell crab appetizer which we both liked. BF had the spicy kin ramen which was yummy and the vegetarian ramen was yummy too. We didn't get to try the Matcha dessert which I heard is good, because the belly was pretty full. Service was spot on.

We LOVE Cafe Mado! We visit at least once every time we come to Brooklyn. It‚Äôs a great spot for brunch/lunch/dinner/mock/cocktail before or after a trip to the Brooklyn Museum. The space is beautiful ‚Äî we love to sit at the bar because it‚Äôs got tons of windows and is surrounded by tree and also we always meet great people and the folks who work there are awesome! The food is beyond amazing. Faves include the Caesar salad and the fries. Their pork with 5 spice seasoning is delicious and you‚Äôll want to try their Brooklyn bitters and soda, any cocktail or mocktail, or coffees. Highly recommend!

I had a great brunch at Cafe Mado. The sausage and egg sandwich was tasty. The pain au chocolat was perfectly flaky, and the latte was rich and smooth. The friendly service and inviting atmosphere made it a perfect spot for a relaxing brunch. Highly recommend!
Had a great Sunday spring dinner here. Everything we ordered was very well executed and super flavorful! Highly recommend for dinner and very accommodating for groups

I had a very nice dinner here. I feel like small plate/sharing style places like this often miss the mark but every dish we got really delivered. the Caesar salad was so fun and delicious, the cavatelli and pork rib were my other favorites. their bread from their bakery is amazing. the only part of the experience that was off was that we were charged for the dessert they brought out on the house since we were celebrating a birthday, which was a little strange, but not enough to knock it down to four stars. otherwise, I really enjoyed this meal and will probably be back.

We had a lovely Sunday dinner here and it was easily one of the best meals I have had in recent months.  The decor is very relaxing and the noise level was just right.  Service was attentive and not rushed. The food and beverages were very well designed and prepared.  This is not a vegetarian restaurant but the vegetable dishes are better than what one would find in many vegetarian places.  Everything is fresh and flavorful.  Even the bread and butter are exceptional.  Desserts are creative and tasty. It's a restaurant you would want to come back to.

This place is truly the gem of LIC, from the service to the ambiance, to the food, every single thing exceeded my expectations. The drinks were amazing, we had the rum espresso martini which was one of the best we‚Äôve had and the Bloody margarita which was both tasty and flavorful. They even made me a spicier one afterwards with a tajin rim which I loved. We started out with the oysters and they were perfect. Their raspberry mignonette added the perfect touch, I would highly recommend. To save the best for last, their 24 oz ribeye steak special was to die for, served at medium temperature with a perfectly crispy exterior and that chimichurri sauce‚Ä¶. the perfect dinner meal!!!!

I‚Äôve been to a few restaurants in the area but whether you‚Äôre having dinner alone, meeting some girlfriends, or going on a date, this is the perfect place.

(Last photo shows how we felt about the ribeye)

Our server Gianna was wonderful. Very friendly & personable, attentive, & helpful. She made us feel very welcome & did not rush us. We did the bottomless brunch cocktails (Bellinis). Gianna made sure our glasses were never empty. The food was delicious (Chicken & waffles, Pulled pork & oxtail, Grillled pork belly, Creme Br√ªl√©e French toast). Everything we ordered, we‚Äôd order again, especially the grilled pork belly. The Creme Brulee French Toast we ordered as a shared dessert, which was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!

We arrived at 4747 LIC and were promptly greeted and seated. We ordered the French toast and a $32 steak. While waiting, a booth with a better view and more comfortable seating became available, and the staff kindly offered to move us, enhancing our experience.

When our food arrived, it was beautifully presented. However, the steak was nearly well-done instead of our requested doneness. We informed the staff, and they immediately apologized and had the kitchen prepare a new steak, which arrived perfectly cooked and delicious.

The swift resolution and exceptional service make 4747 LIC stand out.

I highly recommend this restaurant for its great experience and commitment to customer satisfaction. 5/5 stars proof that a place is exceptional when they correct mistakes and deliver excellence!

This is a great spot for brunch on the weekends. The food was delicious and the service was nice and friendly. The cocktails are on the pricey side, but they have an unlimited mimosa deal for 90 minutes at a reasonable price which I did not take advantage of (maybe next time). I definitely recommend the Eggs Purgatory (but maybe without the anchovies since the fish flavor can be a bit overwhelming) or the salmon Eggs Benedict.

Healthy & Delicious Eats at 4747 LIC

4747 LIC is a cozy spot that offers a fantastic selection of fresh and flavorful dishes. I am always looking for healthy and satisfying options. This place did not disappoint.

The tacos served in crisp salad leaves were just perfect. Light and flavorful, packed with a generous amount of crab. It was a burst of color on my plate. The house lox sandwich was another standout. Silky lox on flatbread  paired with a yogurt sauce was just something I was looking for. The burrata with pear in a savory red sauce was an unexpected combination but it was absolutely delicious.

I‚Äôm not typically a dessert person, but the French toast with berries and roasted pistachios was exceptional‚Äîlight and not overly sweet. It was the perfect way to end the meal.

Highly recommend 4747 LIC for anyone looking for delicious, high-quality food.

This is a nice southern style Burger Joint.   Easy to see.   Always a long line, but it moves quickly.   You order at the counter, then find seating, and then they call your name to pick up the food.   You stay on the line outside until there‚Äôs seating available.   Or you can order to go.   Good food.   Nice staff.   The owner walks around a greets the customers.   Card payments are accepted.   Give this place a try.   We will definitely be going back.

The burgers are amazing. We ordered a double burger and it was more than enough. The French fries and toes are cooked to perfection and the flavor is really good. We were there during the week and in the weekend and during the week you order and find your own seat. During the weekend there was a little line, like 8-10 min and they assigned you a seat after you ordered. The service is extraordinary!!!

This was one of the best burgers I‚Äôve had in a long time. Been living on Long Island for two years now, Los Angeles Native, and would definitely take the train often to eat here. My family and I were talking about how good the food was all day. We had the double with fries and onion rings. We cleaned our plates and the ranch dipping sauce was also very good. Would definitely recommend.

This place is awesome, it was my first stop for food when I reached New York City. Not only is the food awesome, but the staff is really cool, and the environment is nice. I got a double patty smash burger, which was really delicious, I also got their fried pickles (aka Frickles), OMG. I am a fried pickles connoisseur, and these are the best ones I‚Äôve ever had. Thick with good texture, and fried to perfection, you can tell they are handmade with love. I got the ghost pepper dipping sauce to accompany them, creamy with a nice little kick, the sauce came included with the pickles. I had a lovely craft beer to accompany my lunch. I should also add that I tried my brother‚Äôs tater tots and they were delicious, somebody else got like loaded fries, I tried also and they were very good, as were the plain French fries I snagged off someone else‚Äôs tray. Clearly this is a popular place, as the place was nicely buzzing. There was no wait to sit, and if you don‚Äôt want to sit, they do a heck of a grab-and-go service I observed. Go support these guys, get a bang for your buck, I really can‚Äôt recommend it enough! I should add a side note, there is a clean restroom for you to use if need be, as you may or may not know, restrooms in the city are a commodity.

Cool place!
We tried the burger, chicken pieces and two sides. Surprisingly, none of it felt heavy at all. The food was really good.
It is quite efficient with the seating and the system they have. We only had to wait 5 mins for the table even when the place was crowded.
Great for a cheat night. Highly recommend!
The only negative was the soda - the diet coke from the machine was heavily mixed with water (or tasted like that) and was undrinkable.

phenomenal. such genuinely nice people and owners and felt like a small town again. lots of families and not over hyped and just an incredible experience. we did a tasting menu for $70 and everything was amazing and you were full leaving. go for a birthday dinner or a family dinner. the dips and pita were stellar and the branzino and desserts were highlights as well. beyond 5 star rating and will try to make this a more regular spot.

My wife and I stopped by here on a weekday night for dinner. The staff were fantastic and wonderful in accommodating our baby stroller. My favorite thing we ordered was the meatballs - so good! The sourdough bread that came with the spreads was great. My wife is a vegetarian and had no problem ordering food. Can‚Äôt wait to return!

The food was the best food I‚Äôve ever had, the service was amazing and the atmosphere was so great. The owner is the sweetest most caring person. This place is beyond a hidden gem. 10000% go here for the best food of your life.

Overall a decent meal, however it was a situation where the appetizers and shared plates were better than the mains. Personally I weigh reviews more on the food, so despite everything else being great the food brings things down a bit.

I highly recommend the octopus as it is grilled to perfection with a nice smoky char and crisp edge. The cheese is sweet and savory. And the assorted spread is a nice taste of cold dips. And the Greek potatoes are seasoned very well and very easy to share.

However the chicken souvlaki was just okay, the flavors are decent but the chicken itself was overcooked. The lamb is grilled nicely, however it lacks seasoning. For these prices I would expect more from this restaurant. However I did hear from other that the soups and fish were a better choice. If I come back again, I would try those.

The service is great and we had no worries about it. But I would've enjoyed it more if the mains were in the same class as the appetizers.

Love the food here, especially small dishes like the eggplant with feta cheese, cod fish fritters and homemade pita bread with spread. Fri night live rebetiko music gives a great ambience, where anyone can feel included and would like to dance together. It‚Äôs rare to have a place like this in Manhattan which is run by families and you do feel so warm eating here, which is what dining should be about.

Wow! We had an amazing Easter lunch at Felice Montague! The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We loved the lasagna and the conchiglie al salmone! The shareable gelato dessert was so good! Definitely coming back soon!

Truly enjoyed coming here, it was a great place to talk with my best friends for hours, sip delicious cocktails and split appetizers tapas-style.

The appetizers were the best part for me. The mussels were a 10/10 for me, with a sauce that had to be soaked up with bread. The most memorable dish of the night. Mussels were cooked to perfection, and super plump and tender. The bruschetta had this lovely bright, citrusy puree and thick cut, toasted bread. 9.5/10. All of the bread was so good! The tartare was good 8/10.

My pasta was a bit too al dente but everyone else had an incredible experience. The ravioli was particularly delightful (I tried some from my friend). 9.5/10!

One of the best parts about this place is how close it is to the promenade and that amazing view! Don't miss it.

Truly phenomenal. Spent all summer in France eating pasta and this was BETTER. Wonderful marzano tomatoes so fresh and delicate while also savory. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better dinner and service. 10/10

My husband and I were looking for a place to eat while visiting brooklin. We were not disappointed. The atmosphere very warm and friendly. The two course meal was deliciously put together. I personally enjoyed the salad with mixtures of soft, fresh flavors. General manager Rodrigo Caldeira personally greeted us and engaged in conversation with us.

Went to Felice for a celebratory lunch. From the moment I walked in I had a great feeling about this restaurant and it did not disappoint. The service was above 5 stars.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere was classy yet relaxed.  So pleased it was part of my memorable day. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Amazing food, perfectly cooked and all taste incredibly fresh and well sourced. They also serve a warm and trendy vibe inside, with plenty of seats outside too for warmer nights.

We ordered these incredible dishes over a three course meal:
üî• Artichoke starters
üßÜ Short rib terrine
üî• Half chicken roast (!!!)
üçî Burger
üç∞ Chocolate Cake
üßÄ Firm goats cheese

The chicken was probably one of the juiciest, most tender and succulent roast chicken I have had in a very long time.

Dropped by a few times now, never been disappointed! Good food and good vibes. They also open pretty late so you can get a pretty good feed even if you're out later in the evening.

Their burgers are good, roast chicken is very moist and well cooked and if you're looking for a side, their roasted brussel sprouts are pretty tasty too. You'll definitely walk out full!

I visited this spot with my boyfriend in November 2024, and we had an amazing dinner experience. The restaurant has a warm and inviting atmosphere, with a clean interior and a cozy vibe. We walked in without a reservation and were told there would be a 25-30 minute wait, but we were seated in under 15 minutes, at most, on their heated outdoor patio. Still, it‚Äôs a good idea to make a reservation, as the place got pretty busy later on.
The menu is seasonal, so it changes to feature fresh ingredients based on the time of year.
We shared a few appetizers to start:
- The Savoy spinach was super fresh and had a nice balance of flavors.
- The grilled Carolina shrimp cocktail was cooked perfectly, with just the right seasoning.
For our mains:
I went with the Cookshop Burger, cooked medium rare, served with pickles, onions, and crispy fries. It was juicy and packed with flavor‚Äîdefinitely worth trying. My boyfriend had the fish, and he was very happy with his choice.
We were satisfied with the portion sizes and had just enough room for dessert.
Dessert:
- We opted for the apple crisp, which had a delicious pecan streusel topping and a scoop of creamy vanilla ice cream. The warm, crunchy topping paired perfectly with the soft apples, and the ice cream brought everything together nicely.

Overall, the food was delicious, and the wine was excellent! We cleaned all our plates.

The service was attentive and friendly. Prices were reasonable for the area, and we left feeling completely satisfied. We‚Äôll definitely be back to try their brunch options!

Fresh food, excellent service, and dog friendly üòä

Grabbed a quick dinner on a Thursday with a friend who has a service animal ü¶Æ and would definitely recommend.

We got a salad, a burger, and a pasta which were all very good. If you are looking for a simple fresh salad I recommend the little gem lettuce, it was simply delicious.

The server must‚Äôve realized that we were sharing and served the burger cut in half and the fries separately. It was such a simple but appreciated thoughtfulness ü•π

The place was crowded with a great energy. We ordered several dishes and all of them were good. The portions are small so it may take a couple of dishes to feel full.  I recommend the marinated fruit salad and scallop dinner.

(5/5) Having eaten here three times now and recommended it to friends visiting from out of town (who raved about it!), La Marchande is among my absolute favorite restaurants in Fidi.

From the warmth of the service and the softly lit interiors with cozy booth style seating beckoning you in, to the variety in the menu that brings some instant favorites, La Marchande is the full package crowd pleaser with dishes that will please not only the eyes but also the palate.

Would like to give a special shoutout to Abe who's served us twice and exudes hospitality! He also has a wonderful way with words when it comes to describing dishes we asked about, truly bringing the menu to life as he went over the flavors in the dishes down to the details of the garnish. We were tempted to order almost everything he described lol.

Now onto the food - at this point I've eaten probably half the menu, so here's the rundown!

Apps:
+ Milk Bread (5/5) - Simply *the BEST*. We have and will continue to order this every time I eat here. So fluffy and warm and the Scallion Cr√®me Fra√Æche pairing is perfection.
+ Crispy Octopus (5/5) - Another must order, super crispy and well paired. A crowd favorite.
+ Buttermilk Fried Calamari (5/5) - A new addition to the menu from our third visit. Was really impressed by how thinly coated the calamari was, offering a delicate crunch that still lets the seafood shine. The aioli is made in house and is a delicious pairing.
+ King Salmon Carpaccio (5/5) - The maple soy was really refreshing to have on the carpaccio (I typically see variations of some kind of citrus vinaigrette), sweet and savory goodness
+ Squash rigatoni (4/5) - Surprisingly great!! Wasn't expecting much considering this isn't an Italian restaurant but the pockets of squash puree that get nestled in the rings of the rigatoni were so delicious.
+ French Onion Dumplings (3.5/5) - Dumplings were great and packed with flavor but I wish the french onion soup they were bathing in was less concentrated and more drinkable.
+ Caesar Salad (3/5) - Solid but not remarkable, tad salty.
Truffle Pappardelle (2/5) - maybe was an off day, was too salty unfortunately

Mains:
+ Wagyu Boneless Ribeye w/ au poivre sauce (4/5): Cannot expect A5 levels of melt in your mouth but was tender and well seasoned. Would not skip eating the fried rosemary it comes with!! Convinced the table this was not simply a decorative element but really enhances the flavor of the steak üôÇ Also highly recommend the au poivre!
+ Hanger steak w/ chimichurri (4/5): Liked this more than the tomahawk
+ Tomahawk ribeye (3/5): Made me realize that I definitely prefer dry aged steaks flavor wise
+ Ora king salmon (4/5): I would ask for medium rare, the second time we ordered it the fish was less tender than the first even though we asked for medium both times. Couldn't get enough of the squash puree that accompanied it. On third visit the puree is now some kind of pea puree with morel mushrooms but still delish!
+ Grilled Lamb Rack: I honestly cannot remember this dish super well because I had gotten so full when I tried this one lol but think the folks around me enjoyed it. Generous serving size, came with 3 racks.

Sides:
+ Asparagus (4.5/5) - tasted fresh, loved the char and zest on it
+ Lamb fried rice (4/5) - was not expecting the asian fusion here, but the chili crunch worked well (on my third visit I see this is now off the menu sadly)
+ Cremini mushrooms (3.5/5) - Solid, liked the little crunch coating the belly of these.
+ Roasted brussels (3/5) - pretty standard flavor wise with classic caramelization, but as this dish often is, was too salty for my taste

Dessert:
+ Pecan Paris-Brest (3/5) - Certainly a large portion (can imagine sharing it with up to 8 people, would not recommend ordering if only a party of 2) but not my favorite variation of a cream puff. Liked the candied pecans but overall bit too sweet for me.

Drinks - light and refreshing, would order both again!
+ Bon vivant
+ Quelque Chose de Vert

I have had the pleasure of dining here multiple times. I highly recommend you join La Marchande whether you're grabbing drinks post-work, or celebrating an occasion. The staff is so incredibly kind, I've had interactions with Motts, Abraham, Lisa, Alex, Carlo, Anna, Andy, and Kevin the manager. Everyone is always smiling and ready to answer any questions I have. The food is magical, the drinks are unique and I'm always excited to try their new creations! The atmosphere is chic and warm. It's exciting to get dolled-up for the beautiful restaurant, but also feel warmth and comfort where you can relax for hours. This is my go-to meeting spot, and dinner spot anytime I'm in manhattan! I wish I had more pictures of food, but we always eat it to quickly!

From the moment we stepped into the restaurant, everything felt special. The atmosphere was elegant yet inviting, setting the tone for what turned out to be an exceptional evening. . Every detail‚Äîfrom the beautifully plated dishes to the ambient lighting‚Äîwas clearly crafted with care.

What truly elevated the experience, though, was the incredible service. Our server, Ethan, was outstanding‚Äîgracious, knowledgeable, and genuinely attentive without ever being overbearing. He guided us through the menu with thoughtful recommendations and made sure we felt taken care of throughout the night. You could tell he truly enjoys what he does, and it made all the difference.

The entire team deserves praise. The kitchen executed each dish flawlessly, and the staff moved in perfect sync to create a seamless, first-class experience. I left feeling both full and genuinely appreciated as a guest.

I can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant enough‚Äîit‚Äôs the kind of place you remember long after the meal is over. I‚Äôll absolutely be returning.

-Travis

Good spot for brunch with fair pricing. Portions are generous but croissant was not fresh and just reheated to make it fresher. Pancakes arrived undercooked, which was addressed by the staff in a heartbeat

Recommend having reservations on Fridays and Saturday. High bar seating and small tables near bar available for no reservations but stay quite busy. Food was ok, I was expecting a more authentic Italian experience. Great cocktails.

Taiwan, a spatial island with very rich agriculture ,literature and culture.
You should be there and then you will enjoying everything , trust me, Not only by news ,magazine or hear from someone else, Come in, and you should be know.

My eyes were opened when I arrived at Taiwan. It‚Äôs such a beautiful  and clean city. Took the MRT everywhere.  The air pollution from all vehicles is a major problem here.  I looked up the number 1 death issue here and it‚Äôs all related to lung or breathing problems. Other than that, the people are friendly and easy to get around by public transportation. Took the Rail from Airport to Taipei Main Terminal near my hotel and back to Airport. It‚Äôs way cheaper than a taxi. . Do not eat the expensive hotel food as the street food is cheap and good quality.  This is one country where I personally enjoy and plan to revisit in the near future. I sit here thinking why America doesn‚Äôt have the same things or better.
I have live my life for more than a decade here. It's safe,lovely,peaceful,beautiful and very convinient. You can visit the whole in ten days,from north to south. I have a very colorful life here.
People in Taiwan are very friendly and helpful. Transportation in Taipei is awesome, easy to access to most of the places. Street foods are the most popular in each different cities here.
The best of democratic country in the world. Welcome to explore  your own special "Taiwan" experiences.

I love this restaurant üòç.  Always long line. But it's worth waiting. I thought I wrote the reviews earlier because I have been here so many times.

They specialize in tofu but are good at everything else.

I love their Sotbab, freshly cooked rice. Especially, I loved the Egplant flavored rice, even though I am not a huge fan of the üçÜ  eggplant. They are that great.

Very authentic Korean food you should enjoy at least every month or every quartet if you live or work in NYC.

Homemade tofu to start with. Perfect. Best Korean restaurant in town. Food is always fresh made with fresh ingredients. Lunch time make sure you are at the door when open around noon otherwise you must wait. Authentic Korean restaurant style. Super!

The vibe is super chill and every bite is a total flex. I grabbed the Hot Stone Bibimbap with Spicy Pork, Mini Bossam, and Spicy Seafood Rice Cake no cap!!! They taste exactly like the real deal in Korea. Service was mad friendly and the prices are on point. If you‚Äôre hunting for bomb eats in a lit spot, this joint is a must-try. ü§úüèºüôåüèªü§õüèº

A rare gem in the middle of Manhattan. Service was personable and very friendly. Food was excellent. All the tofu products tasted fresh, flavourful, and expertly prepared. Absolutely recommend the seafood tofu soup.

The banchan was generous and very tasty. Refills are happily provided when you ask for them.

100% not a tourist joint. This is a legitimate Korean tofu house in the middle of the city.

This is the second time I have been here within a week. I'm an Asian tofu lover and this place serves the best tofu I have had in all the places i have been. The tofu here have a rich soy taste. Also every crew members are polite friendly with a positive attitude. Bonus point: kitchen is very clean too!
